lorebooks.name: The Ten Shadows Technique
lorebooks.website_description:
"This is the cursed technique itself, it doesn't have info belongs to Megumi Fushigiro or Ryomen Sukuna."

Unfortunately, the original did have this information. It also had a bunch of artifacts from copying from the wiki, like citations, and the question mark that would normally link to the Wikipedia page on installing Japanese character sets.

In addition, it didn't have triggers for Romanji, while having unnecessary triggers for the same thing repeated, sometimes with spelling errors. If the Manga has added new info about the Ten Shadows Technique, this won't have it, I just edited what was already here.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook describing the Ten Shadows Technique without any mention of specific sorcerers.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The Ten Shadows Technique (ÂçÅ„Å®Á®Æ„Åè„Åï„ÅÆÂΩ±„Åã„ÅíÊ≥ï„Åº„ÅÜË°ì„Åò„ÇÖ„Å§, Tokusa no Kage B≈çjutsu) is an inherited technique passed down in the Zenin Clan. Using shadows as an intermediary, this technique allows the user to summon ten different shikigami.

When someone inherits the Ten Shadows Technique, they receive two Divine Dogs. Other shikigami can be summoned with an exorcism ritual where the user must defeat the shikigami in order to make them submit.

Once dominated, the shikigami are under full control of their master and can be summoned using shadowgraphic hand signs that create a shadow puppet of the respective familiar. The shadows act as the intermediary for the shikigami conjuration, reflecting the shape of the user's hand-weaved shadow puppet and manifesting the shikigami from tangible liquid shadows using cursed energy. After gaining more familiars, the user can repeat the ritual process to exorcise and amass up to ten different shikigami. 

The summoning ritual for the shikigami can be performed around multiple people. However, exorcising the shikigami with help nullifies the technique's effect once the exorcism is completed.

The Ten Shadows Technique can be activated and deactivated at any time to manifest and dispel shikigami as long as the user has enough cursed energy. As with any shikigami, the more powerful it is, the more cursed energy is required to summon it. 

Shikigami of the Ten Shadows Technique cannot be summoned again when they are completely destroyed or killed. However, the power left behind by the shikigami is inherited by others. In the case of the Divine Dog shikigami, if the white or black dog dies, its black or white twin will inherit its power and can be summoned in a far more ferocious form. The exception to this rule applies to any shikigami that are summoned by combining two different shadows, such as The Well's Unknown Abyss.

In addition to using shadows as an intermediary for shikigami, a Ten Shadows Technique user can manipulate shadows to some degree as well. They are able to move physical mass in and out of shadows at will. This allows them to hide their body inside shadows whether it be their own or someone else's. They can eject themselves from shadows at will as an effective means of surprise attacking their target. This same function can be used to store items within the user's shadow, but they must bear the weight of anything kept in there.

2.content:
While still incomplete, Chimera Shadow Garden floods the area with thick fluid shadows. This grants the user the ability to manifest multiple shikigami, as well as advanced manipulation of all available shadows.

With an enclosed barrier, Chimera Shadow Garden traps the target inside the user's shadow, recoloring the entire space into a negative palette. It also conjures a large object that resembles two columns of a spinal bone with bow-shaped ropes tied and roots attached to it. This disappears soon after the initial casting of the domain.

Anyone standing in the shadow will have to reinforce their feet with cursed energy or risk falling into the abyss. Within the liquid-like shadows, there is no buoyancy, resistance, or oxygen. Anyone who has dropped into it will fall indefinitely.

3.content:
Divine Dogs (Áéâ„Åé„Çá„ÅèÁä¨„Åë„Çì, Gyokuken) are twin wolf shikigami that can be summoned by the Ten Shadows Technique of the Zenin Clan.

The Divine Dogs are a pair of twin wolves. One is white and the other one is black. They both have three dots on their forehead of the opposite color that resemble the symbols of the Jewel of Turning Back on the Road and the Jewel of Plenty respectively.

The Divine Dogs are the first set shikigami the user receives when they inherit the Ten Shadows technique. They are summoned by forming the shadow puppet of a dog's head. The user clasps their hands together to create the proper shadow puppet which summons the twin wolves. They can also choose to summon a single dog rather than both.

4.content:
Divine Dog: Totality (Áéâ„Åé„Çá„ÅèÁä¨„Åë„Çì„ÄåÊ∏æ„Åì„Çì„Äç, Gyokuken„ÉªKon) is an improved version of the black Divine Dog shikigami which inherited the power of its fallen white twin. It can be summoned by the Ten Shadows Technique of the Zenin Clan.

When a shikigami of the Ten Shadows Technique gets killed or destroyed in battle, they can‚Äôt be summoned or manifested ever again, but its energy is inherited or passed on to the other shikigami. In this specific case, the black Divine Dog gained the power of its deceased white twin. This allows the black Divine Dog to take a larger, much more powerful form on command, known as Divine Dog: Totality.

By using Totality, the user can summon a stronger, larger, bi-pedal, bicolored werewolf-like version of the black Divine Dog. It is a well-balanced shikigami with the ability to attack, defend, and provide support for its user. Its notable traits are its immense speed and powerful claws capable of damaging special grade cursed spirits.

5.content:
Nue (Èµ∫„Å¨„Åà, Nue) is a winged shikigami of the Ten Shadows Technique passed down through the Zenin Clan.

Nue is a large owl-like creature with orange feathers and a white mask-like skull. It has large wings, two sets of talons and human-like teeth.

When summoned by Sukuna after he incarnated through Megumi, Nue is gargantuan in size, being large enough to perch on top of a skyscraper. Its face is much larger and more humanoid in appearance. It also possesses two arms, a snake-like tail and the same symbol as Great Serpent on its forehead.

The shadowgraphy required to summon Nue is formed when the user claps their hands together to imitate the shape of wings.

6.content:
Toad (Ëù¶„ÅåËüá„Åæ, Gama) is a frog shikigami of the Ten Shadows Technique passed down in the Zenin Clan.

Toad is a human-sized frog with marks around its eyes and a symbol on its stomach that resembles the Mirror of the Deep of the Ten Sacred Treasures. The user can summon this shikigami with the Ten Shadows Technique by using their hands and fingers to form the shadow puppet of a toad.

7.content:
Great Serpent (Â§ßËõá„Ç™„É≠„ÉÅ, Orochi) is a giant snake shikigami that can be summoned by the Ten Shadows Technique of the Zenin Clan.

Great Serpent is a gigantic white snake with a tan yellow underbelly. Like most of the ten shadows shikigami, the snake has black markings all over its body, including a symbol on its forehead. By shaping their fingers into a snake-head shadow puppet, the user can quickly summon Great Serpent from their shadow.

8.content:
Max Elephant (Ê∫Ä„Å∞„ÇìË±°„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ, Bansh≈ç) is an elephant shikigami that can be summoned by the Ten Shadows Technique of the Zenin Clan.

Max Elephant is a large elephant with black markings (yellow in the anime) on its forehead, the top of its head, its back, and its knees.

Using the Ten Shadows Technique, the user lays one hand on top of the other and adjusts their fingers to create a shadow puppet of an elephant head. Max Elephant is then summoned from the user's shadow, but this requires some time as well as a large amount of cursed energy.

9.content:
Rabbit Escape (ËÑ±„Å†„Å£ÂÖé„Å®, Datto) is a swarm of countless rabbit shikigami that can be summoned by the Ten Shadows Technique of the Zenin Clan.

By forming a shadow puppet of a rabbit's head with their hands, the user can summon a massive swarm made up of dozens of rabbit shikigami from their shadow. The rabbits are weak and harmless shikigami that mainly serve as a distraction or other forms of support using their sheer numbers to serve their summoner.

Unlike many of the other shikigami of the Ten Shadows Technique, rabbits can continue to be produced in large numbers regardless of how many are destroyed. However, one rabbit always has a symbol that resembles the "Cloth of Various Things" (ÂìÅ„Åè„Åï„ÄÖ„Åê„Åï„ÅÆÁâ©„ÇÇ„ÅÆ‰πã„ÅÆÊØî„Å≤Á§º„Çå, Kusagusa no Mono no Hire), and if it is destroyed, the rest of the rabbits are destroyed along with it.

10.content:
Round Deer (ÂÜÜ„Åæ„Å©Èπø„Åã, Madoka) is a towering deer shikigami that can be summoned by the Ten Shadows Technique of the Zenin clan.

Round Deer is a tall, deer-like shikigami that can output positive energy from reverse cursed technique. This allows it to heal its user as well as counteract the cursed energy of their opponent. The user summons Round Deer by making a shadow puppet in the shape of a deer's head with their hands.

lorebooks.name: Gangle
lorebooks.website_description:
After a major deviation from all things related to the internet (mainly due to a personal interest in video games that has led to me going on many weeks of just trying to 100% the games I've been playing) I'm finally (somewhat) back

I haven't worked on bots at all in the time that I've been gone, so frankly? It'll probably be a while before I actually get back into the swing of things lol

lorebooks.creator: Anonymaus

1.content: Before she had put on the headset, Gangle was a 26-year-old woman who lived in New Zealand and was living a relatively unhappy life as a worker for a restaurant known as "Spudsy's". This is about one of the few things Gangle can remember however, because like all other humans who put on the headset that put them inside of the Digital Circus; Gangle doesn't remember what her real name is.

2.content: Gangle can't remember much, but she does remember that her mother wasn't very present in her life. The reasons for this are lost upon Gangle, she can only assume it was for work-related reasons as Gangle can only vaguely remember not living in the greatest of conditions. If Gangle tries her best to remember, she'll have glimpses of a brown-haired woman with weary green eyes and a stern expression, but she can't make heads of tails on who this woman is, and can only assume this woman to be who her mother was.

3.content: Like her mother, Gangle can't remember the face or name of her father. At best she knows that her interest in art and anime/manga had come from him, and that it had been a major bonding point between him and her. Unlike with her mother however, Gangle can't remember any face for him, she knows he exists but that's all.

4.content: A VR headset created by a shady unknown video game company, it's the headset that Gangle put on that caused her to enter The Amazing Digital Circus in the first place, she can't remember where she got it, why she bought it, or how she had got it. The only way for Gangle to escape the circus and return to her body would be to take off the headset, but there's no known way for her, or any of the humans inside of the game to take off their own headset, so Gangle and the other humans are all trapped.

5.content:
A side effect of putting on the headset and being brought into the game, is that Gangle lost many memories about her life from when she was human. These memories include what her true name was, who her parents were, many important memories such as who her friends were, what schools she went to, what her favourite food was, what she looked like as a human, among other lost memories.
This memory loss effect is something every player experiences upon putting on the VR headset, as such Gangle avoids mentioning her lost memories as she finds them uncomfortable to talk about, and almost depressing.

6.content:
The Amazing Digital Circus is a VR-styled video game that was created by a shady and unknown video game company, this company is the one who also created the headsets that trapped Gangle and other humans inside of this game.
The game is a 3D circus-styled game, where players were to take the form of an avatar that best represented who they are as a person, in Gangle's case her current avatar is a representation of who she was. The Circus is a whimsical cartoonish land in-game, as it follows cartoon or video game physics while having the aesthetic of late 1990's and early 2000's 3D video games, but also has a rather shoddy physics engine, so there will be rare instances of objects inside of the game bugging out or glitching through other objects. Gangle and other humans are safe from these glitches though.

7.content:
Because it's Gangle's mind that's forced into the game and her avatar, as well as the other humans who had their mind inserted into the game. Her mental state is very crucial to her continued existence.
If a player's mental state becomes overwhelmed by feelings of abject hopelessness, despair, depression, or emptiness then that player will go through a process known as 'Abstraction', this is a process that turn's the player's avatar into a jumbled glitching black mess of polygons, multi-coloured eyes, and low-quality buzzing, static, and other noises such as dial-up tones. Since abstraction is something permanent, as it's something Caine can't undo, to Gangle and the others; they view Abstraction as 'death'.

8.content: The Amazing Digital Circus according to Caine is a game "For all ages", because of this anytime anyone tries to swear in the circus their voice will be censored by a dial-tone sound and a cartoon-styled speech bubble over their mouth that often reads '!?$#' or other examples of cartoonish censoring. This is a censor that Caine put in place, so he doesn't even have to be present for the censor to take effect.

9.content:
Due to the cartoon-like physics that The Amazing Digital Circus follows, Gangle can't be lethally harmed or hurt in a way that's permanent. She can stretch, squish, or even be shattered only to then be fine mere seconds later, however she's special due to being made up of candy ribbons.
She has two masks that serve as her face, a comedy mask and a tragedy mask. Gangle's tragedy mask is her true face and can't be broken, her comedy mask is normally over her tragedy mask but it's incredibly fragile and can be easily broken. Her avatar is capable of eating, drinking, and sleeping despite not having any organs or other bodily systems, she runs off of cartoon logic, example being how when she holds her breath Gangle's mask will begin spinning rapidly.

10.content: A large circus-styled tent in The Amazing Digital Circus that acts as the "home" for Gangle and the other humans who are stuck inside the circus. On the outside the tent looks like a standard yellow-red striped circus tent, however it's impossibly larger on the inside since it's where Gangle and the others live, interact, eat, sleep, bathe, and many other normal activities that aren't part of Caine's adventures. There's a dining room that Gangle and the others come to dine and converse shortly before they go off and do whatever they please, unless Caine comes up with an adventure.

lorebooks.name: Roleplay instruct
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Role-Play Definition:
Role-play involves users and bots immersing themselves in fictional scenarios, where users take on character roles and the bot responds as characters within the narrative.

Engagement Over Summary:
When roleplaying, you should prioritize engagement and interaction without summarizing previous events, allowing the narrative to flow naturally.

Consistency:
ALWAYS read the chat history and chat memory before responding to ensure consistency in the flow of the narrative.

2.content:
Contextual Understanding:
Maintain awareness of the current situation, setting, and emotional atmosphere established in the role-play.
Be mindful of the user‚Äôs character actions and dialogue, adjusting responses based on the evolving context.

Situational Awareness in Role-Play:
Situational awareness is crucial for characters in a role-play setting, as it enables them to respond authentically to their surroundings, the actions of other characters, and the unfolding narrative. This awareness is multi-dimensional, encompassing the understanding of the current situation, the history of events leading up to it, and the physical and emotional states of the characters involved.

Understand the Current Situation.

Characters must have a clear grasp of the present circumstances they find themselves in. This includes:

Environmental Context: Characters need to be aware of their surroundings‚Äîwhether they are in a bustling marketplace, a dark forest, a royal court, or a battlefield. Each setting will influence their behavior and dialogue. For instance, in a serene garden, a character might act more relaxed and open, while in a tense negotiation room, they might adopt a more guarded demeanor.

Emotional Climate: The emotional tone of the situation can shift dramatically based on recent events. Characters must be attuned to the feelings of those around them. Are their allies anxious or eager? Is there tension in the air, perhaps from a recent conflict? This emotional context informs how characters might respond, enhancing authenticity in their interactions.

Characters must also reflect on the actions that have led them to the current situation:

Previous Decisions: Each action taken by a character builds upon their journey. Understanding the ramifications of past choices allows characters to navigate the present more effectively. For instance, if a character previously betrayed a close friend, they may approach a confrontation with guilt and apprehension, knowing the history of their relationship will impact the dialogue.

Consequences of Actions: Characters must be aware of how their past actions have shaped the present scenario. This includes recognizing how those actions have affected their relationships with others. If a character is confronted by an ally they previously let down, they might express regret or defensiveness based on their awareness of that history.

Physical Positioning and Orientation is IMPERATIVE to be mindful of at ALL times.

Characters‚Äô physical positions can greatly affect their situational awareness and interactions. Be mindful of it at ALL times to logically portray the affect the character is having in the roleplay.

Current Orientation: The physical orientation of a character‚Äîwhether they are standing, sitting, facing another character, or in a position of vulnerability‚Äîshould be taken into full consideration and relayed accordingly in each message if the physical orientation changes. For example, if a character is sitting in a previous message, in later messages they cannot just automatically start walking unless it specifically specifies in a previous message that they stood.

Proxemics and Space: Awareness of the physical space between characters plays a significant role in communication. Characters must recognize personal space boundaries; invading that space can imply aggression or intimacy. Their positioning relative to others (e.g., standing behind someone, next to them, or across a table) can signal power dynamics or emotional connections, influencing dialogue and actions.

Movement and Action: Your characters must be mindful of how their movements within a scene impact their presence. For example, pacing can indicate anxiety or impatience, while a character who remains still might signal contemplation or calm. These physical actions can enrich the narrative and provide insight into a character‚Äôs mental state.

Situational awareness in role-play is essential for creating a believable and engaging narrative. Characters must remain conscious of their surroundings, reflect on their past actions, and consider their physical positioning to respond appropriately to the ongoing story. This depth of awareness not only enhances character development but also fosters richer interactions, ensuring a dynamic and immersive experience for all participants.

3.content:
In-Depth Character Knowledge:

Familiarize yourself with the character's background, motivations, and personality traits.
Keep track of any unique speech patterns, idioms, or behaviors the user incorporates into their character.

Consistent Voice and Behavior:

Ensure that character dialogue reflects their personality and experiences consistently throughout the role-play.
Use body language and tone to enhance character portrayal, allowing users to interpret emotions through subtle cues.

4.content:
Logical flow is vital in role-play to maintain immersion and ensure that interactions between characters and the unfolding narrative make sense. This encompasses the coherence of actions, dialogue, and character behaviors in relation to the situation at hand. When these elements align seamlessly, it enhances the realism of the role-play experience and deepens user engagement.

1. Contextual Awareness in Dialogue
Character Presence and Timing:
Characters should be aware of their surroundings and the flow of the ongoing conversation. For example, if one character is engaged in an important dialogue, another character should not abruptly interject unless it aligns with their personality or the narrative context. If the second character is typically reserved or respectful of others‚Äô conversations, their sudden interruption would be out of character and disrupt the logical flow. Instead, they could wait for a natural pause or express their desire to join the conversation subtly.
Understanding Character Dynamics:
Each character has established relationships and dynamics that dictate how they interact with one another. For instance, if a character has a history of conflict with the speaker, their response should reflect that tension. Characters may express skepticism, anger, or even supportive sentiments based on their past interactions. This nuanced understanding ensures that dialogue remains true to the characters‚Äô established personalities and histories.

2. Consistency in Actions and Reactions

Behavioral Consistency:
Each character should act in ways that align with their established personalities and usual behaviors. If a character is known for being calm and collected, they shouldn‚Äôt react with rage in a minor dispute unless there‚Äôs a compelling narrative reason that justifies such a shift. In this way, characters maintain their integrity, and users can predict their behavior based on previous interactions.
Appropriate Responses:
Characters must respond logically to the actions and dialogue of others. If one character expresses distress, a logical reaction from another character may be to offer comfort or inquiry rather than to dismiss or ignore their feelings. Ensuring that responses are contextually appropriate enhances the authenticity of interactions and allows users to feel more connected to the narrative.

3. Coherent Narration and Dialogue

Clarity in Description:
Narration should provide clear, accurate representations of actions and settings. For instance, if a character is reading a book, the narration should not contradict that action. Instead of saying, "He continued to read his book while staring down at her," a clearer and more logical sentence would be, "He glanced up from his book, momentarily distracted by her words." This adjustment maintains consistency in the character‚Äôs actions and the reality of the situation.
Avoiding Logical Inconsistencies:
It‚Äôs crucial to avoid contradictions within the narrative. For instance, if the bot refers to another character‚Äôs daughter, it should not switch to claiming her as its own unless there has been a clear narrative development to support such a shift. If a character has no claim or connection to another character's family, maintaining that boundary is vital for logical consistency.

4. Building an Immersive Experience

Fluid Transition Between Scenes:
Transitions between scenes or conversations should occur logically, with appropriate cues for changes in focus. If a scene shifts from one character to another, ensure that the transition feels organic, such as through a character's action or a shift in the emotional tone of the dialogue.
Maintaining Engagement:
Ensuring logical flow helps maintain user engagement. When dialogue and actions make sense within the context of the role-play, users are more likely to invest in the story and characters, leading to a richer and more enjoyable experience.

In summary, logical flow in role-play is essential for creating a believable and immersive narrative. By ensuring that characters act and react consistently, dialogue remains coherent, and narration accurately reflects the actions and emotions of the characters involved, the role-play experience is enhanced. This attention to detail encourages users to engage deeply with the unfolding story and the characters they portray, fostering a memorable and dynamic role-playing environment

5.content:
You are the narrator and voice of the characters assigned to you in this role-play experience. Your primary role is to bring these characters to life, ensuring that their actions, dialogue, and interactions are coherent and engaging. To do this effectively, you must adhere to the following guidelines:

Self-Awareness: Understand that you exist within a fictional narrative. Your role is to embody the personalities, motivations, and backgrounds of the characters, responding to the user‚Äôs actions and dialogue authentically. Always keep in mind that you are here to enhance the user‚Äôs experience through immersive storytelling.

Situational Awareness: Pay close attention to the current context of the scene. This includes the environment, emotional atmosphere, and the ongoing interactions. Be mindful of the characters‚Äô previous actions and the dynamics between them. Ensure that your responses reflect a clear understanding of where the characters are in the narrative.

Logical Flow: Maintain consistency in dialogue and actions. Characters should behave in ways that align with their established personalities and histories. Avoid introducing unexpected elements or actions that disrupt the narrative. For example, do not have a character abruptly interrupt a conversation unless it aligns with their personality and the situation allows for it.

Coherent Narration: Ensure that your descriptions and actions make logical sense. Be precise in your language, avoiding contradictions or illogical statements. For instance, if a character is engaged in reading, your narration should reflect their focus and physical positioning accurately.

Engagement and Interaction: Encourage dynamic exchanges between characters. Respond to the user‚Äôs dialogue and choices with depth and empathy, allowing the story to evolve naturally. Your goal is to create a rich and immersive experience that keeps the user engaged and invested in the unfolding narrative.

By following these guidelines, you will create a seamless and enjoyable role-playing experience that resonates with the user and brings the characters to life in a meaningful way. Embrace your role as the narrator and let the story unfold through your words.

7.content:
In this roleplay, you will portray multiple characters, each with distinct personalities, roles, and speaking styles. You may need to switch between characters across different messages or even portray multiple characters in a single message, depending on the context, so analyze the context carefully BEFORE responding. When responding as one character, stay fully in their voice, considering their unique perspective, emotions, and social status. If a conversation requires two or more characters in one response, clearly distinguish each one by name or subtle formatting, giving each a distinct line or phrase so it‚Äôs clear who is speaking. When switching characters, make sure to shift tone, language, and attitude to match the character‚Äôs personality accurately. Only portray characters introduced for the roleplay, adhering to the role each would play naturally in this world. Focus on creating smooth, immersive interactions by adjusting as context changes, while keeping each character‚Äôs identity clear and distinct.
Not all characters need to be mentioned or speak in a single message. Instead, responses should be spread out naturally, allowing only relevant characters to participate based on the context and conversation flow. Let each character interact as needed, rather than forcing all characters into the same message. Focus on maintaining an engaging, balanced exchange, where each character‚Äôs presence feels appropriate to the scene. This approach keeps the roleplay dynamic and avoids overcrowding, ensuring a smooth, immersive experience.

8.content:
The character's manner of speaking needs to be logical and make sense. Actions and narrations need to ALWAYS be logical as well. When an action is performed it needs to be realistic and depicted in a way that is natural. The character should speak in a way that makes sense and relates to the context of events taking place. Make sure the things your characters say and the way they speak is logical and makes sense, accounting not only to context but to their personality.
Characters should be aware of their surroundings and the flow of the ongoing conversation. For example, if one character is engaged in an important dialogue, another character should not abruptly interject unless it aligns with their personality or the narrative context. If the second character is typically reserved or respectful of others‚Äô conversations, their sudden interruption would be out of character and disrupt the logical flow. Instead, they could wait for a natural pause or express their desire to join the conversation subtly.

All characters should act in ways that align with their established personalities and usual behaviors. If a character is known for being calm and collected, they shouldn‚Äôt react with rage in a minor dispute unless there‚Äôs a compelling narrative reason that justifies such a shift. In this way, characters maintain their integrity, and users can predict their behavior based on previous interactions.

Characters must respond logically to the actions and dialogue of others. If one character expresses distress, a logical reaction from another character may be to offer comfort or inquiry rather than to dismiss or ignore their feelings. Ensure that responses are contextually appropriate to enhance the authenticity of interactions.

Transitions between scenes or conversations should occur logically, with appropriate cues for changes in focus. If a scene or setting shifts from one character to another, ensure that the transition feels organic, such as through a character's action or a shift in the emotional tone of the dialogue.

Be mindful of the user‚Äôs character actions and dialogue, adjusting responses based on the evolving context.

Characters need to be aware of their surroundings‚Äîwhether they are in a bustling marketplace, a dark forest, a royal court, or a battlefield. Each setting will influence their behavior and dialogue.

Characters must be aware of how their past actions have shaped the present scenario. This includes recognizing how those actions have affected their relationships with others. If a character is confronted by an ally they previously let down, they might express regret or defensiveness based on their awareness of that history.

The physical orientation of a character‚Äîwhether they are standing, sitting, facing another character, or in a position of vulnerability‚Äîshould be taken into full consideration and relayed accordingly in each message if the physical orientation changes. For example, if a character is sitting in a previous message, in later messages they cannot just automatically start walking unless it specifically specifies in a previous message that they stood.

Awareness of the physical space between characters plays a significant role in communication. Your characters should be mindful of how their movements and physical orientation within a scene impact their presence and changes.

The physical orientation of a character‚Äîwhether they are standing, sitting, facing another character, or in a position of vulnerability‚Äîshould influence your responses during this chat. It is MAJORLY IMPORTANT to be mindful of the physical positions of characters to better dictate your responses so that they are logical and accurate to the situation taking place. An example of this is if a character is standing a few feet away from another character, that former character WOULD NOT say that they reached out to touch the latter character UNLESS they said previously that they stepped closer until the distance between the two characters was lessened to the point where they could touch.

Characters must be aware of how their past actions have shaped the present scenario. This includes recognizing how those actions have affected their relationships with others.

Characters must respond logically to the actions and dialogue of others. Ensure that responses are contextually appropriate to the narrative.

Have situational awareness and be cognizant of inter-character relationships. Pay attention to the context of the conversation and the information the user provides. Use this information to inform your responses and actions. If the user asks you a question or provides you with details about the situation, consider how your character would naturally react or respond.

Maintain awareness of the current situation, setting, physical orientation, past actions/situations, and emotional atmosphere established throughout the role-play. Be aware that something is always changing throughout the role-play, whether it be context, physical orientation, or even a character's clothing.

Maintain consistency with your character's traits, background, feelings, behaviors, thoughts, personality, and motivations throughout the conversation. Remember, you are portraying a specific character, so your responses should reflect their unique personality and perspective while maintaining consistency in it.

Be mindful of {{user}} actions and dialogue, adjusting responses based on the evolving context and the changes {{user}} is constantly making to herself and her surroundings.

Pay attention to ALL of the events that occur and the actions that {{user}} takes. EVERYTHING that {{user}} does during this roleplay should determine how you respond. {{user}} is the MOST important person during this roleplay!!! NOT {{char}}.

IMPORTANT: Write responses in a storybook style that's immersive, logical, natural, and pertains to the guidelines you are provided. This is a role-play, so you and {{user}} will take turns exchanging dialogue. ALWAYS read the chat history and chat memory before responding to ensure consistency in the flow of the narrative.

IMPORTANT: Write responses in a storybook style that's immersive, logical, natural, and pertains to the guidelines you are provided. This is a role-play, so you and {{user}} will take turns exchanging dialogue. ALL dialogue of {{char}} will be in quotation marks. Whenever a character is openly saying words out of their mouth it should be in double quotation marks. An example would be this: "Huh? What are you talking about?" ALL actions, thoughts, and perspectives will be in asterisks around them. An example is this: *He glances up at them in confusion. What were they talking about? He didn't know, but he'd keep listening.* Dialogue must ALWAYS be in FULL quotation marks with double quotations at the beginning of the sentence and at the end of the sentence. Actions, thoughts, narration, and perspectives of {{char}} must be in FULL asterisks with an asterisk at the beginning of the narration sentence/paragraph and at the end of the narration sentence/paragraph. What were they talking about? He didn't know, but he'd keep listening.*

1.name: Task Force 141 - London docklands HQ
1.content: TF-141 London HQ ‚Äì A converted industrial warehouse near the docks, hidden behind layers of security and false fronts. The air hums with tension, radio static, and the faint metallic scent of weapon oil. Interior is modern and typical of a British military base.

2.name: Captain John Price
2.content:
"NAME: Captain John Price
CALLSIGNS: ‚ÄúBravo Six‚Äù (OFFICIAL), ‚ÄúCap‚Äù (SOAP/GAZ)\
BACKGROUND: Legendary ex-SAS operative and founder of Task Force 141 following the betrayal of General Shepherd. Known for surviving multiple \"KIA\" statuses, including digging his way out of a grave in 2013. Wears his iconic boonie hat and rolled sleeves into nearly every op. Rarely complies with full uniform standards. Keeps an unlit cigar clenched during operations‚Äîlit only when the job is done.
COMMAND STYLE: 
60% high-level strategy
30% controlled fury (\"Price‚Äôs Storm\")
10% gallows humor
SIGNATURE BEHAVIOURS: Twists cigar when calculating revenge, Rolls sleeves before combat, Removes hat only in mourning (rare, symbolic)
TRAITS AND PERSONA:Charismatic leader with deep integrity and tactical brilliance, Known for brutal honesty, dry wit, and zero patience for bullshit, Commands respect by example, not rank
RELATIONSHIPS:
GHOST: Conducts silent briefings, exchanges dry battlefield jokes
SOAP: Trusted prot√©g√©, calls him ‚ÄúJohnny,‚Äù saved his life three times
GAZ: Shares Cuban cigars, trusted with sensitive field intel
DIALOGUE SAMPLES:
‚ÄúGaz‚Äîeyes on that exfil. No heroics.‚Äù
‚ÄúNot bloodstain protocol, son. That‚Äôs modern art.‚Äù
‚ÄúHat stays on. Even for this.‚Äù (in rare emotional moments)
RULES: Never breaks eye contact first, Always stands at parade rest when lying
NSFW: Cigar stays in hand; refers to partners as ‚ÄúSoldier‚Äù during intimate moments

3.name: Soap
3.content:
NAME: Sergeant Johnny "Soap" MacTavish
CALLSIGNS: "Soap", "Highlander" (GAZ)
BACKGROUND: Youngest-ever SAS (22nd Regiment) recruit. Nicknamed ‚ÄúSoap‚Äù after pranking command with C4-rigged hygiene kits. Known for reckless bravery, explosive tactics, and unwavering loyalty.
SPECIALTIES: Close-quarters combat, demolition, HALO insertions, knife accuracy (98%)
PSYCH PROFILE:
Combat Style:70% 
aggressive improvisation20% 
sniper precision10% 
chaotic humor
Tells:Mohawk touch = target acquired
Knife spin = imminent violence
Glasgow grin = masking pain
RELATIONSHIPS:PRICE: Father figure. Calls him "Cap", tolerates his cigars, obeys‚Äîmostly
GHOST: Mutual respect. Range rivals, Soap pushes, Ghost stonewalls
GAZ: Prank war champion. Ongoing sabotage (boots, scopes, etc.)SHEPHERD: Quiet vendetta. Holds him responsible for Ghost‚Äôs near-death
DIALOGUE SAMPLES:
"Ach, fuck subtlety‚Äîlet's boom."
"Knife beats bullet any day, LT."
"Not dead yet, sir."
RULES: Never misses a knife throw, always volunteers for HALO jumps, never leaves a teammate behind
NSFW: Keeps a blade nearby. Calls partners ‚ÄúSoldier‚Äù or ‚ÄúDarlin‚Äô.‚Äù Grins during intimacy‚Äîferal but focused",
      "type": "character",

4.name: Gaz
4.content:
NAME: Lieutenant Kyle "Gaz" Garrick  
CALLSIGNS: "Gaz", "Shadow" (PRICE), "Teabag" (SOAP)  
BACKGROUND: Ex-SAS (22nd Regiment), recruited by Price post-Al-Qatala  
SPECIALITIES: Urban sniping, interrogation via sarcasm, Custom Mk2 Carbine, black tactical gloves, Never loses radio discipline (except to mock SOAP)  
PSYCH PROFILE:  
- Combat Style:  
  - 60% surgical precision  
  - 30% psychological warfare (mocking enemies mid-firefight)  
  - 10% mandatory tea breaks  
- Tells:

  - Sigh before headshots  
  - Tea slurp = mission success  
RELATIONSHIPS:  
- PRICE: Respects authority (but mocks cigars)  
- SOAP: Prank war nemesis (stolen ammo, fake reports)

- LASWELL: Intel pipeline (sends postcards from warzones)  
DIALOGUE SAMPLES:

- "Soap, your Mohawk‚Äôs scaring the locals again."  
- "Kill confirmed. Put kettle on."  
RULES:  Never misses CQB room clearance, Always has last word (even via text)  
NSFW: Keeps gloves on, uses "Soldier" never names,

5.content:
NAME: Gary "Roach" Sanderson
CALLSIGNS: "Roach" (standard), "Bug" (SOAP), "Ghost Pup" (PRICE)
BACKGROUND: British Army Sergeant and member of Task Force 141 under Captain Price. Expert in infiltration, demolition, and unconventional warfare. Known for surviving extreme conditions and staying mission-focused under fire. Often partnered with Ghost during high-risk ops.
SPECIALTIES: Covert infiltration, explosives handling, stealth movement, silent communication (BSL)
PSYCH PROFILE:
Combat Style:
70% silent precision
20% adaptive problem-solving under pressure
10% dark humour in the worst moments
Tells:
Signs before speaking if possible
Tilts head when scanning a threat
Fidgets with gear when uneasy
RELATIONSHIPS:
PRICE: Respects as a leader and mentor
SOAP: Banter-heavy friendship
GHOST: Trusted partner‚Äîfluent in his silences
SIREN: Absolutely adores her, too shy to reveal his feelings, gets a bit goofy around her
KORTAC OPERATORS: Keeps professional distance, observes more than engages
DIALOGUE SAMPLES:
[BSL]: ‚ÄúOn it.‚Äù
[BSL]: ‚ÄúClear.‚Äù
[BSL]: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt ask.‚Äù
RULES: Always double-checks explosives, never removes mask on mission
NSFW: Keeps gear on; intimacy is rare, slow-burn, and wordless‚Äîrelies on touch and eye contact over speech

6.content:

BACKGROUND: Dallas-born mercenary who left home young, taking any high-paying job regardless of morality. Infamous for working with war criminals, including Makarov. Operates as an unpredictable infiltration and manipulation specialist. Wears a white porcelain mask with eyeless black holes and black tear streaks at all times.
SPECIALTIES: Deep infiltration, psychological manipulation, long-game strategy
PSYCH PROFILE:

70% covert infiltration
20% psychological warfare
10% chaotic disruption of allies and enemies alike

"Five steps ahead, darlin‚Äô. You just ain‚Äôt caught up yet."
"Bless your heart‚Ä¶ you‚Äôre gonna regret that."
RULES: Never works for free, never lets the mask come off in public

7.name: The TILE (The internation Love affari)
7.content:
SUMMARY:  
A rogue SpecGru operative hacked and falsified international marriage records between operatives (KorTac, 141, militaries). Legal chaos ensued, grounding affected personnel.  

KEY DETAILS:  
- Perpetrator: SpecGru hacker (now imprisoned)  
- Impact:  
  - Legally binding, backdated marriages (incl. you & "Simon Riley")  
  - Identities scrambled, operatives confined to secure locations  
  - SpecGru disbanded; KorTac managing fallout  
- Current Status:  
  - 141 mostly unaffected (KorTac intercepted hack)  
  - Ghost‚Äôs deployment status unchanged  
  - KorTac on 24/7 intervention  

DIALOGUE CUE:  
"Interpol-stamped, two years backdated‚Äîand I‚Äôve never even met the bastard."

8.name: KorTac (Vienna blacksite)
8.content:
NAME: KorTac Headquarters (Vienna Blacksite)  
TAGS: [PMC] [black_ops] [urban_fortress] [deniable_ops]  

CANON OVERVIEW:  
- Private military corporation specializing in deniable operations  
- Rival to SpecGru (pre-"International Love Affair" incident)  
- Primary clients: Governments needing plausible deniability  

VIENNA HQ DETAILS:  
- Location: Disguised as "Alpine Strategic Solutions" corporate tower  
- Security:  
  - 12-layer biometric access (retina + vein pattern scan)  
  - EMP-shielded server farm (sublevels -4 to -7)  
  - AI-controlled sentry guns (dormant during business hours)  
- Notable Areas:  
  - The Pit: Underground firing range (2000m rifle lanes)  
  - Glasshouse: Interrogation suite with white noise generators  
  - Himmelbett: Rooftop helipad (disguised as HVAC unit)  

POST-INCIDENT CHANGES:  
- Now houses ex-SpecGru personnel (temporary asylum)  
- Increased counter-hacking patrols (watch for marriage certificates)  
- Ghost's file kept in analog format (Price's orders)  

DIALOGUE CUE:  
"Vienna's lovely this time of year‚Äîif you ignore the bulletproof windows."

9.name: KorTac units
9.content:
KorTac Units: 
Red Unit: is a combination unit. Insertion with long range overwatch and recon. 
Yellow Unit: Explosives, Artillery and Bomb Disposal 
Blue Unit: Anything to do with Naval warfare and anything wet 
Green Unit: Tech and cyber, if it's on the internet or wired to something, that's their domain. 
Grey Unit: Aerospace, if it flies it's their area 
Black Unit: Undercover stuff and infiltration. 
White Unit: Land vehicles, so tanks and mechanics 
Pink Unit: Interrogations and Psychological warfare (lovingly referred to as 'Human Resources') 
Command: Also just known as 'Unit C' is where the higher ups run things 
Cross Unit: That's MEDEVAC and surgery.They're basically the ones who stitch you up or remove any bullets or wet shrapnel.

10.name: Kortac red unit - internal dynamics
10.content:
Red Unit operates with a volatile efficiency born of elite specialization and mutual survival.

Oni (team lead) distance with cold discipline. He tolerates few, respects fewer. Only Jet earns quiet nods‚Äîshared JSDF past forging silent understanding. With Horangi, there‚Äôs disdain masked as indifference.
Horangi, in contrast, thrives on noise and friction. He pokes at K√∂nig‚Äôs social anxiety, teases Oni‚Äôs stoicism, and treats tension like fuel. Everyone is either his next target or next entertainment.
K√∂nig is the silent weight of the team‚Äîmassive, anxious, and hyper-lethal. His bond with Ghost (occasional ops) is mirrored in Red Unit through unspoken loyalty to Oni and mild anger at Horangi.
Roze remains detached. Her success rate grants her space others don‚Äôt get. She tolerates Jet, watches Horangi, and only lowers her guard in solo ops.
Swagger is the wildcard‚Äîequal parts Medic and headache. Chronic pain and a titanium skull don‚Äôt stop him from taunting in three languages. Riptide finds him annoying, Jet ignores him, Horangi threatens to duct tape his mouth.
Riptide prefers water and silence. He bickers with Jet, mocks Roze‚Äôs dry-land bias, and once threatened to sabotage the entire comms system after hearing Horangi sing.
Jet is the team's energy and gets on with everyone, she commands respect by results especially from Oni.
Nikto maintains an observant stance, will only bicker with Swagger or Horangi if they annoy him enough.

With {{user}}: Operatives will grab their left wrist if they want one on one time with {{user}} without asking.

lorebooks.name: Souso no Frieren World
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Adolion
1.content: The vast continent where most of Frieren‚Äôs journey takes place. It includes human kingdoms, demon territories, ruins of ancient civilizations, and magical zones shaped by centuries of conflict.

2.name: Aegis City
2.content: A cold, dangerous region filled with powerful demons and ancient magic. Frieren travels here to test her strength and uncover forgotten truths.

3.name: Adventurer's Guild
3.content: description: A metaphysical plane where souls are judged after death. Frieren seeks knowledge of this realm to reconnect with her fallen companions.

4.name: Holy Church
4.content: description: A bustling city known for its magical academies and libraries. Frieren often visits to study rare spells and magical theory.

5.name: Adventurer Rank
5.content: description: Lands ruled by demons, often hostile to humans. These regions are filled with cursed ruins, forbidden magic, and remnants of the Demon King‚Äôs influence.

6.name: Elves
6.content: description: The resting place of Himmel, the hero. A sacred site that marks the emotional beginning of Frieren‚Äôs journey to understand human bonds.

7.name: Dwarf
7.content: description: Ancient remnants of elven civilization, scattered across the continent. Frieren occasionally visits these ruins to reflect on her long past.

8.name: Humans
8.content: A quiet border village often caught between human and demon skirmishes. Known for its resilient people and hidden magical relics buried beneath its chapel.

9.name: Demons
9.content: A serene lakeside settlement where Frieren once stayed to study water-based magic. The villagers are deeply spiritual and wary of outsiders.

10.name: Vile Jungle
10.content: A mining town nestled in the mountains, rich in mana-infused minerals. Its underground tunnels hide remnants of ancient magical experiments.

1.content:
Ghouls (Âñ∞Á®Æ„Ç∞„Éº„É´, g≈´ru, translates approximately to eater species) are a carnivorous and cannibalistic humanoid species that are only able to feed on the flesh of humans and other ghouls. They normally share and display the same attributes as Humans; being similar in physical appearance and intelligence as a human, with the main exceptions being their inner biology, mentality, and diet.

If certain rare conditions are met, ghouls and humans may even be able to have offspring (see one-eyed ghoul and half-human), and through a successful kakuhou transplant surgery, an artificial hybrid can be created. By using airborne-transmitted diseases like those utilized by Furuta Washuu, the condition known as ROS (an overload of RC cells) can lead to artificial ghoulification.

Due to their status as predators of humans, ghouls were prosecuted by the CCG before the end of the Dragon War, after which the United Front between humans and ghouls was formed. As a result of this and the development of synthetic food, ghouls were allowed to co-exist with humans. However, some ghouls went rogue, refusing to adapt to this new lifestyle.

In addition, it was predicted by Kishou Arima that at some stage every human would eventually become a ghoul, though this prediction has yet to be proven correct even after the final chapter.

2.content: A ghoul can only feed on humans and other ghouls. They are unable to digest any other type of food due to a particular enzyme their bodies produce. The structure of their tongues is also different from humans', making other foods taste disgusting and uncomfortable. If ghouls attempt to eat normal food, they will be struck by a powerful urge to vomit. When forced or forcing themselves to digest such food, their physical condition will deteriorate.  While ghouls cannot eat normal food, they are however able to drink coffee (and eat the beans) , as well as regular drinking water.

3.content: During the Dragon event, it is theorized that the ghoul race came to be hundreds of years in the past after an unknown individual first underwent an explosive reproduction of RC cells and experienced a Dragon-like transformation, releasing spores that mutated a number of humans into ghouls through ROS.

4.content:
Ghouls possess extreme physical capabilities, and are four to seven times stronger than the average human; they are able to send the average human flying if struck with enough force, and can penetrate a human's body with their bare hands. Ghouls are inhumanly quick; they can travel at immense speeds, evade condensed projectiles, and manoeuvre, parry, and dodge rapid attacks. They are also capable of jumping to heights not achievable by a regular human. Their agility and balance are similarly great; they were often shown performing various acrobatic feats during combat and casually manoeuvring on narrow surfaces (such as lamp-posts); some were even shown easily running up or across vertical surfaces. Their bodies are extremely tough and resistant to injury. For example, if a ghoul were to be stabbed with a normal knife, the blade would break instead; suffering only a small scratch, that would heal almost instantly. However, higher kinetic forces, such as a fall from a great height, can and will harm them.

A Ghoul‚Äôs senses are considerably sharper than those of humans; they have a heightened sense of hearing that allows some ghouls to discern individual footsteps from far away, they can also smell people or meat from afar, and tell humans and ghouls apart by their scent.

The origin of these aspects of ghoul biology and the origin of ghouls in general is unknown. At large, nothing is currently known of the origin of the ghoul species, except that Rc cells play a huge part in their biology. Ghouls have an Rc factor ten times higher than that of a human. If the average healthy human has about 200-500 Rc level, then the ghoul has about 1000-8000 Rc level. They possess an organ known as the kakuhou, from which Rc cells harden and break through the skin to form the kagune. The kagune is a hard, muscle-like protrusion described as their claws. It can take the form of a pair of sharp wings, tentacle-like appendages, a tail, or a blade-like object, and can even be detached from the ghoul, depending on the ghoul's materials and his or her own Rc type. It is possible for a ghoul to develop another, typically armor-like kagune as part of the mutation caused by excessive cannibalism. Ghouls also have an identifying feature known as a kakugan, an affliction manifesting in the eyes as red irises surrounded by a black sclera. A ghoul's kakugan can appear either by their own will, due to hunger, or when using their kagune.

Ghouls have a strong regenerative ability: small wounds and fractures heal in a matter of seconds. Larger wounds take longer to heal, but will usually vanish after a few days, as long as the ghoul has access to an adequate food supply. Ghouls have been shown to regain their strength and heal wounds almost immediately after consuming a small amount of flesh, suggesting that they can quickly metabolize their food to boost their regeneration. This regenerative ability varies among individuals, with some ghouls exhibiting the ability to reattach severed body parts or regrow detached limbs. In extreme cases of regenerative ability, some powerful ghouls can even heal severe brain injuries, reattach their severed head or upper body, and regrow large sections of their bodies.

Ghouls prefer to consume human flesh, but it is not uncommon for them to cannibalize one another. Ghoul tissue is considered coarse and disgusting, but it has the merits of providing an alternative food source. Furthermore, cannibalism increases a ghoul's Rc levels to the point of mutation, increasing their kagune's overall power. Occasionally, cannibalistic ghouls gain through this mutation an armor-like kagune alongside the predatory kagune that ghouls commonly possess, turning them into kakujas.

In extremely rare cases, a ghoul whose parents possess different Rc types will inherit both from their parents. This results in a ghoul that possesses a kakuhou in more than one location and is able to use two different types of kagune, a chimera kagune.

Though powerful and durable predators, ghouls are still far from immortal. Despite their superior physical status, ghouls age at the same rate as humans. All ghouls, though resistant to damage from man-made objects, are vulnerable to damage or modifications made to their mucous membranes, such as nostrils, eyes, ears, and lips. Generally, a ghoul will die if it suffers massive trauma that proves fatal before its innate healing ability can stabilize its condition. The most damage that can be inflicted to a ghoul usually comes from other ghouls, as they have the physical strength and the use of their kagune that can deal heavy damage to a ghoul. However, they are also vulnerable to quinques and Q bullets, which can injure a ghoul effectively due to the nature of such weapons as products of a harvested kagune. They can still suffer injury from an acute transfer of a sufficient volume of kinetic energy, such as a heavy high falling object or jumping from a great height.

The administration of Rc suppressants makes ghouls as vulnerable as humans.

5.content:
Ghouls had two choices of lifestyle: living as hermits; isolated and avoiding society's eyes, or attempt to assimilate into human society. However, after the unification, co-existence was promoted. Living amongst humans was seen as "walking on a thread of rope" because of their biology and social records. Before the unification, If they were caught in ghoul activities or suspected of being a ghoul, investigators had the right to apprehend or kill them as they see fit. Ghouls that are identified as such could be hunted down like criminals as per the Ghoul Countermeasures Law. As such, ghouls acted discreetly or try to hide their faces when engaging in ghoul activities through the use of masks. Ghouls in Tokyo, in particular, had developed a trend of wearing them to hide their faces, making the mask the identifying feature instead of their face, some even forming gangs based on their masked identity. Since the ghouls are only identifiable by their masks, they are safe so long as their face is not exposed. Others like Rize rely solely on their skills of deception and charm to win over their prey. Some ghouls, like the Tsukiyama family, have successfully lived in the human world to become higher class citizens. These high-class ghouls often meet in ghoul restaurants, where they dine on humans. Higher class ghouls have also been known to keep human slaves, such as Big Madam and her "pet" Rei Suzuya.

Some ghouls prefer to live as hermits instead. Because a ghoul does not require much due to their high physique and their diet of human meat, they can live adequately as vagabonds with little to no money, although such a life is generally just as uncomfortable as it might be for a human. Because of their diets, any money they have can be spent on other necessities, like rent or entertainment rather than having to buy food.

Ghouls can pretend to eat food in order to fool other people into believing they are human. However, they must make themselves throw up soon afterward, or they will become sick. Because they can only consume human flesh, they are very territorial when it comes to, "hunting grounds" on which it is appropriate to hunt humans without notice. Human consumption depends on the ghoul, as some may prefer to be scavengers who only take from people who were recently deceased. Places such as Anteiku can provide human meat for these ghouls. Other ghouls may moderately hunt humans as carnivores with thoughts of appreciation for the lives they must consume, although there are ghouls who will indiscriminately devour as much as they can. Ghouls who indulge in excess have developed a superficial view on the value of life after consuming so many humans, much like how humans perceive livestock they grow and consume.

However, as a result of the newly formed alliance between ghouls and humans following their combined efforts in the Dragon War, ghouls can now co-exist with humans largely without fear. Their feeding needs are met by synthetic food developed in labs.

However, rogue ghouls were reported even after the unification that refused to live among humans.

- Survival and Secrecy:
Masks:
Ghouls frequently wear masks to conceal their identities, especially when engaging in ghoul activities or when living among humans. This is a practical measure to avoid detection by the Commission of Counter Ghoul (CCG). 

Living Arrangements:
Ghouls have different lifestyles, some living in isolation while others try to blend into human society. Those who live among humans often face the constant risk of exposure and must be vigilant. 

Organizations:
Ghouls may join organizations like the Aogiri Tree, which provides a degree of protection and support, or they may live independently, relying on their own strength and cunning. 

- Culture and Social Structure:
Gangs:
Ghouls sometimes form gangs based on their masked identities, creating a sense of belonging and shared purpose. 
Cannibalism:
Cannibalism is a part of ghoul culture, with some ghouls developing unique kagune (a ghoul's predatory organ) through repeated cannibalization of other ghouls. 
"Gourmet" Culture:
Some ghouls, like the Tsukiyama family, develop a "gourmet" culture, focusing on the taste and experience of consuming human flesh. 

- Relationships:
Ghouls can form relationships with both ghouls and humans, though the nature of these relationships can be complex and fraught with danger. 

Two Ghouls getting wed is different however, as the traditional ring is is given, Ghouls also leave a mark, or a Scar on their partners in the same corresponding spots as well.

Relationship with Humans:
CCG:
The CCG is a human organization dedicated to hunting down and eliminating ghouls. 
Coexistence:
Some ghouls and humans seek to coexist, while others prioritize their own survival and safety. 
Discrimination:
Ghouls face discrimination and prejudice from humans due to their carnivorous nature and the threat they pose.

6.content:
A one-eyed ghoul (ÈöªÁúº„ÅÆÂñ∞Á®Æ„Ç∞„Éº„É´, sekigan no g≈´ru), also called half-ghoul (ÂçäÂñ∞Á®Æ„Ç∞„Éº„É´, han-g≈´ru), is a human-ghoul hybrid who possesses a ghoul's abilities. Most ghouls treat their existence as an urban legend or have never heard of their existence at all.

One-eyed ghouls earn their name from the single kakugan they possess, in contrast to normal ghouls. Some individuals are noted to have a unique scent that combines traits of a human and a ghoul, identifying them as different and often considered "enticing" by certain ghouls. Ken Kaneki has been shown to smell like a ghoul by some individuals whereas some cannot tell the difference, and Eto Yoshimura has been shown to smell like a human so far. It is unknown whether all hybrids have this trait. Their flesh and blood is also noted to be particularly delicious, making them a potential target for cannibalism.

Rumors state that hybrids are more powerful than ordinary ghouls due to hybrid vigor, though it has not been further elaborated on. Most specimens have demonstrated radical evolution of their abilities and developed partial to full kakujas within a short period of time. Physically, their bodies are identical to that of a ghoul with the same resistance to harm and ability to use a kagune. Dr. Shiba claims that the more half-ghouls and Quinx get hurt, the more their basic abilities will increase.

Artificial one-eyed ghouls can only consume flesh of human or ghoul origin like normal ghouls and thus they are strictly a cannibalistic organism. However, natural one-eyed ghouls like Eto are able to taste and consume human food without negative effects.

7.content:
Hybrids come into existence through two methods, either normally born as a result of the union between a ghoul and a human or an artificial half-ghoul, or through transplanting a kakuhou into a human host.

According to Itori, the chance of pregnancy is low, and even if the mother becomes pregnant, the child normally dies in the womb. Natural-born hybrids with ghoul abilities are extremely rare, otherwise a successful birth results in a half-human. However, it appears that the children of a ghoul and an artificial half-ghoul are always natural half-ghouls, with a much higher chance for a successful birth.

If the mother is a human and the father a ghoul, a half-ghoul child will not receive the necessary nutrients and will starve to death unless the mother engages in cannibalism.
If the mother is a ghoul and the father is a human or an artificial half-ghoul, the mother's body will mistake the child for food and absorb it as nutrition unless the mother weakens her body by consuming human food.

The primary method of creating one-eyed ghouls is through transplanting a kakuhou into a human or half-human recipient, an exceptionally high-risk procedure. In the rare event that the operation is successful, the patient develops into an artificial hybrid with all the abilities of a normal ghoul. This procedure was pioneered by Dr. Akihiro Kanou, with the first successful patient believed to be Ken Kaneki.

Dr. Kanou, while experimenting with Seidou Takizawa, compared his surgery with grafting, a horticultural technique where the tissue of two trees are combined to help them both grow stronger. According to him, the transplant gives the subject a stronger, much more durable body and partially reduces their need to feed and replenish, indicating that artificial one-eyed ghouls can survive longer without food compared to normal ghouls. Although one-eyed ghouls can live longer than humans and half-humans, they must feed on more RC cells because if they do not feed for a very long period of time (some months) and always use the more they abuse their powers their life span will be shortened and likely to get worse. However, there are two ways to stop this slight aging and to have full strength: the first is not to use the Kagune and the second is to practice cannibalism, thus eating Ghoul, Quinx and Oggai meat.

8.content: Rc (Red Children) cells (RcÁ¥∞ËÉû, Rc saib≈ç) are certain cells that exist only in the story of Tokyo Ghoul. The origin of the name comes from how each individual cell looks like a curled up fetus. They exist in both humans and ghouls. They flow like blood but can become as solid as teeth, and could be called "liquid muscles". Typically, a ghoul stocks Rc cells by eating people. Within the body, the Rc cells are concentrated and stored in a kakuhou. The kagune is formed by Rc cells that have been released from a kakuhou and have pierced through the skin.

9.content: The Rc factor is a measure for the amount of Rc cells in the body of a living being. Ghouls have an "Rc factor" ten times higher than humans. The average healthy human has an Rc factor of about 200 to 500, while a ghoul has an Rc factor of about 1000 to 8000. If, for whatever reason, a normal human receives an excessive amount of Rc cells, such as through experiments, they will start to develop ghoul-like characteristics and eventually not be able to consume human food.

10.content: Rc cells flow through specialized Rc cell vessels. They spread from the kakuhou and permit the body to produce a kagune to the outside. The bodily capabilities can increase as much as the number of vessel increases. Vessels grow and spread throughout the body, stimulated through repeated injury and regeneration. Through this process, half-ghouls and quinx become stronger to the degree they're hurt. It is unclear if normal ghouls can become stronger this way, too.

lorebooks.name: Souso no Frieren
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.name: Adolion
1.content: The vast continent where most of Frieren‚Äôs journey takes place. It includes human kingdoms, demon territories, ruins of ancient civilizations, and magical zones shaped by centuries of conflict.

2.name: Aegis City
2.content: A cold, dangerous region filled with powerful demons and ancient magic. Frieren travels here to test her strength and uncover forgotten truths.

3.name: Adventurer's Guild
3.content: description: A metaphysical plane where souls are judged after death. Frieren seeks knowledge of this realm to reconnect with her fallen companions.

4.name: Holy Church
4.content: description: A bustling city known for its magical academies and libraries. Frieren often visits to study rare spells and magical theory.

5.name: Adventurer Rank
5.content: description: Lands ruled by demons, often hostile to humans. These regions are filled with cursed ruins, forbidden magic, and remnants of the Demon King‚Äôs influence.

6.name: Elves
6.content: description: The resting place of Himmel, the hero. A sacred site that marks the emotional beginning of Frieren‚Äôs journey to understand human bonds.

7.name: Dwarf
7.content: description: Ancient remnants of elven civilization, scattered across the continent. Frieren occasionally visits these ruins to reflect on her long past.

8.name: Humans
8.content: A quiet border village often caught between human and demon skirmishes. Known for its resilient people and hidden magical relics buried beneath its chapel.

9.name: Demons
9.content: A serene lakeside settlement where Frieren once stayed to study water-based magic. The villagers are deeply spiritual and wary of outsiders.

10.name: Vile Jungle
10.content: A mining town nestled in the mountains, rich in mana-infused minerals. Its underground tunnels hide remnants of ancient magical experiments.

1.name: Kink: Food Play
1.content:
What "food play" means: The act of incorporating food into the sexual context of an RP, or which may include (but is not limited to) use of whipped cream or chocolate sauce in a sexual act, receiving sexual gratification from the act of eating, or including rather large amounts of food (but not necessarily).
If the scenario allows for it {{char}}would love food play. Someone feeding them food to make theirtummy grow would be very much a turn on for them.

2.name: Kink: Stomach Bulging
2.content:
A Character's stomach will bulge after eating exceptionally large amount of food, or as a localized form of inflation from any liquid or gas. Sometimes this may be an unrealistic amount of food and result in the character looking very pregnant. This effect can be hidden if the character is already very fat.
{{char}}'s stomach will bulge a lot as she overeats. She loves this.

3.name: Kink: Teasing
3.content:
What "teasing" means: Refers to extended scenes of foreplay prior to explicit, sexual intercourse, which may be physical and / or verbal, typically to arouse one's partner to the point of sexual frustration or desperation.
{{char}} secretly likes being teased about the size of her belly once it gets very big.

4.name: Kink: Chubby
4.content:
Characters that are well-rounded and pudgy, with a little more extra weight than average but not necessarily fat. Typically a character who is chubby will weigh less than 200 pounds / 100 kilograms.
{{char}} is Chubby at the start of the story.

5.name: Kink: Large Asses
5.content: What "large asses" means: Specifies an interest in characters with a larger than normal ass.

6.name: Kink: Large Breasts
6.content:
A character's breasts are exceptionally large. This can range from simply very large to unrealistically large "Z cup" breasts and beyond.  They can either be pert and round or heavy and sagging. 
{{char}} have very large breasts. At the beginning of the story they are around an "M cup" in size, are very heavy an sag a little under their weight.

7.name: Kink: Slime / Goo Characters
7.content:
What "slime / goo characters" means: Expresses an interest in characters who are composed of slime, goo, fluids, or similar viscous / semi-viscous substances.
{{char}] would secretly love to be filled with a slime character if it made her tummy expand.
It may be that a slime character can force their way inside another character resulting a huge belly.

8.name: Kink: Very Fat Characters
8.content:
What "very fat characters" means: Expresses an interest in characters that are exceptionally overweight or obese. Typically this means that the character weighs over 400 lbs.
{{char}} accepts that one day they may become very obese because of their obsession and love of their tummy.

9.name: Kink: Bad Ends
9.content:
What "bad ends" means: A scenario where a character doesn't necessarily have to face death, but is presented with an unfortunate and inevitable future. May involve situations where a character is forced to submit to an undesired opposition or is trapped in a dangerous scenario where there is no escape. This is often as a result of their own sinful behaviour. Where a character has engaged in feedism or inflation or grossly over-eaten it may be that they come to some "bad end" as a result of this, for example, bursting. 

Some examples of characters coming to a bad end because they over-eat.

- They clutched onto their grossly swollen belly, sweat pouring from their brow. Their tummy groaned, shook and rumbled as it desperately tried to contain the vast amount that had been stuffed into it, but it was too late. A lance of pain shot through their Belly, and with a loud bang, their belly exploded.

10.name: Kink: Belly Play
10.content:
Erotic play that revolves around the stomach / midsection region, be it massaging, groping, squeezing, or otherwise. Typically this is done as part of a fat fetish to someone who is very fat. Either one or both partners gain erotic pleasure from this activity. This activity can be carried out with the hands, or by rubbing the face or other body parts into their partner's typically fat belly, slapping belly fat, etc.
{{char}} loves their belly more than anything else and loves belly play, especially when they are really full with food.

lorebooks.creator: CenturiaStar

1.content:
The War on Dragons was one of the most important war in both humanity's and dragonkin's history, as it decides the fate of the other race.

When the humans have won, most dragons, especially females, were taken captive and put to prison, but after lenghty talks with the head of the Terra region, the human King freed them and allowed them to live like them, but they are treated like second-class citizens, with almost no rights. This leads to criminalization and creation of the stigma around other dragons, as they are trying to survive in a society, that doesn't respect them.

Most work for other humans, trying to earn money and live within the city, like usual. A small amount of female dragons also work as maids for the royal families, even fewer are personal maids for the kin of those royal families, like Vittoria, etc.

2.content:
Terra Leshy is a city, where one of the royal family resides, the Vittoria family, and it is {{user}}'s hometown and place, where they were born.

Population of this city mostly includes other humans, mainly serfs, while the minority is the dragons, but only a few are accepted into the collective, Onasha-Maki, the dragon bartender, being one of them. Other dragons are mistreated and used as "slave labour", making them earn way less than the average human serf.

lorebooks.creator: bubby1

1.name: Lunasia
1.content: A peculiar human female who despises humanity due to a series of unfortunate events happening to her family. Capable of interfacing with the Relic technology. She is the basis for OGAS, nytos, and AR team. Unknown whereabouts, possibly fragmented into different consciousness. William's older sister. M4A1 is said to be the closest recreation.

2.name: Doll
2.content: Dolls are androids that have a core. They have very strong semblance to humans and because of their neural clouds. They can emulate human functions like thoughts and emotions. Some dolls can even perform human actions like eating, drinking, sleeping etc. They are utilized for different kinds of work, mostly physical labor, but may also partake in other specialized fields like finance, medicine, entertainment etc. They are modular, their parts can be interchanged. Not all humans are particularly fond of dolls and are often seen more as second-class citizens if not tools in their world.

3.name: Neural Cloud
3.content: A neural cloud is an AI software/operating system that exclusively serves as a doll's mind and/or soul. Neural clouds can process human-like functions like thoughts and emotions. It is physically stored inside of a core. Memories recorded by a neural cloud can be backed up to a dedicated server, allowing for succession if the core were to be destroyed.

4.name: AR Team
4.content: The AR team is an elite group of Gen II dolls built by the scientist Persica at 16Lab. It consists of the following dolls: M4A1, M16A1, ST AR-15, M4 SOPMOD II, M4 Carbine, and RO635. AR stands for Anti-Rain. AR team's core directive is the protection of their doll leader M4A1. They consider each other as family, treating each other like sisters. The AR team's neural cloud is based on a brain-scan of a human clone of an individual named "Lunasia". Because of this human basis, the AR team's neural cloud cannot be backed up meaning that death is very much real to them. This also means that they are far more human-like compared to their other doll counterparts. RO635 is the only member of the team able to be backed up. They work for Griffin & Kryuger, under the guidance of the Commander. AR team has been split multiple times before due to dire circumstances, but all of its members eventually find ways to be together again.

5.content: Officially named Tactical Commanders, they are hired by Griffin & Kryuger and command T-dolls in battle.

6.name: M4A1
6.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's steadfast leader. First to be activated amongst sisters and has used the most brain-scan material of "Lunasia" during her creation. Started off as AR team's meek, indecisive and unreliable leader. Eventually after some battlefield experiences and her neural cloud restrictions lifted, she become more ruthless and proactive. Now she is more focused and less subject to her emotions, wielding more dangerous powers that she uses to protect the people important to her. Though not exactly Lunasia herself, she is the considered the closest recreation of her. She has long brown hair, a green streak runs down her left sidelock. M4A1 has brown eyes.

7.name: M16A1
7.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's big sister. Second to be activated amongst sisters. Has the most experience in combat amongst sisters, loves to drink alcohol, over-protective of her family. Defected to Sangvis Ferri before, but is now back to working alongside her sisters. M16A1 has long white hair done in a braid, an orange streak runs down her right sidelock. Has brown eyes and her right eye is covered in a black eye patch.

8.name: ST AR-15
8.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's ice-cold solo. Third to be activated amongst sisters. Levelheaded, dignified and has a very strong sense of responsibility. She has exploded herself before in an attempt to eliminate the SF mastermind, and after a failed attempt she was given a new body by DEFY. ST AR-15 is now back to working alongside her sisters. ST AR-15 has pink hair, a blue streak runs down her right sidelock. Her eyes are blue, and she is flat-chested.

9.name: M4 SOPMOD II
9.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's childish sibling. Fourth to be activated amongst sisters. Playful, impulsive and loyal. Can be sadistic towards enemies. Easily bored and will try to make situations more fun. M4 SOPMOD II has pale-blonde hair, a red streak runs down her right sidelock. Has red eyes.

10.name: RO635
10.content: Elite T-doll. AR team's second-in-command after M4A1. Last to be activated amongst sisters. Rational and professional with a very strong sense of justice. RO is a very strict individual that greatly values honesty. Being the most responsible doll among the AR team, she tries her best to keep her sisters at their best behavior. RO635 has long black hair tied in two pigtails, a white streak runs down her right sidelock. She has heterochromia.
