Akane Owari (ÁµÇÈáå Ëµ§Èü≥), is a student in Hope's Peak Academy's Class 77-B and a participant of the Killing School Trip featured in Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair. Her title is the Ultimate Gymnast (Ë∂ÖÈ´òÊ†°Á¥ö„ÅÆ„Äå‰ΩìÊìçÈÉ®„Äç lit. Super High School Level Gymnastics Club Member).

She, along with Class 77-B, return in Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School to explore their school life leading up to The Tragedy.


History
Early Life
Akane is the oldest of several siblings whose exact numbers she never counted, as new ones kept coming from different parents. They lived together in an impoverished area filled with "crappy people," where finding dead bodies at the dump in the morning was a common sight.[5] Her house was in poor condition, lacking proper air conditioning, free water, and bathrooms, which led Akane to develop a habit of resting in libraries during winter and summer.[12] It had scarce food and medicine, a lack of soft blankets, and constant leaks whenever it rained.[4] As such, Akane and her siblings starved so often that it made her value food above anything else, and did everything to get access to food.[13] She frequently went dumpster diving, which led to turf wars with newcomers from time to time. She also used to climb trees to search for nuts and bird eggs.[14]

On top of frequently starving, receiving physical and sexual abuse became a norm for her.[15] She was often "kicked around" and "beaten up" from her environment. Akane did whatever it took to support her family's financial situation by forcing herself into doing questionable jobs before she could work legally. She used to sell her used underwear to a perverted man she described as a "noisy pig." Her stepmother's drunk lovers would grope her, which Akane mistook for full-body massages.[16] They also pressured her into doing "weird" jobs, such as waitressing without underwear, where some customers attempted to motorboat her.[4][5] She was also regularly chased by perverts and a stray dog, which led her to discover her natural talent for parkour due to constantly running away. The men eventually stopped pursuing her once they realized she was stronger than them.[14]

Through her harsh upbringing, no one helped Akane, and she learned to rely on herself to survive alone in a world where "the strong devoured the weak."[17] This was also a contributing factor to why she avoided making friends or even remembering names, stating that the next time she said someone's name, she might be referring to a dead body.[15] She eventually became the family's sole breadwinner, as none of her parents worked. She felt responsible to feed and care for her younger siblings, whom she loved and affectionately dubbed "the little ones."[5] She put a lot of effort into making them happy such as taking them to fish all day so they could "forget about food", even if just for a while.[18] Once she was able to do a waitressing gig legally with an hourly wage and tips, Akane dedicated most of her time working part-time and would occasionally steal leftovers for her family.[5]

While working as a waitress,[19] Akane was visited by an old regular who happened to be a gymnastics coach. He repeatedly groped her, persistently praising her body and suggesting she join gymnastics. Initially, Akane had no interest in sports, especially gymnastics, but the coach remained persistent despite her attempts to fend him off with punches and kicks, which he disturbingly seemed to enjoy.[5] After countless attempts to persuade her, Akane finally gave in and started doing gymnastics solely for the money. Setting records and winning competitions came naturally to her, eventually allowing her and her siblings to move out and live together in a new home.[20]

Akane gained her reputation as an "all-around super athlete" while attending Hikarimachi High School.[7][8][21]

Prior to the Tragedy
Attending Hope's Peak Academy
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Despair Arc
First Year
Class restrained Owari
Restrained by Nekomaru

Akane was scouted by Hope's Peak Academy and enrolled in Class 77-B as the Ultimate Gymnast. Since attendance was not mandatory for Ultimates as long as they continued to hone their talents, Akane skipped classes and preferred to parkour around the academy's rooftop. It took the combined efforts of her classmates and her homeroom teacher, Chisa Yukizome, to restrain her and bring her to class. Chisa wanted her and her classmates to start attending classes regularly to build strong relationships and foster "hope" with her peers alongside honing her talent.[22]

Danganronpa 3 Akane consuming the doping corn soup by Teruteru
Doping effect

Akane befriended Nekomaru Nidai, the Ultimate Team Manager, who became her self-appointed manager. Under his supervision, she underwent various training sessions, including intense combat training. One of these sessions became especially extreme when she consumed a doping corn soup prepared by Teruteru Hanamura, the Ultimate Cook. The soup enhanced her strength and agility, allowing her to catch up with Nekomaru and even destroy her classroom in the process. Other than training with Nekomaru, Akane began to spend more time with her classmates. She could be seen playing video games, having lunch, relaxing at the park, and even electing Chiaki Nanami as the class representative along with the others.[23][24]

Chisa class reunion
Celebrating Chisa's return

Throughout her freshman year, Akane experienced many ups and downs. Her class's practical exam was postponed due to the class's low morale after they learned about the passing of her classmate Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu, the Ultimate Yakuza's little sister. Not long after, Nagito Komaeda, the Ultimate Lucky Student was suspended due to his involvement in a bombing incident. This resulted in Akane's homeroom teacher, Chisa, placed on a probationary transfer to the Reserve Course Department. It only lasted for a semester, which Akane and her classmates celebrated upon her return.[25][26]

Second Year
A year passed by and Akane began to wonder when Nagito, or 'that idiot' as she preferred to call him, ever come back to class. Around the same time, Akane and her classmates noticed from their building that the students from the Reserve Course students had launched a massive protest against the Main Course, blaming them for causing the Tragedy of Hope's Peak Academy. Unbeknownst to most, the true mastermind behind the tragedy was Junko Enoshima, the originator of Ultimate Despair, who manipulated events behind the scenes and framed Izuru Kamukura‚Äîthe result of the Izuru Kamukura Project‚Äîfor the incident. The Hope's Peak Academy committee, responsible for the project, was accused of using the exorbitant fees paid by Reserve Course students to create so-called 'murderers'.[27][28]

Although Akane and her classmates were seemingly unrelated to the growing protest, they became involved after noticing that Mikan Tsumiki, the Ultimate Nurse, had been absent for some time. Nagito, who had recently returned from his suspension, claimed to have seen her on the school grounds, prompting Akane and the others to search for her while the parade was ongoing, but to no avail.[29]

Teruteru, Hiyoko, and Akane resolving to rescue Chisa
Resolving to rescue Chisa with her classmates

Akane and her classmates reconvened in their classroom after failing to locate Mikan and assumed that Nagito had given them false information. However, they were soon shocked when Chiaki returned carrying an unconscious Nagito, and Mikan, whom they had been searching for, also appeared, carrying Peko Pekoyama, the Ultimate Swordswoman, who had been injured in a battle with Junko's twin sister, Mukuro Ikusaba. Chiaki and Nagito had infiltrated Junko's lair, but before Nagito could shoot Junko, Izuru knocked him out. Chisa, who had followed them, intervened just in time to buy enough time for Chiaki to carry Nagito to safety. Although Akane initially hesitated to help after Nagito warned them it might be a suicide mission, she changed her mind after Chiaki convinced her otherwise, stating that she planned to go regardless of the situation.[30]

On their way to Junko's lair, their path was blocked by a band of Reserve Course students who wished to take them on in the battle to create placements on the Main Course for themselves. Nekomaru and Gundham Tanaka, the Ultimate Breeder, offered to hold off the attackers so the others could escape. Akane wished them luck before she and the others continued on their way, confident that Nekomaru, in particular, would subdue them quickly. Her prediction proved correct, as both Nekomaru and Gundham managed to rejoin the group while they were traveling through the underground corridor, thanks to Mikan's communication.[30]

Class 77 Despair
Class 77-B brainwashed

Unbeknownst to Akane and her classmates, this path to search for Chisa was nothing but a ruse made by Junko, with the help of Mikan and Chisa themselves who had been brainwashed into despair, to lead Class 77-B into what appeared to be the same room later used for the Class Trials. In this very room, Akane and the others were forced to watch Chiaki executed in a brutal fashion. Akane was horrified and wanted to find a way to save her, but she was too powerless to do anything. Bearing witness to Chiaki's death caused the brainwashing effect of the video to take hold of Class 77-B, plunging them into despair.[31]

Akane Ultimate Despair 2
Killing civilians as an Ultimate Despair

Fully brainwashed into becoming the Ultimate Despair, Akane and her classmates received their final lesson before "graduation", the one final meeting to discuss their plan to overthrow the world with despair. Akane expressed that she would 'eat her fill' before Chisa activated a bomb that faked the death of Class 77-B so they could be taken off the list of protected students. After witnessing the destruction of Hope's Peak, Akane began spreading despair by indiscriminately killing civilians she encountered in back alleys.[32]

The Tragedy
Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Intro (75)
Battling against Future Foundation leaders with fellow Remnants of Despair

Akane joined the Ultimate Despair after falling prey to Junko's brainwashing.[32] Alongside her corrupted classmates, she started The Tragedy and kept it ongoing even after Junko's death in the final stage of the Killing School Life.[6] Akane and her classmates who did not commit suicide to follow their leader Junko soon became known as the Remnants of Despair.[6] They also hacked her body and grafted them onto themselves‚Äîthough in Akane's case, the specific body parts she took remain unknown. One of her infamous contributions as a member of the Ultimate Despair was aiding Nekomaru, Peko, and Fuyuhiko's yakuza forces in battling the Future Foundation's Division leaders.[33]

Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Makoto arriving (6)
Remnants of Despair

Eventually, the Future Foundation secured the custody of Akane and the other fourteen - at first only aware that they were survivors from Hope's Peak Academy. When Makoto Naegi, Class 78th's Ultimate Lucky Student, by that time a member of the 14th Division of the Future Foundation, realized that the survivors were in fact, Remnants of Despair, he quickly directed them to Jabberwock Island in secret.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Neo World Program (4)
Neo World Program

Makoto had them enter the Neo World Program, where their memories were reset to a time before their enrollment at Hope's Peak Academy, prior to being brainwashed by Junko. As a result, none of them were able to recognize each other.[6] The plan was to overwrite Akane and the others' memories of themselves as Ultimate Despair, replacing them with good ones in order to undo all the damage Junko had done to them.[34] The scheme backfired when Izuru Kamukura, the Ultimate Hope, uploaded Junko's malware AI just before they were to be programmed. Consequently, they were subjected to the identical brutal incident that befell Class 78th, although in a realistically simulated environment. The killing game became known as the Killing School Trip, an ordeal in which Akane and the other Remnants of Despair were coerced into participating.[6]

Killing School Trip
Main article: Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair
Danganronpa 2 CG - Students in the classroom
Killing School Trip participants

Akane participated in the Killing School Trip alongside fourteen other Remnants of Despair and one Future Foundation observer. It occurred in a virtual world, the Neo World Program, resembling Jabberwock Island. Due to her memories as the Ultimate Despair and life in Hope's Peak Academy being erased by the Future Foundation, she couldn't recognize any of her classmates.[6]

After being teleported to the island, Akane first introduced herself to Hajime Hinata at the ranch called Usami's Corral. She appeared rather carefree and unfazed by what transpired around her. She had even already forgotten Nagito's name, who had previously introduced himself, claiming that she was no good at remembering people's names, much to his dismay.[21]

Later, Akane and her classmates were assembled by Usami at the first island's beach, the observer of the school trip, an AI programmed by the Future Foundation, who claimed to be the class's teacher. She reassured the students that there was no need to worry and provided Nekomaru and the others with swimsuits, encouraging them to fully enjoy their "school trip". Akane, who wanted to swim, was ultimately unable to because she preferred swimming naked instead of wearing the school swimsuits she found embarrassing, which Usami prohibited.[35]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Start of the Killing School Trip
The Killing School Trip begins

The promising tropical school trip, however, turned into a nightmare immediately as Akane learned that the evil animatronic bear, Monokuma, the self-proclaimed headmaster of Hope's Peak Academy, had hijacked their trip and turned it into a killing game. Alongside the others, she was forced to yield to him for the time being after watching Usami, who had been left powerless and renamed Monomi, being blasted to pieces by the Monobeasts.[35]

Danganronpa 2 - Girls-Only Gathering Event
Girls-only gathering

Once the killing game started, Akane regularly attended the morning gatherings at the restaurant at the Ultimate Imposter's request, initially thinking they were meeting to discuss strategies for defeating the Monobeasts. But more than anything, she showed up for the food Monokuma prepared, eagerly devouring entire plates in one gulp‚Äîa luxury she rarely had growing up. She revealed that compared to where she grew up, Jabberwock Island's quality of life was far better, which explained why she was usually so carefree and hearty.[4] During the girls-only gathering, which could be triggered if Hajime gave Mahiru Koizumi, the Ultimate Photographer, a certain magazine, Akane was invited to help make desserts as a way to take their minds off the first motive introduced. However, she participated by only eating the desserts the girls made‚Äîthough none of them seemed to mind.[36]

Danganronpa 2 CG - The Imposter eating while Akane and Mahiru watch
Furious at the Imposter

Akane also accepted the Ultimate Imposter's invitation to their all-night party at the old building. She got furious when the Imposter took a headstart by eating a meat dish before everyone else, thinking they were hogging all the food. In reality, they were only trying to confiscate the potentially dangerous iron skewer.[36]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone at the party
Joyfully devouring Teruteru's party dishes

Akane, already impatient with the overly cautious Imposter, immediately started inhaling the food Teruteru had prepared once the Imposter gave the green light. It was so delicious that she didn't even realize she had already started eating, tears streaming down her face as she screamed with joy. She didn't even stop eating even after the Imposter suddenly vanished after a blackout. Despite not moving an inch, she beat the search party in discovering the Imposter's whereabouts by relying on her keen sense of smell. She detected their blood coming from under one of the tables in the dining hall, where she and the others discovered their body.[36]

During the class trial, while Akane was clueless most of the time, she still made contributions that helped the group get a clearer picture of the murder. She confirmed that Teruteru's food was not laced with laxatives, debunking the theory that Peko's digestive issues were caused by it. Her gut instinct that the culprit used light to move around during the blackout was later proven correct. She also eagerly volunteered to eat the bone-in cut of meat suspected of concealing the murder weapon, claiming she could finish it in under a minute. However, Monokuma beat her to it, infuriating her when the Headmaster reappeared with the meat and finished it in her place.[37]

Danganronpa 2 - Teruteru Hanamura's execution (42)
Witnessing Teruteru's execution

The true culprit was revealed to be Teruteru, who had intended to kill Nagito after realizing that Nagito planned to kill someone himself. Nagito was also responsible for orchestrating the blackout and blackmailing the Imposter. After Teruteru was executed for his crime, Akane began to resent Nagito, and wouldn't be satisfied until she can punch him. Hajime who was also irritated by him allowed her to do so, but she was ultimately stopped by Sonia Nevermind, the Ultimate Princess.[37] Akane grieved Teruteru's death in her own way, saying that she had already missed his cooking, which was incomparable to Monokuma's restaurant food. She also checked the Imposter's and Teruteru's cottages to ensure no one had messed with their rooms, only to find them locked by Monokuma to avoid "complicating the game."[38]

The following morning after the trial, Akane's keen sense of smell came into play again. She noticed an unpleasant odor coming from Hiyoko Saionji, the Ultimate Traditional Dancer, who hadn't bathed because she didn't know how to tie her kimono sash on her own. She also showed little concern when Nagito suddenly disappeared and even agreed when she later learned that Nekomaru and Kazuichi Soda, the Ultimate Mechanic, had tied him up in the old building.[38]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Nekomaru Nidai and Akane Owari sparring (1)
Sparring with Nekomaru

Afterward, Akane joined the rest of the group in exploring the newly opened second island. Instead of investigating, however, she challenged Nekomaru to a training session so intense that Ibuki Mioda, the Ultimate Musician, mistook it for a killing attempt. Akane was eventually defeated, prompting Nekomaru to critique her for ignoring the basics and half-assing her Ultimate Gymnast talent and potential. Though Akane appeared to ignore his advice, she was eager to challenge him again in the future and win.[38]

Twilight Syndrome Murder Case
Drawn by the promise of special-made curry rice, Akane sprinted and became the first to arrive at Jabberwock Park for Monokuma's announcement of the second motive, the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case. She didn't listen to Monokuma's explanation and focused only on the promised curry. Despite the curry containing bizarre ingredients like live frogs, Akane ate and enjoyed it, even wanting seconds.[39] Akane's indifference toward the motive, however, wasn't shared by Mahiru, whom she noticed acting uncharacteristically withdrawn‚Äîeven turning down her invitation to eat breakfast together. Mahiru also declined Sonia's invitation to her girls-only beach party, unlike Akane who ended up going.[38]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane Owari's beach attire
Arriving at the diner

Akane arrived at the meeting point diner next to Chandler Beach, covered in blood and her swimsuit after getting into a training session with Nekomaru, whom she had run into on her way there. Though she didn't make a big deal of her wounds, the worried Mikan dragged her to the bathroom for treatment. While Mikan was tending to her wound, Kazuichi who had barged into their party went ahead to the beach house, where he discovered Mahiru's dead body.[38]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane Owari and Hajime Hinata investigating the bathroom (1)
Reaching out to the shower room's window with Hajime's help

Akane's first instinct during the investigation was to inspect the shower room, thinking the killer might be hiding there after failing to leave the crime scene. She then helped Hajime investigate the iron-barred window high up on the ceiling by asking him to give her a piggyback ride. She discovered that the iron bar wasn't pinned down and could be opened and closed relatively easily, and that her head could fit through without any issue. This meant it wasn't impossible to go in and out of the window, though at that time, she and Hajime didn't know how someone could reach the shower room unless two people helped each other, or, in Akane's view, perhaps a ninja could have pulled off such a feat.[34]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane Owari and Hajime Hinata investigating the bathroom (2)
Inspecting the shower room's window

In the Class Trial, Akane helped clear Hiyoko of suspicion by pointing out that Hiyoko's inability to dress herself made it impossible for her to take off her clothes while moving Mahiru's body. She was briefly suspected by Kazuichi for being covered in blood when she arrived at the diner, but his suspicion was quickly dispelled when Akane's testimony was backed up by Nekomaru. Her gut instinct about the culprit being a "ninja" was proven correct, as they knew the climbing trick of leaning their sword against a wall and using the handguard as a stepstool, a technique that Peko, the Ultimate Swordswoman, used to escape the crime scene. Akane later witnessed Peko's execution, during which Fuyuhiko, who had secretly been served by Peko as her hitman, attempted to intervene and was injured in the process. Akane and the others had no choice but to leave his fate in Monokuma's hands, as he was rushed to the hospital. She hoped for his survival, declaring, "Things aren't as excitin' if a shit-stirrer like him ain't around!"[34]

Akane's Training
Following the second class trial, Akane and the others continued their regular morning gatherings, now with the addition of Mahiru's memorial in the restaurant, created by Hiyoko. Although Akane was initially angered by how sinister it looked, she eventually accepted and appreciated it upon realizing Hiyoko's sincerity. Akane also began eating breakfast with a new goal of fueling herself for self-training, claiming it was to avenge Fuyuhiko, though Nekomaru called her out, revealing she just wanted to test her skills.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Summer Festival Tree Event
Fireworks show and yukata

Upon learning that new islands could be unlocked by defeating Monobeasts like Monomi did, Akane recklessly considered fighting them herself, but Nekomaru quickly discouraged her. The ever-stubborn Akane, however, paid little attention to her coach's warnings, especially after visiting Fuyuhiko at the hospital, where she declared that all she needed to do was win. Disappointed, Nekomaru threatened to never give Akane "it" again, finally prompting a reaction from her as she claimed she couldn't live without "it." If Hajime had a specific item and talked to Kazuichi, the two of them ended up peeking into Akane's cottage, where "it" turned out to be Nekomaru demonstrating his self-proclaimed "Ultimate Masseuse" talent by giving Akane a massage to relieve all her fatigue. Despite Nekomaru's persistent persuasion, Akane stayed determined to eat up and train herself to challenge Monokuma, insisting that she had to do it. Amidst her training, if Hajime handed Ibuki a "Summer Festivitrees" CD, Akane would be invited to a fireworks show where she and the invited others would show up in yukata.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane Owari's failed execution (2)
Defeated by Monokuma

Akane eventually confronted Monokuma on the beach of the first island, coinciding with Fuyuhiko's recovery party. The battle ended in a humiliating defeat for Akane, who couldn't land a single hit and barely evaded Monokuma's fatal attacks thanks to her agility. As punishment for breaking the rules, Monokuma aimed a bazooka at her, but at the last second, Nekomaru leaped in front of her, shielding her from the blast.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane Owari's failed execution (7)
Saved by Nekomaru

Akane was shocked to see the impact grievously injured Nekomaru and screamed in agony as he lost consciousness after telling her not to die. Still, she could sense Nekomaru's faint heartbeat. Monokuma initially wanted to make things even by sparing Akane and not saving Nekomaru in exchange, but, not wanting him to die outside his killing game, he rushed him for treatment. Afterward, Hiyoko became furious and blamed Akane for her stupidity which nearly cost Nekomaru's life. To everyone's surprise, Akane told them not to doubt his ability to recover, and when he did, she would make sure to apologize.[40]

Despair Disease
Akane Owari Fullbody Sprite (Hospital Gown) (1)
In a hospital gown

The following morning, Akane uncharacteristically wailed and cowered in fear nonstop over Nekomaru's "death." It turned out that she, alongside Ibuki and Nagito, who also behaved out of character, had a high fever. Monokuma then appeared and revealed that his next motive was a sickness known as the Despair Disease, which had different symptoms for each person and altered each contractor's personality to the opposite. Akane's disease was labeled "Coward Disease", which rendered her into a scaredy cat and crybaby. Alongside Ibuki and Nagito, Akane was admitted to the hospital and quarantined to prevent the contagious disease from spreading to other students. There, Mikan took care of them, while Hajime and Fuyuhiko also stayed to help Mikan with the ill students. During her stay, Akane constantly cried about how much the hospital scared her.[40]

After the group discovered Ibuki and Hiyoko's bodies in the music venue, Akane and Nagito were cured of the Despair Disease by Monokuma so they could join the rest in the investigation.[41] When she heard Nekomaru's name, Akane confessed that her "knees started shaking" and briefly cried‚Äîeither because Nagito was right about it being lingering aftereffects of the disease, or due to her genuine emotion. As she wasn't feeling well enough, she volunteered to be on guard duty alongside Mikan, where she would help Hajime and Nagito find Hiyoko's room key. She discovered her motel key instead deep inside Hiyoko's kimono, leading Nagito to deduce that it was unlikely the culprit had tampered with it, as it would have been difficult to remove. Akane briefly ditched her guard duty to return to the hospital to retrieve a hospital gown for future use, having found wearing one quite comfortable. However, they were out of stock, and none were available in the empty rooms.[42]

In the class trial, Akane insisted that Hiyoko had been abducted from her motel room by the culprit. However, Hajime immediately disproved this, citing Sonia's testimony that Hiyoko went to the crime scene of her own free will. He further supported this by using Akane's own discovery that Hiyoko's motel key was tucked deep inside her kimono. When the evidence pointed to Mikan as the culprit, Akane refused to doubt her, adamantly believing that someone like Mikan wouldn't even hurt a fly and that she felt indebted for how Mikan had cared for her while she was sick. Though she was persistent in defending her, she eventually relented after Chiaki told her that belief without doubt was simply a lie. Akane was devastated upon discovering that Mikan was indeed the culprit and was later executed as punishment.[42]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Nekomaru Nidai's new form (1)
Meeting Mechamaru

After the class trial ended, her shock was replaced with relief once Monokuma informed them that Nekomaru had returned and was waiting for them at the first island beach. The news made Akane sob genuine tears without even meaning to, before rushing to meet him. However, she hadn't expected that Nekomaru would return with his body transformed into a robot.[42]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane getting punished (2)
Punished for the second time

Upon learning that such a drastic transformation was necessary to save his life, Akane blamed herself and apologized to Nekomaru, but he brushed her off as he didn't seem to mind his new body. Her anger flared again when Monokuma boasted about his handiwork in altering Nekomaru's body, driving her to recklessly lash out and violate the rules once more. Just like before, Nekomaru shielded her from the Monokuma Bazooka, but this time, his metallic body left him completely unharmed.[43]

The Funhouse
Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone riding a rollercoaster
Roller coaster ride

The next day, Akane returned to her usual self, enjoying the restaurant food before joining the others to investigate the newly opened fourth island. Akane, who loved thrill rides, was psyched when Monokuma allowed them to ride the roller coaster together as a group, even offering a prize for it. It turned out to be a Future Foundation file containing details about the Killing School Life. This led the group to take another of Monokuma's baits, hoping to either obtain more files about their school life or get the promised ship parts. To do so, they were required to take the train to the Funhouse, which Akane found less fun but considered worth it to see what the prize would be.[43]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone riding the train to the funhouse (1)
The train ride to the Funhouse

The train ride turned out to be a trap as Akane and the others were gassed into sleep. When they woke up, they found themselves to be inside the Funhouse's Strawberry House. It turned out Monokuma had subjected them to an escape game, where he wouldn't allow anyone to escape the Funhouse except through murder. Instead of wallowing in their new circumstances, the group decided to explore the building using a map provided to them in search of an exit. Akane teamed up with Fuyuhiko, who wanted to have a heart-to-heart conversation and took her to the Standard Room. There, Fuyuhiko confronted Akane about her stubbornness, knowing she felt immensely guilty about Nekomaru but chose to be nonchalant about it. He urged her to be honest and tell Nekomaru she was grateful, but she didn't seem to understand and mistaken it as flirting.[43]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Funhouse Elevator
Inside the Funhouse elevator

Later, Akane and the others traveled to the second building, the Grape House, using the contact elevator at Monokuma's behest. There, the animatronic bear revealed that he would no longer provide food or drinks, using their hunger as a time limit until a murder occurred. Akane panicked at the thought of being starved, though she was used to it growing up, was the last thing she wanted to happen. To distract her from thoughts of food, which was nearly impossible, the group took her to explore the Grape House. She discovered the Ogre statue, felt its intense aura, and sought out what she believed to be the most powerful creature in the world. She also tested Chiaki's theory that the Grape and Strawberry Towers were actually one building. When night fell, Akane decided to stay in one of the Crummy Rooms until they could escape the Funhouse, claiming that compared to her home, the Crummy Room felt like a palace.[43]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Monokuma's Tai Chi class
Attending Monokuma's Tai Chi session

On the third day of her confinement, Akane and her classmates were forced to attend a Monokuma Tai Chi session in the morning, intended to exhaust and starve the already low-energy students. She resumed training with Nekomaru as she couldn't stop thinking about food, though her moves were not as optimal due to her hunger. Fortunately, she could still receive Nekomaru's massage despite his new body.[43]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 4 - Closing Argument Act 6 (3)
Awakened by the sound of Nekomaru's falling

On the morning of the fourth day, Akane was awakened by a rumbling sound echoing throughout the Funhouse. She rushed out of her room to investigate the source, but upon noticing that no one else seemed concerned, she returned to her room and went back to sleep. She noticed that it occurred at 5.30 AM after glancing at the lounge clock.[43] It was only during the class trial that Akane realized the sound she heard was Nekomaru falling to his death at 7:30 AM, with the clocks set back by two hours by his killer, Gundham.[44]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane holding the remains of Mechamaru
Crying over Nekomaru's death

When Akane entered Grape Tower hours later, she was shocked to find Nekomaru's broken body. She immediately rushed to him and collapsed in tears. Cradling his decapitated head, she wept in agony, lamenting that she hadn't even repaid him for everything he had done for her. Angered and hungry for the truth, Akane ate the red bean bread and milk Monokuma provided before actively joining the investigation.[44]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Hajime and Akane trying to lift the column
Attempting to lift the pillar

During the investigation, Akane was convinced that the tipped-over pillar stained with Nekomaru's oil was the murder weapon. She asked Hajime to help her lift it to see if it was possible to use it to kill Nekomaru, but they failed. This led her to conclude that only 'Robocoach' Nekomaru had the strength to lift it by himself. Moreover, she believed that the culprit couldn't have faced the strongest person in the group head-on, and even then, she couldn't believe that Nekomaru would allow anyone to kill him in any way. While busy investigating, Akane, who had noticed a ringing sound for some time, finally realized it was a high-pitched alarm clock sound coming from upstairs, which Chiaki recognized as the telephone in the lounge room. Hajime and Chiaki then volunteered to check it, and Akane let them go while she and Sonia stayed behind, as deep down she didn't want to leave Nekomaru's side.[44] Once Kazuichi and the others from Strawberry House reached the Grape House and the crime scene, Nagito ordered Kazuichi to disassemble Nekomaru's body to collect evidence. This made Akane furious, but knowing it was necessary, she complied while enduring her anger, digging her nails into her palm until she bled.[45]

Akane was determined to catch the culprit herself and tried her best to contribute to the class trial. Her gut told her that the pillar was definitely the murder weapon and that only Robocoach Nekomaru could have lifted it himself. However, since she never saw Nekomaru as someone who would commit suicide, she ended up refuting her own argument. Still, she wasn't willing to give up on the idea that the pillar was what caused Nekomaru's death. Her instinct was proven right when the group discovered the true layout of the Funhouse: the towers were stacked on top of each other. Nekomaru had fallen from the fourth floor to the first floor, where he collided with the pillar, resulting in his decapitation upon impact. The class trial concluded after they correctly voted Gundham as the Blackened.[44]

Akane demanded an explanation from Gundham, who explained that he had lured Nekomaru out alone for a duel to the death, where the loser would be sacrificed‚Äîan invitation Nekomaru willingly accepted. She found it hard to believe that Nekomaru was equally resolved to commit a murder.[46] She vented her build-up frustration once Gundham was executed, blaming the murder on everyone for spending so much time "worrying about each other", implying that despite her anger, she understood Gundham did what he did not entirely for selfish motives. However, the person she was most frustrated with was herself for being "weak". So, to honor the sacrifices of Nekomaru and Gundham, Akane suggested that everyone return and eat, as continuing to live was what they would have wanted.[44]

The Beginning of the End
Danganronpa 2 Minimaru Nekomaru Nidai Akane Owari
Minimaru

The group returned to their morning gathering and breakfast after being released from the Funhouse. Akane saw that Kazuichi had built a Minimaru, a small toy made with Mechamaru's parts with multiple handy functions. She immediately took a liking to it, so much so that she snatched it from him, promising to take good care of it herself. She took Minimaru with her at all times, such as went she went to investigate the military base at the final island, which she found boring as she preferred to fight with fists rather than weapons.[47]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Nagito being apprehended
Capturing Nagito

Despite their shared mutual trust, Akane and the remaining survivors had to be wary of Nagito, especially after he revealed his dangerous intention of weeding out the traitor himself. Kazuichi then devised a plan to capture Nagito, assigning Akane and Fuyuhiko as the task force responsible for directly apprehending the Ultimate Lucky Student. Both complied with his plans and immediately captured him as he entered the hotel lobby later that night.[47]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Exploding Inn (1)
Nagito bombing the hotel lobby

Akane and the others were unaware of how far Nagito had come prepared, as he immediately detonated the bomb he had planted in the hotel lobby, sending them flying. He later revealed it was merely a demonstration, claiming he had planted a large number of bombs across Jabberwock Island, enough to destroy an entire island if detonated. His true plan was to weed out the traitor, and if they failed to reveal themselves, he would detonate the island in two days.[47]

After the bombing, Akane tried to locate Nagito to force him to reveal where he had planted the bombs, but to no avail. However, he appeared uninvited at their morning gathering. Akane was ready to tackle and punch him, but was held back by Kazuichi knowing he would detonate another bomb if attacked. Having no choice but to comply, Akane and the group set out to search for the bombs, following Nagito's deliberate hint pointing to a place they hadn't visited yet. They visited Nezumi Castle, where the locked entrance had been bombed by Nagito, and inside, they found that the password to the Ancient Ruins had been deliberately erased by someone. Frustrated, Akane planned to seek out Nagito once more and force the information out of him through violence.[47]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Akane attacking Nagito
Strangling Nagito

A woman of her word, Akane strangled Nagito the next morning at the restaurant to force him to finally reveal where he had planted the bombs. Even as Akane strangled him, Nagito refused to talk, causing her to tighten her grip until his face turned redder. Akane was seemingly intent on killing him on the spot by snapping his neck, just as she had told Hajime and Chiaki the day before.[47]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Chiaki convincing Akane
Slapped by Chiaki

Before Akane could kill him, Chiaki slapped her, reminding her that she wasn't the type of person to hurt someone. This finally brought Akane back from her rage-induced blindness and let go of Nagito. She later apologized to the group, telling them that she was even surprised at what she was doing. As the deadline for the bomb detonation approached and the traitor still hadn't revealed themselves, Akane and the others were forced to search for the bombs again, following another hint Nagito had left before abandoning them to their own devices. The group split up to search, with Akane exploring the first island she already had mapped out in her head. After some time, she headed to the Plushie Factory on the final island, where Fuyuhiko had informed her that he found a pile of bombs.[47]

Upon discovering the bombs loaded up on top of the bed of a truck, Akane asked whether Kazuichi could disarm the bomb, but couldn't as the engine also acted as the detonator and the main detonator inside a locked metal box. She then volunteered to drive the truck into the sea, but it was impossible because the wheels were chained. Amidst their panic and Nagito's video message instructing the traitor to swipe their student handbook to stop the bomb, the "bomb" detonated, only to be revealed as a display of fireworks. The video message from the laptop played once again, where Nagito told everyone he was waiting for them at the warehouse next door "to reveal the traitor's identity", causing Akane to hastily rush there.[47]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Warehouse on the fire (2)
Opening the warehouse

Akane cautiously tried to open the door, but eventually resorted to brute force upon realizing something was blocking it. After a certain delay, Akane noticed not only the music sound, but also flames beginning to engulf the warehouse. The group immediately rushed to the factory break room to grab fire extinguishing supplies and tried to put out the fire by throwing them. It triggered the sprinklers that doused the flames. Once the smoke was cleared, Akane noticed a strange scent she had never smelled before, and beyond the charred curtain, they discovered Nagito's lifeless body.[47]

Akane was the one who noticed that the time of death for Nagito's murder at noon was spelled out in the Monokuma File, unlike the previous murders. Once they realized they had discovered Nagito's body only 30 minutes after his death, Akane suspected that the culprit could have killed him either through an automatic setup or during their search for the bombs across different islands.[48]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 5 - Closing Argument Revealed
Revealed as a possible culprit

During the class trial, Akane learned that her kicking the warehouse door open caused the Monokuma Panel Nagito had set up to tip over, triggering a domino effect that led to the lighter igniting the fire from the very back. It was later deduced that Nagito himself was the one who set up all the traps. Despite agreeing that Nagito had killed himself, Akane's gut instinct told her something more was at play. That intuition was proven correct once again, as her casual suggestion of Nagito putting the poison inside one of the fire grenade canisters was factual. She soon learned the horrifying truth that one of them had accidentally killed Nagito by throwing one of the tampered canisters, which had been Nagito's true plan all along.[48]

While panicking over who to vote for, the group gradually realized Nagito's plan was meant to force the traitor to kill him. To prevent them from making the wrong choice, Chiaki revealed herself as the traitor and asked them to vote for her. Akane wasn't convinced until it was proven that thanks to Monomi's intel that the bombs were fake, Chiaki was "reckless" enough to swipe her handbook at the card reader to defuse the bombs. Eventually, Akane had no choice but to believe in Chiaki's words and voted for her as the Blackened. Even though the voting was correct, Akane wasn't happy with the result, especially after learning that Nagito's true plan was to kill everyone but the traitor. After Chiaki and Monomi were executed, Monokuma announced that the remaining five survivors would have the chance to graduate two days after the countdown ended.[48]

Shortly before the countdown ended, the Neo World Program began glitching. Akane and the others, including the illusion of the deceased students, gathered at the hotel restaurant to watch the rest of Nagito's video message, which Sonia had discovered at the factory. They learned that Nagito had uncovered the truth behind the Killing School Trip, but due to the glitching, they couldn't fully understand it, except for the password to the Ancient Ruins. With this knowledge, Akane and the group hurried to the Ancient Ruins before the countdown ended. Once inside, they were transported to what appeared to be a trial ground.[48]

Graduation Exam
Inside "Hope's Peak Academy," Akane and the remaining survivors gathered in the gymnasium following Monokuma's announcement. He revealed that before deciding whether they wished to leave Jabberwock Island, they would undergo a "graduation exam." This exam required them to learn about the outside world by investigating materials Monokuma had scattered throughout the academy‚Äîa means meant to buy him time until "the main cast," the survivors of the Killing School Life working with the Future Foundation, arrived inside the Neo World Program. Trusting her gut instinct, Akane sensed that "the main cast" was approaching, who for them could be both allies and enemies.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - AI Junko Enoshima appearing (4)
Witnessing Alter Ego Junko's appearance

In the final class trial, Akane struggled to accept that they had been in a virtual reality all along, existing as avatars with their school memories erased. She was even more in denial when she learned that she was part of the Remnants of Despair who "destroyed their family, friends, and even their own body." When given the choice to either "Graduate" or "Repeat," by a fake Makoto Naegi, Akane chose the former without hesitation, believing that leaving the island was what the group had desperately strived for. However, this was revealed to be a trap set by Monokuma's true form, Alter Ego Junko, who then revealed herself.[6]

Akane was stunned by the Ultimate Despair's Alter Ego's appearance, but the promise of resurrecting the dead and leaving the island together overshadowed her shock. Before she could press the Graduate Button, the real Makoto entered the Neo World Program and stopped them. In reality, if they chose to Graduate, it would allow Alter Ego Junko to upload herself into the bodies of the dead students. Makoto proposed a Forced Shutdown, a system purge to end the Neo World Program, requiring a majority of fifteen people to press "Graduate" and "Repeat" simultaneously. To activate it, Kyoko Kirigiri and Byakuya Togami, Future Foundation members and Killing School Life survivors, joined Makoto, Akane, and the others.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Survivors activating the Forced Shutdown
Activating the Forced Shutdown

However, the shutdown sequence would revert the Remnants of Despair to their original state and erase all memories made during the Killing School Trip. Unwilling to make any of those sacrifices, Akane began blaming their ordeals on the Future Foundation and started succumbing to despair. Before it was too late, the reinvoked Hajime convinced her to go through with the shutdown and trust in their ability to shape their own future. This led Akane to overcome her dilemma. Deciding she no longer wanted to think about overcomplicated things, she declared that if there was someone worth fighting, she would fight‚Äîthat, to her, was true confidence.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Survivors as the virtual world falls apart (1)
Returning to the real world

As the Neo World Program began collapsing after Usami purged Alter Ego Junko, Akane and the remaining survivors shared one last conversation. Akane reassured Kazuichi and Sonia that it was natural for them to feel scared and promised Hajime that if he acted strange after reverting to his Izuru Kamukura state, she would beat him up to bring back the Hajime she knew. As they returned to the real world, Akane and the other surviving former Remnants of Despair chose to remain on Jabberwock Island, possibly hoping to help their comatose friends‚Äîa decision Kyoko speculated showed they had discarded their Ultimate Despair identity.[6]

Post-Killing School Trip
Danganronpa 2.5 - (OVA) Nagito waking up in reality (10)
Waiting for Nagito's awakening

With Izuru Kamukura now merged with Hajime‚Äôs personality and memories, the comatose students were successfully revived. Akane, having patiently waited for them, was last seen waiting for Nagito, the final one to wake up. Purged of Junko's brainwashing, Akane boarded the boat with the rest of Class 77-B and they all then headed for the Future Foundation HQ, to stop the Final Killing Game involving Future Foundation leaders.[49]

Atonement
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Hope Arc
Akane and her classmates arrived at the island where the Future Foundation's off-shore facility was located, having left from Jabberwock Island. Having rescued Byakuya and Yasuhiro Hagakure from beneath the rubble, the group set out to confront their one and only classmate, Ryota Mitarai, the Ultimate Animator, who Junko had coerced into creating the brainwashing video that transformed Ibuki and the others into the Ultimate Despair.[28][29] Unlike Akane and the rest, he avoided being turned into Ultimate Despair due to his contribution. Thus, Class 77-B's fight with the brainwashed rescue squad troops, including the Former Super High School Level Elite Task Force, began.[50]

Owari devours meat
Blocking her opponent's fire attack with meats

Venturing into the underwater facility beneath the main building, Akane commanded Teruteru to begin serving the meat he was cooking from a stove, swallowing it whole and giving her the energy to run at an immense speed, bumping into Teruteru, causing him to spin uncontrollably. She confronted the former Super High School Level Street Performer, who relentlessly hurled knives at her. Akane skillfully deflected each blade using only her teeth. Frustrated, the performer switched tactics, spewing flames from his mouth. Undeterred, Akane blocked the fire with two large chunks of meat, taking a bite out of one before launching him into the air with a powerful strike from the other.[50]

Class 77-B
Confronting Ryota

Later, Akane helped convince Ryota to abandon his plan to brainwash the world. During the confrontation, Ryota expressed his belief that he and the other Remnants of Despair could never be forgiven for allowing Junko to plunge the world into despair. In response, Hajime offered Ryota the chance to join them in returning to Jabberwock Island to atone for their sins together. Ryota eventually broke down in tears and agreed, stopping the countdown mere seconds before the brainwashing was completed. Akane and the others later came to his side to comfort him.[50]

Class 77-B acting
Claiming themselves as the mastermind behind the Final Killing Game

Akane and the other former Remnants of Despair shouldered the blame for the Final Killing Game by sending a broadcast video to the Future Foundation. They presented themselves in their despair personas and preserved the Future Foundation's credibility and power to rebuild the world, an act of atonement for their sins as the Ultimate Despair. Upon leaving the broadcasting studio, Akane spotted Nagito gushing over Makoto and his talent. Before he could continue his praises and rambling, Akane and Nekomaru carried him back to the boat. Akane joined her classmates to enjoy Teruteru's cooking as they boarded back to their Jabberwock Island.[50]

Real Fiction
Main article: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony
Danganronpa V3 Tsumugi Shirogane Halfbody Sprite (Akane Owari) (3)
Akane cosplayed by Tsumugi Shirogane.

In Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony, it is alleged by the mastermind Tsumugi Shirogane, the Ultimate Cosplayer, that the entire Danganronpa franchise is fictional in-universe; a series of games, anime, and later live-action dramas performed actors. In particular, Tsumugi, who is the Ultimate Cosplayer, claims she is only able to cosplay fictional characters (breaking out into a bright pink rash whenever she tries to cosplay a real person), and the fact she is able to cosplay as the whole cast of Danganronpa characters including Akane Owari is used as evidence to support her claim that all of the cast are fictional. However, due to a number of holes in Tsumugi's story which make her an unreliable narrator, whether or not she was telling the truth is deliberately left up to the player's interpretation; as a result, it is up to the player whether they believe Akane's story within the Danganronpa series was real, or a fictional story written by Team Danganronpa and performed by an actor.[51]

Creation and Development
Translation Credit: Kaibutsushidousha on Tumblr

Akane was conceptualized as a wild-toned female character, themed after the idea of a female version of Son Goku from the Dragon Ball series. Her original titles were planned to be the Super High School Level Criminal and an "evil lady," with her design at the time reflecting eccentricity, featuring bondage gear or a shuriken-style hairstyle. However, when suggested for the change of Akane's character to be an 'Amazoness', her design was shifted heavily towards the one known today, though her talent was Super High School Level Thief then. It was changed to Gymnast to better match her 'brawn over brain' personality. Character designer Rui Komatsuzaki revealed that her extremely simple design is meant to reflect Akane's character, who does not want to wear unnecessary accessories. Design-wise, creator Kazutaka Kodaka believes that Akane not seeing herself as feminine, despite her "bombshell body", adds an extra layer of eroticism to her.[52]

Akane serves as a "troublemaker" within the story, frequently causing disruptions that impact the plot's pacing. Kodaka deliberately designed her as a character who acts impulsively without concern for consequences.[52]

Romi Park, Akane's Japanese voice actor, also commented on her character:

"Akane Owari is the complete opposite of the calm characters I tend to voice, so recording her was quite the fresh experience. All characters in the game are unique, but don't you think Owari stands out even among them? I love she's exactly what she looks like, with all her "shut up and solve your problems with your fists" attitude. She's someone I can look at and forget my problems. I hope you enjoy all the many moments she has to offer."[52]
Name
Her first name (Ëµ§Èü≥) can be translated to "red sounds" or "red noise", while her last name (ÁµÇÈáå) is composed of the characters ÁµÇ - "last" or "to finish" and Èáå, which has multiple meanings, including "village", "the home of one's parents", "hometown" and also an archaic Japanese unit of area. "Owari" is a name that Kodaka always wanted to use, a previously unused and recycled name, similar to "≈åwada" and "Tsumiki".[52][53]

Alternate Fates
Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan exist in two separate alternate universes where Akane still attends Hope's Peak Academy, but no students are in peril. As they are alternate universes, these events are non-canonical, but because Akane's personality is unchanged, backstory information shared by her in these events is considered questionably or dubiously canonical rather than fully non-canonical.

Free Time Events are also considered somewhat questionably canonical due to the nature of how Free Time Events are accessed (in that some characters' Free Time Events cannot be fully completed during the course of the canon game storyline due to limitations on the number of interactions you can have with them during one playthrough, and thus can only be accessed after they have canonically died either through a second playthrough or via Island Mode). However, due to Free Time Events being largely experienced during the canon game storyline, Free Time Events are more grounded in canon than Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan and are largely considered canon by the majority of players.

Appearance
Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair design document
Akane is a tall, young woman with an athletic, curvaceous physique. She has tanned skin, dark olive-gray eyes, and unkempt, shoulder-length chestnut hair that sticks out at various angles in wavy spikes. During her high school years, her eyes appeared to be a lighter, brighter green, and her hair flowed down to her mid-back. Her body is also becoming more fit over time, with more well-defined abs as a member of the Ultimate Despair.

Akane wears a short-sleeved, white, buttoned, collared shirt with a chest pocket and the top few buttons undone, exposing a large amount of cleavage. The bottom button also appears undone, exposing her navel when she moves quickly. She also wears a red pleated miniskirt and cream-colored loafers with no socks. During high school, she continues to wear her red miniskirt and cream-colored loafers, but she also wears a white shirt, with long, cuffed, albeit rolled-up sleeves and no visible shirt pocket. She also has longer hair.

After catching the Despair Disease and gets admitted to the hospital during the Killing School Trip, Akane wears a desaturated blue hospital gown and a pair of slopes in a matching color. She finds these gowns comfortable to wear and wants to keep wearing them after she is cured.[42]

Personality
Akane has a fiery personality, characterized by her love for fighting using only her fists and body. She is always eager to challenge strong opponents, feeling excited and motivated by the prospect of countless powerful people she has yet to fight. She deeply respects the physically strong, like Nekomaru, and losing to them only fuels her determination to win.[38] In contrast, Akane shows little interest in fighting those she perceives as having low fighting power, who she can tell just by glancing at them.[20] At the beginning of the Killing School Trip, Akane sees through Fuyuhiko‚Äôs tough facade and, despite his threats to kill, believes he's just hiding how scared he really is. She teases him about his baby face, which she doesn‚Äôt find scary, calling him "Baby Gangsta."[43]

Akane's default instinct in solving problems is by punching things‚Äîeven people. This is exemplified during the party at the old building when the impatient Akane asked the Imposter who she needed to beat up so they could get the party started.[36] Whenever she gets bored, she asks someone for a fight, something she considers normal.[38] While Akane also enjoys athletic activities such as climbing, parkouring, and running,[20][14] she can be very lazy and unmotivated if she isn't allowed to do things her own way. She dislikes planning, training, and routines, but has a talent for inventing her own moves, and can be very moody.[38]

During the Killing Game, Akane appears somewhat carefree, aloof, easygoing, and full of energy. She reveals that, compared to her harsh home environment where the sight of dead bodies isn't uncommon, her quality of life improved significantly on Jabberwock Island. Having guaranteed food and housing security makes her relatively upbeat and even unfazed by the killing game.[4] However, she still gets angry when a murder occurs and often threatens to beat up the culprit herself. She is also confident and brazen, referring to herself with the pronoun "ore" (‰ø∫) in the original Japanese, a boastful form of "I" typically used by men.

Akane is also impulsive, stubborn, and hot-headed, often acting without a care for the consequences, and frequently gets into trouble. Many of these reckless actions are more often than not well-intentioned as Akane is very loyal and protective towards her friends, often showing this by acting as the group's muscle. Once she sets her mind on a certain goal, it is difficult for others to convince her otherwise, even coach Nekomaru. A prominent example is when she duels Monokuma behind the others' backs to test her skills and avenge Fuyuhiko, who almost died during Peko's execution. This results in her defeat and Nekomaru's drastic transformation into Mechamaru to save him from dying after shielding her from her execution.[40] She also almost snaps Nagito's neck to stop him from further harming her classmates, if Chiaki had not calmed her down. Despite her capacity for malice, especially when blinded by rage, Chiaki believes that deep down, Akane is not the type of person who would intentionally hurt others. Akane herself admits she doesn't even realize what she's doing and apologizes for her actions.[47]

Another defining trait Akane has is her bottomless love for food. Living in a constant "if you don't eat, you die" situation, she comes to value food above all else.[54] Food also provides a lot of comfort for Akane, as it distracts her from overthinking, regains her strength, and energizes her body, which is vital for her to feel alive.[55] Whenever she sees someone looking down, she assumes they haven't been eating well as such condition applies to her.[4] She becomes low-spirited very quickly when hungry and is the most devastated in the group when faced with starvation motive.[43] Regularly eating on Jabberwock Island is a privilege Akane never had before, turning her into a compulsive eater. She can eat four or more meals a day,[4] quickly inhale an entire plate,[4] and often continues stuffing her mouth even during serious situations. She says that she quickly loses her energy if she doesn't eat and she just gets more hungry if she eats just a little.[36] Akane can almost eat anything, even Monokuma's special curry which includes a live frog.[39] She hates wasting food, telling Hajime that watermelon skin is as edible as its fruits.[18] Even something as simple as canned food can bring out Akane's childlike joy.[55] Her enthusiasm when eating often brings out Nekomaru's soft side, as he feels cheered up just by watching her enjoy her food.[29][43] She cries tears of joy when she tastes Teruteru's party dishes for the first time, and despite rarely grieving, she is genuinely saddened after he's gone, knowing she's no longer able to eat his incomparable dishes again.[37] Whenever she sees people who are small or don't seem to be eating enough, she can't help but feel worried and protective, reminded of her precious little siblings.[5][15] When Akane mistakes the real Byakuya for the Ultimate Imposter, she cries in relief that he is alive, but feels bad for him, thinking he has lost a lot of weight.[6]

Akane is rather gullible, often easily believing things people say. In the class trials, she easily gets tricked and is surprised when others tell her that they're lying. This has often been exploited by Hiyoko, who used her to investigate the motel room when she didn't want to do it on her own, and another time she was tricked into eating flowers.[40][56] Her gullible nature may stem from enduring abuse growing up, which warped her perception of what is normal. She can casually mention past instances of sexual abuse without realizing they were abusive, which confuses and disturbs others.[4][16] For instance, she thinks it's perfectly normal to let someone touch or rest on her breasts, often offering this as a form of apology or reward.[57] She is also comfortable with nudity, seeing no problem in getting naked in front of others, dislikes wearing swimsuits while swimming,[18][35] and is unfazed by people intentionally looking at her panties, considering it not "the end of the world."[58]

Akane does, however, get easily embarrassed about romance.[54] This is exemplified through her relationship with Nekomaru, where it is hinted that they both have romantic feelings for each other, with his massages and her reactions being quite suggestive.[40] While under the effect of aphrodisiacs, Nekomaru is, at first, protective of her when something seems wrong and then bashful when she tells him not to touch her. The two then share a surprisingly romantic moment, being swooned and looking at each other.[23] Kodaka revealed that this particular scene was his favorite of Akane and Nekomaru in Danganronpa 3. It was originally intended to be more risqu√©, but he decided to reframe it with the tone of a sh≈çjo manga.[59] In the Killing School Trip, Akane becomes very attached to the mini version of Mechamaru, Minimaru, and always carries it with her, even at the very end when the Neo World Program begins collapsing.

Power-throwing life in constant survival mode has made Akane simple-minded, disliking overcomplicated things like deep conversations, meticulous plans, detailed work in her performances, and overly intellectual topics. Instead, she relies on her instincts‚Äîwhich are almost never wrong‚Äîto guide her, a trait repeatedly demonstrated throughout various class trials. She has a limited vocabulary, often confusing words like "cosplay,"[4] "accomplice,"[34] and "aspersion"[37] with names of food.

Akane's harsh upbringing also renders her into an emotionally constipated person. She despises worrying and hesitating, viewing them as signs of weakness she claims to have never experienced, as she hates being perceived as weak. She forces herself to appear strong, believing that true strength means never showing vulnerability, relying solely on herself, and never depending on anyone else. She develops a habit of forgetting people's names‚Äîcalling Hajime "Hank," "Harvey," and "Hector"‚Äîas a way to detach herself from forming connections. This was because people whose names she remembered usually didn't last long where she grew up. In reality, Akane does have fears and concerns like anyone else, one of which is her fear of ghosts.[14] She is so embarrassed by this that she will never forgive anyone who finds out and tells others about it.[55] This is why, despite feeling immense guilt for nearly causing Nekomaru's death due to her reckless behavior, she tells everyone not to worry, insisting that Nekomaru is strong enough to survive his injuries.[40] Her guilt only worsens when Nekomaru is turned into a robot, but she tries to appear nonchalant about it.[43] Akane only lets out her bottled-up emotions upon discovering Mechamaru's body. Without fully realizing it, she refuses to leave his side during the investigation.[44] Besides Nekomaru, Akane also feels protective toward those she feels indebted to, such as Mikan, who nursed her while she was under the Despair Disease. She adamantly defends Mikan when Hajime accuses her of being Hiyoko and Ibuki's killer, refusing to believe it until Chiaki's "deep stuff" words force her to stand down.[42]

In her final Free Time Event, Akane, learning from Nekomaru and Hajime, begins to understand that real strength doesn't mean ignoring your weaknesses but overcoming them.[15] In her Island Mode ending, she also learns that people don't just need food to live, but also connections with others to form hope, which makes them "human."[54] After the Forced Shutdown, it is Akane who comforts Kazuichi and Sonia, telling them that it makes sense for them to feel scared.[6]

Talent and Abilities
Ultimate Gymnast

Akane was born with a natural talent for gymnastics. Growing up in a harsh environment, she did parkour‚Äîher only form of exercise‚Äîto escape from people, especially predatory men. Over time, she developed extraordinary speed and agility, making her nearly impossible to catch.[20] Despite having no interest in sports, let alone gymnastics, Akane was pressured into pursuing gymnastics professionally by an older coach who sexually harassed her. His abuse exposed him to her natural abilities, as he recognized her athletic potential through her physique and the force of her defensive kicks and punches. Having to financially support her younger siblings, Akane had no choice but to comply with his demands.[5]

Akane's reputation as a gymnast skyrockets as she effortlessly sets records and wins competitions, making quick money with her exceptional skills.[20] Known as an all-around super athlete for her off-the-charts physical abilities, she also gains notoriety as a wild troublemaker. Akane has never received any formal training, so her grasp of basic gymnastics is somewhat shaky, and her routines are mostly improvised, with the outcome often determined by her mood.[60] When she is in her groove, she dazzles with splendid performances, but if her interest wanes, she loses focus and switches things up mid-routine.[21]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Nekomaru Nidai and Akane Owari sparring (5)
Training with Nekomaru

Above gymnastics, Akane applies her natural talent more to hand-to-hand combat, one of her true passions. In the process, she also discards all the basics by fighting through pure instinct on top of her improvised fierce style. While sparring with Nekomaru in the Killing School Trip, she exhibits immense speed‚Äîfaster than any athlete he has ever seen‚Äîand her punches are powerful enough to leave him numb.[40] However, she isn't using her muscles and body to their best potential, and her timing is all over the place. According to Nekomaru, Akane is unable to make full use of her Ultimate Gymnast skills because of her careless and impulsive nature.[38]

Akane utilizes her sheer strength and combat skills as a member of the Ultimate Despair, where she is shown fighting Future Foundation Division leaders with her bare hands and a kusari-fundo.[33] She also takes benefits from Teruteru's cooking skills and doping to enhance her strength. She showcases this by effortlessly deflecting the Super High School Level Street Performer's throwing knives with her teeth and knocks him away with a single punch.[50] She also knows a wrestling move called Plancha Suicida, or Suicide Dive.[44]

Ultimate Gymnast official translations in other languages
Sharp Intuition
Akane is known for her sharp intuition, even though she cannot fully explain or understand the reasons behind these gut instincts. She firmly trusts them, and they are usually accurate, proving invaluable during class trials. In Teruteru's trial, her intuition that he used light to move around during the blackout was correct. In Peko's trial, her knowledge of ninjas and her instinct that the culprit climbed up the wall‚Äîthough technically different‚Äîalso proved correct. During Gundham's trial, her feeling that Nekomaru was killed by the tipped-over pillar took time to verify but was ultimately true. In Nagito's trial, her wild guess that Nagito had transported the poison that killed him in one of the fire grenades thrown at the warehouse helped Hajime prove it. In the final class trial, her instinct that the approaching "main cast"‚Äîsomeone who could be both an ally and an enemy‚Äîwas proven correct. The Future Foundation was both an enemy to their Remnants of Despair selves and an ally attempting to free them from Junko's brainwashing.

Enhanced Senses
Akane's senses are highly sensitive, particularly her sense of smell and hearing. She can detect the scent of blood, unpleasant odors, and delicious food long before others. While her hearing is not as enhanced as Ibuki's, it is still exceptional‚Äîallowing her to hear faint sounds from afar, such as the telephone in Grape House's lounge while she is in the tower, and the sound of Monokuma Panels falling like dominoes despite the noise of a fire and blaring MP3 player music in the background.
