Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu (‰πùÈ†≠Èæç ÂÜ¨ÂΩ¶), is a student of Hope's Peak Academy's Class 77-B, and a participant of the Killing School Trip featured in Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair. His title is the Ultimate Yakuza (Ë∂ÖÈ´òÊ†°Á¥ö„ÅÆ„ÄåÊ•µÈÅì„Äç lit. Super High School Level Gangster).

He, along with Class 77-B, return in Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School to explore their school life leading up to The Tragedy.



History
Early Life
Fuyuhiko is the heir to the Kuzuryu yakuza clan, the largest criminal syndicate in the nation, with a membership surpassing 30,000.[12] As an heir, Fuyuhiko grew accustomed to the Kuzuryu Clan's way of settling disputes through violence, leading him to believe that as long as he bore his family name, he would always be surrounded by a mountain of dead bodies. His upbringing toughened him so much that he no longer cried about anything, including losing a fight by second grade. Being treated with caution by non-clan members was second nature to him due to his status. Ever since Fuyuhiko was too young to understand, he often witnessed his parents' frequent fights. It involved his mother's various attempts to kill his hotheaded father during minor arguments that quickly escalated. There were a few instances when Fuyuhiko was nearly killed in the aftermath of his parents' fights, but his assigned hitman, who had accompanied him since infancy, Peko Pekoyama, was always there to protect him.[4]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu and Peko Pekoyama's relationship
The Ultimate Yakuza with his hitman

Being a rambunctious kid, Fuyuhiko took Peko through a childhood filled with bizarre adventures with him.[13] One time, Fuyuhiko and Peko were kidnapped together, but she managed to find a way to escape, and they ended up lost in the mountains. Fuyuhiko began to cry when Peko tried to cheer him up as he could sense that she was just as scared and worried. Eventually, Peko managed to save them both using her skills as a swordswoman and her determination to protect him as his loyal tool.[14] During a visit to the zoo, Fuyuhiko once challenged the king of the monkeys to a fight, and Peko had to step in to help. He had a "handsome smile" that Peko still remembers even years later.[15]

Fuyuhiko often got into trouble, which led to incessant lectures from his parents. To escape these scoldings, he developed a habit of climbing to the very top of the trees in their backyard. When they eventually found him, they would either bring the dogs or shake the tree until he fell out.[16] Since he often couldn't climb back down on his own, Peko would have to come to his rescue.[17] This close bond they shared made Fuyuhiko resent the idea that Peko saw herself as nothing more than a tool, that he never asked for a tool. He never viewed her that way and always wanted her to be "herself."[18]

Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc (Episode 03) - Natsumi's Reason (51)
Fuyuhiko and Peko in Natsumi's eyes

Peko, on the other hand, noted that despite being a yakuza, Fuyuhiko had a kind heart.[19] He would constantly question and worry about his position, believing that his little sister, Natsumi, was more deserving of succeeding as clan head. He was fond of her and always helped her when she needed it, dubbing her the Ultimate Little Sister. Although Natsumi was an annoying little sister who loved making a fool out of him, on top of being self-centered, selfish, and extremely arrogant, Fuyuhiko praised his talent for getting people to do what she wanted. He believed that this skill was what made her deserve the Ultimate Yakuza title more than he did. She was even called the reincarnation of their uncle. When a faction within the clan wanted to make her the next leader, Natsumi refused, claiming she was only amazing because she was Fuyuhiko's sister. Fuyuhiko could not accept this and insisted that she could lead while he lived on his own, as he believed she was better than him at everything.[5]

As a teen, Fuyuhiko attended Suzuran High School before enrolling in Hope's Peak Academy as the Ultimate Yakuza, in Class 77-B.[7][8] His sister then followed his footsteps by transferring to the Reserve Course Department of Hope's Peak.[20]

Prior to The Tragedy
Attending Hope's Peak Academy
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Despair Arc
First Year
Danganronpa 3 (Despair Arc) - ED (Textless) (8)
With his classmates

Fuyuhiko was scouted by Hope's Peak Academy as the Ultimate Yakuza and enrolled in Class 77-B. Since Peko was also scouted as the Ultimate Swordswoman in the same class. Fuyuhiko instructed her to keep their professional relationship a secret and to treat each other like normal classmates.[21]

Despite the school stating that attending class was not mandatory as long as students spent their time honing their talents, Fuyuhiko was one of the few students who attended. He became frustrated with his supposed homeroom teacher, Koichi Kizakura, who spent his time drinking and neglecting the class. Thanks to Chisa Yukizome, the new assistant homeroom teacher he came to respect, however, the class managed to resume with her helping Fuyuhiko to gather his classmates, in the hope that they could build strong relationships and "hope" with each other.[22]

Nagito Fuyuhiko Teru and Kazuichi play
Playing video games

Because he didn't like people getting too chummy with him, Fuyuhiko maintained some distance from his classmates.[23] Nevertheless, he still joined them in various group activities, such as repairing the classroom, playing video games, having lunch together, and electing Chiaki Nanami, the Ultimate Gamer, as the class representative[24]

Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc (Episode 03) - Twilight Syndrome Murder Case (12)
Checking his sister's body

At some point, Fuyuhiko was informed by Peko that Natsumi had enrolled in the Reserve Course Department after she asked their dad for it so she could follow him to Hope's Peak Academy. He didn't allow Peko to check on his sister although he was well aware of her bad attitude. This innate trait of hers eventually pushed Sato, a fellow Reserve Course student and friend of Mahiru Koizumi, the Ultimate Photographer, to murder her. Sato killed Natsumi after she bullied Mahiru in an attempt to make her give up her seat, allowing Natsumi to usurp her title. After hearing the news, Fuyuhiko immediately went to the hospital morgue to see his sister's body.[20]

Fuyuhiko was angered by his sister's death and sought vengeance. He heard the rumor that Sato was with Natsumi on the day of her murder, and happened to see her throwing a photo into the garbage incinerator area behind the school buildings. To his shock, the photo showed a broken flower vase in the classroom next to the music room where Natsumi was murdered. This convinced him that Sato was the true culprit, rather than the suspected local pervert who had broken through the music room's window to kill his sister. Enraged, Fuyuhiko declared that he would never forgive her and retaliated by killing her with a metal bat.[25]

Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc (Episode 04) - Intro (10)
Thinking about his sister's death

His sister's death affected not only Fuyuhiko's morale but also the entire class. Mahiru had the hardest time coping with Sato's death but was unaware that Fuyuhiko had killed her best friend. As a result, Chisa was forced to postpone Class 77-B's annual practical exam.[26]

Second Year
Ibuki Fuyuhiko Peko
Ibuki noticing Fuyuhiko and Peko interacting

By his upperclassman year, Fuyuhiko appeared to be doing better after Natsumi's death. He even unintentionally showed more interaction with Peko. He helped her pick up her things during the move to the new building, which was noticed by classmates like Ibuki Mioda, the Ultimate Musician, and Mikan Tsumiki, the Ultimate Nurse.[27]

Around the same time, Fuyuhiko and his classmates noticed from their building that the students from the Reserve Course students had launched a massive protest against the Main Course, blaming them for causing the Tragedy of Hope's Peak Academy. Unbeknownst to most, the true mastermind behind the tragedy was Junko Enoshima, the originator of Ultimate Despair, who manipulated events behind the scenes and framed Izuru Kamukura‚Äîthe result of the Izuru Kamukura Project‚Äîfor the incident. The Hope's Peak Academy committee, responsible for the project, was accused of using the exorbitant fees paid by Reserve Course students to create so-called 'murderers'.[28] Although Fuyuhiko and his classmates were seemingly unrelated to the growing protest, they became involved after noticing that Mikan had been absent for some time. Fuyuhiko mentioned that he had a contact to check up on her house, but she wasn't there either. Worried about her well-being, Fuyuhiko and the others went to search for her based on Nagito Komaeda, the Ultimate Lucky Student's intel, but to no avail.[29]

Fuyuhiko Peko moment
Holding the injured Peko

When they reconvened in their classroom, they learned that Chiaki and Nagito had infiltrated Junko's lair, but Nagito had been injured after being knocked out by Izuru while attempting to assassinate Junko. Around the same time, Mikan, whom they had been searching for, appeared with an injured Peko, who had been defeated in a fight against Mukuro Ikusaba, Junko's twin sister. Seeing her wounded, Fuyuhiko immediately rushed to her side and held her, furious and ignoring Peko's appeal to run away as he was resolved to seek vengeance against Mukuro. Fuyuhiko then agreed to Chiaki's rally so they could all go help Chisa, who had managed to fend off Junko and co. to allow Chiaki and Nagito to escape from her lair, ignoring Nagito's warning that it could be a suicide mission, fully aware of the danger.[30]

Class 77 Despair
Class 77-B brainwashed

Unbeknownst to Fuyuhiko and his classmates, this path to search for Chisa was nothing but a ruse made by Junko. Although Fuyuhiko briefly noticed that Chiaki went missing on their way, Mikan, who had pushed her down a corridor, lied, claiming Chiaki had injured her ankle and needed to rest. Fuyuhiko was unaware that Mikan was responsible and that she, along with Chisa, had been brainwashed into despair and instructed by Junko to lead Class 77-B into the room later used for the Class Trials. In this very room, Fuyuhiko and the others were forced to watch Chiaki executed in a brutal fashion. Fuyuhiko was horrified but he couldn't tear his eyes away from the screen. Bearing witness to Chiaki's death caused the brainwashing effect of the video to take hold of Class 77-B, plunging them into despair.[31]

Fuyuhiko Peko despair
Massacring the Diet members alongside Peko

Fully brainwashed into becoming the Ultimate Despair, Fuyuhiko and his classmates received their final lesson before "graduation", the one final meeting to discuss their plan to overthrow the world with despair. Fuyuhiko expressed that together with Peko, he would "lead their people down the right path." Chisa then activated a bomb that faked the death of Class 77-B so they could be taken off the list of protected students. The young master and his hitman began helping Junko to spread despair by launching a massacre in the Japanese Diet, later seen standing back to back amidst a sea of corpses.[32]

The Tragedy
Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Intro (63)
Revealing his eyepatch

As an Ultimate Despair, Fuyuhiko, alongside his corrupted classmates, started The Tragedy and kept it ongoing even after Junko's death in the final stage of the Killing School Life. Those who did not commit suicide to follow their leader Junko soon became known as the Remnants of Despair, which included Fuyuhiko and her classmates. They also hacked her body and grafted them onto themselves. In Fuyuhiko's case, although it is never explicitly confirmed, it is strongly possible that he was the one who implanted one of Junko's eyes into his own socket to "see her despair." He did not wear an eyepatch during his school years and only began wearing one after becoming an Ultimate Despair. Following his awakening from the Neo World Program, his right eye remained shut and non-functional, similar to how Nagito's severed left arm, which had been replaced with Junko's, was rendered unusable.[6][33]

Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Intro (45)
Leading a platoon of his clan subordinates

With Peko by his side, Fuyuhiko had done many horrible things. Using his power and influence, he led a brainwashed yakuza army equipped with Monokuma helmets to spread despair. He deployed Peko and his army to attack Future Foundation division leaders, aided by Nekomaru Nidai, the Ultimate Team Manager, and Akane Owari, the Ultimate Gymnast. However, Fuyuhiko was eventually captured by the organization, along with the other Remnants of Despair.[34]

Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Makoto arriving (6)
Remnants of Despair

The Future Foundation then secured the custody of Fuyuhiko and the other fourteen - at first only aware that they were survivors from Hope's Peak Academy. When Makoto Naegi, Class 78th's Ultimate Lucky Student, by that time a member of the 14th Division of the Future Foundation, realized that the survivors were in fact, Remnants of Despair, he quickly directed them to Jabberwock Island in secret.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Neo World Program (4)
Neo World Program

Makoto had them enter the Neo World Program, where their memories were reset to a time before their enrollment at Hope's Peak Academy, prior to being brainwashed by Junko. As a result, they couldn't recognize each other, except for Fuyuhiko and Peko, who still recognized each other. The plan was to overwrite Fuyuhiko and the others' memories of themselves as Ultimate Despair, replacing them with good ones to undo all the damage Junko had done to them.[6]

The scheme backfired when Izuru Kamukura, the Ultimate Hope and the final product of the Izuru Kamukura Project, uploaded Junko's malware AI just before they were to be programmed. Consequently, they were subjected to the identical brutal incident that befell Class 78th, although in a realistically simulated environment. The killing game became known as the Killing School Trip, an ordeal in which Fuyuhiko and the other Remnants of Despair were coerced into participating.[6]

Killing School Trip
Main article: Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair
Danganronpa 2 CG - Students in the classroom
Killing School Trip participants

Fuyuhiko participated in the Killing School Trip alongside fourteen other Remnants of Despair and one Future Foundation observer. It occurred in a virtual world, the Neo World Program, resembling Jabberwock Island. Due to his memories as the Ultimate Despair and life in Hope's Peak Academy being erased by the Future Foundation, he couldn't recognize any of her classmates except for Peko.[6] Before interacting with anyone else on the island, Fuyuhiko ordered Peko to keep their professional relationship a secret and to treat each other like normal classmates, much like they did during their school years.[21]

After being teleported to the island, Fuyuhiko begrudgingly introduced himself to Hajime Hinata by the pool in Hotel Mirai. He immediately acted defensively and rudely, pushing Hajime and Nagito away after badmouthing them and threatening to never act friendly with the group.[12] He joined the group at the beach on the first island after Usami, an AI programmed by the Future Foundation to oversee the group, assembled them. However, he refused her offer to join the others in swimming, preferring to be left alone.[35]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Start of the Killing School Trip
The Killing School Trip begins

The tropical school trip soon turned into a nightmare as Fuyuhiko learned that the evil animatronic bear, Monokuma, the self-proclaimed headmaster of Hope's Peak Academy, had hijacked their trip and turned it into a killing game. Fuyuhiko initially believed it was some sort of performance. Soon realized that Monokuma was serious and forced the group to submit to his authority and killing game by rendering Usami into Monomi, her powerless version, and then blasting her to pieces using the Monobeasts.[35]

Once the killing game began, Fuyuhiko continued to act standoffish while attending the first meeting at the restaurant and later checking out the countdown that appeared in Jabberwock Park. At the same location later that night, after being summoned by Monokuma for the first motive introduction, Fuyuhiko got into a verbal fight with Mahiru, leading him to threaten the group and claim he was capable of committing murder. Even though Peko tried to calm him down, Fuyuhiko continued his outburst until the Imposter intervened, assuring him that, like everyone else, they would make sure he didn't become a victim, finally managing to calm him.[36]

Fuyuhiko skipped the morning meeting the next day and communicated only in secret with Peko, who relayed information about his whereabouts and condition to the group. Through her, he also learned that the Imposter would be hosting an all-night party later that night, which he had no intention of attending. However, not long after Chiaki began guarding the entrance to keep Monokuma away during the party, Fuyuhiko was seen loitering nearby. Chiaki, being emotionally intuitive, quickly picked up that he actually wanted to join. He was rebuked by the idea and claimed he was just out for a walk before leaving the area. Fuyuhiko shut himself in his room during the investigation of the Ultimate Imposter's murder and had to be dragged to the trial grounds by Monokuma.[37]

Danganronpa 2 - Teruteru Hanamura's execution (42)
Witnessing Teruteru's execution

During the class trial, Fuyuhiko immediately suspected everyone who attended the party. However, when Peko was suspected, he came to her defense. He argued that someone might have put laxatives in her food so the culprit could trip the breaker while she was away, but this was disproven. He was briefly suspected of the murder due to his absence from the party and the possibility that he could have killed the Imposter from under the floorboards. Chiaki refuted that with her testimony and the fact that she and Gundham Tanaka, the Ultimate Breeder, clarified that it was impossible to access the floorboards from outside. Fuyuhiko survived the first class trial after the true culprit, Teruteru Hanamura, the Ultimate Cook, was voted as the Blackened and executed for his crime.[37]

Fuyuhiko learned from Peko that the second island was opened following the trial, thus declining her breakfast invitation and going ahead to explore and have breakfast alone at the diner. He was agitated when Hajime tried to talk to him while he was eating, explaining that he wasn't avoiding the group, but rather trying to prove that he could rely on himself without the help of the Kuzuryu Clan. He also didn't want "affections" to hold him back when it was his time to kill. He came to check out the Ancient Ruins after Chiaki insisted, and became convinced that only the traitor from the "World Ender" organization could open the door and contact the outside world.[38]

Fuyuhiko made a brief entrance at the morning meeting the following day. He criticized Nekomaru and Kazuichi Soda, the Ultimate Mechanic, for tying up Nagito, provoking Kazuichi into a verbal argument. Kazuichi taunted him, saying he wasn't afraid of Fuyuhiko's empty threats, and called him a "pipsqueak" without his clan to back him up. This infuriated Fuyuhiko, but he was ultimately stopped by Peko, prompting him to begrudgingly walk away.[38]

Twilight Syndrome Murder Case
Danganronpa 2 - Twilight Syndrome Murder Case Envelope
Carrying the game's prize

Fuyuhiko became tempted to play the second motive, the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case, wanting to prove his own claim that all he needed to do was win, that only the strong survive, not the weak who end up like the Imposter or Teruteru. He played the game sometime after everyone dispersed that night and before breakfast the next morning, when he bumped into Hajime while carrying an envelope.[38] It was later revealed to be the prize for the first person to complete the Truth Route of the game, where he discovered he was a character in the game as Guy F.[18]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Twilight Syndrome Murder Case (18)
The Kuzuryus' name appears in the game's credits

The envelope contained photos related to his sister's murder as well as Sato, though he couldn't remember them due to his school memories having been erased. Wanting to verify the truth behind the game's content, Fuyuhiko sent the photographs to Mahiru, who also appeared in the game as Girl D. However, Mahiru never responded and began avoiding him, much to his frustration. She had also played the game on her own but was left confused by its content, as her memories of Sato and Natsumi had also been erased. Mahiru instead arranged a meeting with the others who appeared as characters in the game, Hiyoko, Mikan, and Ibuki, to discuss its contents.[18]

Convinced by the truth behind the game that Mahiru had helped Sato get away with killing his sister, Fuyuhiko became driven by revenge and enlisted Peko to help him isolate and kill Mahiru. He had Peko sabotage Mahiru's plans by luring both Mahiru and Hiyoko, the only person who accepted her invitation, to the beach house at separate times using fake notes. Hiyoko arrived first at 2:00 pm, was quickly neutralized by Peko, and dragged her unconscious self into the closet. Alongside Peko, Fuyuhiko waited another 30 minutes for Mahiru's arrival, prepared to kill her with a metal bat, mirroring the mindset of his past self and his in-game counterpart, Guy F.[18]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Scene of the murder (Chapter 2) (2)
Convincing Peko to abort the plan

Soon, he got into an altercation with Mahiru, initially wanting to believe the game was mere fiction. However, he lost what little patience he had left when Mahiru told him that seeking revenge on Sato was wrong. Consumed by rage, he reached for the metal bat he had hidden under a bench, but before he could kill Mahiru himself, Peko intervened, grabbed the bat, and bludgeoned Mahiru to death with a single blow. This shocked Fuyuhiko, as the original plan seemed never to have involved Peko killing Mahiru herself. He warned her about the consequences of killing on the island, which Peko had already understood and had made up her mind. She wished to fulfill her duty as a "tool" by taking the blame for Mahiru's death and allowing her young master to escape the island. Though Fuyuhiko begged her to forget about the Kuzuryu Clan and abandon the plan, Peko refused to listen and continued to carry out her own plan after he fled the crime scene.[18]

On his way out of the area, Fuyuhiko was spotted by Hajime and Kazuichi, who were sneaking into Sonia Nevermind, the Ultimate Princess's, girls-only beach party. He evaded their questions and took advantage of Ibuki and Mikan's arrival to quietly slip away. He locked himself in his cottage during the investigation and only reappeared just before the class trial began, right as Monokuma was about to lose his temper over his tardiness.[18]

During the class trial, Fuyuhiko immediately became the center of the talk once everyone discovered that he was Guy F, thus by default having the strongest motive to murder Mahiru, Girl D, the accomplice of Sato or Girl E. Peko saved him from the hot seat by arguing that someone unrelated to the game's events might have used it as a cover for their crime, leading her to begin framing Hiyoko as the culprit. Fuyuhiko helped to pressure Hiyoko, which initially worked as Peko's setup cornered her. However, the group soon realized that the planted yellow gummy was not Hiyoko's staple gummy and that her clothes were too clean for her to be the culprit. Fuyuhiko tried to refute this but failed when it was pointed out that Hiyoko couldn't even dress herself without assistance.[18]

Fuyuhiko became highly defensive when the trap backfired and the group realized that Peko had set it up. She was identified as the only possible culprit who could have washed Mahiru's blood off herself using the water bottles found in the beach house trash can. He tried to lie about seeing her swimming, but it contradicted his earlier statement. He challenged the group to explain how Peko escaped the beach house. After extensive discussion, however, they discovered that she had used her shinai as a stepstool to climb out through the high window in the shower room and recovered it with her sword bag. Fuyuhiko was still heated until Peko stopped him, before conceding and admitting to the crime. What shocked him even more was when she assumed the persona of the serial killer Sparkling Justice to push the others into voting for her. Unable to stand watching her like that, he begged her to stop, but she continued until she was eventually voted as the culprit. Achieving her goal, Peko dropped off her fake act and revealed that she was nothing more than a tool to carry out the murder for Fuyuhiko, her young master.[18]

After the class trial, Fuyuhiko revealed his final encounter with Mahiru, how he got cold feet at the last minute, resulting in Peko killing her before he could in order to take the blame for him. He struggled with whether to fulfill Peko's wish, meaning he would not only see her as a mere tool all along but also sacrifice everyone else and escape alone. In the end, he couldn't do it, much to Peko's dismay. Deep down, however, she knew Fuyuhiko wouldn't accept her offer so easily due to his kind-hearted nature despite being a yakuza. Fuyuhiko confessed to Peko that since childhood, he only wanted her to be herself, the Peko he had always known, then broke down in tears not wanting her to leave him just yet.[18]

Fuyuhiko tried to reach Peko during her execution, running through the marionette army as she, controlled by Monokuma like a straw doll, mindlessly slashed them down. Just as he got within a step of her, a marionette leaped toward Peko. She instinctively whirled around and sliced it in half, accidentally slashing Fuyuhiko's right eye in the process, causing him to collapse. In shock, Peko embraced him, shielding him with her body as the marionettes repeatedly stabbed her until the whole area was covered with her blood.[18]

Danganronpa_2_Chapter_2_Execution
Danganronpa 2 CG - The students and Fuyuhiko's injuries
Surviving Peko's execution

Though injured, Fuyuhiko survived thanks to Peko's sacrifice. With Mikan unable to stop his profuse bleeding without proper medical tools, Monomi insisted that Monokuma save him, citing the rules of the Killing School Trip, that only the blackened could be executed. Unable to break his own rules, Monokuma reluctantly rushed Fuyuhiko to the hospital, leaving the others with no choice but to entrust his fate to him.[18]

Fuyuhiko's Resolve
Danganronpa 2 CG - Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu at the hospital (1)
Resting at the hospital

Fuyuhiko was taken to the hospital on the newly opened third island. He was discovered resting in one of the patient's rooms by Mikan, heavily bandaged and still weak from his injuries. His medical records showed that he sustained only light sword-related wounds which did not damage any of his organs or nerves, which according to Mikan was miraculous. Chiaki believed it wasn't luck, but the direct result of Peko's sacrifice. That was why Fuyuhiko said he couldn't die just yet, though he refused to elaborate further. The following day, Mikan who nursed him reported to the group that he was steadily recovering though he permanently lost his right eye.[39]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu re-introducing himself
A surprise formal reintroduction

The next day, Fuyuhiko made a surprising entrance at the restaurant despite still recovering from his injury. He formally reintroduced himself and greeted the group properly for the first time since the killing game began, much to everyone's surprise. Now wearing an eyepatch to cover his non-functional right eye, which unsettled some, he claimed he didn't mind, confidently saying it gave him a bit of prestige.[39]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu asking for forgiveness (2)
A "proper" apology

Hiyoko, still grieving Mahiru's death and bitter from being used as a scapegoat, was unimpressed by what she called his 'half-assed apology.' She also blamed him for Peko's death and declared that she would never be friends with him, something Fuyuhiko understood all too well. He then collapsed to his knees and, to fully show his resolve and remorse, attempted harakiri, reopening his wounds. Though ashamed for causing more trouble, he was carried back to the hospital by Nekomaru and Kazuichi, and Mikan was once again forced to stitch his wounds. His drastic action, however, finally made Hiyoko reconsider her difficult stance toward him.[39]

Later that night, Ibuki held a recovery party for Fuyuhiko at the music venue, which he was adamant about attending despite his injury. Amidst the party, Hiyoko was surprisingly revealed to be among the attendees. She later told Fuyuhiko that, while she still hadn't forgiven him, she was willing to cooperate with him until they left the island, much to his relief, and once again apologized to her.[39]

The group's unity and fleeting moment of happiness, however, abruptly ended when they learned from Monomi that Akane had challenged Monokuma to a duel. Fuyuhiko and the others rushed to the beach on the first island to check on her. Not wanting anyone to sacrifice themselves for his sake, Fuyuhiko tried to intervene but was stopped by Nekomaru, who leaped in front of Akane and shielded her from Monokuma's bazooka, suffering grievous injuries in the process. He insisted that Monokuma save Nekomaru just as he had saved him. Monokuma complied as he didn't want Nekomaru to die outside of his killing game, but due to the severity of Nekomaru's injuries, he was taken away for an extended period to be "treated."[39]

Despair Disease
More troubles for the group came in the form of Despair Disease, the third motive of the killing game, which had different symptoms for each person and altered each contractor's personality to the opposite. Akane, Ibuki, and Nagito caught it, forcing the group to quarantine them in the hospital, with Mikan caring for them to prevent the healthy ones, like Fuyuhiko, from catching it. While the others opted to station themselves at the nearby motel, Fuyuhiko volunteered to help out Hajime and Mikan in caring for the sick students.[39]

After dark, Fuyuhiko noticed that Nagito was having trouble breathing, so he went to look for Mikan and Hajime. He walked into the on-call room where Mikan and Hajime were sharing a cot. He furiously berated them for mistakenly thinking they were being lascivious. While Mikan was checking on Nagito and ensuring his breathing had returned to normal, Fuyuhiko showed Hajime a surveillance camera unit that Kazuichi repurposed into a video chat device. It was meant for communication between the hospital and motel teams while the Despair Disease was still spreading. However, it had limitations, specifically, the motel team's device had to be placed near the music venue, which was closer to the hospital. Fuyuhiko told Kazuichi so he could set the devices to turn on 30 minutes after every morning and evening announcement. As Monokuma forbade more than one non-patient from staying the night at the hospital, Fuyuhiko and Hajime had no choice but to retire to their respective cottages.[39]

Fuyuhiko and Hajime arrived at the hospital early the next morning only to learn from Mikan that Nagito's condition was getting worse. He relayed this information to the motel group through the surveillance camera unit. He became irritated to find out that Monomi had joined them, claiming he could catch the disease. Frustrated, he ended the call abruptly. Throughout the day, he grew restless, repeatedly entering and leaving the hospital. He handled the evening transmission, only to find that neither he nor the motel team had learned anything new, before returning to his cottage.[39]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 3 - Closing Argument Act 3
Discovering Ibuki and Hiyoko's body

After the morning announcement, Fuyuhiko saw Mikan in front of the hospital panicking about Ibuki having gone missing from her room, so the two split up to search for her around the island. Along the way, they ran into Hajime and Chiaki, who were also looking for Ibuki. Hajime led them to the music venue, where he believed she might be. Strangely, the door appeared to be locked, even though Hajime easily entered earlier and the music venue wasn't supposed to have a lock, so the four of them forced their way inside. There, they discovered not only Ibuki's body but also Hiyoko's.[39]

Fuyuhiko helped lower Ibuki's hanging body before investigating. He inspected the door of the music venue they had broken down earlier and discovered a drumstick snapped in half. This led him to believe that the drumstick had been used to jam the door, suggesting that the culprit was still inside the music venue when they forced their way in. He concluded that Hiyoko was killed in the ten minutes between Hajime leaving and breaking down the music venue's door. Following his own theory, he began to suspect Kazuichi and Sonia, as they were the only ones no one had seen prior to the discovery of Ibuki and Hiyoko's bodies.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Class Trial Elevator (Chapter 3)
Descending to the trial ground

In the class trial, Fuyuhiko realized his line of thinking was the culprit's trap in motion. With Chiaki's help, he discovered that the true reason the door was hard to open was due to a semitransparent glob used as glue, while the broken drumstick was merely a red herring. The culprit who tricked him was none other than Mikan. After splitting up with Fuyuhiko that morning, she went to the crime scene, revealed Hiyoko's body, and shut the door before rejoining him, Hajime, and Chiaki. At first, it was hard for Fuyuhiko to believe that someone as clumsy as Mikan could commit murder, but the overwhelming evidence left him no choice. Mikan was correctly voted as the culprit and later executed, leaving Fuyuhiko and the others bewildered as they learned of her true nature, and especially the many questions about the World Ender she left in her wake. Nonetheless, he was relieved to hear that Nekomaru had recovered and was waiting for them at the First Island beach.[40]

What Fuyuhiko did not expect, however, was Nekomaru had been fully converted into a robot as the only means to save his life. He was even more surprised by how cheerfully Nekomaru seemed to accept his new body, something Fuyuhiko felt was incomparable to losing his own right eye.[41]

The Funhouse
Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone riding a rollercoaster
Riding a roller coaster

Fuyuhiko was disgusted at Monokuma for meddling so much with Nekomaru's robotic body by installing useless functions. However, he had a more pressing matter to attend to which was the Future Foundation and the traitor they sent to infiltrate the group, the organization Mikan claimed was responsible for transporting them to Jabberwock Island and was, therefore, their collective enemy. This was partially true, as Mikan spoke from the perspective of the Remnants of Despair. Monomi's connection to the organization was why Fuyuhiko and the others initially refused to explore the fourth island she opened but eventually went after Monokuma promised them ship parts and their Hope's Peak student profiles as a reward. To earn the promised prize, Fuyuhiko satisfied Monokuma's request by joining everyone on the roller coaster at the amusement park. The prize turned out to be a school file related to the Killing School Life, which, instead of helping them understand their circumstances, only confused them further.[41]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone riding the train to the funhouse (2)
The train ride to the Funhouse

Fuyuhiko and the others decided to take another of Monokuma's baits, hoping to either obtain more files about their school life or get the promised ship parts. To do so, they were required to take the train to the Funhouse, which Fuyuhiko found suspicious but had no choice but to go. His suspicion turned correct as Fuyuhiko and the others were gassed into sleep mid-journey. When they woke up, they found themselves to be inside the Funhouse's Strawberry House. It turned out Monokuma had subjected them to an escape game, where he wouldn't allow anyone to escape the Funhouse except through murder.[41]

Fuyuhiko rallied the group to not give up and encouraged them to explore the building in pairs using the map provided, in hopes of finding an exit. Before exploring, he took Akane with him, wanting to have a heart-to-heart conversation, and brought her to the Standard Room. There, Fuyuhiko confronted Akane about her stubbornness, knowing she felt immensely guilty about Nekomaru, just as he had with Peko. He pointed out that she, like him, was only alive because of someone else's sacrifice. However, Akane chose to act nonchalant about it. He encouraged her to be honest and thank Nekomaru for saving her, something he knew she didn't want to hear, but also knew only he could say to her.[41]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Funhouse Elevator
Inside the Funhouse elevator

Later, Fuyuhiko and the others traveled to the second building, the Grape House, using the contact elevator at Monokuma's behest. There, the animatronic bear revealed that he would no longer provide food or drinks, using their hunger as a time limit until a murder occurred. Fuyuhiko, fed up with Monokuma's dirty tricks, took the even more shocked Akane with him to explore Grape House. He discovered that the second floor of the house mirrored each other and suspected that the telephones on each lounge could be used to communicate with each house. He also joined Chiaki and the others to test her theory that both towers were the same buildings. Fuyuhiko retired for the night, taking one of the Crummy Rooms in Strawberry House after losing at rock-paper-scissors.[41]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Fuyuhiko witnessing Mechamaru
Witnessing Nekomaru descending the stairs

On the third day of their confinement, Fuyuhiko and his classmates were forced to begin attending Monokuma Tai Chi sessions in the morning, intended to exhaust and starve the already low-energy students.[41] Despite this, Fuyuhiko still managed to wake up on time on the fourth day, but was surprised to see the lounge clock showing 5 AM, unaware that it was actually 7 AM, as Gundham had secretly set all the clocks back by two hours. At the same time, he heard Nekomaru closing his room doors and began descending toward the first floor. He had considered catching up to him, but lacked the energy and willpower due to starvation, something he regretted after learning about Nekomaru's murder.[42]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Clock ringing in Strawberry House
Trying to stop the alarm

Fuyuhiko sat in the lounge, dissociating as he waited for Nekomaru to return, only to be jolted by the loud ringing of the lounge clock alarm at 5:30 AM‚Äîor 7:30 AM in reality. As he tried to turn it off, Kazuichi rushed in and told him to stop it. Gundham, the one who had set the alarm, also appeared and looked visibly disturbed. After the alarm was silenced, the three were suddenly shaken by a loud, earthquake-like rumble that caused Kazuichi to panic and cling to Fuyuhiko. Unsure of what had happened, they decided to wait it out, but when nothing followed, they returned to their rooms, unaware that the sound they heard was Nekomaru falling to his death.[42]

At 7:00 AM (9:00 AM in reality), Fuyuhiko, Gundham, Kazuichi, and Nagito attempted to use the elevator to reach Grape Tower for Monokuma Tai Chi, believing they had gone on time. However, they discovered that the elevator was broken, along with the Strawberry Hall door button, leaving them completely cut off from the other house. Fuyuhiko then resorted to calling the Grape House team using the lounge telephone. Hajime who received the call confirmed Fuyuhiko's fear that the missing Nekomaru had been murdered, with his body discovered in Grape Tower. Fuyuhiko then updated Hajime that Kazuichi would work on repairing the elevator, and that they should investigate separately in the meantime. Following Nagito's suggestion, Fuyuhiko checked the clocks in both buildings after Kazuichi repaired the elevator. He found that none of them appeared tampered with, unaware that Gundham had actually set them all back by two hours. He also began to notice how strangely Nagito behaved ever since he cleared the Final Dead Room.[42]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Layout of everyone at the strawberry house
Foiling Gundham's alibi setup

During the class trial, Fuyuhiko realized that by staying in the lounge, he had unknowingly thwarted Gundham's perfect alibi. After setting up Nekomaru's death, Gundham had planned to return unnoticed to his soundproofed Deluxe Room before the alarm went off. However, with Fuyuhiko in the lounge, he couldn't slip back without being seen. This forced Gundham to appear when the alarm rang, as Chiaki speculated he feared Fuyuhiko or Kazuichi might check his room and discover he was missing. Fuyuhiko's unintentional contributions led the group to Gundham's correct identification as the culprit and subsequent execution.[42]

The Beginning of the End
The group returned for their morning gathering and breakfast, while Fuyuhiko grew increasingly concerned about Nagito's worsening attitude since the last class trial. Later, he joined the group to explore the final island, where he found street stalls filled with food but completely devoid of customers and staff. After everyone finished exploring, he gathered the group to discuss their findings about the area and the Future Foundation at the same street stalls. When he mentioned the possibility that the Future Foundation and Monokuma were two opposite entities, Nagito, who hadn't shown up earlier, entered the scene, announcing his plan to weed out the traitor within the Future Foundation.[43]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Nagito being apprehended
Capturing Nagito

Fearing Nagito was planning to commit a murder, Kazuichi then devised a plan to capture Nagito, assigning Fuyuhiko and Akane as the force responsible for directly apprehending the Ultimate Lucky Student. Both complied with his plans and immediately captured him as he entered the hotel lobby later that night, threatening to tie him up.[43]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Exploding Inn (1)
Nagito bombing the hotel lobby

Fuyuhiko and the others were unaware of how far Nagito had come prepared as he immediately detonated the bomb he had planted in the hotel lobby, sending them flying. He later revealed it was merely a demonstration, claiming he had planted a large number of bombs across Jabberwock Island enough to destroy an entire island if detonated. His true plan was to weed out the traitor, and if they failed to reveal themselves, he would detonate the island in two days.[43]

After the bombing, Fuyuhiko and the others were given hints as to where he had planted the rest of the bombs, a place they hadn't visited yet. They visited Nezumi Castle, where the locked entrance had been blasted open by Nagito. Inside, they discovered that the password to the Ancient Ruins had been deliberately erased, which they suspected was Nagito's doing. Frustrated and growing doubtful, Fuyuhiko suggested the group split up for the time being so everyone could move around more easily. He also speculated aloud that if a traitor existed among them, they might try to save themselves by revealing the bomb's location to Nagito.[43]

On the morning of the deadline, Nagito appeared before Fuyuhiko and the others for the final time, suggesting they split up and searched for the bombs before they detonated and did as he suggested. Fuyuhiko assigned himself to cover the final island where he discovered them piling up inside the Plushie Factory and told Hajime, Kazuichi, and Akane to gather there. Kazuichi revealed that the bomb was impossible to disarm since the main detonator was locked inside a metal box. When they reached the deadline, the "bomb" detonated, only to turn out to be a fireworks display. Then the video message on the laptop played again, with Nagito saying he was waiting for them at the warehouse next door "to reveal the traitor's identity," which made an angry Fuyuhiko rush there.[43]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Warehouse on the fire (2)
Opening the warehouse

After they forced open the blocked door of the warehouse open, Fuyuhiko and the others were greeted by darkness at first, but after a certain delay, flames began to engulf the warehouse. The group immediately rushed to the factory break room to grab fire extinguishing supplies and tried to put out the fire by throwing them. It triggered the sprinklers, effectively dousing the flames. The warehouse, now clear of smoke, revealed the horrifying state of Nagito's lifeless body to Fuyuhiko and the others.[43]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 5 - Closing Argument Revealed
Revealed as a possible culprit

The brutality of Nagito's murder led Fuyuhiko to believe that the killer might have tortured him to satisfy their grudge. He later visited Nezumi Castle to confirm that the "Spear of Gungnir," which had impaled Nagito's abdomen, was taken from there. Based on this, he concluded that the traitor had tried to stop Nagito's plan from exposing their identity. However, the group discussion revealed that all of Nagito's wounds were self-inflicted. He had orchestrated his own death, including allowing the spear to impale him. His true cause of death was revealed to be from inhaling the poisonous gas he had secretly swapped with the contents of one of the fire grenade canisters, meaning that one of the remaining survivors had killed him without them even realizing.[44]

While panicking over who to vote for, the group gradually realized Nagito's plan was meant to force the traitor to kill him. To prevent them from making the wrong choice, Chiaki revealed herself as the traitor and asked them to vote for her. Fuyuhiko initially doubted her confession, but thanks to Hajime's convincing effort, he had no choice but to vote for her. Had Chiaki not outed herself as the traitor, everyone but her would have been executed, the true goal Fuyuhiko suspected Nagito wanted to achieve, a suspicion that Monokuma later confirmed. After Chiaki and Monomi were executed, Monokuma announced that the remaining five survivors would have the chance to graduate two days after the countdown ended. Fuyuhiko doubted Monokuma would allow them to escape the killing game so easily after the countdown ended, thinking he would subject them to do something.[44]

Shortly before the countdown ended, the Neo World Program began glitching. Fuyuhiko and the others, including the illusion of the deceased students, gathered at the hotel restaurant to watch the rest of Nagito's video message, which Sonia had discovered at the factory. They learned that Nagito had uncovered the truth behind the Killing School Trip, but due to the glitching, they couldn't fully understand it, except for the password to the Ancient Ruins, "11037". With this knowledge, Fuyuhiko and the group hurried to the Ancient Ruins before the countdown ended. Once inside, they were transported to what appeared to be a trial ground.[44]

Graduation Exam
Inside "Hope's Peak Academy," Fuyuhiko and the remaining survivors gathered in the gymnasium following Monokuma's announcement. He revealed that before deciding whether they wished to leave Jabberwock Island, they would undergo a "graduation exam." This exam required them to learn about the outside world by investigating materials Monokuma had scattered throughout the academy‚Äîa means meant to buy him time until "the main cast," the survivors of the Killing School Life working with the Future Foundation, arrived inside the Neo World Program.[6]

While exploring the academy, Fuyuhiko, alongside Hajime, learned from Monokuma about Junko Enoshima, the Ultimate Despair, and the Tragedy of Hope's Peak Academy, which involved the mass suicide of 2,357 Reserve Course students, with Hajime as the sole exception. Fuyuhiko didn't believe Junko had any involvement in their killing game, as she had already perished during the Killing School Life.[6]

In the final class trial, Fuyuhiko struggled to accept that they had been in a virtual reality all along, existing as avatars with their school memories erased. For a moment, he felt hopeful that the deceased students weren't truly dead. However, Monokuma, and later the fake Makoto Naegi, interjected, explaining that with their avatars gone, the chance of them ever waking up was nearly zero. This revelation devastated Fuyuhiko, causing him to shout curses in anguish. While still processing that revelation, along with the fact that he was part of the Remnants of Despair, Fuyuhiko, along with the others, was given a choice by Monokuma and the fake Makoto: to either "Graduate" or "Repeat" However, this was ultimately revealed to be a trap set by Monokuma's true form, Alter Ego Junko, who then revealed herself.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - AI Junko Enoshima appearing (4)
Witnessing Alter Ego Junko's appearance

Although shocked by her return in the form of an Alter Ego, Fuyuhiko was tempted by her offer to revive the deceased students if he chose to graduate, disregarding the logic behind it. Before he could press the Graduate Button, the real Makoto entered the Neo World Program and stopped them. In reality, if they chose to Graduate, it would allow Alter Ego Junko to upload herself into the bodies of the dead students. Makoto proposed a Forced Shutdown, a system purge to end the Neo World Program, requiring a majority of fifteen people to press "Graduate" and "Repeat" simultaneously. To activate it, Kyoko Kirigiri and Byakuya Togami, Future Foundation members and Killing School Life survivors, joined Makoto, Fuyuhiko, and the others.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Survivors activating the Forced Shutdown
Activating the Forced Shutdown

However, the shutdown sequence would revert the Remnants of Despair to their original state and erase all memories made during the Killing School Trip. This reaffirmed Fuyuhiko, who deep down only wanted to see Peko again, to still consider choosing to graduate, despite knowing the risk of turning Peko into a copy of Junko. As he slowly succumbed to despair, Fuyuhiko heard "her" voice, remarking that it was the first time she had ever yelled at him. With the reinvoked Hajime encouraging him to go through with the shutdown and trust in their ability to shape their own future, Fuyuhiko overcame his dilemma, stating that he wouldn't be able to stand on his own feet if she kept treating him like a kid.[6]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Survivors as the virtual world falls apart (1)
Returning to the real world

As the Neo World Program began collapsing after Usami purged Alter Ego Junko, Fuyuhiko and the remaining survivors shared one last conversation. Fuyuhiko stated that whether everything that had transpired within the Neo World Program would be in vain or not depended on them from that point forward. As they returned to the real world, they chose to remain on Jabberwock Island, possibly hoping to help their comatose friends‚Äîa decision Kyoko speculated showed they had discarded their Ultimate Despair identity.[6]

Post-Killing School Trip
Nagito's Illusory World
Main article: Danganronpa 2.5: Nagito Komaeda and the World Vanquisher
An illusory version of Fuyuhiko, created by the Neo World Program, appeared within Nagito's dream world shortly before Nagito was revived from his comatose state by Izuru Kamukura, who had by then merged with Hajime's personality and memories. Due to suffering a very traumatic death in the program, Nagito's mind created a strange, relatively peaceful world he lived in as a coping mechanism, which included this copy of Fuyuhiko.[45]


Fuyuhiko was first shown in front of Hope's Peak Academy's gate with Kazuichi. The two of them approached the beat-up Nagito and discovered that he had undergone a series of unlucky events earlier. In class, Fuyuhiko found that Nagito's injury became worse as he was hit by a baseball that flew through the infirmary window while he was being looked after by Mikan. Both of them then saw Kazuichi have a heartwarming moment with Sonia, which led Fuyuhiko to ask if Nagito had a dream of his own and wanted him to drop his "nobody" act and show his true colors.


After school ended, Fuyuhiko and Nagito waited for Kazuichi in front of the caf√© where Kazuichi and Sonia were supposed to meet. As Fuyuhiko thought, Kazuichi planned to ditch his "date" due to his inferiority complex, thinking that a princess like Sonia was too good for a normal mechanic like him. Fuyuhiko told him that a man shouldn't back down on his word and shouldn't make Sonia wait for him for long. Thanks to Fuyuhiko and Nagito's support, Kazuichi managed to face his fear and meet with Sonia without any worry.


On the way home, Fuyuhiko praised Nagito for successfully motivating Kazuichi, saying that it wasn't just noise coming out of his mouth. Nagito, however, told Fuyuhiko that the world should be free from any talents so people could reach a modest, happy life‚Äîin an intimidating manner‚Äîprompting Peko Pekoyama, who had been following them, to prepare to beat Nagito if necessary. Fuyuhiko, who saw through this, indirectly told Peko to back off, as well as Nagito, commenting that he was still as creepy as ever. Fuyuhiko then invited Nagito to drink non-alcoholic wine together before he suddenly fell off the road and accidentally hit Mikan, who was taking a walk with Hiyoko.


The happy days of Fuyuhiko and his friends were suddenly shrouded in darkness after Kazuichi was murdered. Just before Kazuichi's funeral began, Fuyuhiko received a report that Kazuichi wasn't killed in an accident but was instead murdered by someone who called himself the World Destroyer.


Fuyuhiko, along with Peko and Sonia, prepared to face their dear friend‚Äôs killer in a designated building. As they encountered the World Destroyer, Fuyuhiko and Sonia asked why he had killed Kazuichi, only to be told that the "who" didn‚Äôt matter and that the death of any classmate was sufficient. This statement angered Fuyuhiko, who was ready to shoot the World Destroyer to death before he was interrupted by Sonia, who shot him with a rocket launcher.


Much later, after Peko called Nagito prior to her own death, the World Destroyer sent a photo of a deceased Fuyuhiko and Sonia to him. Nagito eventually came to see their corpses in person and faced off against the World Destroyer. In the final scene with the World Destroyer, Nagito managed to destroy the building where he had met him and, as a last act, killed himself using Fuyuhiko's gun, eventually waking up from the Neo World Program.


After Nagito awoke from the Neo World Program, Fuyuhiko, Kazuichi, and the rest of his classmates, who just like Nagito, had been resurrected by Hajime, were already waiting for him at the harbor. The Ultimate Yakuza commented that he had slept for so long and wondered what kind of dream he had dreamed of. Nagito then hugged Fuyuhiko and Kazuichi, telling them that at least it wasn't a bad dream.

Although Fuyuhiko had permanently lost his right eye even in the real world, he was purged of Junko's brainwashing. He then boarded the boat with the rest of Class 77-B and they all headed for the Future Foundation HQ, to stop the Final Killing Game involving Future Foundation leaders.[45]

Atonement
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Hope Arc
Fuyuhiko Hope
Observing Peko's fight

Fuyuhiko and his classmates arrived at the island where the Future Foundation's off-shore facility was located, having left Jabberwock Island. Having rescued Byakuya and Yasuhiro Hagakure from beneath the rubble, the group set out to confront their one and only classmate, Ryota Mitarai, the Ultimate Animator, who Junko had coerced into creating the brainwashing video that transformed Ibuki and the others into the Ultimate Despair.[28][29] Unlike Fuyuhiko and the rest, he avoided being turned into Ultimate Despair due to his contribution. Thus, Class 77-B's fight with the brainwashed rescue squad troops, including the Former Super High School Level Elite Task Force, began. Fuyuhiko observed Peko's battle with the Super High School Level Discus Thrower. After she came out victorious, Fuyuhiko commented that the bamboo sword was the most suitable weapon for Peko, to which she agreed.[33]

Fuyihiko Peko invite Ryota to join them
Confronting Ryota

Later, Fuyuhiko helped convince Ryota to abandon his plan to brainwash the world. During the confrontation, Ryota expressed his belief that he and the other Remnants of Despair could never be forgiven for allowing Junko to plunge the world into despair. In response, Hajime offered Ryota the chance to join them in returning to Jabberwock Island to atone for their sins together. Fuyuhiko also told him to stop sulking and join them. Ryota eventually broke down in tears and agreed, stopping the countdown mere seconds before the brainwashing was completed. Fuyuhiko and the others later came to his side to comfort him.[33]


Fuyuhiko and the other former Remnants of Despair shouldered the blame for the Final Killing Game by sending a broadcast video to the Future Foundation. They presented themselves in their despair personas and preserved the Future Foundation's credibility and power to rebuild the world.[33]


Having accomplished their atonement, Fuyuhiko and his classmates boarded back to Jabberwock Island by boat. He was last seen offered plates of food by Peko.[33]

Real Fiction
Main article: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony
Danganronpa V3 Tsumugi Shirogane Halfbody Sprite (Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu) (1)
Cosplayed by Tsumugi Shirogane

In Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony, it is alleged by the mastermind Tsumugi Shirogane, the Ultimate Cosplayer, that the entire Danganronpa franchise is fictional in-universe; a series of games, anime, and later live-action dramas performed actors. In particular, Tsumugi, who is the Ultimate Cosplayer, claims she is only able to cosplay fictional characters (breaking out into a bright pink rash whenever she tries to cosplay a real person), and the fact she is able to cosplay as the whole cast of Danganronpa characters including Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu is used as evidence to support her claim that all of the cast are fictional. However, due to a number of holes in Tsumugi's story which make her an unreliable narrator, whether or not she was telling the truth is deliberately left up to the player's interpretation; as a result, it is up to the player whether they believe Fuyuhiko's story within the Danganronpa series was real, or a fictional story written by Team Danganronpa and performed by an actor.[46]

Creation and Development
Translation Credit: Kaibutsushidousha on Tumblr

Creator Kazutaka Kodaka revealed that the first element established about Fuyuhiko during the earliest stages of development was his title: Super High School Level Yakuza. However, in their subconscious effort to create a "legit yakuza," the development team couldn't find a personality that fit the role. Character designer Rui Komatsuzaki noted that his early design pitches for Fuyuhiko leaned too heavily into the stereotypical "burly, scary, and ruffian" image of a yakuza. None of the "giant man" designs were approved, so Komatsuzaki swapped Fuyuhiko's original design with the "dumb cute boy" concept he had initially created for Nekomaru.[47]

The design shift bent Fuyuhiko's character direction into "a cute yakuza boy." Komatsuzaki then reimagined Fuyuhiko's appearance, changing from a traditional Japanese yakuza aesthetic to something closer to an Italian mafia style. The resulting design features a vulgar young man in a high-class suit, lending him an unexpectedly intellectual look. That said, Fuyuhiko's in-game scenes retain little of the Italian mafia flavor. On the contrary, the traditional undertones of an old-fashioned Japanese yakuza remain intensely present throughout his scenes.[47]

According to Kodaka, Fuyuhiko was designed as a character whose personality and mannerisms would gradually evolve throughout the story, with big turning points in the early, middle, and late stages of the game. Kodaka noted how Fuyuhiko's constant character development was particularly tiresome to write. However, as a result, Fuyuhiko became a fleshed-out and widely appreciated character. In the early parts of the story, he was portrayed as a "big baby" who couldn't do anything on his own, which was a rare personality type within the Danganronpa series.[47]

Daisuke Kishio, Fuyuhiko's Japanese voice actor, also commented on his character:

"I think Fuyuhiko Kuzuryuu is a very likable character, cool right from his name. At a first glance, what stands out the most is his short stature, baby face, and cute freckles, but he‚Äôs actually a gangster who gets things done better than any adult, and even kind of a dandy. These little quirks are what make characters fun to voice, and what makes me can‚Äôt stop wanting all of you to love them."[47]
Name
His first name (ÂÜ¨ÂΩ¶) can mean "winter boy" or "winter prince", while his last name (‰πùÈ†≠Èæç) means "nine-headed dragon", which happens to be a deity in Japanese culture. Despite his name meaning "winter boy", Fuyuhiko was born in the middle of summer, which corresponds to his younger sister's name. Although it is written using different characters, the first two syllables in Natsumi's name make the Japanese word for "summer" (Â§è).

He was initially planned to be named "Inuhiko" (Áä¨ÂΩ¶), meaning "dog boy." However, since Nekomaru (Áå´‰∏∏ "round cat") already had an animal-themed name, his name was changed to Fuyuhiko. He was given the last name Kuzury≈´ because Komatsuzaki was robbed in Kuzury≈´ Park three times during his middle school days.[47]

Alternate Fates
Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan exist in two separate alternate universes: one where Usami succesesfully kicks Monokuma out of the Neo World Program and the Hope Restoration Program goes forward as intended, and one where Fuyuhiko still attends Hope's Peak Academy, but no students are in peril. As they are alternate universes, these events are non-canonical, but because Fuyuhiko's personality is unchanged, backstory information shared by him in these events is considered questionably or dubiously canonical rather than fully non-canonical.

Free Time Events are also considered somewhat questionably canonical due to the nature of how Free Time Events are accessed (in that some characters' Free Time Events cannot be fully completed during the course of the canon game storyline due to limitations on the number of interactions you can have with them during one playthrough, and thus can only be accessed after they have canonically died either through a second playthrough or via Island Mode). However, due to Free Time Events being largely experienced during the canon game storyline, Free Time Events are more grounded in canon than Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan and are largely considered canon by the majority of players.

Appearance
Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair design document
He is a slim young man with a refined appearance, often described as having a "baby face." Because of his fairly short build, Fuyuhiko generally presents an overly aggressive demeanor to assert that he is, in fact, a tough gangster. He has dusty blond crew-cut hair, with a distinct pair of curved lines shaved on each side of his head. He also has freckles along the bridge of his nose and a birthmark near his mouth on the right side. His eyes are gold, and he has permanent blush marks on both cheeks.

Befitting his title, Fuyuhiko dresses in traditional yakuza fashion: well-tailored suits. During the Killing School Trip, he wears a two-piece suit consisting of a dark pinstripe jacket and pants over a white dress shirt. His tie is brown-black with an animal skull emblem on it, and he wears black dress shoes with a platform heel. On his left lapel is a pin in the shape of the emblem of the Kuzuryu family, and he wears two silver rings on his right hand. He later wears a black eyepatch with a white, round dragon pattern. Even though many Yakuza members get tattoos, Fuyuhiko states that he has not been tattooed yet.[48]

In his official splash art, Fuyuhiko wears a similar outfit with the addition of a black fedora adorned with a dragon emblem on the left. He layers his suit with a black blazer with the Kuzuryu emblem pinned to the left lapel, pairs it with black shoes, and holds a pair of dark sunglasses in one hand.

While attending Hope's Peak Academy, Fuyuhiko wears a white long-sleeved button-up shirt secured by a pale teal necktie underneath a pastel-brown waistcoat with a grid pattern. He pairs this with black school slacks and the same pair of shoes he wears in the Killing School Trip.

Personality
First Impression
‚Äú	He probably wants to be a part of the group, but he can't be honest about it... He believes he's different from everyone else... That's why he's always alone. ...He's like the main character of an RPG. Have you played those before?

‚Äî Chiaki about Fuyuhiko, Chapter 1 - Deadly Life
‚Äù
Fuyuhiko is initially incredibly stand-offish, always in a crappy mood, and rude to the other students on the island. He claims he's not going to play at being friends with anyone, and considers it not worth his time and beneath him. When Fuyuhiko interacts with others, whether by choice or not, his attitude is combative and irritable. He is easily angered and often resorts to threatening or insulting others when they disagree with or complain about his actions. He badmouths everyone, using names like "bastard," "dumbass," and "motherfucker." In the original Japanese, his signature insult is boke („Åº„Åë), and he frequently punctuates arguments with it. He is also not above casually issuing death threats to anyone who irritates him. He asserts his yakuza background so often to enhance his lone-wolf attitude. Despite claiming he had no interest in the party hosted by the Imposter, he shows signs of wanting to attend by lurking around the old building. He makes excuses before leaving the moment Chiaki picks up his true intention.[37] His bad attitude causes mutual dislike between him and Mahiru, who often scolds him and is distressed by his constant death threats. Their tension escalates after they learn that they are a part of the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case, with Fuyuhiko ending up planning to kill her for her involvement in her little sister's death. He hesitates when he gets into an altercation with her, but her firm belief that revenge is wrong pushes him over the edge, and he nearly goes through with it before Peko ultimately kills her in his place.[18]

This defensive attitude in the early stages of the killing game may have stemmed from his pride as the Ultimate Yakuza, as well as an underlying insecurity about his position. He wants to prove that he can survive on his own without relying on the Kuzuryu Clan or his assigned hitman, which is why he pushes Peko away and loathes being treated like a kid. He claims he distances himself from others so he won't be dragged down by affection when the time comes to kill. However, in the end, it is affections that prevent him from escaping the killing game on his own when Peko presents him with the opportunity to do so. His quest for revenge over his little sister's death wavers, as he finds himself unable to sacrifice everyone else's lives for his own. Worse, doing so would mean confirming that he sees Peko, a very dear childhood friend, as nothing more than a tool assigned to him by his clan. That hesitation leads Hajime to realize that beneath all of Fuyuhiko's anger, rudeness, defensiveness, and lone-wolf behavior, he is actually a very different person. He breaks down for the first and only time during the killing game, overcome with pure agony and tears as Peko is dragged to her execution. He tries to intervene but only ends up losing both Peko and his right eye in the process.[18]

Growth
Feeling remorse and guilt over causing Peko and Mahiru's deaths, Fuyuhiko decides to take responsibility for his actions by gradually becoming the kind-hearted yakuza Peko had always known since childhood.[19] He grows more sociable and cooperative, unafraid to admit his mistakes. He becomes a man of his word who refuses to half-ass his resolve, attempting harakiri to properly apologize and attending his recovery party despite his injuries, something the old Fuyuhiko would have never done. Viewing his life as a spare and living on borrowed time thanks to Peko's sacrifice, he honors Hiyoko's wish to be the first to "be cut off" when problems arise. This is why he volunteers to assist Mikan and Hajime in caring for the sick students during the Despair Disease outbreak and even attempts to intervene in Akane's execution.[40] Although he matures into a loyal, level-headed, protective, and caring figure, he still retains his short temper and habit of cursing, often calling others 'bastards' and 'dumbasses', though now he uses it more affectionately. This side of Fuyuhiko is shown even during his school years. Despite retaining his lone-wolf tendencies,[23] he gradually becomes more involved in group activities and grows to genuinely care about his classmates.

He also becomes a deeply contemplative person, often reflecting on his past mistakes and genuinely striving to better himself to atone for them. He realizes how wrong it was to blindly rush into revenge, and now lives with the consequences, constantly haunted by them. However, in his final Free Time Event, he manages to calm himself and refocus on surviving, determined to ensure that none of his fallen classmates' deaths are in vain.[49] Seeing himself in Akane's shoes after Nekomaru sacrificed his human body to protect her, he tells her to drop her nonchalant act, be honest about her feelings and guilt, and, most importantly, express her gratitude to Nekomaru for everything he's done.[42] He tells Hajime to take good care of the important women in his life before it's too late, speaking from the pain of losing Peko and Natsumi.[5] After escaping the killing game, he wants to visit his sister's grave and hold a proper funeral for Peko and Mahiru, though he's ultimately relieved of that burden when Hajime brings the latter two back.[50] He comes to respect Mahiru's protective tendencies by once scolding Kazuichi's rudeness toward Chiaki, saying that Mahiru would scold him if she were still around.[43] He also once reflects and becomes emotional over a particular photo displayed at Mahiru's memorial, one she had secretly taken, showing him and Peko together, appearing like equals for the first time. His growth throughout the killing game leads Hajime to describe him as looking like a mature, grown man.[51]

He often contemplates his position as well, having self-esteem issues about carrying the burden of being the rightful heir to the Kuzuryu Clan. He thinks his little sister is better suited for the job, and in the meantime wanting to be strong on his own without ever relying on his family's power.[5] Because of his insecurities, Fuyuhiko is particularly sensitive about his appearance, knowing that people expect a big, muscular man to lead a yakuza family. His own appearance defies those expectations, but his sheer willpower and the way he overcomes great hardships prove that he's more than capable of leading. He dislikes and will react violently if someone were to describe him as having a "baby face" or if they were to make fun of his height.[12][52][53] Fuyuhiko is lactose intolerant and hates when people mention milk, even though he secretly wishes he could drink it to grow taller. Despite his tough status, he's just like a normal person with simple pleasures. He enjoys sweets like fried dough cookies (karint≈ç in the original Japanese), though he finds them embarrassingly unmanly and keeps that preference to himself. In contrast, he appears to dislike sour stuff.[54] He's likewise self-conscious about not having any tattoos, claiming it is something not to be gawked at.[48][55]

In his Free Time Event, Hajime's "harmless-looking face" and inviting presence allow Fuyuhiko to openly reflect on his past while also giving him confidence in his ability to lead the clan and face the future.[5] Deeply honoring their bond, Fuyuhiko even performs a brotherhood cup ceremony with him, officiating him as a "brother" and vowing that they'll both make it out of the killing game alive, a promise they ultimately fulfill.[49] In his Island Mode ending, he resolves to stop running from his weaknesses and the constant comparisons to his little sister, vowing to become a man worthy of leading the family business with his own hands.[53]

Fuyuhiko takes duty very seriously, and if there's someone who he can trust, he will open his heart and cooperate with them. Despite having no compunctions about murder or framing others for his crimes, he takes more trivial violations of honor and moral codes seriously. For instance, he is strictly against underage drinking,[49] underage driving,[56] and teenage sex.[39] He is also very critical of Kazuichi for his constant attempts to flirt with Sonia. He once desperately tried to stop Kazuichi from molesting Sonia when they were under the effect of aphrodisiacs.[24] During his school years, he was one of the few students who attended the class regularly, even though he didn't have to.

Talent and Abilities
Ultimate Yakuza

As the heir to the Kuzuryu Clan, Fuyuhiko was raised in a "kill or be killed" environment, where settling disputes through violence was the norm. Even his parents' arguments sometimes ended with him getting involved and nearly killed.[4] Due to his family's notoriety, people treated him with extreme caution. He claimed to have gotten used to being doubted, admitting that he had done many things that deserved suspicion.[57] He also expressed that he could relate to the dark impulse of refusing to let someone you hold a grudge against die easily.[58] This manifested in his tendency to indulge in his "an eye for an eye" philosophy against those who wronged him or the people he cared about. He avenged his younger sister by killing her murderer, Sato, and during the Killing Game, he devised a plan to kill Mahiru, who had previously helped Sato cover up the crime. He specifically used a metal bat to murder Sato and later planned to kill Mahiru with one to emphasize that philosophy. [18]

Having been used to being surrounded by a "mountain of bodies," Fuyuhiko did not get overwhelmed by death easily, even from a young age. To him, the way his classmates tried to get along and play nice during the Killing Game made less sense than his initial confrontational and direct approach to embracing a bloodbath.[4] This leads him to frequently sympathize with his classmates for being forced into participating in the killing game. To him, they are only "civilians,"[42] "students who live honest lives,"[4] and "regular bastards",[53] people from a completely different world where bloodshed is not the norm.

Despite being toughened by his upbringing, he claims there is nothing inherently strong about him aside from being born into the Kuzuryu Clan.[4] He worries and questions about his positions constantly,[19] thinking his younger sister will make a better leader due to her skill set. Natsumi counters that she is only amazing due to being her little sister. She even attempts to follow him into Hope's Peak's main course because she believes he truly deserves his title.[5]

True to Natsumi's words, Fuyuhiko possesses qualities that warrant Hope's Peak scouting him as the Ultimate Yakuza, namely his resolve and willpower. Feeling remorse for directly causing the deaths of Mahiru and Peko, he swallows his pride by formally greeting the group he had previously antagonized and berated nonstop. He then attempts harakiri to prove the sincerity of his words and later insists on attending his recovery party hosted by Ibuki despite his reopened wounds, prompting Nekomaru to remark that, like any other yakuza, Fuyuhiko may have mastered pain tolerance to an art.[39]

Fuyuhiko not only changes for the better ever since Peko dies in the Neo World Program, but he also supports the group throughout with his organizational and leadership skills. He assists Mikan and Hajime in monitoring the students affected by the Despair Disease and resolves the surveillance camera issue connecting the hospital and motel teams by instructing Kazuichi to set up the device 30 minutes after every morning and evening announcement.[39] He also helps coordinate the group's efforts to locate the so-called bombs Nagito has planted somewhere on the island.[43]

Fuyuhiko's leadership is further exemplified during his time as a member of Ultimate Despair, where he uses his influence and his clan's power to help lead the spread of despair.[34] He also has contacts he can rely on to gather information for him, such as locating Mikan's whereabouts after she disappears during his upperclassman year.[29]

He appears to be well-acquainted with yakuza traditions such as sakazukigoto, a highly formal ceremony in which two or more men exchange sake in traditional cups, typically to pledge loyalty and brotherhood. In Fuyuhiko's case, he swaps the sake with water, and the ceremony is performed with Hajime in his final Free Time Event to honor their friendship and to promise that they will both make it out of the killing game alive. The ceremony is also traditionally used to establish a hierarchy between parties, which is why Fuyuhiko asks Hajime if he wants to be his underling or "little brother."[49] Fuyuhiko also possesses the knowledge of popular yakuza-themed media, such as the movies A Man from Abashiri Prison and The Yakuza Papers.[59]

Ultimate Yakuza official translations in other languages
Kuzuryu Clan
Further details about the clan members, including Fuyuhiko's relatives are expanded in his Island Mode. Despite his parents' violent tendencies and the many traumatic experiences he endured witnessing that violence, Fuyuhiko deeply respects both of them. He mentions that his father is so strong he could lift the Jabberwock Statue on his own,[16] has his own biography published,[60] and even took Fuyuhiko fishing, turning their catch into fresh sashimi to eat on the spot.[48] His mother, on the other hand, is extravagant; she loves coconuts so much that they are scattered across the floor all year round. The Kuzuryu Clan has a tradition that they won't acknowledge a man as a true member unless he can split a coconut with his bare hands. The family also has a summer custom of slicing watermelons with long cane swords at the beach until the sand is soaked red.[48] The family's fondness for violence runs even in his cousin, who is obsessed with weapons, though she never lets him touch them. He once had a great-grandfather who was a former Navy man.[61] Perhaps the most infamous Kuzuryu is his late uncle, known as the "Overlord of the South," said to be the strongest member of the clan. Rumors claimed his final battle with a pursuing detective nearly destroyed the world,[5] and Fuyuhiko genuinely believed his uncle was even stronger than a tank.[61]
