Trivia
Similar to Mondo Owada,[62] they clubbed their victims' head with a blunt object in a fit of rage, driven by the loss of their deceased siblings, though in Fuyuhiko's case, the act was carried out by Peko.[18]
Discounting Chihiro Fujisaki's Alter Ego, Fuyuhiko was the first actual person to interfere in an execution, as well as the first person to be harmed during an execution that was not prepared for him. The other being to interfere with an execution was Genocide Jack in Punishment of the Fighter.
In Danganronpa IF, it is revealed that Yasuhiro Hagakure owes him and his clan 8 million dollars, because he extorted money from "the girl related to the Kuzuryu Clan".
Based on their interactions in the non-canon Danganronpa V3 bonus mode, Ultimate Talent Development Plan, Fuyuhiko is unaware that Yasuhiro scammed his sister and Yasuhiro is unaware Fuyuhiko's family is one of the families he owes money to.
Fuyuhiko's English voice actor, Derek Stephen Prince, also voices Kokichi Oma in Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony.[63]

‚Äú	Giving up on life and choosing death...is nothing but a blasphemy toward life. It is a violation of the natural order! It is the arrogance of humanity!

‚Äî Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair
‚Äù
Gundham Tanaka (Áî∞‰∏≠ ÁúºËõáÂ§¢), is a student of Hope's Peak Academy's Class 77-B, and a participant of the Killing School Trip featured in Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair. His title is the Ultimate Breeder (Ë∂ÖÈ´òÊ†°Á¥ö„ÅÆ„ÄåÈ£ºËÇ≤ÂßîÂì°„Äç lit. Super High School Level Animal Breeding Committee Member).

He, along with Class 77-B, return in Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School to explore their school life leading up to The Tragedy.



History
Early Life
Gundham's tendency to self-mythologize, coupled with his complicated and larger-than-life ch≈´niby≈ç-influenced speech, often made his past difficult to interpret. While his dramatic language obscured certain details, elements of truth could still be discerned.

One detail he revealed about his past was that he lived with his mother during his childhood. Even though they appeared to have a good mother-son relationship, her cooking skills left much to be desired. Having no choice but to silently endure her terrible cooking as to not make her cry, Gundham began to develop a belief that his body was "poisonous" and carried "a fearsome curse." He then used his home life to create a defensive persona to not let other people touch him, claiming that they would "immediately decompose and wither away." He applied this when he was in grade school, where it was revealed that he never held hands with other children. He would fake a condition and position himself near the teacher to avoid questions. He also regularly skipped folk dances at school,[14] managing to leave without participating, thanks to a nurse who sympathized with him, or as he put it in his own words, "from the same tribe" as him.[4] He also mentioned that he had only been to an amusement park once during his childhood and that no one had ever bought him a toy.[15][16]

Gundham seemed to have an absent father, as his mother is the only parental figure he explicitly mentioned and credited with raising him. However, he hinted at his father's existence by describing himself as "the offspring of an angel and a devil" and "a result of a union between a human and a demon."[16][17]

While attending Fazal Commerce High School[9][10], Gundham became a notable member of the Breeding Club due to his ability to tame any animal and his success in proliferating endangered species. A joke rumor circulated that he could also speak to animals.[18] His most noteworthy contribution, however, was running a website related to animal breeding. The true content was never revealed, but he claimed that his research results were eagerly awaited by scientists (or "sorcerers") around the world. The website was said to be highly secured (or "magically enchanted") so only chosen individuals could access it, while ordinary people could only access the dummy site called "Exciting Breeding Journal."[19] Gundham also conducted his own ethical breeding research, with his latest project being a hybrid hamster with "sparkling silver fur" with dominant spots and bands. Alongside this and many other animals he cared for at home, he entrusted their care to people he selected to assist with his breeding duties.[7]

Four Dark Devas of Destruction
Four Dark Devas of Destruction

Gundham was always seen carrying the Four Dark Devas of Destruction (Á†¥Â£äÁ•ûÊöóÈªíÂõõÂ§©Áéã, hakai-shin ankoku shiten-≈ç lit. Four Heavenly Kings of Darkness and Gods of Destruction), his four pet hamsters inside his scarf.[18] Their names are Supernova Silver Fox San-D (orange and white), Mirage Golden Hawk Jum-P (the ever-sleepy tan fur with a peach underbelly), Crimson Steel Elephant Maga-Z (grey and white with a chipped ear), and Invading Black Dragon Cham-P (orange and plump). Due to their territorial nature, Gundham used his body as "a bed" to tame them, which was why his left hand was always wrapped in bandages.[7][20]

Prior to the Tragedy
Attending Hope's Peak Academy
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Despair Arc
First Year
Tanaka's hamsters
Cleaning the classroom

Gundham was scouted by Hope's Peak Academy and enrolled in Class 77-B as the Ultimate Breeder and referred to himself as "Tanaka the Forbidden One." Since attendance was not mandatory for Ultimates as long as they continued to hone their talents, Gundham was not among the classmates who regularly attended class. Nonetheless, he was relatively easy to convince by his homeroom teacher, Chisa Yukizome, to start attending classes to build strong relationships and foster "hope" with his peers alongside honing his talent.[21]

Danganronpa 3 (Despair Arc) - ED (Textless) (18)
With Class 77-B

Gundham was often seen spending time with his classmates‚Äîplaying video games, having lunch together, electing Chiaki Nanami, the Ultimate Gamer, as their class representative, and even letting Kazuichi Soda, the Ultimate Mechanic, to play with Four Dark Devas of Destruction.[22][23] He also grew close to Sonia Nevermind, the Ultimate Princess, who, over time, picked up Gundham's unique way of speaking and mannerisms.[24]

Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc (Episode 04) - Aftermath (65)
With his pet pomeranian

As the Ultimate Breeder, Gundham often trained his pets and brought them to school, including his 'fearsome' Pomeranian. This pet was one of the few that was difficult for him to train,[25] managing to escape and wander the halls of Hope's Peak Academy on its own, prompting him to put up a missing poster for it. Unbeknownst to him, it had encountered Nagito Komaeda, the Ultimate Lucky Student, who accidentally spilled a drink while trying to greet it, only for the Pomeranian to lick it. These drinks were actually laced with the Antagonist drug of Gundham's upperclassman, Seiko Kimura, the Ultimate Pharmacist. This caused the pomeranian to grow into a giant and accidentally wreak havoc in the school gym, leading to a bomb incident. As a result, Nagito was suspended for a year due to his involvement in the incident, while Chisa as his homeroom teacher was placed on probation for one semester with the Reserve Course. Meanwhile, the pomeranian eventually shrank back to its normal size and returned to Gundham, who remained unaware of what it had done.[5]

Second Year
Tanaka's Grizner
Performing with Grizner

In his upperclassman year, Gundham continued to bring his pets to his classroom, even Grizner, a live brown bear, to demonstrate his talent by performing a series of strange gestures with it. This occurred around the same time when students from the Reserve Course students launch a massive protest against the Main Course, blaming them for causing the Tragedy of Hope's Peak Academy. Unbeknownst to most, the true mastermind behind the tragedy was Junko Enoshima, the originator of Ultimate Despair, who manipulated events behind the scenes and framed Izuru Kamukura‚Äîthe result of the Izuru Kamukura Project‚Äîfor the incident. The Hope's Peak Academy committee, responsible for the project, was accused of using the exorbitant fees paid by Reserve Course students to create so-called 'murderers'.[6][26]

Gundam parodies Saint Seiya with his hamsters
Twelve Zodiac Generals

Although Gundham and his classmates were seemingly unrelated to the growing protest, they became involved after noticing that Mikan Tsumiki, the Ultimate Nurse, had been absent for some time. Nagito, who had recently returned from his suspension, claimed to have seen her on the school grounds, prompting Gundham, alongside his Twelve Zodiac Generals (each of the Four Dark Devas of Destruction's identical offspring), and the others to search for her while the parade was ongoing, but to no avail.[27]

Kazuichi, Gundham, and Mahiru's reaction to Nagito's warning
Contemplating whether to go or not upon Nagito's warning

Gundham and his classmates reconvened in their classroom after failing to locate Mikan and assumed that Nagito had given them false information. However, they were soon shocked when Chiaki returned carrying an unconscious Nagito, and Mikan‚Äîwhom they had been searching for‚Äîalso appeared, carrying Peko Pekoyama, the Ultimate Swordswoman, who had been injured in a battle with Junko's twin sister, Mukuro Ikusaba. Chiaki and Nagito had infiltrated Junko's lair, but before Nagito could shoot Junko, Izuru knocked him out. Chisa, who had followed them, intervened just in time to buy enough time for Chiaki to carry Nagito to safety. Gundham, who was initially pleased with the chance to unleash his power to help Chisa, reconsidered once Nagito urged them not to go, warning it might be a suicide mission. However, Chiaki convinced him otherwise.[28]

Nekomaru and Gundham rejoining the group
Rejoining the group

On their way to Junko's lair, their path was blocked by a band of Reserve Course students who wished to take them on in the battle to create placements on the Main Course for themselves. Gundham, together with Nekomaru Nidai, the Ultimate Team Manager, stayed behind to fend them off while the others went ahead. Despite their classmates' concerns for their safety, Gundham and Nekomaru, exhausted from their battle, were able to catch up with the group while walking down the tunnel beneath the Izuru Kamukura statue, due to Mikan, who had phoned them and given the group's whereabouts.[28]

Class 77 Despair
Class 77-B brainwashed

Unbeknownst to Gundham and his classmates, this path to search for Chisa was nothing but a ruse made by Junko, with the help of Mikan and Chisa themselves who had been brainwashed into despair, to lead Class 77-B into what appeared to be the same room later used for the Class Trials. In this very room, Gundham and the others were forced to watch Chiaki executed in a brutal fashion. Gundham was horrified and wanted to find a way to save her, but he was too powerless to do anything. Bearing witness to Chiaki's death caused the brainwashing effect of the video to take hold of Gundham and the others, plunging them into despair.[29]

Remnants of Despair watching Hope's Peak destruction
Witnessing Hope's Peak's destruction

Fully brainwashed into becoming the Ultimate Despair, Gundham and his classmates received their final lesson before "graduation", the one final meeting to discuss their plan to overthrow the world with despair. After Sonia expressed that she would bring her country "peace and no war", Gundham voiced that his class "have all proven to be true comrades". Chisa then activated a bomb that faked the death of Class 77-B so they could be taken off the list of protected students. Later, Gundham and his class stood outside the school grounds as they watched Hope's Peak's destruction.[30]

The Tragedy
Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Intro (14)
Leading an army of wild animals

Gundham joined the Ultimate Despair after falling prey to Junko's brainwashing.[30] Alongside his corrupted classmates, he started The Tragedy and kept it ongoing even after Junko's death in the final stage of the Killing School Life.[31] Gundham and his classmates who did not commit suicide to follow their leader Junko soon became known as the Remnants of Despair.[31] They also hacked her body and grafted them onto themselves‚Äîthough in Gundham's case, the specific body parts he took remain unknown. One of his infamous contributions as a member of the Ultimate Despair was leading an army of wild animals to help him spread despair and destruction.[32]

Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Makoto arriving (6)
Remnants of Despair

Eventually, the Future Foundation secured the custody of Gundham and the other fourteen - at first only aware that they were survivors from Hope's Peak Academy. When Makoto Naegi, Class 78th's Ultimate Lucky Student, by that time a member of the 14th Division of the Future Foundation, realized that the survivors were in fact, Remnants of Despair, he quickly directed them to Jabberwock Island in secret.[31]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Neo World Program (4)
Neo World Program

Makoto made them enter the Neo World Program, where their memories were reset to a time prior to their entering Hope's Peak Academy, before they were brainwashed by Junko - resulting in all of them not recognizing each other.[31] The plan was to overwrite Gundham and the others' memories of themselves as Ultimate Despair, replacing them with good ones in order to undo all the damage Junko had done to them.[33] The scheme backfired when Izuru Kamukura, the Ultimate Hope, uploaded Junko's malware AI just before they were to be programmed. Consequently, they were subjected to the identical brutal incident that befell Class 78th, although in a realistically simulated environment. The killing game became known as the Killing School Trip, an ordeal in which Gundham and the other Remnants of Despair were coerced into participating.[31]

Killing School Trip
Main article: Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair
Danganronpa 2 CG - Students in the classroom
Killing School Trip participants

Gundham participated in the Killing School Trip alongside fourteen other Remnants of Despair and one Future Foundation observer. It occurred in a virtual world, the Neo World Program, resembling Jabberwock Island. Due to his memories as the Ultimate Despair and life in Hope's Peak Academy being erased by the Future Foundation, he couldn't recognize any of his classmates.[31]

After being teleported to the island, Gundham first introduced himself to Hajime Hinata at the airport. His grandiose personality, combined with the fact that he carried around his pet hamsters inside his scarf, quickly alarmed Hajime, who immediately flagged him as an eccentric person.[18] Unlike Hajime, however, Gundham seemed to be in a better temper at the beginning, telling the overly panicking Hajime to cool his head.[34]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone at the beach (1)
Building a sand castle

Later, Gundham and his classmates were assembled by Usami at the first island's beach, the observer of the school trip, an AI programmed by the Future Foundation, who claimed to be the class's teacher. She reassured the students that there was no need to worry and provided Gundham and the others with swimsuits, encouraging them to fully enjoy their "school trip". Gundham accepted her offer by changing into his swimsuit and could be seen building a sand castle on his own.[34]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Start of the Killing School Trip
The Killing School Trip begins

The promising tropical school trip, however, turned into a nightmare immediately as Gundham learned that the evil animatronic bear, Monokuma, the self-proclaimed headmaster of Hope's Peak Academy, had hijacked their trip and turned it into a killing game. Despite initially refusing to participate, Gundham and the others had no choice but to submit to his authority after Usami was rendered powerless, forcibly renamed Monomi, and made an example by being blown to pieces by the Monobeasts.[34]

Once the killing game started, Gundham regularly joined the morning meeting at the restaurant at the behest of the group's self-appointed leader, the Ultimate Imposter, and also to feed the Four Dark Devas of Destruction. He remained calm and unfazed by the emergence of the countdown and the possibility of a large organization masterminding the killing game. His composure only cracked when Sonia complimented his "cute" hamsters, making him blush and unintentionally igniting a one-sided romantic rivalry with Kazuichi, who was interested in Sonia.[20]

The Party
Danganronpa 2 CG - A photo of the party (2)
Attending the party

Gundham later agreed to join the all-night party the Imposter hosted at the old building. Thanks to San-D, he noticed that the windows in the building had been covered with iron plates, though he didn't know the exact reason why. Once the party started, Gundham started panicking when he realized his "Hell Hound Earring" had gone missing, just a few moments before a blackout occurred. [20] Even after the group made a horrifying discovery of the Imposter's body in the dining hall once the lights returned, it did not stop Gundham's agitation over his lost earring. He revealed that he had received it to commemorate taming the same Pomeranian pet he had at Hope's Peak and had worn it ever since.[25] When Hajime suggested it might have fallen through the gaps in the floorboards, Gundham spotted his earring.[35]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Gundham Tanaka and Chiaki Nanami investigating
Investigating a potential outside entrance to the floorboards

Gundham then went around the building to look for a way to get under the floorboards. He was later helped by Chiaki, who thought it might be helpful to understand the true nature of the murder. Unfortunately, they were unable to find any access from the outside as the building was surrounded by firm fences. Gundham had yet to call it quits and continued searching for it, making him appear to Hajime as though he had no intention of investigating.[35]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Gundham Tanaka finding the trap door
Discovering the secret passage

Gundham's stubbornness, however, proved extremely valuable during the class trial. With the help of Jum-P, he managed to find access to the floorboards through the storage room, where a secret passage was hidden beneath a large assortment of random boxes. He immediately grabbed a lighter from the supermarket before finally retrieving the lost earring he had dropped under the floorboard. While he was down there, he noted that the only out-of-the-ordinary item he discovered was the glowing paint applied to the knife near where the Imposter's blood was dripping. These discoveries became crucial in proving that the culprit had accessed the floorboards to murder the Imposter from beneath the gaps and relied on the glowing paint to move toward their target. Thanks to Gundham's contribution, the group managed to pin the crime on the true culprit, Teruteru Hanamura, the Ultimate Cook. As a result, he and the others survived the first class trial after Teruteru was correctly voted guilty and executed as punishment.[35]

Silence and Solitude
The following day, Gundham attended the regular morning meeting, even though the Imposter was no longer with the group. Upon learning that Monokuma had lost one of his Monobeasts, allowing the group to explore the second island, Gundham taunted him but was stopped from engaging in a pointless activity by Mahiru Koizumi, the Ultimate Photographer. He would also learn that Nekomaru and Kazuichi had knocked out Nagito and tied him up in the old lodge to prevent him from causing trouble, as he was the one who plotted to kickstart the killing game and tempted Teruteru to commit murder‚Äîa decision Gundham vehemently agreed upon.[36]

One morning, Gundham, who typically spent his time by himself, overheard Kazuichi and Hajime's plan to rendezvous at the supermarket at 2:30 p.m. He went to ask them about it but was immediately shooed away by Kazuichi. The incident offended him and led Gundham to declare that someone like him, who desired only silence and indifference, would never concern himself with "ants." Despite this, Gundham reappeared at the same time that Kazuichi and Hajime were heading to the beach house. If Hajime talked to him, Gundham would once again remind him that he wished to be left alone, a lie that Hajime could tell by his lonely expression, and wish he had mustered the courage to just say he too wanted to be included in their hangout.[36] During the investigation of Mahiru's murder, Gundham revealed to Hajime that he had discovered their beach party event, once again insisting it was no concern of him as he loved silence and solitude. But by now, Hajime had begun to understand that, despite his claims, Gundham secretly wanted to be invited too.[33]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Class Trial Elevator (Chapter 2)
Descending to the second class trial

During the class trial, Gundham was misled by the true culprit into believing that Hiyoko Saionji, the Ultimate Traditional Dancer, had summoned Mahiru to the beach house, hidden in the closet, and killed her upon her arrival before fleeing the scene. However, once Hiyoko calmed down and testified truthfully, Gundham and the others realized that she was merely being set up as a scapegoat for Mahiru's death. Gundham then opened a discussion regarding the physical state of the culprit after they had tainted themselves with Mahiru's blood while dragging her to block the roadside entrance of the beach house. This led the group to pinpoint the crime on Peko who used water bottles in the beach house to wash the blood off of her. Gundham later witnessed her execution, which injured Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu, the Ultimate Yakuza who Peko had secretly served as his hitman, who tried to intervene in the process. Gundham and the others had no other choice but to leave his fate to Monokuma's hand who ran him off to the hospital, saying that there was no other way than to move forward.[33]

Despair Disease
Following the second class trial, Gundham alongside Nagito arrived at the morning gathering a bit later than usual. He was shocked to see a sinister-looking memorial for Mahiru, immediately shouting his desire to destroy such a "blasphemous false idol" to pieces. This led Hiyoko, the one who had built the memorial, to burst into tears right after everyone else had complimented her effort. Shortly after, Monomi informed them that she had defeated another Monobeast, allowing the group to investigate the third island. Gundham inspected the hospital and mentioned how it brought back memories stating that he once had his body carved with "the mark of defeating the devil." Hajime didn't bother trying to interpret what he meant, as Gundham himself told him to forget about it.[37]

Gundham was present and baffled when he witnessed Fuyuhiko, who barely recovered, formally reintroducing himself and apologizing for his terrible and aggressive behavior toward the group since the beginning of the killing game. He also attended Fuyuhiko's recovery party later that night hosted by Ibuki Mioda, the Ultimate Musician. However, Gundham didn't expect Ibuki's music to be so intense that it even made the Four Dark Devas of Destruction less lively than usual. The party was soon interrupted by Monomi, who informed the group that Akane Owari, the Ultimate Gymnast, had attempted to duel Monokuma herself, resulting in her execution. However, Nekomaru shielded her at the last second, suffering severe injuries, which led Monokuma to take him away from the group for quite some time for "treatment".[37]

Adding to the group's newfound troubles, Gundham and the others discovered that Nagito, Akane, and Ibuki had contracted the Despair Disease, which not only gave them a high fever but also drastically altered their personalities. Since the disease would continue spreading until a murder occurred, Gundham and the other healthy students decided to quarantine the sick students, with Mikan, Hajime, and Fuyuhiko volunteering to care for them. Gundham suggested that he and the rest should stay at the nearby motel in case anything happened. Not only that there was the possibility that the disease might have spread to Hotel Mirai and their cottages, he also wanted to keep his pet hamsters safe.[37]

Despite their best efforts to prevent a murder, Hajime discovered a body at the music venue, which was later identified as Ibuki's. He then went to the motel to break the news and found Gundham, Monomi, and Chiaki first. Gundham initially suspected that Hajime had caught a similar lying disease to Nagito, but Chiaki believed him. She and Hajime returned to the crime scene, while Gundham offered to watch over the motel in their absence. When Gundham arrived at the crime scene much later with the rest of the group, however, they discovered not only Ibuki's but also Hiyoko's body.[37]

Jum-P running around the stuck slip of paper in rapid circles
Jum-P retrieving the stuck slip of paper on the baton ceiling

During the investigation, Gundham inspected the baton lighting where Hiyoko's body was strapped. He noticed a scrap of thick paper stuck at the top and ordered Jum-P to retrieve it by running around until it fell into his hand. In the class trial, this paper was revealed to be a scrap of wallpaper the culprit had used to cover Hiyoko's body which the culprit used to manipulate the group's perception that Hiyoko had died after Ibuki. However, Gundham argued that Hiyoko couldn't have died before Ibuki on the basis that there was no blood on the crime scene. Hajime and Chiaki objected, proving that the killer wiped the blood off, forcing him to retreat. He also got into a childish quarrel with Kazuichi, threatening to kill each other over suspecting Sonia as a possible culprit.[38]

When the evidence began to point toward Mikan, Gundham was initially in disbelief that a "slow-witted woman" could commit murder but eventually ceased to defend her, as no one else could have committed the murder. After Mikan was executed, Gundham and the others went to the beach on the first island, feeling hopeful about reuniting with Nekomaru, whom Monokuma claimed was waiting for them there‚Äîonly to discover that he had been completely transformed into a robot.[38]

The Funhouse
Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone riding a rollercoaster
Riding a roller coaster

Aside from adjusting to Nekomaru's new appearance, Gundham and the others grew wary of the Future Foundation and the traitor they sent to infiltrate the group‚Äîthe organization Mikan claimed was responsible for transporting them to Jabberwock Island and was, therefore, their collective enemy. This was partially true, as Mikan spoke from the perspective of the Remnants of Despair. This was why Gundham and the others initially refused to explore the fourth island opened by Monomi but eventually went after Monokuma promised them ship parts and their Hope's Peak student profiles as a reward. To earn the promised prize, Gundham satisfied Monokuma's request by joining everyone on the roller coaster at the amusement park, visibly scared as he tried to steady his heart. The prize turned out to be a school file related to the Killing School Life, which, instead of helping them understand their circumstances, only confused them further.[39]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Everyone riding the train to the funhouse (1)
Train to the Funhouse

The group then decided to visit the Funhouse only accessible when everyone was present, to find the promised ship parts or more information about their Hope's Peak student profiles. Gundham referred to it as an act of sheer madness, as they plunged themselves into Monokuma's trap, which made everything the more interesting to him. True to his words, when he and the others boarded the small train heading to the Funhouse, they were gassed with white smoke that knocked them all unconscious. When they woke up, they found themselves to be inside the Funhouse's Strawberry House. It turned out Monokuma had subjected them to an escape game, where he wouldn't allow anyone to escape the Funhouse except through murder.[39]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Funhouse Elevator
In the contact elevator

Instead of wallowing in their new circumstances, the group decided to explore the building using a map provided to them in search of an exit. Gundham and Sonia were the first to pair up and began exploring before Kazuichi even had a chance to ask Sonia to team up with him. Although he had enlisted Four Dark Devas of Destruction to search the areas for him, he failed to find an exit. Gundham and the others would later travel to the second building, the Grape House, using the contact elevator at Monokuma's behest. There, the animatronic bear revealed that he would no longer provide food or drinks, using their hunger as a time limit until a murder occurred. Rather than helplessly panicking, the group agreed to explore the Grape House in the same pairs, leading Gundham and Sonia to team up once again, ditching Kazuichi for the second time in a row.[39]

San-D pressing the Strawberry Tower's door button
San-D pressing the Strawberry Tower's door button

Though the group failed to find any possible exit in either tower, Gundham at least discovered a sufficient food source for his hamsters‚Äîseeds from the flowers planted in Strawberry House's indoor park. He also discovered an extremely small radio-controlled toy, which turned out to be the promised ship part from Monokuma who never specified it would be a real one. Lacking the energy to be upset, Gundham and the others listened to Chiaki's theory that the two towers were actually the same building. They went to confirm this, and Gundham once again showcased his command over his hamsters, sending San-D to press the button to open the Strawberry Tower door. When nighttime fell, the group assigned themselves rooms, with the boys‚Äîexcluding Hajime‚Äîstaying in Strawberry House. Gundham won at rock-paper-scissors, securing one of the two Deluxe Rooms, and retired for the night.[39]

On the third day of confinement in the Funhouse, Gundham attended Monokuma's Tai Chi lesson he planned to do regularly every 7 AM to exhaust and starve the students further to push them into killing. Judging by how irritable everyone was, he believed it would boil down to either everyone starving to death or someone committing murder before that could happen.[39] Gundham personally believed that choosing death and giving up on life was nothing but blasphemy against life‚Äîa violation of the natural order and a mere act of resignation. Driven by his belief that it was better to fight for survival than to let anyone starve to death, Gundham resolved to commit murder.[40]

At some point between the end of the Monokuma Tai Chi lesson and the following morning, Gundham entered the Final Dead Room, a challenge where participants could access the Octagon to claim the promised Ultimate Weapon from Monokuma. After solving the escape room puzzle, he played a 1/6 Russian Roulette game, which granted him access to the Octagon. There, he discovered the true layout of the Funhouse and devised a killing plan using this secret.[40]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 4 - Closing Argument Act 1 (2)
Murder preparation

First, Gundham wanted to isolate the groups from each houses by disabling the contact elevator from the Strawberry House side. He did so by tampering with the control panel using tools he obtained from the Octagon. He then manipulated the clocks in both buildings, setting them back by two hours. In the Strawberry House lounge, he set the wall clock's alarm to 5:30 a.m. to provide himself with an alibi later. After completing his preparations, Gundham went to Strawberry Tower with the tools from the Octagon, waiting for Nekomaru's arrival. He knew that Nekomaru's built-in radio clock would wake him at the actual time of 7:00 a.m. for Monokuma Tai Chi at the Grape Tower. However, due to the disabled elevator, Nekomaru had no choice but to head to the Strawberry Tower, which, after Gundham's tampering, showed 5:00 a.m. on the Funhouse's clocks.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Nekomaru and Gundham face off
Standoff with Nekomaru

Once Nekomaru entered the Strawberry Tower, Gundham challenged Nekomaru to a duel to the death‚Äîan intent that Nekomaru immediately sensed. Gundham praised Nekomaru for neither running away nor calling for help, recognizing that, at that moment, Nekomaru was equally resolved to kill him. He also noted that the situation would have been more complicated if the intended murderer became the victim. However, Gundham had the advantage because he already knew about Nekomaru's robotic functions, which Nekomaru himself had mentioned a few days prior, including the Good Night Button at the back of his neck. Using this knowledge, Gundham commanded the Four Dark Devas of Destruction to sneak up on Nekomaru and forcefully press the button, forcing him to enter sleep mode and rendering him immobile.[40]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 4 - Closing Argument Act 4
Setting up the murder while Nekomaru was immobile

Gundham then set the alarm in Nekomaru's chest to 7:30 a.m. to wake him up at that time. He tied Nekomaru with a metal wire, tied with a loop at the wire's tip, and hung it on the doorknob. Afterward, he exited the Strawberry Tower and destroyed its door button from the hall, preventing anyone in Strawberry House from entering the tower and uncovering the building's true structure‚Äîtwo towers stacked on top of each other. Finally, Gundham used the secret Octagon passageway to travel to Grape House, and upon arriving at Grape Hall, he pressed the button to open the tower. This caused the elevator-liked floor of the tower to descend, causing Nekomaru's tied body to dangle midair from the wire, signaling his setup's success. Gundham placed a hammer on the floor to mislead the group into believing it was the murder weapon. He also wrapped a chain around the back door, creating the illusion that access to the tower from Strawberry Hall was impossible.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Clock ringing in Strawberry House
Failed alibi setup

After finishing his setup, Gundham returned to his room using the secret passage, intending to establish an alibi for when Nekomaru would eventually die from the fall. However, he didn't anticipate Fuyuhiko‚Äîwho had seen Nekomaru descending earlier‚Äîstill sitting in the lounge. This ruined Gundham's perfect plan, preventing him from returning to his Deluxe Room, which was located past the lounge. As a result, he was forced to appear before Fuyuhiko and the others when the alarm he had set for 5:30 (which was actually 7:30 in real time) went off, a mistake that would bite him hard later in the class trial.[40]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 4 - Closing Argument Act 6 (3)
Hearing the sound of Nekomaru's falling to his death

When Nekomaru's radio alarm rang at exactly 7.30 AM, he began to panic as he found himself tied midair. He swung his body to try to break free, but the doorknob which he had half-broken a few days prior couldn't handle the strain. As a result, it broke, sending Nekomaru falling to his death from the fourth floor to the first. He was instantaneously decapitated as he collided with a pillar. The sound echoed throughout the Funhouse, heard by everyone except those who occupied the deluxe rooms, creating a glaring anomaly for Gundham, a resident of one such room.[40] Later during the class trial, Chiaki speculated that Gundham couldn't hide until the excitement died down, fearing that Fuyuhiko and Kazuichi might check his room and discover his absence.[41]

During the investigation, Gundham, who purposefully trapped himself in the Strawberry House, contributed significantly less than the others.[40]

Gundham's Fate
In the early to mid-stages, Gundham maintained his usual demeanor, with his remarks occasionally receiving positive and supportive reactions from Sonia, and the exact opposite from Kazuichi. He also challenged the group's assumption that Strawberry House and Grape House were connected horizontally by questioning how the contact elevator functioned. Additionally, he disputed the idea that Nekomaru had fallen to his death.[40]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Layout of everyone at the strawberry house
Gundham's position shortly before the lounge alarm rang

Gundham became a prime suspect after the group realized how odd it was that, as someone staying in the soundproof Deluxe Room, he could have heard the lounge alarm ringing. When suddenly accused, Gundham became noticeably panicked and out of character, but he quickly rebounded, questioning how he could have traveled between the two houses. Hajime refuted him by revealing the secret passage connecting the 3rd floor of Strawberry House and the 1st floor of Grape House, which Nagito had discovered in the Octagon and which Gundham had also used during the murder. The group also proved that Gundham must have cleared the Final Dead Room, as the tools he used during the murder were only available in the Octagon.[40]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 4 - Closing Argument Revealed
Revealed as the culprit

Out of all the accusations, it was Nagito's assumption that Nekomaru was killed "without" fighting him that infuriated and offended Gundham the most. In response, Gundham challenged the group one final time, arguing that it wasn't easy for him to press Nekomaru's Good Night Button, especially in a one-on-one situation against the physically strongest person in the group. Hajime and Chiaki countered him, suggesting that he could have used "the power of hamsters," sending his exceptionally smart and trained Four Dark Devas of Destruction to do the deed for him. Gundham was impressed by their deduction and how they complimented his "subordinates'" capabilities, which led him to confess to his crime.[40]

After being correctly voted as the Blackened, Gundham corrected one misconception: contrary to the group's belief that Nekomaru didn't fight, he revealed that Nekomaru had accepted his challenge to a duel, fought bravely, but ultimately lost and was sacrificed. Furthermore, he explained that succumbing to starvation was blasphemy against life, and he believed it was better to kill for survival than to give up on life. As Sonia tearfully begged Monokuma to spare Gundham from execution, Gundham gently told her that it was unbefitting of a noble like her to stop a man from going to his death. He then delivered one final grandiose speech before being dragged to his execution.[40]

Gundham's execution began with a stampede of animals led by Monokuma charging toward him. Having already accepted his fate, Gundham calmly placed the Four Dark Devas of Destruction atop a nearby rock for safety. He proceeded to draw a magic circle on the ground using a wooden staff, attempting to cast a defensive spell as the stampede closed in. The spell failed, and Gundham was violently trampled, his body flung into the air before falling back to the Earth. As he lay dying, his saddened hamsters approached him, and instead of being cast into hell as he desired, angelic animals carried his body to the sky and heaven.[40]

Danganronpa_2_Chapter_4_Execution

After his death, Sonia and the others chose to honor Gundham's speech by moving forward, continuing to live, and believing in each other‚Äîlest he crawl out of hell and be very cross with them. Agreeing with this, Akane and Chiaki suggested everyone refresh themselves by eating enough food and getting restful sleep, determined not to give up their fight to escape the island‚Äîjust as Gundham and Nekomaru would have wanted. Gundham's deceased portrait in the class trial courtroom could be seen in the fifth trial.[40]

Gundham briefly reappeared as an illusion shortly before the countdown ended, as the Neo World Program began glitching. Sonia revealed that she had been taking care of the Four Dark Devas of Destruction after Gundham's death and had taken them for a walk when Gundham briefly appeared near her due to the glitch. Gundham vanished once the survivors stepped inside the ruins.[42]

The illusory Gundham was later conjured in a scenario made by Alter Ego Junko to persuade Hajime and the remaining survivors to graduate. Had she succeeded, it would have allowed her to upload her AI into the comatose bodies of the "dead" Remnants of Despair, effectively reviving them as copies of herself. In this sequence, Gundham asks the group if they wish to be "awed by the sight of my prowess."[31]

Post-Killing School Trip
Danganronpa 2.5 - (OVA) Nagito regaining his memories (18)
Revived Gundham and his classmates

After Alter Ego Junko's defeat, Gundham remained in a coma alongside his classmates, while the survivors waited for them to wake.[31] Eventually, Izuru Kamukura‚Äînow merged with Hajime's personality and memories‚Äîrevived them. Purged of Junko's brainwashing, Gundham who was now alive and awake from Neo World Program, boarded the boat with the rest of Class 77-B and they all then headed for the Future Foundation HQ, to stop the Final Killing Game involving Future Foundation leaders.[8]

Resurrection and Atonement
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Hope Arc
Gundham engaging in a battle with the SHSL Falconer
Engaging in battle

Gundham and his classmates arrived at the island where the Future Foundation's off-shore facility was located, having left from Jabberwock Island. Having rescued Byakuya Togami and Yasuhiro Hagakure, two members of the Future Foundation and survivors of the Killing School Life, from beneath the rubble, the group set out to confront their one and only classmate, Ryota Mitarai, the Ultimate Animator, who Junko had coerced into creating the brainwashing video that transformed Ibuki and the others into the Ultimate Despair.[6][27] Unlike Gundham and the rest, he avoided being turned into Ultimate Despair due to his contribution. Thus, Class 77-B's fight with the brainwashed rescue squad troops, including the Former Super High School Level Elite Task Force, began.[43]

Gundham seizing his opponent's falcon
Seizing his opponent's falcon

Gundham battled the Super High School Level Falconer on the rooftop, unlocking the seal on his name, previously "Tanaka the Forbidden One" to "Gundham Tanaka" and unleashing his full power. This allowed him to seize control of his opponent's falcon, ultimately defeating him. Gundham's Twelve Zodiac Generals also increased in number, suggesting the possibility of them reproducing while Gundham was in the Neo World Program.[43]

Gundam talks about atonement to Ryota
Confronting Ryota

Later, Gundham helped convince Ryota to abandon his plan to brainwash the world. During the confrontation, Ryota expressed his belief that he and the other Remnants of Despair could never be forgiven for allowing Junko to plunge the world into despair. In response, Hajime offered Ryota the chance to join them in returning to Jabberwock Island to atone for their sins together. Gundham also proclaimed that he, as "The Lord of War", welcomed all who would walk his path. Ryota eventually broke down in tears and agreed, stopping the countdown mere seconds before the brainwashing was completed. Gundham and the others later came to his side to comfort him.[43]

Class 77-B acting
Claiming themselves as the mastermind behind the Final Killing Game

Gundham and the other former Remnants of Despair shouldered the blame for the Final Killing Game by sending a broadcast video to the Future Foundation. They presented themselves in their despair personas and preserved the Future Foundation's credibility and power to rebuild the world. Having accomplished their atonement, Gundham and his classmates returned to Jabberwock Island and he was last seen talking with Sonia as the boat took them home.[43]

Real Fiction
Main article: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony
Danganronpa V3 Tsumugi Shirogane Halfbody Sprite (Gundham Tanaka) (3)
Gundham cosplayed by Tsumugi Shirogane.

In Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony, it is alleged by the mastermind Tsumugi Shirogane, the Ultimate Cosplayer, that the entire Danganronpa franchise is fictional in-universe; a series of games, anime, and later live-action dramas performed actors. In particular, Tsumugi, who is the Ultimate Cosplayer, claims she is only able to cosplay fictional characters (breaking out into a bright pink rash whenever she tries to cosplay a real person), and the fact she is able to cosplay as the whole cast of Danganronpa characters including Gundham Tanaka is used as evidence to support her claim that all of the cast are fictional. However, due to a number of holes in Tsumugi's story which make her an unreliable narrator, whether or not she was telling the truth is deliberately left up to the player's interpretation; as a result, it is up to the player whether they believe Gundham's story within the Danganronpa series was real, or a fictional story written by Team Danganronpa and performed by an actor.[44]

Creation and Development
Translation Credit: Kaibutsushidousha on Tumblr

According to series creator Kazutaka Kodaka, Gundham's character originated with his Super High School Level Animal Breeding Committee Member title, with his personality and backstory fleshed out from that concept. Kodaka revealed that he enjoys developing characters by incorporating risky elements, and Gundham exemplifies this approach, having developed a unique lore of his own. Initially, his character was conceptualized as a self-proclaimed mouthpiece that existed only to communicate the thoughts of sapient hamsters, but this idea was discarded due to its confusing and nonsensical nature. The concept was simplified into the version that appeared in the game.[45]

Character designer Rui Komatsuzaki stated that Gundham's sanpaku eyes were a design element he decided on for a Danganronpa 2 character even before Kodaka had created any. He envisioned this particular character as being overly self-conscious about how he dresses, overcompensating for his insecurity with strange fashion choices, such as his scarf, bandages, and enough accessories to complete his design. He also added the hamsters because it was decided that Gundham would be a breeder, and later incorporated the earring as part of a murder trick.[35] Komatsuzaki also believed that the Four Dark Devas of Destruction would go on to live in Sonia's clothes after his death in the Killing School Trip, though he was unable to reflect this in her sprites.[45]

Tomokazu Sugita, Gundham's Japanese voice actor, also commented on his character:

"Gundam Tanaka is an eccentric character, but he's also strong-willed and understanding. A man with a character akin to a king who mustn't be named. But he's so full of energy that I almost lost my voice at the end of his recording (laughs). One of the best things about this game is how you navigate an extreme situation that shows who people really are, and you overcome its dangers with words alone, no weapons or superpowers. Take a good look at what all characters are doing, not just Tanaka."[45]
Name
The kanji in Tanaka (Áî∞‰∏≠) means "rice field" and "center," a generic surname purposefully chosen to make his first name, "Gandamu" (ÁúºËõáÂ§¢), which uses irregular readings, fully stand out. His first name can roughly be interpreted as "snake-eye dreams." He is named after a Ramenman character who share similarities with Gundham. Both characters have to change their name in their respective anime to avoid sounding like the popular Japanese mecha anime, Mobile Suit Gundam. Gundham's execution refers to a particular scene from the original anime as well.[45][46]

In Gundham's case, it was most likely due to the risk of copyright infringement from Sunrise. This led to Gundham's first name in Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc never being mentioned, even in the credits. In-universe, he claims that his first name is "cursed" and cannot be spoken aloud, thus given the nickname "Tanaka the Forbidden One" (Â∞ÅÂç∞„Åï„Çå„ÅóÁî∞‰∏≠).[21][46] It is a direct reference to the Yu-Gi-Oh! card, "Exodia the Forbidden One". However, in Danganronpa 3 - Side: Hope, Gundham breaks the seal on his name and declares himself to be Gundham Tanaka. Interestingly, Gundham's unsealing speech mentions "the rising sun will burn the multiverse to ash", which is most likely a reference to the Sunrise company.[43]

The names of Gundham's four hamsters are: San-D, Jum-P, Maga-Z and Cham-P. All of the names are references to sh≈çnen manga magazines (Sunday, Jump, Magazine, and Champion).

Alternate Fates
Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan exist in two separate alternate universes where Gundham still attends Hope's Peak Academy, but no students are in peril. As they are alternate universes, these events are non-canonical, but because Gundham's personality is unchanged, backstory information shared by him in these events is considered questionably or dubiously canonical rather than fully non-canonical.

Free Time Events are also considered somewhat questionably canonical due to the nature of how Free Time Events are accessed (in that some characters' Free Time Events cannot be fully completed during the course of the canon game storyline due to limitations on the number of interactions you can have with them during one playthrough, and thus can only be accessed after they have canonically died either through a second playthrough or via Island Mode). However, due to Free Time Events being largely experienced during the canon game storyline, Free Time Events are more grounded in canon than Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan and are largely considered canon by the majority of players.

Appearance
Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair design document
Gundham wears a long, black jacket that stops below his knees and is always left open, with dark red coloring on the inside; which is part of his former school uniform. He also pins a dog breeder badge on the left side of his jacket. The left sleeve is rolled up to the elbow and fastened to the jacket with silver pins. Gundham is also known for his long purple scarf, which wraps around his neck and covers his chin. Vertical symbols are emblazoned on the back of his jacket and the ends of his scarf. Underneath his jacket, Gundham wears a white button-up layered over a slightly darker shirt with a purple cross design on the chest. His black pants are tucked into black boots riddled with straps. He wears an undercut, and the top section of his hair is slicked back into a single curl. His hair looks more wild and jagged when he's enraged. His hair color is black with light grey streaks through it.

Gundham has a noticeably pale and grey skin tone and has no eyebrows.[47] He has grey eyes but he wears a red contact lens in his right eye. The grey scar that runs through his left eye onto his right cheek appears to be a tattoo. He is always seen with his hamsters, the Four Dark Devas of Destruction. The Devas often camp out inside the scarf that Gundham always wraps around his neck, but they frequently appear during conversations or at his command. Due to their territorial nature, Gundham bandaged up his left arm with a single red bead hanging from the bandage knot, which he refers to as his "cursed arm," up to the elbow to protect his skin.[7] Gundham's Hell Hound Earring hangs from his right ear, and he wears silver rings on the index and middle fingers of his right hand.


Finishing Gundham's Free Time Events yields the item 'Gundham's Undergarments' which are invisible to those who have too low of an "astral level". This hints that Gundham possibly doesn't wear them.

While attending Hope's Peak Academy, Gundham wears the school's standard male uniform. He accessorized the uniform with the same scarf, shirt, belt, and boots he wore during the Killing School Trip. Instead of just the Hell Hound Earring, he wears an earring in each ear. He still wears an undercut, but the longest pieces of the top section frame his forehead.

As a member of Ultimate Despair, Gundham appears to wear a type of straitjacket underneath a large jacket with a fluffy white collar. His face has more tattoos, including a scar-like tattoo on his right cheek and an obscure symbol on his forehead. Using his talents as the Ultimate Breeder, Gundham controls armies of beasts. He seems to always keep his eyes closed. Instead of carrying the Devas, a large, dark snake wraps around his body.

His swimsuit in Danganronpa S: Ultimate Summer Camp consists of a pair of black swim trunks with a black drawstring waistband and a purple cross-shaped design on the right side, the same cross that appeared on his shirt shown during the Killing School Trip. He is shirtless but retains his signature purple scarf and his left hand remains wrapped in bandages. He still carries the Four Dark Devas of Destruction with him.

Four Dark Devas of Destruction

San-D is an average-sized hamster with white and orange fur, dark-tipped ears, and pink hands, feet, and nose. She also has small black eyes and rosy cheeks. Jum-P is also an average-sized hamster with white and brown fur and pink feet, nose, and cheeks. Personality
Gundham has an eccentric personality, stemming from his ch≈´niby≈ç syndrome, characterized by his delusions of grandeur. As "the offspring of an angel and evil,"[17] he proclaims himself as evil personified, one who has claimed dominion over evil, and thus a being that transcends humanity.[40] To further embellish his villainous persona, he adopts grandiose titles such as the Supreme Overlord of Ice and Tanaka the Forbidden One.[18][21][40] He also refers to his pets as his loyal subordinates under the dominion of the Tanaka Empire and gets offended when others call his Four Dark Devas of Destruction "hamsters."[38] Gundhams talks in an exaggerated, theatrical style reminiscent of a cartoon supervillain, using pompous, old-fashioned, esoteric vocabulary, allowing him to inflate mundane interactions. His speeches, dripping with poetic, cryptic, and metaphorical language and terms, often irritate and confuse others, especially those who are not used to interacting with him, ultimately causing Gundham to push them away from him. He perceives "normal people" as inferior beings incapable of comprehending the full extent of "his power," calling them "mere humans," "fools," and "fiends," among other dismissive terms.[18][19][35]

In conjunction with being the "great and powerful Gundham Tanaka," he acts self-centered and aloof‚Äîalienating himself from others to focus on caring for himself and the Four Dark Devas. Though Gundham appears prideful and shuns spending time with mere mortals, he appears to be lonely. This is exemplified by how he attends the morning meetings at the restaurant without fail and accepts the Imposter's invitation to the all-night party.[20] He also hints to Hajime that he wants to be included in Sonia's beach party. He claims that he only desires silence and solitude, though his lonely expression later on suggests otherwise. Hajime can tell Gundham wants to be invited but never directly asks, instead retreating into his usual aloof persona.[36][33]

This loneliness and his inability to express his true wants and needs without resorting to his overly dramatic "evil lord" jargon, may stem from Gundham's extreme social awkwardness. It starts with his belief that his existence is "cursed" and that "poisons" run through his blood due to enduring his mother's terrible cooking. He uses this to justify his strictness about avoiding physical contact with others since childhood, disguising his fear of intimacy. He goes so far as to fake illnesses to avoid folk dances and playing with other children.[4] The only person he is willing to become vulnerable to and capable of touching is a "singularity" he describes as "a being who can make the impossible possible by overcoming various limitations." In simpler terms, this could refer to someone like Hajime‚Äîsomeone who continues to bond with him despite his "defenses" and genuinely considers Gundham a friend he wants to survive the killing game with.[17]

His social awkwardness can make him come across as inconsiderate, such as when he calls Hajime "trash" upon first meeting him simply because his only pet was a hermit crab passed around in elementary school.[18] Similarly, during the investigation of the Imposter's murder, he becomes fixated on recovering his Hell Hound Earring, stubbornly prioritizing it over actively participating in the investigation though his discoveries helped solve the murder.[35] Gundham also has a habit of pretending to know more than he actually does. When he can't provide the knowledge to others, he will immediately distract them by throwing unrelated speeches in his signature evil overlord style.[48]

Tanaka and Sonia in sync
In sync with Sonia

Gundham's harsh facade conceals a softer, more sensitive side, which is frequently shown through his interactions with Sonia. He bonds with Sonia during both their time at Hope's Peak and the Killing School Trip due to their complementary interests‚ÄîSonia's fascination with the occult, her genuine admiration of his "evil" persona, and most importantly, her fondness for his "cute hamsters" and his strong and trusting relationship with them. Her sincere appreciation often leaves Gundham uncharacteristically flustered, causing him to stutter and blush.[20] In the original Japanese, she is also the only one that Gundham does not refer to as kisama (Ë≤¥Êßò an old-fashioned term for 'you' that was once used to address social equals or inferiors, but in modern usage, it is almost exclusively used by men in a derogatory manner) or by their last name, instead calling her "she-cat" at one point or "the Dark Lady", his fantasized version of Sonia.[39] They are compatible with each other and have great teamwork as shown while attending Hope's Peak, with the two growing so close over time that they could even finish each other's sentences due to Sonia latching to Gundham's eccentric personality.[24] While trapped in the Funhouse, they are the first to pair up and leave, while everyone else is still deciding who to partner with to explore the building. They later become a very effective duo during the fourth class trial.[40]

Other than Sonia, Gundham seems to be less harsh toward women. He has a good relationship with his mother and endures her terrible cooking to avoid making her cry, prompting Hajime to note that he is a "good guy" deep down. He also gains sympathy from a nurse at his grade school, who often allows him to leave without participating in folk dances.[4] With his female classmates, he allows them to choose their desired rooms before the boys do while trapped in the Funhouse, even referring to them as "kittens."[39] He is often agreeable with Ibuki's opinions, calling her remarks "nice lines."[36] When Mikan gets accused as a culprit, he initially comes to her defense claiming that a "slow-witted woman" like her is incapable of murder.[38] He also appears unaffected by Hiyoko's demeaning attitude and mean comments about being embarrassed by his outlandish dialogues‚Äîquite the contrast to his reactions with fellow men. When Fuyuhiko gives him a backhanded compliment, Gundham threatens to crush him into dust. His interactions with Kazuichi take this up a notch, where he dismisses almost anything Kazuichi says about him.[35]

Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc (Episode 03) - Fuyuhiko and Peko Discuss Natsumi (2)
Letting Kazuichi to play with his hamsters

Gundham's relationship with Kazuichi, on the other hand, highlights his indifference toward trivial matters, such as Kazuichi's one-sided romantic rivalry over Sonia. He primarily finds Kazuichi annoying when he insults the Four Dark Devas, dismissing him as a "lowly human," similar to his view of most others. However, while attending Hope's Peak, their relationship appears slightly better, with Gundham occasionally allowing Kazuichi to touch his hamsters.[23]

Another trait and ability often showcased by Gundham is his level-headedness. In class trials, while not always the most prominent contributor to the trials, whenever he does contribute, it is quite substantial. He is also willing to stand corrected and retreat from a debate when evidence proves his understanding of a situation false, as showcased in the second and third class trials.[33][38] He is the one who suggests that the healthy students stay at the motel during the Despair Disease outbreak, just in case anything happens to the affected students.[37] He is also smart enough to plan a complicated murder using the Funhouse's unique structure, which is only ruined by pure coincidence beyond his control.[40]

He also has a deeper understanding of certain situations and isn't lost in his own world. For example, Gundham is among the first to openly acknowledge Nagito's grey morality, recognizing that it is impossible to establish a relationship with someone like Nagito, who he deems unpredictable by the usual human standards rooted in experience, making Nagito a fearsome individual.[36] Nagito's erratic behavior, such as his willingness to be sacrificed as a stepping stone for his classmates' hope and how he actually pushed Teruteru into committing murder, eventually leads Gundham to not mind if Nagito "retires permanently" when he contracts the Despair Disease.[37] His perceptiveness and contemplative nature strangely reveal that he cares about his classmates, albeit in his own distant way. He contemplates where the souls of the Imposter and Teruteru go after their avatars' deaths, and advises Hajime to pray for their souls so they can be saved.[36] He also perceives Peko as a "foolish soul" for remaining a slave, yet he accepts her choice to stay loyal to her young master.[37]

Gundham also possesses a great respect for nature and its laws. He understands that nature is indiscriminate in its harsh cruelty, noting that "pleasure and pain are irrelevant as long as you have a purpose, and take action for that sake."[19] He also does not fear death and strongly dislikes mankind's malicious ways. Notably, Gundham hates the idea of giving up without a fight, for he believes that all creatures are born to fight tooth and nail to survive. According to him, giving up your life willingly is blasphemous toward nature (and by extension, oneself). This philosophy is what leads him to commit murder, refusing to let himself or his classmates actively choose to starve to death instead of fighting to cling to life. As such, he allows his target, Nekomaru, a fair chance to fight him and show the same resolve to uphold his belief‚Äîa duel to the death to reignite everyone's will to survive, in which he comes out victorious. When he is cornered in the class trial, the only accusation that elicits the strongest reaction from him is Nagito's claim that Nekomaru went down without a fight‚Äîan insult to both his beliefs and Nekomaru. He eventually surrenders after Hajime and Chiaki acknowledge that he used his "subordinates," the Four Dark Devas, to subdue Nekomaru. Though the nature of Gundham's actions is never fully justified as purely selfish, purely selfless, or somewhere in between, Hajime and Chiaki are inclined to believe that he sacrifices himself for the group, based on how he didn't resist as much during the class trial. Gundham, however, as someone who firmly believes that murder is murder regardless of motive, blatantly denies this.[49]

Attitude Toward Animals
Though he may be awkward around other people, Gundham deeply cares about animals he often refers to as "magical beasts" and pets as "familiars".[19] He claims that anything that can talk "will eventually betray you," hinting at the possibility that he has been hurt by others before. This idea is supported in his Final Free Time Events, where he accuses Hajime of being a "Kotodama user" a label he seemingly attaches to people who try to manipulate him with "false words" and "cheap tricks", believing Hajime is one and doubts his sincerity when calling him a friend.[17] As a result, Gundham prefers to trust animals for their loyalty and sincerity.

Although it is only a rumor that he can speak with animals, what remains true and recognized by those around him is that Gundham genuinely understands the feelings of animals and is often seen with a gentler, softened expression and a smile when talking about them. His empathy towards animals leads him to pity livestock for being raised for the sole purpose of human consumption.[50] He is also highly responsible toward the animals under his care, consistently providing them with plenty of exercise, high-quality food, and a good place to sleep‚Äîespecially for the Four Dark Devas of Destruction amid the killing game.[7] He dedicates most of his cottage space to their large cage and an extensive hamster tunnel sprawled across the floor. His consistent caring and responsibility enable the mutual trust and strong bond he shares with his pets, allowing his commands to be heeded, whether they are hamsters, falcons, bears, or notoriously difficult Pomeranians. His love for animals, however, doesn't extend to anthropomorphic cartoons of animals "who walk on two legs and speak human languages," which he finds highly offensive. This also extends to Monokuma and Monomi, as they "can talk" and, most importantly, aren't "cute."[50]

In his Island Mode, it is revealed that Gundham is fond of reading encyclopedias about animals from around the world and can become emotional when watching movies related to animals.[51][52] Gundham also comes to love pumpkins not only because they contain high nutrients and are versatile for various cooking methods, but also because their seeds provide an effective food source for his Four Dark Devas of Destruction.[19]

Four Dark Devas of Destruction
San-D appears to have a quite cheerful personality, often cheering with her paws up and enjoying eating sunflower seeds. However, she can be greedy for more territory and shown to knock Jum-P aside from his territory.[7] She is also shown to be quite agile, able to skillfully press the Strawberry Hall button.[39] Jum-P, despite almost constantly appearing to be asleep, is capable of moving around and carry out Gundham's order. He discovers the secret passage in the storage room of the old building and retrieves a thick scrap of paper by running around it during the third investigation.[20][38] When Hajime first meets Gundham during the Killing School Trip, Gundham claims that Jum-P has something to say: "We're not used to going easy on our enemies... so don't make us angry. You wouldn't like us when we're angry."[18]

Maga-Z appears to be slightly more aggressive than the others, with his squinted eyes giving him a meaner look. He is seen biting Kazuichi's finger when he attempts to touch him.[23] He once lost his temper when Jum-P accidentally stepped his foot on his territory, and as a result, he attacked Cham-P and then Gundham's arm when he intervened.[7] Cham-P often appears to have a jolly and relaxed expression, and Gundham implies he is the most docile and smartest out of the hamsters, because unlike the others he understands fear. He also tells Cham-P once to "exert your strength to your heart's content!"[39]

Talent and Abilities
Ultimate Breeder

Gundham's official talent in English localization is the "Ultimate Breeder". However, in the original Japanese release, the more literal and accurate translation to it (Ë∂ÖÈ´òÊ†°Á¥ö„ÅÆ„ÄåÈ£ºËÇ≤ÂßîÂì°„Äç) is "Super High School Level Animal Breeding Committee Member", or in the Funimation subs, "Animal Raising Committee Member". It is a common after-school club in many Japanese schools dedicated to caring for animals (usually small birds, reptiles, and rodents) kept within the school grounds.

Gundham did splendidly as a club member due to his proficiency in training and caring for any animal and his success in proliferating endangered species.[18] He revealed that his secret technique to taming animals is by starting with the basics‚Äîchanting "Good girl, good girl"‚Äîand ensuring they understand that he has no ill will. To achieve this, one must appear innocent and recognize which animals enjoy being touched and which do not. He then spends a long time with them until he begins to hear their words. Hajime comments that this must be something only the Ultimate Breeder can experience.[50]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 4 - Closing Argument Act 3 (2)
Commanding the Four Devas to force Nekomaru into sleep mode

On a more serious note, Gundham has a natural aptitude for taming animals. This is best exemplified by his pet hamsters, the Four Dark Devas of Destruction, which he carries around in his scarf and shirt. He put considerable effort into training them, allowing them to follow commands ranging from basic to advanced‚Äîdemonstrated multiple times during the Killing School Trip‚Äîsuch as retrieving small objects from high places, scouting an entire floor, and even sneaking up to press Mechamaru's Good Night Button, rendering him immobile.[38][40] While attending Hope's Peak, he often brings his pets to school as part of their training. It includes his Pomeranian, which he claims as one of the hardest to tame, but over time managed to master.[25] He is also able to command a brown bear to perform tricks by following his gestures.[6] He is also capable of taming wild animals, demonstrated during his time as an Ultimate Despair, where he commanded an army of beasts to unleash chaos, despair, and destruction.[32] The rumor of him being able to speak with animals, though never confirmed, was demonstrated directly during his battle against the Super High School Level Falconer, where he effortlessly commands the falcon to switch allegiance to him simply by unsealing his true name.[43]

As a Breeding Club member, Gundham's most noteworthy contribution, to which he dedicated a significant amount of time, is running a website related to animal breeding. While the true content is never revealed, he claimed that scientists worldwide eagerly await his research findings. The website is said to be highly secured so only chosen individuals could access it, while ordinary people can only access the dummy site called "Exciting Breeding Journal."[19] Gundham also conducts his own ethical breeding research, with his latest project being a hybrid hamster with "sparkling silver fur" with dominant spots and bands. Alongside this and many other animals he cares for at home, he entrusts their care to people he selected to assist with his breeding duties.[7] His breeding skill enables the Four Dark Devas of Destruction to produce healthy offspring known as the Twelve Zodiac Generals, and by the conclusion of the Final Killing Game, their numbers continued to increase.[27][43] Gundham is also knowledgeable about various breeds of hamsters and never forces himself to keep one he's incompatible with, such as the Roborovski hamster.[7]

"Kehehe... Splendid... Fuhahahaha, that was splendid! For a mere human, you did quite well!"
"...You don't wish to forgive me? Do you feel regret? Then finish it! Cast your impure votes for Gundham Tanaka! My beloved, deadly foes! Let the voting time begin!"

"Sonia... An act as unrefined as stopping a man from going to his death...does not befit a noble such as yourself."
"Yes, I do not mind...however... ...What is it, my Four Dark Devas of Destruction? Are you worried about me? Oh, my feared Four Dark Devas of Destruction, that is not like you at all... However, there is no need to fear... In this world, I am only a temporary visitor... I was simply visiting for a moment...and now that my duty is complete, I must return to the darkness... That is why, until the very end... Pride! Conceit! Courage! Insolence! Fearful of nothing! Daunted by nothing! Let us laugh uproariously! That is Gundham Tanaka! I shall stick with my evil until the very end! Open Sesame, Pandaemonium! I shall fill hell with true hell! FUHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!"

Trivia

Nekomaru, Gundham's victim's, cause of death is foreshadowed by the final victim in The Wizard of Monomi 2.5D, a movie Mikan used for an imitation murder. She recreated only the first two victims, omitting the third‚Äîdepicted as a tin man whose body was mutilated. This mirrors how Gundham murders Nekomaru, where his robotic body is destroyed, and his head is decapitated, resembling the third victim.[37][39]
In his first Free Time Event, Gundham asks Hajime for his "hidden name" and "special ability." Hajime, who has no memory at the time, objects, claiming he has neither. In reality prior to the commencement of the Killing School Trip, however, he was already transformed into Izuru Kamukura, the Ultimate Hope.[19][43]
In his Island Mode, Gundham is implied to be unable to swim, claiming that he's "not very effective against water-types," which may also be a reference to Water-type Pok√©mons.[54]
In the Danganronpa Another Episode artbook, a beta model who appears to be Gundham controlling Robo Justice robot can be seen.[55]
Gundham's English voice actor, Chris Tergliafera, also voices Ryoma Hoshi in Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony.[56]
Gundham's stage actor, Masahiro Inoue, was married to Sonia's 2015 stage actress, Jaimie Natsuki.[57][58]

Gundham and the Four Dark Devas of Destruction are included in the collaboration of Danganronpa 3 x H≈çkai Gakuen.
Gundham is included in the third wave of Danganronpa 1.2 Reload x Divine Gate.
Gundham appears as a dress-up item in Atgames.[citation needed]
The Four Dark Devas were featured in a promotional art by Rui Komatsuzaki from the anime Wooser's Hand-to-Mouth Life and Akudama Drive.
