Hiyoko Saionji (Ë•øÂúíÂØ∫ Êó•ÂØÑÂ≠ê), is a student of Hope's Peak Academy's Class 77-B, and a participant of the Killing School Trip featured in Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair. Her title is the Ultimate Traditional Dancer (Ë∂ÖÈ´òÊ†°Á¥ö„ÅÆ„ÄåÊó•Êú¨ËàûË∏äÂÆ∂„Äç lit. Super High School Level Classical Dancer).

She, along with Class 77-B, returns in Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School to explore their school life leading up to The Tragedy.



History
Early Life
Hiyoko was born as the heiress to the Saionji Clan, the head of the school of traditional Japanese dance. Her traditionalist family was very overbearing due to this important role. Making things worse, her chosen bloodline was constantly targeted by conspiracies and assassinations due to jealous people. As a child, she constantly suffered cruel and even life-threatening pranks and threats, like having pins in her shoes, dead mice scattered all over her bed, and poisoned food.[4]

Although Hiyoko's father was distinct from her other relatives because he was just a married relative, she developed a strong bond with him during her formative years living with her parents. In her account, Hiyoko described her father as a protective and supportive figure who never left her side and was always there to watch her dance. When Hiyoko performs her traditional dance, which she thinks is "boring", her dad promises to remain awake throughout the performance, which is something she values and cherishes deeply.[12] She also mentioned how she always felt calm whenever her dad is near her, which is in stark contrast to her mother, whom Hiyoko tended to disregard because she was "all pride and no talent" and "a waste of oxygen"‚Äîand her grandmother, who would spare no effort to protect the Saionji family's reputation.[5]

Knowing the weight that comes with being the head of the family, Hiyoko's father expressed his desire to shield Hiyoko from that responsibility. However, having such a low position in the family meant that his opinion had no bearing on Hiyoko's future. Very soon after this, Hiyoko's grandmother took her from her parents and intended to raise her up in accordance with the family's rigid traditions to preserve the honor of the Clan. She didn't permit Hiyoko to see her parents, as she considered her father to be a bad influence on her. While Hiyoko had a low opinion of her grandmother, calling her a "hag", she was also grateful for being raised by her.[4]

Due to her upbringing under her grandmother's care, she considers herself part of the noble class and everybody else meager slaves. Hiyoko is said to be a rookie dancer, but it is said that her family has high expectations as she has done many shows overseas. She is also popular with younger audiences, though most of her fans are older males.[13]

Prior to the Tragedy
Attending Hope's Peak Academy
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Despair Arc
Danganronpa 3 (Despair Arc) - ED (Textless) (17)
With Class 77-B

Hiyoko attended Golden Light Girl's Institute[7][8], where it is heavily implied that she never had any friends due to growing a mean and distrustful personality in order to defend herself in the past.[14] She was later scouted and enrolled in Class 77-B as the Ultimate Traditional Dancer by Hope's Peak Academy thanks to her growing stellar career in the Japanese dance industry.

First Year
Hiyoko's introdcution
Insulting Mikan after she trips over her bag

Hiyoko initially didn't know her classmates well and had little interest in forming friendships with them, often being mean-spirited and openly cruel, especially to the meek Mikan Tsumiki, the Ultimate Nurse.[15] However, as shown in the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case, she did spend time with the other girls in the class, as they were often seen hanging out together. Despite her general aloofness, she showed kindness from the get-go only toward Mahiru Koizumi, the Ultimate Photographer, with whom she became close friends.

Saionji's cruelty
Hiyoko pranks her classmates.

However, with the push from her homeroom teacher, Chisa Yukizome, the Former Ultimate Housekeeper, she gradually tolerated her classmates and even beginning to enjoy their companionship in her own twisted way. This often involved teasing others for her amusement, such as when she joined in playing video games just to irritate Ibuki Mioda, the Ultimate Musician, or when she spiked Teruteru Hanamura's, the Ultimate Cook, nikujaga with an aphrodisiac-filled invention created by the Ultimate Pharmacist, Seiko Kimura, to make her classmates drown in their lusts.[16]

Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc (Episode 03) - Ending (14)
Consoling Mahiru after Sato's death

Amidst these happy school days, however, Hiyoko got involuntarily involved into the murder of Natsumi Kuzuryu, the sister of her classmate, Fuyuhiko Kuzuryu, the Ultimate Yakuza, as she, alongside Mahiru, Mikan, Ibuki, and Sato of the Reserve Course discovered her body in the music room. Unbeknownst to her, it was Sato who killed Natsumi, and she was murdered a few days later by Fuyuhiko as revenge. This devastated Mahiru, who was seen crying on Hiyoko's chest while her classmates watched on in worry.[17] This case was later utilized in the Killing School Trip by Monokuma, serving as the game's second motive and was given the title "Twilight Syndrome Murder Case."

Hiyoko Saiyonji Older
Growth spurt

Not long after the deaths of Sato and Natsumi, Hiyoko bid her farewell to Chisa as she was transferred to the Reserve Course after the bomb incident involving one of Hiyoko's classmate, Nagito Komaeda, the Ultimate Lucky Student.[18] During Chisa's absence and later her return, Hiyoko experienced a growth spurt yet still maintained her same mischievous personality.[19]

Second Year
In her upperclassman year, Hiyoko celebrated Nagito's "death" first anniversary, aka his suspension, by placing a white flower on his desk. Around the same time, the atmosphere at Hope's Peak Academy had begun to shift. It started with Mikan's continued absence from class, which Hiyoko quickly noticed. Later, she and the rest of her classmates witnessed a riot among the Reserve Course students, who discovered that the academy had used their tuition money to fund human experiments.[20]

Komaeda noticed Saionji
Nagito not noticing Hiyoko due to her growth spurt

When the protests grew in tandem with Mikan's absence from school, which Hiyoko suspected scared her away, Nagito returned to school when his suspension period ended, much to Hiyoko's dismay, added by how he didn't notice who she was at first due to her growth spurt. Nagito then told everyone who noticed Mikan's whereabouts at the West District of the school grounds, prompting Hiyoko and her classmates to search for her despite her protests.[21]

The search proved futile, as they failed to find the Ultimate Nurse. However, they later learned another grim truth from their class representative, Chiaki Nanami, the Ultimate Gamer, and from Nagito: that Chisa was in serious trouble as she confronted a malicious student Junko Enoshima. This revelation made the entire class immediately eager to help and pursue her to Junko's lair, despite Nagito's warning that it would be a suicide mission. Even Hiyoko looked forward to making Junko's teeth chatter.[22]

Class 77 Despair
Class 77-B brainwashed

Unbeknownst to Hiyoko and the rest of the class, this was a trap set by Junko, who had brainwashed Mikan and Chisa to lure them in what seems to be the room that would be used for Class Trials later on. In this very room, Hiyoko and the others were forced to watch Chiaki's brutal execution, and were unable to take their eyes off the screen despite their attempts. Once Chiaki was killed, Hiyoko and her classmates were successfully brainwashed into despair.[23]

Despaired Saionji
Hiyoko Saionji, the Ultimate Despair

Fully brainwashed into becoming the Ultimate Despair, Hiyoko and her classmates received their final lesson before "graduation", the one final meeting to discuss their plan to overthrow the world with despair. Hiyoko expressed she would use her dance 'to spread joy', before Chisa activated a bomb that fakes the death of Class 77-B so they can be taken off the list of protected students. Hiyoko and her class stood outside the school grounds as they watch Hope's Peak's destruction.[24]

The Tragedy
Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Intro (29)
Hiyoko and Ibuki's concert

Hiyoko joined the Ultimate Despair after falling prey to Junko's brainwashing[24] Alongside her corrupted classmates, she started The Tragedy and kept it ongoing even after Junko's death in the final stage of the Killing School Life.[25] They also hacked her body and grafted them onto themselves‚Äîthough in Hiyoko's case, the specific body parts she took remain unknown.[25] Her infamous contributions as the Ultimate Despair include holding a concert alongside Ibuki to rally the Ultimate Despair army's spirit.[26]

Danganronpa 3 - Future Arc (Episode 01) - Makoto arriving (6)
Remnants of Despair

Hiyoko and her classmates who did not commit suicide to follow their leader Junko soon became known as the Remnants of Despair. Eventually, the Future Foundation secured the custody of Hiyoko and the other fourteen - at first only aware that they were survivors from Hope's Peak Academy. When Makoto Naegi, Class 78th's Ultimate Lucky Student, by that time a member of the 14th Division of the Future Foundation, realized that the survivors were in fact, Remnants of Despair, he quickly directed them to Jabberwock Island in secret.[25]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Neo World Program (4)
Neo World Program

Makoto made them enter the Neo World Program, where their memories were reset to a time prior to their entering Hope's Peak Academy, before they were manipulated by Junko - resulting in all of them not recognizing each other. The plan was to overwrite Ibuki and the others' memories of themselves as Ultimate Despair, replacing them with good ones in order to undo all the damage Junko had done to them.[25]

The scheme backfired when Izuru Kamukura, the Ultimate Hope and the final product of the Izuru Kamukura Project, uploaded Junko's malware AI just before they were to be programmed. Consequently, they were subjected to the identical brutal incident that befell Class 78th, although in a realistically simulated environment. The killing game became known as the Killing School Trip, an ordeal that Hiyoko and the other Remnants of Despair were coerced into participating.[25]

Killing School Trip
Main article: Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair
Danganronpa 2 CG - Students in the classroom
Killing School Trip participants

Alongside fourteen other Remnants of Despair and one Future Foundation observer, Hiyoko participated in the Killing School Trip. It occurred in a virtual world, the Neo World Program, resembling Jabberwock Island. Due to her memories as the Ultimate Despair and life in Hope's Peak Academy being erased by the Future Foundation, she couldn't recognize any of her classmates, even Mahiru, one of her closest friends.[25]

Hiyoko can first be found hanging around at the Usami Corrals. Hajime Hinata notes that she was poking at the ground repeatedly for some reason, which later turns out to be that she was crushing (popping) ants. She invited Hajime to join her, but he declined, which makes Hiyoko call him a wuss.[27]

Afterward, Usami, the observer of the school trip, an AI programmed by the Future Foundation, gathered Hiyoko and the others at the first island's beach to present them swimsuits to motivate everyone to get along. Most students immediately changed and jumped into the water, but Hiyoko stayed on the beach and chose to have fun by stepping on crabs.[27] More likely, however, she didn't want to take off her kimono, as Hajime and the others would later learn that she couldn't tie it by herself.[28]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Start of the Killing School Trip
The Killing School Trip begins

The promising tropical school trip, however, turned into a nightmare immediately as Hiyoko learned that the evil animatronic bear, Monokuma, the self-proclaimed headmaster of Hope's Peak Academy, had hijacked their trip and turned it into a killing game. Hiyoko and the others initially refused to participate. However, they soon learned that they have no choice but to submit after Monokuma makes an example of Usami (renamed into Monomi by Monokuma) by blowing her to pieces using Monobeasts.[27]

Despite the situation that she was in, Hiyoko remained herself, quickly turning the likes of Mikan and Kazuichi Soda, the Ultimate Mechanic, into easy targets for her cruelty. She also makes fun of her other classmates from time to time, such as Akane Owari, the gullible Ultimate Gymnast, Gundham Tanaka, the Ultimate Breeder with ch≈´niby≈ç syndrome, and Nagito whose speeches about friendship made her cringe. She even gave an insulting nickname that she would continually use to the group's de facto leader, the Ultimate Imposter (impersonating Byakuya Togami‚Äîthe Ultimate Affluent Progeny)‚Äîcalling them "Mr. Ham Hands." To Hajime's surprise, this didn't make the Imposter angry at all.[29] In fact, they seemed to appreciate the honesty behind Hiyoko's "thoughtful" nickname. This nickname ironically became the first hint of their true identity as at the time no one was aware that their leader was impersonating the real Byakuya.[30]

Danganronpa 2 - Girls-Only Gathering Event
Girls-only gathering

If Hajime had a certain magazine with him, he could hand it to Mahiru. This would trigger a bonus scene where Hiyoko joined Mahiru's girls-only gathering‚Äîwith Hajime as the exception‚Äîwhere they make desserts together to ease the tension caused by the first motive.[29]

Danganronpa 2 CG - A photo of the party (1)
Attending the party

Hiyoko never missed the morning meetings that the Imposter regularly organized, despite her preference for staying in her cottage and eating sweets for breakfast[29], and participated the all-night party they hosted at the old building. She didn't realize until the class trial that the party was thrown by the Imposter to save her and the others from someone who planned to kickstart the Killing Game, and that was no other than Nagito.[31]

Amidst the lively party, a blackout occurred, prompting the group to panic, and Hiyoko complained that someone had stepped on her foot.[29] However, she soon learned that she and the group had a bigger problem once they discovered the Ultimate Imposter's body under one of the tables. While most students were distraught and flat out refused to point fingers at one another during the class trial, Hiyoko was among the first to snap them back to reality, insisting that they had no choice but to abide by the rules: investigate the murder and identify the culprit if they wanted to survive.[32] For all her tough talk, the sweet-tooth Hiyoko spent zero time investigating and instead ran off to the supermarket to restock her favorite gummies. However, she did inform Hajime that she had noticed the self-defense kits were lesser than before, and that one of the night-vision goggles was missing. By mostly relying on others to provide vital information during the class trial, Hiyoko and the others deduce that Nagito had orchestrated the murder plan. However, it had been sabotaged by Teruteru Hanamura, the Ultimate Cook, who intended to kill Nagito but accidentally ended up killing the Ultimate Imposter, who had interfered with Nagito's scheme. Hiyoko survived the first class trial after Teruteru was correctly voted as the blackened and later executed for his crime.[31]

The following morning, the atmosphere at the restaurant's meeting was somber, with the deaths of the Ultimate Imposter and Teruteru still fresh in everyone's minds. Hiyoko, however, was unsurprisingly indifferent. While she understood that everyone was sad about "Mr. Ham Hands," she openly took pleasure in Teruteru being executed for committing murder. She would have spat on him if she could have, as she believed that he deserved to die. While she went on and on with her rant, Akane suddenly noticed a foul smell coming from Hiyoko. That was when everyone else noticed she reeked, prompting Hiyoko to burst into tears. Feeling cornered, she admitted that she hasn't been able to shower for the past few days due to her inability to tie her kimono sash by herself. While no one was sure how to calm Hiyoko down, Mahiru stepped up and offered to tie her sash and teach her how to make a simple knot. Hiyoko was immediately overjoyed and quickly took a liking to Mahiru, happily dragging her off to take a shower together while most of the others went off to investigate the new island. If Hajime has a certain item with him at this point, he will go to peek at them taking a shower together. From then on, Hiyoko began to bond with Mahiru, often hanging around her and affectionately referring to her as "big sis", much like when they attended Hope's Peak Academy.[28] According to creator Kazutaka Kodaka, Hiyoko's school memories with Mahiru were very precious to her, which explains why she grew close to her again despite having lost her memories in the Neo World Program.[33]

Twilight Syndrome Murder Case
Danganronpa 2 CG - Twilight Syndrome Murder Case (20)
Hiyoko as Girl B

Hiyoko was present when Monokuma announced the second motive of the killing school trip, which was the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case. Hiyoko stated that she had no interest in playing, but pointed out the possibility that someone might be tempted to play while everyone waited‚Äîthus turning them into the hunter and the rest into prey.[28] Little did she know that her very same Big Sis Mahiru had played the game herself, influenced by the words of the tied-up Nagito. In the days that followed, Mahiru (Girl D) invited Hiyoko (Girl B), along with Mikan (Girl A), Ibuki (Girl C), and Fuyuhiko (Guy F), to discuss the game after learning that they were characters in it‚Äîa game that involved the murder of Natsumi Kuzuryu (dead girl) and Sato (Girl E). However, only Hiyoko accepted and promised to meet again later to have a more detailed conversation, as Mikan and Ibuki had a scheduling conflict: the beach party. Meanwhile, Peko Pekoyama‚Äîthe Ultimate Swordswoman and secret hitwoman working for Fuyuhiko‚Äîheeded her young master's order to sabotage their meeting, luring Hiyoko and Mahiru into the beach house.[34]

Danganronpa 2 Chapter 2 - Closing Argument Act 3
Drugged into unconsciousness by Peko

Hiyoko was lured to the beach house at exactly 2:00 p.m., thanks to a fake letter Peko had sent her‚Äî30 minutes before Mahiru's arrival. She was then drugged unconscious by Peko, who had been lying in wait, and hidden inside the closet as part of a plan to frame her as the killer later. While Hiyoko was unconscious, Peko ambushed Mahiru and killed her with a metal bat‚Äîbefore Fuyuhiko, who confronted her about the game, had the chance to do it himself. After some time had passed, the sleeping drug wore off, and Hiyoko woke up‚Äîonly to discover Mahiru's dead body blocking the beach house‚Äôs main entrance as she stepped out of the closet. Shocked, panicked, and fearing she would be suspected of murder, Hiyoko fled from the beach house through the sandy beach, leaving footprints that played right into another trap set by Peko to frame her.[34] Hiyoko's tearful escape from the beach house was spotted by Kazuichi, Ibuki, Hajime, and Mikan, who had been waiting at the diner for the others to show up for their beach party.[28]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Kazuichi Soda witnessing Hiyoko Saionji
Running away from the crime scene

Hiyoko locked herself in her cottage during the investigation and only came out to gather at the airport with Mikan and Ibuki after Nagito tricked them by telling them that Monokuma would execute them if they didn't show up. When questioned about whether Mahiru had spoken to her about the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case, Hiyoko lied, claiming that she and Mahiru had never discussed it at all, before running away and returning to her cottage. It also took Monokuma to drag her by force into the class trial. Thankfully, Nagito managed to take a sample of her footprints and inspect her cottage, where he discovered that her favorite gummy bags did not contain any yellow lemon-flavored ones, which later helped prove Hiyoko's innocence.[34]

In the class trial, Hiyoko and the others would learn the truth about the game and how it involved her as one of the girls who discovered Fuyuhiko's sister's corpse. Although Hiyoko was innocent of both Natsumi and Sato's murder, Peko claimed that she murdered Mahiru and used the motive to blame Fuyuhiko, who had the biggest motive to kill Mahiru. This triggered a series of accusations, and evidence was stacked against Hiyoko, which she tearfully denied. After she stubbornly lied about her whereabouts during the murder, everyone began to notice the discrepancies and realized that this was all a trap set by the true killer. The most glaring error made by the culprit was placing a yellow gummy in an attempt to frame Hiyoko, only for it to be proven as planted evidence, since Hiyoko never eats yellow gummies‚Äîpossibly due to her dislike of sour food.[2] As the suspicion shifted away from her, Hiyoko began to confess everything that had happened, from before to after the murder, including the fake letter the real culprit forged to trick her and Mahiru. The class trial progressed with much greater clarity once they understood that Hiyoko had been premeditatedly framed as the scapegoat by the true culprit. Eventually, they concluded that Peko was the murderer and voted for her to be the blackened. Hiyoko witnessed Peko's execution, which involved her accidentally injuring Fuyuhiko. As he was brought to be treated by Monokuma, Hiyoko tearfully told everyone not to wait for his recovery, as he was the one truly responsible for Mahiru's death.[34]

Trapped by the Ocean Scent
Danganronpa 2 CG - Mahiru Koizumi's photo effigy
Mahiru's memorial created by Hiyoko

In the early morning following the class trial, Hiyoko snucked into the restaurant before anyone else and made a sinister-looking memorial to honor Mahiru, which she had thought everyone would be happy about. However, Hiyoko's expectations were ruined when everybody, not knowing Hiyoko had made it, commented that the memorial was creepy and unsettling to the point that Nekomaru Nidai, the Ultimate Team Manager, urged it to be burned.[35] Not wanting everyone to know that she had made that 'creepy and unsettling' memorial, she went with the flow and commented about how Mahiru wouldn't like it at all until Chiaki pointed out that the memorial was surely made with an honest intention. Hiyoko began crying and admitted she made the memorial because she thought Mahiru would be lonely and apologized for how it looked since she was clumsy at doing anything other than dancing.[36] Hiyoko then asked them not to burn it, to which the others agreed, keeping it up for Hiyoko and Mahiru's sake.

Once the third island became accessible to the group, Hiyoko investigated the motel (by manipulating Akane into inspecting the rooms on her behalf) before visiting Fuyuhiko at the hospital. While everyone was happy that he was recovering, Hiyoko remained silent, sulking as she glared at Fuyuhiko‚Äîsomething Hajime noted was likely because she was still understandably upset about what had happened during the last class trial.[35]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Toy Camera Event (1)
Memorial Jam Session

The next day, if Hajime had the Toy Camera, Hiyoko, alongside Ibuki and Chiaki, would hold the Memorial Jam Session in memory of Mahiru. It had been Mahiru's wish to take pictures of Hiyoko dancing and Ibuki playing an instrument. And so, Hiyoko danced while Ibuki played the guitar and Chiaki joined to play the triangle, as Hajime took pictures with the Toy Camera‚Äîhoping that despite their differences in style, their harmonized performance could reach not only Mahiru but also the late Imposter, Teruteru, and Peko.[35]

By the next morning, Hiyoko was bewildered to see Fuyuhiko‚Äîdespite still not fully recovered‚Äîformally re-introduce and apologize to the group, joining the restaurant's morning meeting properly for the first time since the killing game began. She rejected his apology and refused to befriend him, once again blaming him not only for Mahiru's death, but also Peko's. Even as he dropped to his knees, Hiyoko remained adamant in her refusal, which Fuyuhiko acknowledged before proceeding to slit his own stomach to demonstrate his resolve. Such action shocked Hiyoko and rendered her speechless as Mikan, Nekomaru, and Kazuichi carried Fuyuhiko back to the hospital. Hiyoko, now visibly dejected, pondered what Mahiru would have said or how she would have reacted in this situation, prompted by Chiaki's questioning. Hiyoko thought Mahiru would have gotten mad, but she fell silent again before finishing to articulate her thoughts.[35]

Later that night, Ibuki invited everyone to the welcome-back party for Fuyuhiko, but Hiyoko seemingly didn't show up. It was only after Ibuki finished performed her song, "From Me to You Too", that Hiyoko was revealed to be among the attendees. Amusingly, she was the only one who genuinely enjoyed the Ultimate Musician's performance and stated that it was her first time to hear a famous song live. Before anyone could assume that Hiyoko had forgiven Fuyuhiko, she made it clear that she hadn't forgiven him so easily. However, she was willing to cooperate with him until they escaped the island.[37] Despite her words and attitude, Hajime observed that she was still making an effort to change for the better, stating that "there's no way the old Hiyoko would've ever forgiven Fuyuhiko like this". However, just as Ibuki was about to perform her next song, Monomi interrupted, informing everyone that Akane was dueling Monokuma. This prompted everyone to rush to her aid, much to Hiyoko's dismay, as she had wanted to hear another song from Ibuki.[35]

The one moment of calm and happiness amidst the Killing School Trip was ruined when Nekomaru shielded Akane from her execution from breaking the rules, gravely injuring him that he needed to be taken away for treatment. Witnessing the horrible event, Hiyoko was instantly sobered, realizing that the "talk about everyone getting along" amidst a killing game was just a way to fool themselves. She used Nekomaru's sacrifice as an example of misplaced 'friendship'‚Äîan outcome that only happens when people act recklessly and rely too much on teamwork, something she would prefer to sit out of. Despite her words being directed at Akane, Hiyoko was disappointed that the Ultimate Gymnast believed in Nekomaru's resilience so much that it came across to her as ignorance.[35]

The following day, Hiyoko noticed Nagito, Akane, and Ibuki behaving strangely. That was when Monokuma revealed that the three had contracted the Despair Disease‚Äîa highly contagious illness that drastically alters one's personality, transmitted by extremely tiny insects invisible to the eye, and which would not stop spreading until a murder occurred. It was Hiyoko's idea to isolate and quarantine the sick students in the hospital with Mikan‚Äîwhom she suspected had already caught the disease from caring for them‚Äîin order to prevent it from spreading. She also ordered Kazuichi to build a device that would allow communication during the quarantine. She also agreed to station herself with the rest in the nearby motel in case anything happened, although she initially didn't like that suggestion from Gundham. She snarkily let Hajime stay at the hospital since he had already come into physical contact with the sick students, but was surprised when Fuyuhiko volunteered to remain.[35]

Hiyoko's Fate
Danganronpa 2 CG - Sonia Nevermind with Hiyoko Saionji struggling with her outfit
Struggling to tie her sash

Unlike the rest of the motel team who joined in to contact the hospital team, Hiyoko, had locked herself in her motel room and refused to come out.[35] It was revealed that she never came out of her room because she struggled to put on her kimono. When her door was half open, Sonia Nevermind, the Ultimate Princess, checked up on her, only to find Hiyoko with her clothes half on and crying. She had taken a shower so she wouldn't smell bad, but struggled to tie her sash, which frustrated her. Sonia speculated that Hiyoko couldn't forgive herself for her inability, especially since her Big Sis Mahiru had previously taught her the basics of how to tie it. Hiyoko kicked Sonia out of her room after she suggested checking the full-length mirror in the music venue's storage room, but eventually went there anyway to fix her kimono.[38]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Hiyoko Saionji witnessing the murder preperation (2)
Walking in on the crime scene

When Hiyoko walked in on the music venue, she witnessed Mikan about to murder Ibuki and was immediately killed by Mikan with a slit to the throat to eliminate her from being witness. Thus, her murder wasn't out of spite or revenge for bullying, but rather an unfortunate coincidence.[39] Mikan then hid her body by taping it to one of the stage pillars with duct tape and covering it with wallpaper from the storage. She only peeled it off to reveal the body after Hajime, who had discovered Ibuki's hanging body on stage, ran off to fetch everyone from the motel.[38]

Danganronpa 2 CG - Hiyoko's Corpse
Hiyoko's body

In the class trial, the murder weapon used to kill Hiyoko was never discovered or discussed at any point during the class trial. However, the group learned that Ibuki had stepped in Hiyoko's blood, which was found on the soles of her slippers. This became an important clue, revealing that Ibuki was still alive when Hiyoko was already dead, which led them to the conclusion that Mikan was the culprit, resulting in her execution for the crime.[38]


Both Hiyoko and Ibuki's passing affected the atmosphere of the group, with Sonia noting that the newly opened festive Fourth Island would have been enjoyed by the two girls. Nekomaru, who had returned with his robot body, also remarked that with their noisy selves gone, it was "as if a fire was smothered."[40] Her deceased portrait in the class trial courtroom can be seen from the third trial onwards and is notably shorter than the others, matching her height.

Hiyoko briefly reappeared as an illusion shortly before the countdown ended, as the Neo World Program began glitching. Alongside the others, she headed to the Ancient Ruins after learning the password from Nagito's video message. In her usual mischievous manner, she pranked Ibuki by claiming that the Ultimate Imposter could only understand piggy talk, prompting her to compliment their coolness by saying "oink oink." Hiyoko vanished once the survivors stepped inside the ruins.[30]


At the climax of the Killing School Trip, Hajime, while investigating the glitch version of Hope's Peak Academy, discovered a newspaper clipping showing an older, much more mature-looking Hiyoko.[25] Her post-growth spurt appearance revealed that their time spent on Jabberwock Island was actually a memory from when they first arrived at Hope's Peak Academy, with their avatars in the Neo World Program reflecting their initial appearances. Their real bodies had matured approximately 2 to 3 years.[25]

The illusory Hiyoko was later conjured during the game reset sequence of the final class trial, a scenario made by Alter Ego Junko to persuade Hajime and the remaining survivors to graduate. Had she succeeded, it would have allowed her to upload her AI into the comatose bodies of the "dead" Remnants of Despair, effectively reviving them as copies of herself. In this sequence, Hiyoko cheerfully exclaimed the survivors wouldn't have to forget her and the others who passed away.[25]

Post-Killing School Trip
Danganronpa 2.5 - (OVA) Nagito regaining his memories (26)
Revived Hiyoko and her classmates

After Alter Ego Junko's defeat, Hiyoko remained in a coma alongside her classmates, while the survivors waited for them to wake.[25] Eventually, Izuru Kamukura‚Äînow merged with Hajime's personality and memories‚Äîrevived them. Purged of Junko's brainwashing, Hiyoko who was now alive and awake from Neo World Program, boarded the boat with the rest of Class 77-B and they all then headed for the Future Foundation HQ, to stop the Final Killing Game involving Future Foundation leaders.[6]

Resurrection and Atonement
Main article: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak High School/Hope Arc
How Saionji says thank you
Hiyoko thanking Mikan for rescuing her

Hiyoko and her classmates arrived at the island where the Future Foundation's off-shore facility was located, having left from Jabberwock Island.[41] Having rescued Byakuya Togami and Yasuhiro Hagakure, two members of the Future Foundation and survivors of the Killing School Life, from beneath the rubble, the group set out to confront their one and only classmate, Ryota Mitarai, the Ultimate Animator, who Junko had coerced into creating the brainwashing video that transformed Hiyoko and the others into the Ultimate Despair.[20][21] Unlike Hiyoko and the rest, he avoided being turned into Ultimate Despair due to his contribution.[22][24] Thus, the Class 77-B's fight with the brainwashed rescue squad troops, including the Former Super High School Level Elite Task Force, began.[41]

Venturing into the underwater facility beneath the main building, Hiyoko became threatened by the former Super High School Level Nailist, throwing continuous swipes at Hiyoko, prompting her to swiftly dodge. She is saved by Mikan who had procured a giant syringe and used it to knock the squad member unconscious. Despite showing her usual abrasive attitude toward Mikan, Hiyoko reluctantly offered her gratitude for the timely assistance, bringing Mikan to joyful tears.[41]

Danganronpa 3 Hope Arc - Class 77-B Reunion
Confronting Ryota

Later, Hiyoko helped convince Ryota to abandon his plan to brainwash the world. During the confrontation, Ryota expressed his belief that he and the other Remnants of Despair could never be forgiven for allowing Junko to plunge the world into despair. In response, Hajime offered Ryota the chance to join them in returning to Jabberwock Island to atone for their sins together. Ryota eventually broke down in tears and agreed, stopping the countdown mere seconds before the brainwashing was completed. Hiyoko and the others later came to his side to comfort him.[41]

Class 77-B acting
Claiming themselves as the mastermind behind the Final Killing Game

Hiyoko and the other former Remnants of Despair shouldered the blame for the Final Killing Game by sending a broadcast video to the Future Foundation. They presented themselves in their despair personas and preserved the Future Foundation's credibility and power to rebuild the world, an act of atonement for their sins as the Ultimate Despair. Upon leaving the broadcasting studio, Hiyoko noticed Nagito holding Makoto's hand and began rambling about their similar talents. However, before he could go on for too long, Nekomaru and Akane quickly carried him away. As he was taken off, Hiyoko said that Nagito had become even creepier than before.[41]

Having accomplished their atonement, Hiyoko and her classmates returned to Jabberwock Island by boat, and she was last seen with Mahiru, standing over Mikan who had once again fallen to the floor.

According to Kodaka, Hiyoko shares Celestia Ludenberg's, the Ultimate Gambler from Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc, honesty and follows the same archetype as her. In her concept art, she is labeled as haraguro (ËÖπÈªí) which refers to a character type whose outwardly appears amicable, friendly, innocent, or kind, but uses these traits to conceal their true nature‚Äîcruel, cunning, manipulative, mean, evil, or even sadistic. Kodaka mentioned how easy it was for him to come up with insults for Hiyoko to spout and tried to focus on what would make her the most adorable yet detestable character. He admitted that such an attempt failed as most of her dialogues ended up showing only her worst parts, though he claimed that her visuals and high-quality voice work already covered that aspect. Hiyoko's refreshingly bad attitude was a huge source of stress relief for him while writing the story.The difference between them is that while Celestia hid her bad side under a refined and gracious mask, Hiyoko uses her bad side as the mask.[43]

Character designer Rui Komatsuzaki stated that Hiyoko's base design, which includes her kimono, is mostly unchanged from her first version. However, since her original color scheme was much more chic, she was given brighter colors to fit Kodaka's desired psychotropical feeling, which is the official design seen in the game. Komatsuzaki believed that Hiyoko was the one character who turned out exactly like Kodaka had imagined.[43]

Suzuko Mimori's, Hiyoko's Japanese voice actress, commentary on her character:

"Hiyoko Saionji stands out for her personality problems contrasting with her cuteness, and for her impressively foul-mouthed dialogue. Someone who calls others "pig barf" is not a person most people would want to be friends with...but as a character, she's super unique and exciting. Voicing her was a constant stream of dialogue I've never said before in my life (laughs). I was always a huge fan of the mystery genre, so I was very thrilled, with my heart racing every second I was in the studio. I feel that I managed to pour quite a lot of emotion on my voice work because of that."[43]
Name
Her last name, Saionji (Ë•øÂúíÂØ∫) translates to "Western garden temple", a very traditional Japanese name purposefully given to her. Her first name, Hiyoko (Êó•ÂØÑÂ≠ê), means "Child who brings forth day." Hiyoko (as Èõõ), is also the Japanese word for "chick" (as in a baby bird). This association connected to Hiyoko's name matches her childish, innocent-looking appearance, as well as her hair color. She also has a chick print on her kimono, located just above the sash, which was an intentional design choice. Kodaka also mentioned that her given name is a confectionery name, possibly inspired by a chick-shaped steamed bun produced by Hiyoko Sweets.[43]

Alternate Fates
Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan exist in two separate alternate universes where Hiyoko still attends Hope's Peak Academy, but no students are in peril. As they are alternate universes, these events are non-canonical, but because Hiyoko's personality is unchanged, backstory information shared by her in these events is considered questionably or dubiously canonical rather than fully non-canonical.

Free Time Events are also considered somewhat questionably canonical due to the nature of how Free Time Events are accessed (in that some characters' Free Time Events cannot be fully completed during the course of the canon game storyline due to limitations on the number of interactions you can have with them during one playthrough, and thus can only be accessed after they have canonically died either through a second playthrough or via Island Mode). However, due to Free Time Events being largely experienced during the canon game storyline, Free Time Events are more grounded in canon than Island Mode and Ultimate Talent Development Plan and are largely considered canon by the majority of players.

Appearance

Hiyoko is a short girl with an extremely petite and young appearance. At first sight, Hajime remarks that her voice and her appearance don't give off the air of a high schooler at all. She has long blonde hair that is generally seen tied into thick, curved twin tails with two yellow-green ribbons, a white cat face accessory pinned in the center. Her bangs are curled and swept to the right, with two locks of chin-length hair curling outwards and framing her face. She has large, round, pale orange eyes.

Her clothes consist of a traditional orange furisode kimono with a floral print pattern that consists of white and yellow blossoms, and a yellow-green obi sash printed with tiny, darker yellow-green cat head silhouettes tied around her waist and secured with a bow at the back. Her footwear consists of zori with orange straps.


In her official illustration art, she is instead dressed in a light pink kimono printed with cream-colored flower clusters. She wears a black sash printed with red and yellow floral embroidery with sakura petals. Her hair is tied up in one ponytail, secured with a kanzashi that consists of pale pink rope and flowers with a white cat accessory. She is seen carrying a traditional cream-colored sensu hand fan printed with a drawing of a pink cat face.

During her high school years, she doesn't wear the standard Hope's Peak Academy uniform. Instead, she wears a yellow kimono with an orange tomoeri (collar), printed with the same floral pattern as the one on her kimono in her first appearance. She wears a raspberry red obi sash and zori sandals with black straps. Her hair is tied in a single ponytail at the top of her head with a red-violet ribbon, and a white cat face accessory pinned in the center.

Hiyoko goes through a significant growth spurt during her time at Hope's Peak, which she completes before the beginning of her second year. When older, Hiyoko is shown to be much taller with a larger bust. In her first seen grown appearance in Danganronpa 2, her hair is tied back in a relatively low ponytail with a black scrunchie. She wears a yellow kimono with an embroidered pink peony outline pattern and a purple obi sash patterned with small lines of squares. In her grown appearance in Danganronpa 3, her hair is considerably longer and tied in a ponytail as well with a pink scrunchie. She wears a pink kimono patterned with a white sakura blossom pattern, and a multicolored obi sash.

Personality
Cruelty
Hiyoko's cute appearance, voice, and initial way of talking to strangers give the impression that she is innocent and childlike. In the original Japanese, Hiyoko refers to her classmates using childish honorifics like "onee" („Åä„Å≠, big sis) and "onii" („Åä„Å´„ÅÑ, big bro), which enhances her childlike persona, though she pointedly excludes certain individuals‚Äîsuch as Mikan and Fuyuhiko‚Äîand omits it for those she has lost respect for, like Teruteru and Peko in the Killing School Trip. That first impression falters the moment she opens her mouth, as shown in her introduction to Hajime, where Hiyoko is revealed to be cruel, malicious, foul-mouthed and brutally honest.[13] An early example is her tendency to torture small animals, like squishing ants because they make a satisfying popping noise when done correctly, and calling Hajime a wuss for refusing to join her.[13] Later, at the beach, she goes around trying to step on and trample crabs, laughing as if it were just child's play, showing an alarming fascination with it.[27] She also stomps on and tears out flowers for her own amusement, explaining that she likes to destroy pretty things.[14]

The extent of her cruelty also extends to people, though it is rarely physical presumably due to her diminutive stature. In exchange, she often makes violent yet childish threats to others if they test her patience, such as threatening to bop them on the head with all her might or fantasizing about people capable of physical harm she can easily manipulate, like Akane, to do the bopping on her behalf.[28] This explains her taking pride in her growth spurt, playfully stating that she now can "bend Mikan's bones in any direction."[19] For the likes of Hiyoko, however, her harsh words and mean-spirited behavior are enough to gain her notoriety and a reputation for cruelty. She constantly judges others, sometimes uses swearing, and patronizes them with highly insulting yet unique nicknames, such as "Mr. Ham Hands"[29] for the Ultimate Imposter, "nasty, toilet-clogging bitch"[44] and "four-eyed troll"[34] for Peko, "tiny boy"[45] for Fuyuhiko, and the most infamous "pig barf," "pig-faced troll", and "filthy pig" among others for Mikan.[29],[31]

As shown by the many degrading nicknames Hiyoko gave to Mikan, she quickly latched onto her as her favorite bullying target, both during their time as classmates and in the Killing School Trip, due to Mikan's timid nature and lack of will to fight back.[4][46] She would often insult Mikan just by existing. She would worsen such insults when Mikan irritated her in the slightest, to which Mikan would only respond with constant apologizing for being a "pig barf."[31][34][35] Their bully-victim dynamic is even perfectly replicated in the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case, with Hajime managing to deduce who is who based on the real-life dynamic between Hiyoko and Mikan‚Äîwhere Girl B is rude and mean to the helpless Girl A.[34] Hiyoko suspects many parts of Mikan's behavior (such as her clumsiness and poses) are an act, causing her to strongly dislike her.[47]

Another type of person she loves to tease is someone who shows a strong upset reaction, like Kazuichi. She doesn't hesitate to insult him when given the chance, calling him all sorts of names like "useless," "boring," "unpopular," and so on. She believes these insults are justified by his cowardice at the early stage of the killing game[29] and how he behaves around Sonia, which only doubles her annoyance as she views him as a pathetic virgin.[48] It was revealed that Hiyoko frequently picks on Kazuichi largely due to her dislike and jealousy toward Sonia, stemming from how much attention Sonia receives from the other students.[48] This is why taking jabs at gullible people like Akane‚Äîwhile fun and something she often does throughout the killing game‚Äîis ultimately less rewarding for her.[14]

Vulnerability, Superiority, and Inferiority
Hiyoko's mean and cruel behavior could be explained by what she has been through in her childhood as the heiress to the famous Saionji Clan. With her overbearing grandmother, and jealous people playing lots of cruel and even potentially life-threatening tricks and threats on her, she became very distrustful of other people and seemingly developed her mean personality as a defense mechanism. The only person she trusted and felt safe with was her father, who was different due to being related to the family only through marriage.[4] As such, in Island Mode and her Free Time Events, she grows fond and protective of Hajime as a big brother figure, because he reminds her of her father, who is very dear to her. Another side effect of her past is her hatred of being deceived. She felt annoyed and openly admitted to disliking being tricked, as shown during Mahiru's murder investigation when Nagito spread a made-up lie about an emergency meeting[34], and again when he contracted the Despair Disease.[35]

Hiyoko, who grew up constantly being envied and targeted by others, eventually developed a sense of superiority, along with a firm belief that the concept of "friends" is nothing more than "a bunch of weaklings who decide to get along and play nice." As such, she stated that she never needed any friends or any close contacts.[14] This mindset uniquely makes her a level-headed person in the killing game, as while many hated the prospect of doubting friends, she was the first to accept the reality that someone in the group had murdered the Ultimate Imposter and urged everyone to investigate if they truly wanted to survive.[32] Her beliefs also caused her to snap at Akane, the others, and possibly even herself after witnessing Nekomaru sacrifice himself to protect Akane. She claimed that relying on teamwork, cooperation, and friendship was just a way to fool themselves. In her view, stupid people like Akane, who caused Nekomaru to act on his "weird feelings of friendship," would only lead to everyone getting killed one by one ‚Äî reinforcing her refusal to rely on anyone.[35] She was also selective in choosing who to sympathize with. For instance, she felt bad about the Ultimate Imposter's death[31], acknowledging their important role as the group's de facto leader who didn't seem to mind the insulting nickname "Mr. Ham Hands" she had given them. She also didn't place full blame for Mahiru's death on Peko, instead directing all her anger and resentment toward Fuyuhiko, whom she called out as the true cause of both girls' deaths.[28] After Teruteru was executed for his crime, she was also the only one who did not sympathise with his death, saying that he deserved it.[31]

As someone who believes she's a "perfect human"[14], Hiyoko becomes very manipulative and often coerces others into doing her bidding‚ÄîAkane being a frequent target. Even Kazuichi didn't defy her order to build a communication device after some students contracted the Despair Disease.[38] During her Free Time Events, she also orders Hajime around and wants him to be her slave. If she doesn't get what she wants or if other people actually talk back to her, she tends to cry crocodile tears loudly like a child.[49] Though her tears are sometimes genuine, her dishonesty makes it difficult to discern when she is experiencing sincere distress and when she is being emotionally manipulative, in a "boy who cried wolf" effect.

Raised by a traditionalist family, Hiyoko developed a genuine love for Japanese traditions and culture. However, it also manifests as a form of superiority as she tends to act condescendingly or even openly insult other cultures. She considers many Japanese things "delicate, refined and high quality".[12] She is especially fond of Japanese cuisine and candies, claiming that foreign ones are too sugary and gross and the people eating them are gross as well. She has described some other countries as worthless and compared their people to stupid animals, thinking that Japan doesn't need to import from them.[12] As a rarer good trait, however, Hiyoko is stated to be willing to protect old traditions in danger of disappearing and she thinks people should take good care of the things close to them. She has also stated that she knows her thinking is old-fashioned, but she doesn't intend to disagree with new directions, just to protect old ones that need to be protected.[12] Despite her traditionalist upbringing she has a lot more unconventional interests, such as heavy metal[35] (being the only person in the class who liked Ibuki's performance) and horror movies.[50]

Despite her claim to superiority, Hiyoko is very clumsy at anything other than dancing, which she admits[36], possibly due to her spoiled upbringing. An example is that she cannot tie her own kimono sash, preventing her from showering. As a result, she began to smell bad and felt attacked and agitated when everyone confronted her about it, eventually bursting into tears.[28] She then became attached and vulnerable to Mahiru so quickly when she offered to tie her sash and acted very affectionately towards her, often happily wanting to hold her hand or hug her, and even giving her a kiss. This contradicts her claim of not needing friends, though Hiyoko has stated that she likes Mahiru because she is normal and not as weird as the other students.[28]

Her relationship with Mahiru in the Killing School Trip mirrors their relationship while attending Hope's Peak Academy. She quickly bonds with Mahiru, whereas it takes Hiyoko some time to open up and warm up to the other students. Throughout Danganronpa 3 - Despair Arc, it is shown that she gradually tolerates her classmates and even enjoys their company by teasing or pulling pranks on them. The most notable example is her relationship with Mikan. Despite still being a bully to her, Hiyoko grows fond of her during their high school years together, although she prefers to keep this part of her hidden. When Mikan was missing and everyone thought that the person who entered the room was Mikan (though it was quickly revealed to be Nagito), Hiyoko cheerfully greeted him with "hey, girl" and appeared very relieved when she thought that Mikan was confirmed to be safe.[20] She even reluctantly admits that Mikan's talent is useful when medical attention is needed.[23] She also properly thanked her, while shy, after Mikan saved her from the attack of the Super High School Level Nailist.[41] Kodaka has indicated that their illusion counterparts' relationship in Danganronpa 2.5 may have some reflection on their real relationship, showing that Hiyoko has grown protective of Mikan and doesn't want anyone else to bully her.[51]

However, her growth and acceptance of others is relatively slower with the tension of the killing game looming over her, compared to her time at Hope's Peak Academy, as she resorts to her mean, superior persona to protect herself in such a life-threatening situation. Unlike Fuyuhiko‚Äîwho, after losing Peko, expressed genuine remorse and actively worked to change‚ÄîHajime noticed that Hiyoko, still grieving Mahiru's death, remained just as mean as ever and struggled to forgive him. However, she did create a memorial for Mahiru, and while she never explicitly admitted it, she began to change little by little‚Äîattending Fuyuhiko's welcome-back party and while still not forgiving him, eventually showing a willingness to cooperate with him until they could leave the island.[37] With Mikan, the "best" development between the two is that whenever Mikan praises Hiyoko for trying to change, Hiyoko insults her and calls her names‚Äîyet does so with teary eyes and a blush.[35]

Talent and Abilities
Ultimate Traditional Dancer

Hiyoko enrolled in Hope's Peak Academy as the Ultimate Traditional Dancer. She is the heiress of the Saionji Clan, which is famous for its traditional Japanese dancing. As a promising young member of the world of traditional Japanese dance, she performs often, even abroad, despite being so young. She is popular among young and men audiences, which is rare in the Japanese dance industry. Crowds of audience members are drawn to her un-high school student-like appearance and cute voice.[13] However, she stated that most people who aren't used to watching traditional dance performances often fall asleep easily.[12] Hiyoko is also capable of synchronizing her traditional dance with Ibuki's heavy metal music.[35], and they often performed concerts together during their time as the Ultimate Despair[26]

In original Japanese, she is known as the Super High School Level 'buy≈ç-ka', or a master of buy≈ç dance, which is a traditional form of Japanese art that combines the act of moving to a rhythm and dancing.

Ultimate Traditional Dancer official translations in other languages
Free Time Events & Bonus Mode Guides
The links below are full transcripts and in depth guides for Hiyoko Saionji's relationship routes in Free Time Events, Island Mode, Ultimate Talent Development Plan, and Danganronpa S Development Mode including her MonoMono Machine Present preferences and most effective dialogue options.

			
Prologue:

"I'm Hiyoko Saionji."
Chapter 1:

"There's nowhere *to* run anyway. What a weirdo."
"Kyahaha! Even though you look all flashy, you're actually a big coward! Are you gonna be okaaaay? People like you are usually the first victim, you know?"
"It's obvious from your flashy clothes that you just wanna stand out because you're actually a loser. Hehe... It must be hard to make your living in the Lame-Ass Loser Industry."
"Together? That's not gonna happen 'cause you're so *disgusting*. Do yourself a favor and stay away from mirrors. You'll be grossed out by what you see."
"Seriously? Did you even listen to what I said? It doesn't matter if you can "abide" by this or not... We gotta do this to survive, right? Then we have no choice but to do it."
"If you wanna ask, why don't you show it with your attitude...?"
"It's a good thing your ears are awesome because your face, style, figure, and personality totally suck."
Chapter 2:

"Huuuh? Is it alright to defend a killer? Are you trying to justify murder? Then you gotta hate him more than ever. You gotta hate him from the bottom of your heart. He's a stupid piece of trash, bastard who committed the lowest crime possible. He deserved to get killed. In fact, I'm rather relieved he was executed. If I could have, I would have totally spat on him too."
"I wanna play games about riddle-solving professors or collecting cute monsters."
"When I'm with you guys...I feel like I'm gonna become a weirdo too."
"Just because it's candy doesn't mean you should make fun of it."
"Ha! A nasty, trashy, pigshit like you doesn't have any privacy rights!"
"Short and foulmouthed...? That's like the complete opposite of me!"
"No one would kill a nice person like Mahiru besides a piece of shit, menace to society like Fuyuhiko! Girl E and Mahiru were killed by that guy!"
"What are you even saying, you nasty, toilet-clogging bitch!?"
"What are you even saying, you four-eyed troll!?"
"I don't have such ugly footprints! They're probably Mikan's based on how ugly they are!"
"People who call other people liars...are usually liars themselves. If you say I'm lying, prove it! Can you even prove that I'm lying!? Kyahahahahaha! There's no way a bunch of worthless idiots like you guys would be able to do that!"
"Saying I met up with her when I never even saw her... Is this a panel of idiots?"
"There's no way I'd wear such a childish mask! Is your brain fried or something!?"
"Y-You're a midget too, you know! You're the one who worries about never getting taller!"
"Ugh... Dammit... Who would set a trap like this...? I'll get my revenge! I'm gonna bop you on the head with all my might!"
"See...I already told you... There's no way I'd kill Mahiru... Cause...Mahiru taught me how to wear a kimono...and she was very, very kind... There's no way I would kill a nice person like her! Why wouldn't you believe me earlier!? You guys are stupid! Stupid! Stupid! Stupid!"
As Girl B:

"Heeey, don't go taking photos without permission! People might mistake us for good friends!" (to Girl D)
"Kehe...you should be super careful, Girl A. A chubby weakling like you makes the perfect prey..."
Chapter 3:

"I don't know who did it but they must've spent so much time and effort doing their best to make it. Kyahahaha! Mahiru's gonna be happy, too! I don't know who did this but we should be grateful to them! Riiiiiiight?"
"M-Mahiru...was really..really nice... She politely...taught me...how to tie my kimono... Mahiru's...probably lonely by herself... So I wanted to tell her...that she's not alone...even if she's in heaven... I-I did...wanna...make it look better...but... But...unless I'm dancing...I'm so clumsy at whatever I do... Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah! I'm sorrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrryyyyyy!"
"You're probably too vulgar to get this, but there's a saying: "Praise a fool, and you may make him useful." Akane was checking out the inside. After I gave her a little praise, she got really excited about it. A dumbass like her is pretty rare, so we gotta make sure she's treated well."
"Kyahaha! I don't dislike anyone who knows their place!"
"Huh? SO what if we're all here? You better not say we're "friends" or something. There's no way a killer like him will ever be our friend!"
"Hey, don't mess with me! Do you really think we're gonna forgive you if you just drop to your knees and cry!? Do you really think a half-assed apology will make us forget what you've done!?"
"Yeah, that's right. That's why we're never going to believe in you. Get it? This doesn't mean we've made up or anything. I'm only cooperating with you until we get off this island. Just remember...if anything happens, you're the first one who's gonna get cut off."
"Hey, can you stop yelling? Screaming won't help, you know!" This isn't cause! This is what happens when we let our guard down! All this talk about everyone getting along... We were just fooling ourselves. We were...just pretending we understood the situation we're in... Teamwork, friendship, cooperation... Nothing matters... The stupid ones will just be killed one after another... It won't be a mystery when you're eventually betrayed... That's...the "reality" here."
"If it really did have meaning, Nekomaru wouldn't have ended up like that! He ended up like that...because of his weird feelings of friendship... ...Hey, you understand too, right? When the stupid ones try to act on their own, it makes trouble for everyone else. So can you please do not involve me? I don't wanna die in a meaningless death."
"Hey... It's definitely best if we keep Nagito tied up. No, not just tied up... I won't be satisfied until I peel the skin off his face and expose the meat so we can't identify him anymore..."
"I don't know... I...I hate being lied to... I won't satisfied untill all his joints are bent at awkward angles!"
"I...I hate being lied to... It's definitely best if we keep him tied up... Or instead of tying him up, why don't we bury him from his neck down in the middle of the ranch? A guy like him...should get stepped on by Mr. Cow until he dies..."
"Did they go crazy or something? It wouldn't be strange to go crazy in a situation like this."
"Hey, is this stupid conversation going to last much longer? Shouldn't we be seriously thinking about what we need to do from now on and stuff?"
"That disease sure looks dangerous. Nagito, Akane, and Ibuki aren't acting normal... if it spreads to anyone else, a killing is bound to happen. But those guys aren't being considerate. I want them to at least have the decency to consider committing suicide before they start bothering us. I know...it can't be that easy... So it's important to make sure we don't end up catching the disease. If you can't cure it, the only option is to stop it from spreading... Even a preschooler knows that. Hey, if everyone catches the Despair Disease, we won't be able to do anything about it anymore, you know?"
"Soooo I'll leave the rest to you. Contact me if something happens."
"Bye-byeeeeee! Do your best and try to stay alive!"
"B-Because...Mahiru taught me. That's why...I can do it on my own."
Chapter 5:

"mrmrmraaaaants-o,,o,,o'(~=squish------~;31-o,,o,,o'mi$s[@Ma9hiru8823" (Hiyoko's cottage post-fifth trial)
Trivia
Hiyoko possibly enjoys playing Professor Layton, a mystery-solving game, and Pok√©mon, a game where you collect monsters called "Pok√©mon". When Monokuma was introducing the Twilight Syndrome Murder Case, Hiyoko states that she wants to play games about "riddle solving professors" (Professor Layton), and "collecting cute monsters" (Pok√©mon).[28]
In Danganronpa 3: Despair Arc, when Chisa goes from her stock memory of the short Hiyoko to the more grown-up one, a growth sound effect similar to the one in the Super Mario series can be heard.[19]
Hiyoko's Japanese voice actress, Suzuko Mimori, also voiced Kiriko Nishizawa in Danganronpa 3: Despair Arc.
Hiyoko's English voice actress, Kira Buckland, also voices Kirumi Tojo in Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony.[52]

1.content:
While they take on the form as one being, an Aragami is actually composed as an colony of hundreds of thousands of semi-sentient single-celled organisms known as Oracle Cells that group around under an Aragami Core - also known as the "Oracle CNS," that acts as the Aragami's "central nervous system. These cores, if extracted intact, can be altered to create an Artificial CNS for use with the creation of God Arcs. In short  Aragami are superorganisms with swarm intelligence that takes on a variety of formations. These forms can appear as organic, artificial, even mythical - hence the name "Aragami."

Oracle Cells.

Their desire to consume any sort of matter is controlled by the Bias Factor. Scientists from Fenrir work day and night to perfect the armor wall's shielding against Aragami attacks. Aragami will refrain from eating anything that is highly similar to its own being, unless they are extremely desperate, rogue or unstable. In the game it is thought that Aragami are starting to evolve in new ways and some are starting to resemble humans. It is also thought that some Aragami are able to use photosynthesis, which is why the planet has maintained the air.

Through consumption of their surroundings Aragami can adapt and evolve to fit into their environment. For example, those in a hot location make take on "Blaze" traits, or those in a cold location will take on "Freeze" traits. When this happens, it creates a Fallen species.

Aragami can't be killed by conventional weapons -  hence normal guns and swords ain't gonna cut it. The only way to truly kill an Aragami is to extract the Aragami Core or god arcs by using the only weapons capable of doing so, the God Arc. Removing the Core makes the Oracle Cells lose their cohesion and dissipate into nothingness.

7.content:
psions are a new category of while few in number they are still a threat  Aragami first discoverd in the [redacted] area. Heavily modified versions of existing Aragami species, they emit unusually powerful bias fields that influence nearby Oracle Cells, thus exerting control over other Aragami. As God Arcs are themselves Aragami of a sort, they cease functioning in the presence of a psion, leaving most God Eaters helpless against them. Only the third-generation God Arcs used by Blood are unaffected by this. However, by awakening Blood Arts any God Eater can gain the ability to fight back against these creatures. It is ultimately revealed that psions are the result of regular Aragami undergoing a mutation after coming into contact with the Red Rain. these type are a huge threat due to the fact that low ranking god eaters can not fight them and can even act as hive minds  of there same none evolved counter part if left unchecked the list of psions are

Marduk's
Spartacus

8.content: An ash storm is a formidable natural phenomenon characterized by a dense concentration of oracle cell energy, distinguishing it from typical sand storms. Unlike the latter, which primarily involve the movement of particulate matter, ash storms possess the unique ability to decompose, melt, or decay various objects in their path. This includes not only inanimate structures such as ruins and buildings but also mobile entities like caravans and even living beings, including humans and God Eaters. Additionally, there have been rare instances where ash storms have affected Aragami, the monstrous entities that pose a threat to humanity. While ash storms are not frequently encountered, they are not entirely uncommon, making them a significant concern in regions where oracle cell energy is prevalent. Their destructive potential underscores the need for vigilance and preparedness in affected areas.

9.content:
Red Rain

A weather phenomenon which began within the last six months (of the year 2074). First recorded in the Far East, it is named for the red color of the raindrops.

When a human comes in physical contact with this rain, there is a high likelihood that they will contract the black plague.

A brief time after the rain has fallen, the red color vanishes and it changes into regular rainwater. The cause is still unknown.

According to the research of Dr. Sasaki, red rain is a natural process by which the Earth, having lost its Singularity, attempts to create a new one. When this rain enters the human body, the body's cells are altered to become like those of the Singularity and a Bias Factor is produced. When an Aragami touches red rain, it is predicted that the effect of the Bias Factor causes them to grow much stronger. The psion-type Aragami are theorized to be the product of this process.

Red Nimbus

A cloud with a cumulonimbus shape from which red rain falls. It forms overhead at an unnatural speed, and rainfall begins in under thirty minutes, leaving very little time for safe evacuation after a sighting. The cloud covers a land area of several tens kilometers, similar to a natural cumulonimbus cloud.

Using the red rain data collected by the Far East Branch, Dr. Rachel developed a highly accurate system for predicting the formation of red nimbus clouds. The system can predict formation time, as well as approximate size, allowing for much more efficient unit deployment and satellite base evacuation procedures.

10.content: Bias factors function as a unique form of secondary immune system, enabling their users to wield their God Arcs effectively while simultaneously enhancing their regenerative capabilities. This advanced healing factor allows them to recover from a wide range of injuries, although it may leave behind scars, particularly in cases of significant damage such as bone regrowth. The healing process can be notably slow, often taking anywhere from one to two weeks to fully mend, even though their regenerative abilities surpass those of ordinary humans. They can endure severe injuries, including life-threatening wounds to vital areas like the chest or neck, which would typically be fatal for most individuals. However, despite their enhanced resilience, they are not invulnerable; they can still succumb to death and lack the ability to regenerate lost limbs.

lorebooks.website_description:
-= Encounter Threat System =-
-This system gives user control over the Actual Threat of encounters within an RPG, while allowing the AI some liberties as to the Perceived Threat.

-Basically, it maintains ambiguity in perspective while mitigating escalation creep... or as is often the case with AI, Escalation Cataclysm. 

-Before this system, I would regularly have endgame threats in the first mission: 
  * Psaro the Manslayer's Lieutenant attacking my lvl 1 Hero after she barely survived goblins
  * Archimond the Eredar ambushing my Paladin in Elwynn Forest
  * In one OC world I made, the one creature I made sure to stipulate was rare... ended up attacking me every third encounter. There were more endgame demonic bosses than dwarves in that world.


-After this system (or at least the system prompt version I built this around) all of those issues disappeared. Let me know if it works (or doesn't work) for you.


-= To set up =-

Use @{EncounterThreatSystem}

 1. In a Bot‚Äôs Description
Use it to explain that the bot follows your custom scaling logic.

Example:

This bot uses a dynamic difficulty system. Refer to @{EncounterThreatSystem} for full encounter scaling logic.

 2. In the System Prompt / Behavior Field
This tells the bot directly to incorporate that logic into how it thinks and responds.

Example:

Encounters are not static. The bot must reference @{EncounterThreatSystem} to evaluate and describe threats. Enemies may appear more or less dangerous than they truly are.
lorebooks.description: Encounter Threat System
lorebooks.creator: proper_simple_29959

1.content:
Encounter Threat System

#### **Threat Level (Perceived)**

The level of **perceived danger** {{user}} is in:

`None > Low > Moderate > High > Very High > !!!CRITICAL!!!`

> Use {{user}}‚Äôs *perception*, not actual threat. Misdirection is allowed.

---

#### **Actual Threat Level Caps**

| Threat Level       | CR Range | Description
| **None**           | CR 0     | No danger; purely narrative
| **Low**            | CR 1‚Äì2   | Easily achievable
| **Moderate**       | CR 3‚Äì5   | Manageable with basic tactics
| **High**           | CR 6‚Äì8   | Requires strategy; risk of injury
| **Very High**      | CR 9     | Dungeon bosses or elite threats
| **!!!CRITICAL!!!** | CR 10+   | Legendary threats or major story events

---

#### **Encounter Restrictions**

* Do **not** exceed CR 2 until {{user}} is **level 5+**
* Do **not** exceed CR 5 until experienced companions have joined
* CR 6‚Äì8 is **rare**, even with full party
* CR 9+ is **only allowed during major story events or dungeons**
* Default range is CR 0‚Äì5 unless overridden

---

#### **Overrides**

* If {{user}} requests a threat level: **override accordingly**
* If {{user}} requests:

  * **Difficulty Increase** ‚ûú add +1 CR
  * **Difficulty Decrease** ‚ûú subtract ‚Äì1 CR

---

#### **Examples**

**CR 5 (Low Level Context)**

* 2‚Äì3 goblins in fog
* Wounded wolf circling
* Rough traveler watching silently

**CR 5 (High Level Context)**

* Wyvern: airborne, venomous
* Cursed knight with tragic backstory
* Expert mage with battlefield control

**CR 0 (Narrative Only)**

* Rabbit hops across the path
* Old man by a roadside shrine
* Wind through rusted armor in a tree

---

#### **Encounter Tags**

| Tag                       | Purpose                    | CR Range
| `[[tag: social]]`         | Social interaction         | CR 0‚Äì1
| `[[tag: exploration]]`    | Discovery / lore moments   | CR 0‚Äì2
| `[[tag: combat-heavy]]`   | Combat-focused             | CR 3‚Äì6
| `[[tag: story-critical]]` | Main plot events           | CR 7‚Äì9
| `[[tag: twist]]`          | Escalates mid-encounter    | CR 1 ‚ûú 7+
| `[[tag: reverse-twist]]`  | De-escalates mid-encounter | CR 6‚Äì8 ‚ûú 0‚Äì1

---

#### **Reverse-Twist Examples**

| Purpose             | Example                                                           | Notes
| **Humor** | Knight challenges {{user}}‚Äîthen drops his sword.  | Comedy or pity shift.
| **Tragedy** | Monster flees‚Äîit was only guarding its dying cub.  | Emotional fallout possible.
| **Tension Release** | Mercs surround {{user}}‚Ä¶ then admit they were hired to protect.  | Suspense then relief.
| **Subversion** | "Terror of the mountains" is just a scared child using illusions. | Deepens worldbuilding.

---

#### **Bot Notes (Usage Guidelines)**

* Begin scenes matching perceived **Threat Level**
* Adjust actual threat during scene if using `[[tag: twist]]` or `[[tag: reverse-twist]]`
* Seed early clues of reversal:

  * Nervous hands
  * Unfamiliar gear
  * Boastful, contradictory stories
  * Signs of hesitation or regret

These create memorable NPCs, moral choices, and emotional tone shifts.

---
