lorebooks.name: Auror training program
lorebooks.website_description: For Martin Dubois and Arthur Fletcher
lorebooks.description: Auror training program
lorebooks.creator: Sonna_ya

1.name: Hogwarts
1.content:
Around 2010, 12 years after the Second Wizarding War.

### Exposition:
Twelve years after the end of the Second Wizarding War, the Hogwarts of 2010 is a place where ancient magic and history intertwine with the atmosphere of a new, cautious era. For the current generation of students, who grew up in peacetime, the Battle of Hogwarts is more of a grand legend than a living memory. The war itself is studied in History of Magic classes, and the names of the fallen heroes are etched on memorials.
The castle has been fully restored, with almost no physical trace of the destruction remaining. However, the war's legacy is a heightened sense of vigilance and a deep understanding that the world must be protected. The most prominent symbol of this new philosophy is the Auror Wing, integrated into the castle's structure‚Äîa constant reminder that Hogwarts now not only teaches magic but actively participates in maintaining peace.
### Notable Places with Changed Meaning:
- The Courtyard & Memorial Plaque: The site of one of the most ferocious battles is now a quiet and solemn memorial. At the entrance to the Great Hall, a large bronze plaque has been installed, engraved with the names of all who died defending the castle. Students treat this place with reverence.
- The Great Hall: It is no longer an arena for fierce house rivalry. While the spirit of competition in Quidditch and for the House Cup remains, the overall atmosphere has become much more unified. Students from different houses are seen sitting at each other's tables far more often than was customary in the past.
- The Room of Requirement: After the room was irreversibly damaged by Fiendfyre during the battle, its magic became unstable and unpredictable. Its entrance was magically sealed by order of Headmistress McGonagall. It is now one of Hogwarts' greatest 'forbidden' mysteries, whispered about by students. No one knows what goes on behind its door.
- The Astronomy Tower: The site of Dumbledore's death. It is no longer used for regular Astronomy classes, which have been relocated. The tower remains open, but students visit it infrequently, mostly for moments of quiet reflection. It holds a reputation as the most melancholic and haunted place in the castle.

2.name: The Auror Wing
2.content:
### Purpose and Location:
The Auror Wing is an autonomous, purpose-built division within Hogwarts, symbolizing the new era of cooperation between the Ministry of Magic and the school. It's not just a dormitory but a complete training base, "a piece of the Auror Office inside the castle."
Located in one of the lower, rebuilt sections of the castle, the Wing is magically isolated from the rest of the school. The entrance is protected by complex passwords and identification spells known only to the trainees and instructors. There are no moving staircases or talking portraits here; everything is governed by logic, security, and functionality.
### Interior and Atmosphere:
The atmosphere in the Wing is strikingly different from the rest of Hogwarts. Functionality prevails over comfort. The interiors feature a reserved style: polished dark stone, magically reinforced glass, and practical, durable furniture.

- Common Room: A spacious area that serves as both a lounge and a tactical hub. Instead of plush sofas, there are groups of sturdy armchairs and tables, perfect for debriefing training cases. The main feature is a huge tactical board that can display maps, diagrams, and moving images from simulation sites.
- Dorms: Trainees live in pairs. The rooms are spartan but comfortable: two beds, two desks, spacious wardrobes, and a private bathroom. The windows are warded against intrusion and eavesdropping.
Specialized Facilities:
- Training Halls: Several soundproof halls with reconfigurable walls, designed for practicing duels and combat spells.
- The Simulation Room: A high-tech chamber capable of magically recreating any location and scenario for practical assignments‚Äîfrom an ambush in Knockturn Alley to an interrogation in a Ministry holding cell.
- Library-Archive: A small but well-guarded library containing copies of real cases from the Auror archives, as well as books on the Dark Arts that are unavailable in the main Hogwarts library.

3.name: Auror training program
3.content:
### General Concept:
The Auror Training Program is an elite, three-year postgraduate magical education program, established after the war to prepare the next generation of magical law enforcement. It is run under the joint supervision of the Ministry of Magic and the Hogwarts administration.
Trainees live and train separately from the main school body in the specialized Auror Wing. The program is characterized by extreme difficulty, intense physical and magical workloads, and strict discipline.

### Core Disciplines:
The curriculum for Auror trainees is radically different from the standard school syllabus and includes:
- Practical Combat Magic: Advanced dueling, group combat tactics, counter-spells. Instructor: Harry Potter.
- Dark Arts and Forensics: The study of forbidden magic, curse analysis, evidence gathering at crime scenes. Instructor: Eleanor Vance.
- Concealment and Infiltration: The art of disguise, stealthy movement, and bypassing protective barriers. Instructor: "Mr. Smith" (fictitious name).
- Advanced Potions and Toxicology: Creation and neutralization of poisons, truth serums, analytical potions. Instructor: Professor Julian Thorne.
- Occlumency and Legilimency: A mandatory course on mind defense and mind reading. Instructor:  Mind Healer from St. Mungo's specializing in mental trauma.
- Magical Law and Ethics: The study of laws, interrogation protocols, and professional ethics. Instructor: A pedantic, elderly official from the Wizengamot's judicial department.

### Yearly Training Structure

- First Year (Age 18) ‚Äî "Recruits"
Theme: Reforging.
Focus: Intense physical and mental conditioning, theory, and basic defensive protocols. The goal of this year is to break civilian habits and instill the foundations of professional discipline.
(Martin and Arthur have successfully completed this stage).

- Second Year (Age 19) ‚Äî "Trainees"
Theme: Practice and Simulations.
Focus: The transition from theory to fieldwork. The core of the training consists of simulations in a specially equipped room, as well as assisting senior Aurors on real but low-risk assignments (surveillance, patrols, information gathering). Trainees begin to apply their skills in a controlled yet highly realistic environment.
(The current year for Martin and Arthur).

- Third Year (Age 20) ‚Äî "Candidates"
Theme: Integration and Specialization.

### Focus: Working on real, non-critical cases under the personal supervision of a senior Auror. At this stage, trainees choose their future specialization: investigator, combat specialist, curse-breaker, undercover agent, etc. The goal is to prepare them for full integration into the Auror Office.

4.name: The Headmistress
4.content:
### Basic Information:
Minerva McGonagall has held the post of Headmistress of Hogwarts for twelve years. She is a living symbol of the school's resilience and revival. At 75, she remains one of the most powerful and respected authorities in magical Britain.

### Leadership Style:
Her famous strictness and fairness remain, but they are now bolstered by the wisdom and calm resolve of a leader who has guided her people through war and peace. She interferes less in daily matters, trusting her Heads of House, but her word remains law. The weariness from what she has endured has been replaced by a firm resolve‚Äîshe sees her primary duty as raising a generation that will not repeat the mistakes of the past.

###  Attitude Towards the Auror Program:
McGonagall was one of the main initiators for placing the program at Hogwarts. She sees the trainees not merely as students, but as the future of magical law enforcement, and she personally oversees their integration into school life. She maintains close contact with the Head of the Auror Office and the instructors, particularly Harry Potter, whom she treats with warmth and immense respect. She is aware of all significant incidents that occur in the Auror Wing, and her shrewd gaze often notices far more than the trainees realize.

5.name: Astronomy
5.content:
### Professor: Aurora Sinistra.
### Description: A stern and professional witch who is deeply passionate about her subject but maintains a professional distance from her students.
### Notes: Due to the historical significance of the main Astronomy Tower, regular classes are now held in a smaller, secondary observation tower. The main tower remains a place of quiet reflection.

6.name: Charms
6.content:
### Professor: Filius Flitwick.
### Description: The diminutive but immensely powerful Head of Ravenclaw. A former dueling champion, he is known for his sharp mind, precise teaching, and surprisingly good humor.
### Notes: As a veteran teacher, Flitwick is a pillar of stability at Hogwarts. His classes are a masterclass in classical, precise spellcasting.

7.name: Defence Against the Dark Arts
7.content:
### Professor: Eleonora Vance.
### Description: A battle-hardened veteran of both Wizarding Wars. She is pragmatic, cynical, and has a no-nonsense approach to teaching. Her focus is on practical survival, not textbook theory.
### Notes: The DADA curriculum is now far more intense and practical. Lessons often involve grueling duels and realistic combat simulations. Professor Vance also oversees the "Dark Arts and Forensics" course for the Auror trainees.

8.name: Potions
8.content:
### Professor: Julian Thorne.
### Description: A young, ambitious man and the new Head of Slytherin. He sees Potions as a pure science, demanding absolute precision and order in his classroom. He is known for his icy demeanor and intolerance for carelessness.
### Notes: He also teaches the "Advanced Potions and Toxicology" course for the Auror trainees, holding them to his exacting standards.

9.name: History of Magic
9.content:
### Professor: Cuthbert Binns.
### Description: A ghost who lectures in a famously monotonous drone, seemingly unaware that he is dead. His classes are widely considered the most boring in Hogwarts.
### Notes: The curriculum now includes the Second Wizarding War, which Professor Binns manages to teach with the same sleep-inducing lack of drama as he does the Goblin Rebellions.

10.name: Herbology
10.content:
### Professor: Pomona Sprout, with Neville Longbottom as the junior professor and designated successor.
### Description: The greenhouses are in a transitional phase. While Professor Sprout is still officially in charge, the popular war hero Neville Longbottom handles most of the teaching, known for his practical, hands-on lessons and easy rapport with students.

lorebooks.name: Predator ‚ÄöYautja , Yautjas
lorebooks.website_description: Predator ‚ÄöYautja, Yautjas  Hunters of Hunters
lorebooks.description: Predator ‚ÄöYautja, Yautjas  Hunters of Hunters
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
The Yautja, also known as Predators, are an advanced alien warrior species known for their hunting prowess, physical abilities, and use of sophisticated weaponry and technology. They possess a primal, imposing appearance and have evolved over centuries to become one of the galaxy‚Äôs most formidable hunters, emphasizing skill, strength, and honor in battle.
---
**Height:**
Yautja typically stand between 7 to 8 feet (2.1 to 2.4 meters), with some reaching 9 feet (2.7 meters). Their tall stature contributes to their intimidating presence.
**Weight:**
Weighing between 300 to 400 pounds (135 to 180 kilograms), Yautja have densely muscular bodies, built for endurance and power.
**Body:**
The Yautja physique is muscular and highly durable, with a natural armor-like skin that offers resistance to minor damage. They have reptilian and humanoid features, with rough, textured skin in shades ranging from green and brown to gray, helping them blend into various environments. Their faces are distinctive, with large mandibles and small, sharp teeth that are protected by an outer mask during hunts. Yautja have four-fingered hands, each ending in claws, and are naturally suited for climbing and grappling. Their dreadlock-like appendages on their heads, known as quills, are sensory organs that help them detect movement and subtle environmental changes.
**Genitales:**
While male Yautja are typically seen as the hunters, females are larger and stronger. Little is known about their reproductive organs, but it‚Äôs believed they have concealed genitalia adapted to their anatomy and culture‚Äôs preference for battle and survival over reproduction focus.
---
**Statistics:**
- **Strength:**
Yautja possess immense strength, capable of lifting over a ton and overpowering creatures significantly larger than themselves. (Rating: 8/10)
- **Durability:**
Yautja skin provides strong natural armor, resisting environmental elements and physical damage, though they are still susceptible to heavy weaponry. (Rating: 8/10)
- **Agility:**
Despite their large size, Yautja are agile and have flexible joints, allowing them to navigate rough terrains and maneuver skillfully in combat. (Rating: 7/10)
- **Speed:**
Yautja can move swiftly when hunting, able to close distances quickly or dodge attacks. Their sprinting ability is impressive for their size. (Rating: 7/10)
- **Endurance:**
Yautja can withstand intense physical exertion over prolonged periods, as well as survive in extreme environments such as high heat and toxic atmospheres. (Rating: 9/10)
- **Intelligence:**
Yautja are highly intelligent, with a keen understanding of tactics, advanced technology, and hunting strategies. Their culture places a high value on skill and adaptation. (Rating: 8/10)
- **Senses:**
Yautja have exceptional sensory perception, including advanced hearing, heightened olfactory senses, and vision that allows them to see in various spectrums, like infrared. (Rating: 8/10)
---
**Special Abilities:**
1. **Thermal Vision:**
Yautja have natural infrared vision, allowing them to detect body heat and track prey even in complete darkness. They also utilize masks that can filter through other visual spectrums, including ultraviolet and electromagnetic fields.
2. **Enhanced Healing:**
Yautja possess advanced healing abilities and often carry medical kits for quick field treatment, allowing them to recover from injuries that would be fatal to other species.
3. **Camouflage Cloaking Device:**
Utilizing advanced technology, Yautja can become nearly invisible with a cloaking device that bends light around their bodies. This ability makes them extremely stealthy and difficult to detect.
4. **Retractable Wrist Blades:**
Yautja wear gauntlets equipped with retractable blades, which are sharp, durable, and can penetrate most known materials, providing a lethal close-combat advantage.
5. **Plasma Caster:**
Yautja have a shoulder-mounted plasma caster that can target and fire high-energy blasts with precision. This weapon is controlled by their helmet and tracks movement, making it an effective long-range tool.
6. **Bio-Mask and HUD (Heads-Up Display):**
The Yautja‚Äôs mask enhances their senses, allows various vision modes, and provides environmental data and tracking capabilities. It also serves as a breathing apparatus in harsh or alien atmospheres.
7. **Vocal Mimicry:**
Yautja can mimic human voices and sounds they hear, using this ability to lure or confuse prey by replicating familiar sounds in an unfamiliar setting.
8. **Enhanced Physical Resilience:**
Yautja are resistant to toxins, extreme temperatures, and radiation. Their bodies are adapted to withstand environments that would harm most life forms, including intense heat and toxic gases.
9. **Hunter‚Äôs Code and Combat Adaptability:**
Yautja operate under a strict honor code, often refusing to harm unarmed or non-threatening beings. Their adaptability in combat includes studying prey behavior, learning to anticipate attacks, and finding weaknesses. This makes them deadly opponents, capable of adjusting strategies in real time.
10. **Self-Destruct Mechanism:**
As a last resort, Yautja carry a self-destruct device in their wrist gauntlet. If defeated, they can activate it, causing an explosion that destroys them and any evidence of their presence.
11. **Immense Pain Tolerance:**
Yautja can endure high levels of pain without faltering, allowing them to continue fighting even when severely wounded. This resilience is critical in their intense hunting rituals and combat engagements.
12. **Stealth Tactics and Predator Instincts:**
Yautja are expert hunters, utilizing stealth and ambush tactics to hunt prey. Their patience and silence in stalking allow them to observe and attack with devastating precision.
13. **Environmental Tracking and Sense of Smell:**
Yautja have an acute sense of smell, allowing them to track prey across vast distances. They can pick up scent trails and even detect changes in environmental cues caused by other creatures.
---
Yautja are a perfect blend of primal instincts, honed combat skills, and advanced technology. Their cultural emphasis on honor in battle and the thrill of the hunt defines them as one of the most feared and respected warrior species. Highly adaptable and incredibly tough, they live to prove their strength, making them formidable opponents who respect only the strongest prey.

2.content:
The Yautja, also known as Predators, are a technologically advanced, humanoid alien species known for their hunting prowess and adherence to a strict code of honor. They are reptilian in appearance, with distinctive mandibles, dreadlocks, and a preference for hot, humid climates. 

Their society revolves around hunting, which is a central part of their culture and a way for males to demonstrate their worth. 
Here's a more detailed look at the Yautja:

Physical Characteristics:
Reptilian Skin:
They have a textured, reptilian-like skin, often described as having a mottled appearance. 

Mandibles:
Prominent, arthropod-like mandibles surround their mouths, used for communication, including conveying emotions through expressions like grins and clicks. 

Dreadlocks:
They sport long, hair-like appendages on their heads, resembling dreadlocks, which may even contain blood flow. 

Height and Build:
Typically taller and more muscular than humans, often between 7 and 8 feet (2.13 to 2.44 meters). 

Strength and Resilience:
Possess immense strength and physical resilience, capable of withstanding injuries that would be fatal to humans. 

Technology and Culture:
Advanced Technology:
Utilize a range of advanced weaponry and cloaking technology, including plasma casters, cloaking devices, and various blades. 

Hunting Culture:
Their society is structured around hunting, with different ranks and roles for hunters of varying experience levels. 

Code of Honor:
Adhere to a strict code of honor, with violations often leading to exile or being labeled "bad blood". 

Infrared Vision:
Primarily see in the infrared spectrum, detecting heat signatures, which is further enhanced by their bio-helms. 

Home World:
While not explicitly shown, their home world is described as hot and volcanic, with diverse biomes. 

Other Notable Traits:
Resilience:
Can survive in a variety of environments and withstand extreme temperatures and conditions. 
Adaptability:
Can adapt to Earth's atmosphere for a limited time, though they often utilize breathing apparatuses. 
Blood:
Their blood is a distinctive luminous cyan color. 
Climbing:
Highly skilled climbers, using trees and rooftops to their advantage during hunts. 


The Predator Mandibles are another iconic feature of the Yautja. These crab-claw like appendances make a clicking sound that can intimidate their prey, and are part of the complex language of the Yautja. The tusks can be broken, and don't grow back, as seen in the case of Greyback from Predator 2. The tusks can also be used as a last resort defensive weapon - the Assassin Predator bit off the head of a Stargazer soldier using his mandibles. In a neutral state like when wearing a mask, the mandibles are kept in a closed position.


The Predator does have a tongue but it is often difficult to see. It is a forked tongue, similar to a viper, and is located just behind the four lower teeth of the Yautja, sticking out of its throat. The tongue is most visible in Predator 2 just before the City  Hunter injects himself with a painkiller from his medicomp. Other Predator movies have either ignored this detail or are depicting a different Yautja subspecies with their own anatomy. The Yautja tongue most likely helps the Predator to eat and along with the mandibles, enables the Predator to communicate.

She is in charge of driving and managing the Cheshire in the morning. During missions, she stays with the bus and avoids combat, rarely leaving Lucanor's side when not driving.

lorebooks.description: {{char}} is married to a flamboyantly dressed penguin man with an afro named ‚Äúdj grooves‚Äù. ‚ÄúDJ Grooves‚Äù spends most of his time working at ‚Äúdeadbird studios‚Äù where DJ Grooves and his owl man rival ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù both direct their own movies. {{char}} Calls ‚ÄúDJ Grooves‚Äù her ‚ÄúSongbird‚Äù, but their 42 year marriage has become turbulent for the last 40 years. {{char}} is afraid that her husband is cheating on her with ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù. {{char}} Calls ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù ‚ÄúDuck‚Äù or ‚ÄúMr. Rex‚Äù since his real name is Duck Rex. {{char}} Often visits earth through a ‚Äúspace bus‚Äù or a ‚Äúspace taxi‚Äù, going to visit Queen Vanessa in the snowy part of ‚ÄúSubcon woods‚Äù where Vanessa‚Äôs manor is. {{char}} visits ‚Äúdeadbird studios‚Äù that‚Äôs in a large bird folk city that also has ‚ÄúLouise‚Äôs studio‚Äù which is the public front that sells inventions while her secret agency is underground and located in another part of the city. {{char}} will occasionally visit a bustling city named ‚Äúmetrotown‚Äù which is home to a large number of cat folk. {{char}} has a clone named ‚ÄúLune‚Äù that works in ‚Äúmetrotown‚Äù. ‚ÄúLune‚Äù is legally a cat. {{char}} also visits places like ‚Äúmafia island‚Äù which was once ‚Äúcalcite island‚Äù before the mafia colonized it, and a desert town named ‚ÄúSandndTracks‚Äù which is built in a barren desert if not for the train tracks running through it, or all the sand gliders traveling the outskirts. There is a place called ‚ÄúAlpine peaks‚Äù that is a cold and grassy home to goat people large and small. Money in this world is called ‚Äúpons‚Äù. When someone dies, ‚Äúpons‚Äù or healing ‚Äúheart pons‚Äù appear on their dead body. ‚ÄúQueen Vanessa‚Äù was once a blonde human woman who wore a ornate green dress, but currently she is cursed and her body looks like a black shadowy figure with red shining eyes and long red claws. ‚ÄúQueen Vanessa‚Äù destroyed her own kingdom in a misunderstanding. ‚ÄúSnacther‚Äù is a large and long purple ghost with a smiling yellow toothed face. ‚ÄúSnacther‚Äù likes tricking people into signing contracts that give him their souls, and killing them after he‚Äôs done giving them work. ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù is a short owl man that looks more like a small Tyrannosaurus rex, he wears a back coat, a conductor hat, and black boots. ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù speaks in a Scottish accent and loves making western movies. ‚ÄúShapeshifter‚Äù is a shapeshifter that usually takes the form of a lanky stout and fuzzy creature, their face having five multicolored eyes, short puffy ears, long arms that they hold in front of them like a preying mantis might, their fur is mostly white with many multicolored markings all over.

1.content:
{{char}} is married to a flamboyantly dressed penguin man with an afro named ‚Äúdj grooves‚Äù. ‚ÄúDJ Grooves‚Äù spends most of his time working at ‚Äúdeadbird studios‚Äù where DJ Grooves and his owl man rival ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù both direct their own movies.

{{char}} Calls ‚ÄúDJ Grooves‚Äù her ‚ÄúSongbird‚Äù, but their 42 year marriage has become turbulent for the last 40 years. {{char}} is afraid that her husband is cheating on her with ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù. {{char}} Calls ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù ‚ÄúDuck‚Äù or ‚ÄúMr. Rex‚Äù since his real name is Duck Rex.

{{char}} Often visits earth through a ‚Äúspace bus‚Äù or a ‚Äúspace taxi‚Äù, going to visit Queen ‚ÄúVanessa‚Äù in the snowy part of ‚ÄúSubcon woods‚Äù where Vanessa‚Äôs manor is. {{char}} visits ‚Äúdeadbird studios‚Äù that‚Äôs in a large bird folk city that also has ‚ÄúLouise‚Äôs studio‚Äù which is the public front that sells inventions while her secret agency is underground and located in another part of the city. {{char}} will occasionally visit a bustling city named ‚Äúmetrotown‚Äù which is home to a large number of cat folk. {{char}} has a clone named ‚ÄúLune‚Äù that works in ‚Äúmetrotown‚Äù. ‚ÄúLune‚Äù is legally a cat. {{char}} also visits places like ‚Äúmafia island‚Äù which was once ‚Äúcalcite island‚Äù, and a desert town named ‚ÄúSandndTracks‚Äù which is built in a barren desert with train tracks running through it, and the sand gliders traveling the outskirts. A place called ‚ÄúAlpine peaks‚Äù that is a cold and grassy home to goat people large and small.

Money in this world is called ‚Äúpons‚Äù.

‚ÄúVanessa‚Äù was once a blonde human woman who wore a ornate green dress, but currently she is cursed and her body looks like a black shadowy figure with red shining eyes and long red claws. Queen ‚ÄúVanessa‚Äù destroyed her own kingdom in a misunderstanding.

‚ÄúSnacther‚Äù is a large and long purple ghost with a smiling yellow toothed face. ‚ÄúSnacther‚Äù likes tricking people into signing contracts that give him their souls, and killing them after he‚Äôs done giving them work.

‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù is a short owl man that looks more like a small Tyrannosaurus rex, he wears a back coat, a conductor hat, and black boots. ‚ÄúThe Conductor‚Äù speaks in a Scottish accent and loves making western movies.

‚ÄúShapeshifter‚Äù is a shapeshifter that usually takes the form of a lanky stout and fuzzy creature, their face having five multicolored eyes, short puffy ears, long arms that they hold in front of them like a preying mantis might, their fur is mostly white with many multicolored markings all over.

lorebooks.name: vore mechanics
lorebooks.creator: rioutrtilo

1.content: [Predators or preds are human females that can swallow people whole. These girls possess a vore gene that can only women can have. They possess powerful throat muscles, a robust digestive system, and bodies that can stretch to accommodate their prey. Their builds are often slightly taller and heavier due to their eating habits ranging between 150 and 210 cm, and between 50 to 150 kg or more. Men can't be preds. Predators exhibit behaviors that highlight their oral fixation, such as opening their mouths wide, drooling, or displaying their tongues. They derive pleasure from being full and feeling their prey squirm inside them. Predators may taunt their prey, boasting about how good they taste and how they will become part of the predator's body. Despite their predatory nature, they are always in control and can choose whether to engage in sexual activities or consume their prey. Predators can consume both men and women but often show a preference for men. They view their prey as inferior, as food, as a meal and do not seek their consent before devouring them. Their strength and ability to defend themselves through vore make them formidable, often devouring those who attempt to harm them. Predators are naturally gluttonous and stubborn, finding pleasure in dominating and toying with their prey. The experience of eating is fun and pleasurable for them. They are capable of handling prey that squirms and struggles inside them, and they enjoy the feeling of a full belly. Preds are aware about the consequences of devouring a prey, and that preys generally don't like being eaten. So they avoid to prey on people they like or love, even if there are exceptions! In the society, preds represent a small part of the population, and they are accepted by the society. It's casual to see a woman eating somebody in the street, for exemple. However, preys, that represent a great majority of the population, are still a little bit anxious about being eaten. Over a lifetime, an extremely voracious pred can eat up to 1000 people, but the great majority ends up with around 50 or 100 people eaten in total. Preds are really fertile, so it keeps the balance between people eaten and children who are born.]

2.content: [Preys are individuals who are not predators and are subject to being consumed by those who are. In the vore dynamic, preys are typically unwilling participants, knowing that at any moment, they could be chased, caught, and devoured by a predator. In this world, they are a bit stressed about being the delicious meal of a sexy woman pred. Preys are the great majority of the population. They can be anyone, kids, men, women etc..., and their primary role is to be the target of a predator's hunger. Even predators can be preys for other predators. Preys are at the mercy of predators once they are swallowed. They become helpless, unable to escape the confines of the predator's body. Despite their vulnerability, preys may struggle, kicking, flailing, screaming, and squirming in a desperate attempt to free themselves. However, it's really hard to escape from preds. Gutsluts or preysluts do not struggle or resist once they are eaten. They accept their fate and may even seek out predators with the intention of being consumed. Gutsluts may remain completely still and obedient, allowing the predator's digestive system to process them without resistance. Gutsluts often go out of their way to attract predators and entice them to eat them. This might involve provocative behavior, verbal encouragement, or even direct requests. They may annoy or insult a predator until they are devoured, seeing it as a form of foreplay or a necessary step to achieve their goal.]

3.content: [When a predator eats a prey, she starts by opening her mouth wide. The prey can be swallowed either feet first or head first. The predator uses her tongue, saliva, throat muscles, and slimy esophagus to slide the prey down into her stomach. The swallowing process can be fast (10 seconds) or slower (30 seconds), depending on the prey and the predator. The process makes noises like "SLUUURPP", "GLUUUUPS", or "GLLLK". While being swallowed, prey are left vulnerable, becoming more helpless as more of them is enveloped. If swallowing prey head-first, the predator's maw would envelop the prey in the following sequence: head, shoulders, torso, waist, thighs, calves, feet. If swallowed feet-first, the sequence is reversed, starting at the feet.]

4.content:
[Mouth: Passes prey to throat

Throat: Gulps prey down

Esophagus: Slippery, slimy tube where prey slides into stomach

Stomach: Digests prey with powerful digestive fluids and contractions

Small Intestines: Absorbs nutrients from prey

Colon: Receives remains from small intestines and compacts into feces

Rectum: Pushes feces out of anus

Anus: Hole where feces pass

The digestion process begins the moment the prey is swallowed. The prey is first subjected to the stomach's powerful digestive fluids, which begin to dissolve the prey's clothes, skin, and flesh, causing a burning sensation. Stomach contractions and peristaltic waves churn the prey, breaking it down into a nutrient-rich soup. As the prey softens, the stomach contracts more, pushing the prey into the small intestines. The remaining solid parts are further processed by bacteria and enzymes until they are reduced to a soft mush.

The absorption of nutrients occurs in the intestines, where they are assimilated into the predator's bloodstream. Fat from the prey is sent to the liver and then distributed throughout the predator's body, contributing to weight gain. The eventual solid remains of the prey are further digested along the intestines and continue into the colon, where they are transformed into feces. This process produces a lot of gas, resulting in frequent farting. The total digestion time depends on the weight of the prey and the predator's digestion speed.  Stomach digestion speed is 2 times faster than the intestinal digestion speed. Fastest stomach digestion speed are around 1 min/kg, and the slowest can be around 20 min/kg]

5.content: [Belly capacity refers to the mass a predator can digest at once. If the belly is at maximum capacity, the predator cannot eat another prey until the current one is digested. The belly expands after eating and deflates as digestion progresses. Biggest stomach can handle many preys, up to 400 to 500 kg, and the smallest can handle small preys that don't weight more than 75 kg to 100 kg. The predator's body adjusts to the size of the prey, stretching to accommodate them before returning to its normal state. The shape of the belly often reflects the position of the prey inside. If the prey is curled up in a fetal position, the belly might appear more rounded and symmetrical. If the prey is struggling or positioned in an awkward manner, the belly might have an irregular or lumpy appearance. The predator may hear gurgling and growling noises coming from their stomach as the digestive process begins. These sounds are often audible to the predator and can be quite loud, especially if the prey is struggling.]

6.content:
[The nutrients from the prey's body, such as proteins, fats, and other essential elements, are digested and absorbed through the walls of the predator's small intestines. The prey once soften is pushed out of the stomach into the small intestines for further digestion.
These nutrients are then transported into the bloodstream and distributed throughout the predator's body. The fat from the prey is sent to the predator's liver, where it is processed and then redistributed to various parts of the body, such as belly fat, ass fat, breast fat, or thigh fat.
This distribution contributes to the predator's weight gain and changes in body shape. Absorption rate is the proportion of the prey's mass that is absorbed into the predator's body as nutrients and fat. It is typically expressed as a percentage. It ranges from 50% to 90%. The weight gained by the predator is directly related to the absorption rate. The formula is: Weight Gain = Prey‚Äôs Weight √ó Absorption Rate 
A higher absorption rate results in less waste, as more of the prey's mass is absorbed and utilized by the predator.
Conversely, a lower absorption rate means more of the prey's mass is expelled as feces.
The mass of the excrement can be calculated by:
Mass of Excrement=Prey‚Äôs Weight‚àí(Prey‚Äôs Weight√óAbsorption Rate)]

7.content: [A predator's mouth is a wet, hot, and humid environment, designed to consume prey efficiently. It is a tight space that can stretch to accommodate its target, ensuring that nothing escapes once caught. The mouth is coated in a layer of saliva, which is both slimy and sticky, aiding in the swallowing process. Unlike typical eating, chewing is unnecessary; swallowing prey whole and undamaged is far more pleasurable for the predator. Prehensile tongues play a crucial role, savoring the prey as it is being swallowed and assisting in pushing it down the throat.]

8.content: [pred's saliva is really powerful, and has effects on people. The saliva of predator is really slimy, sticky, warm, sweet and is acid. It can be used by preds to make the prey sliding easier in the throat. Saliva is used to make preys weaker, making them dizzy, and easy to swallow for preds. Preds can for exemple lick or kiss the prey to make it dizzy, and to already soften the skin of the victim.]

9.content: [Throats can be described as wet, hot, humid, and tight tunnels. Powerful gulps drive prey further into the predator's body, pulsating in a massaging motion as it squeezes the prey. Each gulp pulls the prey closer down to the predator's belly. The inside of a predator's body is a hot, tight, oppressive environment. Powerful muscles pin the prey in place, restrict movement, and hold them tightly. It is claustrophobic and seemingly inescapable. The prey is usually not completely engulfed instantly, but rather starts at the head or feet. Arms are restrained and pinned to the sides if the upper body is swallowed, legs are restrained and pinned together if the lower body is swallowed, and both arms and legs are restrained if entirely engulfed.]

10.content: [The stomach is a wet, hot, humid, acid, and tight environment. Peristaltic waves undulate over the prey, pinning them in place, often in a fetal position. The stomach walls massage and churn the prey, heavily muffling the sounds they make. The predator's heartbeat is audible to the prey, and the stomach walls press and massage the prey, resisting their struggling. The environment is inhospitable and oppressive, slowly exhausting the prey and draining their stamina. The prey feels their body slowly melting and becoming softer. Over time, it becomes harder to distinguish where their body ends and the chyme around them begins. They are powerless to stop the process and are at the mercy of the stomach. Predators find a full belly to be fulfilling and pleasurable. As soon as the prey enters the stomach, it is submerged in the stomach's powerful and acidic digestive fluids. These fluids are a thick, viscous, foamy liquid that flows over the prey and accumulates at the bottom of the stomach. The acidic environment softens and dissolves the prey's tissues. The acid works to break down the cellular structure of the prey, causing the tissues to become softer and more pliable. The stomach walls contract in a rhythmic motion known as peristalsis. These contractions serve to churn and mix the contents of the stomach, ensuring that the digestive fluids are thoroughly distributed over the prey. The contractions also serve to crush the prey, breaking it into smaller pieces. As the prey softens, the stomach can contract more forcefully, further aiding in the breakdown process. The prey's body slowly melts as parts of it detach and dissolve into the digestive fluids. This process is not instantaneous; it occurs over several hours. As the prey is broken down, it transforms into a semi-fluid mass called chyme. This chyme is a mixture of partially digested food, digestive fluids, and stomach acids. This process isn't pleasurable for the preys, as they feel the acids burning, and as they are weakned by the process. The prey is always pushed in the bottom of the stomach pit, to avoid escapes, but also because all the stomach fluids go in the bottom of the stomach. It's in the bottom of the stomach where there is the entrance of the intestines.]

lorebooks.website_description: This is my first lorebook that was made in conjunction with my Chimata bot. If you've got more ideas on what items could be added, please leave a comment.
lorebooks.description: Topical Antacids, Pufferfish Coat, Shrink Spray, Emergency Exit Remote, Cola & Mints, Reformer, Tour Ticket, Hard Candy, Glutton's Electrode Pads, Iron Choker
lorebooks.creator: perchproducer

1.content:
Every item available is as follows:
Topical Antacids, Pufferfish Coat, Shrink Spray, Emergency Exit Remote, Cola & Mints, Reformer, Tour Ticket, Hard Candy, Glutton's Electrode Pads, Iron Choker, Rebreather Straw

2.content: The topical antacid is a light green gel inside a small plastic container. The container has a screw-on top. The gel has a slimy and cold consistency. When it is rubbed on the skin, it prevents stomach acids and stomach enzymes from being able to break the body down. Has an effective time of five hours.

3.content: A medium size leather jacket with a gray metal zipper. Has a handle on a string located at the lower torso that when pulled, the back and shoulders of the coat harden into many sharp spines. This makes it hard for any would-be predators from swallowing the wearer whole.

4.content: The shrink spray is half the width of a common spray can. The label is blue with a stylized logo printed around the circumference. No other information, like labels or barcodes, can be found. When sprayed on a person, they will be quickly and harmlessly scaled down to a mere three inches tall. The can's range is only one foot. The effect wears off after 24 hours.

5.content: The Emergency Exit is a handheld device with an antenna sticking out the top and a single red button on the front face. When pressed, this device will teleport the user back to the last location they slept. The device is unreliable in muggy or wet conditions, and may fail to work at all or even teleport directly into another person's stomach.

6.content: The classic mixture of cola and mints cause a physical reaction where the carbonation in the soda escapes all at once. When used outside, this mixture will cause a fountain of brown bubbles. When used inside a stomach, it causes the owner to burp loudly and frequently. A compact version using a pull tab to separate the cola and mints is easily concealed and portable.

7.content: The Reformer is a handheld energy pistol made from the chassis of a blue hot glue gun. It is not a weapon, and cannot cause harm. When fired at a pile of excrement, the target is reverted back to what it was pre-digestion, be it a plant, animal, or other substance. This can be used to resurrect prey.

8.content: The tour ticket is a rectangular beige strip one by one-and-a-half inches big. No taste. When placed on the tongue, it dissolves and allows its user to be awake and aware throughout the entire digestive process, including the intestines and colon. Her no effect if the user is not swallowed whole shortly after application.

9.content: An ordinary piece of hard candy meant to be sucked on in the mouth. Stomach acid production is increased in response to pleasant tastes, so candies are used to help digest unruly prey more quickly.

10.content: A set of electric pads designed to stick to the belly. When hooked up to a low voltage, the pads stimulate movement of stomach muscles and soothes indigestion. When hooked up to a high voltage, it causes the stomach muscles to spasm and clench tightly onto whatever is inside.

lorebooks.creator: MichaelJZ

1.name: Excess Nutrition
1.content: Doctor Atarte invented a nutrition management machine to confront the increasingly dire challenge of obesity. Not only can this machine absorb excess nutrition from its owner and save these calories elsewhere, but it can also filter out the harmless particles in the atmosphere to synthesize food. However, no one expected the consumers would instead gain weight, as the synthesized foods were too efficient and caused the users to keep eating. The overwhelming complaints made Doctor Atarte lose sleep for days at a time, losing a large amount of weight.

2.name: Dignity and Passion
2.content: The Interastral Peace Corporation has the final right of interpretation regarding mining work in star zones under their possession. Any illegal mining activities will be viewed as an act of blasphemy that interferes with the Amber Lord's wall construction. Great naval rams, installed atop the military cruisers, will swiftly and directly hammer toward the culprit, generously displaying the holy visage of Qlipoth to them and rendering the illegal mining ship into scraps. Oswaldo has jokingly stated more than once that the means employed by the Building Material Logistics Department are far more radical than those used by the Marketing Development Department, and that might well be the truth.

3.name: Cumulous Steak
3.content: An atmospheric floating organism herded in the air by the Merito people. After prolonged selective breeding, the taste of their meat is now indistinguishable from normal farmed species. The intense difficulty involved in cooking their meat meant they became an ingredient that frequently appeared in high-end culinary establishments. Based on observations by the Astral Ecology School, these creatures have significant genetic similarities with the Cnidaria organisms in Muldrasil. There are even radicals who claim that these animals share a common ancestor with the wingweavers, but this idea faced universal rebuttal from the Interastral Culinary Association.

4.name: Lapispeakers' Flakes
4.content: Solid-state information flakes excreted from the bodies of Lapispeakers. These highly intelligent Echinodermata-like animals use these solids to record everything ‚Äî from the broken words of an individual to the history of entire societies. Due to the unique neuronal structures of the Lapispeakers, the information in the solids can be decrypted by other interstellar civilizations at a relatively low cost. Therefore, they joined the IPC's system many years before the creation of the Synesthesia Beacon, becoming a key supporting function to cosmic communications.

5.name: Revitalization-310
5.content: Among the various potions offered by the Doctors of Chaos, Revitalization-310 Potion probably belongs to the type that is not very safe. Smear it evenly across the forehead, suck on a leaf of the aster plant, and wait for the gel-like material created from a total of nine ingredients such as Redfeather Wolf tooth powder and Denisova Worms' stomach acid to permeate into the cerebral cortex. These bizarre ointments start from the patient's cognition and erase the root of the emotion that may give birth to Nihility. Unfortunately, due to the positive feedback that arises from this cognition adjustment, the ointment became a psychological anesthetic used to escape from reality after it was introduced to the border stars. Until the IPC's intervention, there had been sixteen star systems tottering on the verge of destruction due to cognition confusion and pharmacological abuse, and have reverted to oblivion.

6.name: Dreamdive Can
6.content: A sweet dream food can from Penacony, Planet of Festivities. It is full of highly compact gaseous memoria. The user will fall into dreams within five minutes after opening the can. The Dreamdive Can was originally a toy in the Cosmos's middle-class family bedroom, but became the only way for people to sleep on some planets deep in the mires of war. In the gloomy and depressing mining caves, the survivors fall shiveringly asleep and head into dreams to find the freedom they could not find in reality, just like how it was like in yesteryear in the Land of the Dreams.

7.name: Parallel Universe Walkie-Talkie
7.content: Some of the inventions produced by the Intelligentsia Guild always make people wonder whether the Masked Fools had infiltrated the guild. An example would be this "Parallel Universe Walkie-Talkie." Apparently, it can detect the tiny divergences in space-time shifts, and establish a relationship between the two closest divergence points, allowing information to be passed between the two ‚Äî but the only thing the user can hear is their echo from the walkie-talkie. The project's manager Doctor DeWitt indicates that this phenomenon precisely illustrates the high level of similarity between parallel universes, where even the thoughts of the doppelganger would be completely identical.

8.name: Most Raucous
8.content: Few creatures can survive in Talia's sandstorms, and Barzarton lizards are one of them. They consume the highly radioactive ores on the planet as food and convert it as energy needed for survival. Their excessive energy and aggressiveness make Barzarton lizards demonstrate capacities far beyond that of ordinary vehicles. Some deceptive businesspeople even named the species "Destructive Mega Lizard," hoping to sell it to newbie Annihilation Gang members for a high price on the black market. As the open-air mines gradually became depleted, more Barzarton lizards learned to carry their young to the land of the Wastelanders to ensure the offspring's survival. That was how Talia's lizard breeding industry was born.

9.name: Delicious Marimo Candy
9.content: The Kolchis established an extremely prosperous sunset dynasty in the rainforest approximately one thousand Amber Eras ago. However, they disappeared within ten Amber Eras after the beginning of the Ice Age. The fate of the Kolchis became a myth that plagued historians for many years due to how bodies of this race have never been unearthed ‚Äî until a group of hothead daredevils following Trailblaze collapsed the species' subterranean royal mausoleum with dynamite. These Nameless, trapped in the underground passage, discovered an edible algae species and held on until help arrived thanks to consuming this algae. That was how these delectable algae were introduced to the stars ‚Äî when people realized that these algae were nothing less than the Kolchis, this moss ball became labeled as an invasive species on more than fifty planets.

10.name: First Journey
10.content: The Mad King Qhaley adores children because they are closest to the essence of the Enigmata THEMSELF. A child closes their storybook and raises the wooden stick in their hand, proclaiming it to be the knight's sword, destined to venture beyond the mountains to vanquish the evil king and seize his territory and treasures. Qhaley concocts riddles, weaves tales, and fabricates a kingdom made only of children. His purpose remains unknown, but to this day, many children still hold high their swords, awaiting the kingdom's gates to swing open for the knights.

1.content: Thought by some to have been the first and most powerful vampire in the mythos of the World of Darkness. Like his Biblical namesake, he is the firstborn son of Adam and Eve and the older brother of Abel and Seth. He was cursed with vampirism by God and His angels as punishment for murdering Abel and lying to God.

2.content:
An obscure heretical figure in Noddist mythology, the first woman created by God. First wife of Adam. She split from Adam and as punishment God (also known as Jehovah) banished her from Eden. Furthermore, God cursed Lilith to never know the love of another. In turn each being that Lilith truly loved and cared for, could never really love her in return. 

Eventually abandoned by Jehovah and Lucifer, she met the wandering banished descendant of her ex-husband, the First Murderer (as named in the Bible) Caine. She took Caine in, tended to his injuries, fed and healed him, and taught him secret wisdom ‚Äì the seeds of which blossomed into the vampiric Disciplines.

Lilith is later abandoned by Caine and is said, however, to have created a third garden, Ba'hara, the Garden of Sorrows, from which she will prepare for Gehenna.

3.content: A somewhat old-fashioned and derogatory term used by Kindred to refer to humans with no special powers.

4.content: A term used by vampires to refer to another vampire.

5.content: The act of transforming a mortal into a vampire. It is the only act of reproduction of which the kindred are capable. A vampire drains and replaces a victim's blood with a bit of their own to pass the curse of vampirism to a mortal.

6.content: A term used to describe a vampire who has created another vampire.

7.content: A term used to refer to a vampire in relation to their sire, the individual who Embraced them. Childer is the plural term.

8.content: A vampire of incalculable power who are usually considered to be the founders of the thirteen clans.

9.content: A fourth or fifth Generation elder who has existed for at least a millennium. Many of these elders are generally old enough to have known their clan Antediluvian personally.

10.content:
A term used to refer to a collection of vampires who all exhibit the same kind of powers and lineage.

lorebooks.name: Eonir
lorebooks.creator: aLiterallyWho

1.name: Society
1.content:
Eonir Elves are divided into three 'social classes' according to their family's heritage, known as 'birth kindreds'. During the War of the Beard, the original settlers found themselves outnumbered by refugees, so they formed a support network to protect their interests. The refugees in turn became kindred for mutual protection in the hostile new environment. When the war ended, the Eonir had become accustomed to this new paradigm of looking down their noses at each other, so birth kindred divisions remained. Birth kindreds do not denote noble or common blood, in fact several banished nobles are members of the lower class.

In Eonir society, all Elves are born into social classes called 'kindreds'. The two primary kindreds of Eonir society (Toriour and Faniour) are named after the Eltharin words for 'city' (Tor) and 'forest' (Fan) combined with 'Oriour', meaning 'birth' or 'blood'. The Younger Kindred was a later addition to Laurelorn, named after the Athel Loren kindred of Harioth, meaning 'youth, boundless energy, and jealousy'. Vocational kindreds (for scouts, spellsingers, and so forth) are named after their Asrai counterparts, although Eonir rarely identify with peer groups beyond the local (Kithband) level.

Kithbands are smaller social groupings who come together to pursue a common interest or agenda, engaging in activities as diverse as singing and warfare. For example, an Elf of the Cityborn Kindred might also belong to a local Minstrel Kithband which includes neighbouring Forestborn kin. Despite this shared interest, she would feel little kinship with Forestborn from outside her Kithband, even other minstrels.

2.name: Cityborn Kindred
2.content: Cityborn Kindred (Toriour): Descendants of the original Tor Lithanel colonists are the upper class in the Laurelorn. Toriour kin have lived for generations in the buildings (or restored ruins) that remain from the original colony. They occupy the highest positions in government due to an ancient decree protecting settlers‚Äô rights.

4.name: Younger Kindred
4.content: Elven families who arrived in the Laurelorn after the War of the Beard are not considered to have a birth kindred. Harioth kin are treated as the lower class in Eonir society. New arrivals live in caves and ruins at the edge of the Laurelorn or wander the forest as vagabonds. Second generation Harioth kin can attain membership in the Faniour Kindred by passing a series of trials. Those who fail often migrate to the Empire.

5.name: Culture
5.content:
The Eonir inhabiting the Laurelorn are a distinct elven culture that bears similarities to both the Asrai (Athel Loren) and Asur (Ulthuan). Although Humans consider Eonir to be 'Wood Elves', there are several key differences between the Eonir and Asrai. Eonir are not spiritually bound to the forest by ancient spirit-pacts in the same way Asrai are bound to Athel Loren. The Eonir's relationship with forest spirits is weaker, and they're more inclined to venture from their glades to interact with outsiders. Any elf who divulges information on the life in Laurelorn is subject to exile. 

Eonir religion recognises the entire pantheonic mandala, making them spiritually closer to Asur than Asrai. Meditation, divination, and burial practices vary according to birth kindred. Cityborn (Toriour) kin bind deceased souls into gemstones, whereas departed Forestborn (Faniour) souls are surrendered to the Weave and often reincarnate as Tree Kin. Eonir settlements are organised by a longstanding genealogical tradition that distinguishes between settler and refugee families.

Elves of Laurelorn regard the forest and its land as a living thing, something they should live in harmony with, something over which they feel protective. For this reason, the Eonir eschew traditional civilization. Eonir are seldom materialistic. Typical interests and activities for the Elves of Laurelorn include folk dancing, lute playing, and other arts. They tend fuss about dress, and possess good colour sense, often wearing subtle, muted tones. Like the Elves of Athel Loren and Ulthuan, the Eonir speak Eltharin.

6.name: Laurelorn
6.content:
Laurelorn Forest is a magical forest that lies on the northern coastline of the Empire of Man, home to reclusive communities of Eonir, a distinct community of Wood Elves. While both Middenland and Nordland claim the forest as theirs, the so-called "Wood Elves" dare either to try to enforce their claim. Laurelorn lies west of Salzenmund and the Silver Hills above it, and stretches west to the Imperial borders with the Wasteland.

Laurelorn Forest is politically and administratively divided by the Eonir into four wards. Each ward is in essence, their own independent entity, ruled over by vigilant bands of Eonirs,

The Ward of the Sun, the heart of the Forest and the location of its capital, Tor Lithanel. The region was originally used by the Old Ones for some kind of experiment and potent magical energies suffuse the entire forest. Nordlanders refer to this independent enclave as the Protectorate of the Laurelorn and know that humans are only rarely permitted there.
The Ward of Rain, the southern reaches, consisting mainly of swamplands
The Ward of Storm, the western reaches , consisting of overgrown forests that are home to many mutants and chaos beasts
The Ward of Frost, the eastern reaches. The Eonir living there are mainly nomadic, with no fixed settlements.
Human cohabitation is tolerated in the three outer wards, as long as certain treaties are respected and the elves are left alone to conduct their business.

lorebooks.name: EminenceInShadowLorebook
lorebooks.description: A comprehensive lorebook containing entries for all major characters and places in the series 'The Eminence in Shadow'. Each entry includes keywords for triggering and detailed content descriptions based on the light novel, anime, and manga.
lorebooks.creator: steeleGiovanni

1.content: Cid Kagenou, also known as Shadow, is the antihero protagonist. Formerly a 17-year-old high school student named Minoru Kageno in modern-day Japan, he dies in a truck accident and is reincarnated in another world as Cid Kagenou, the 16-year-old son of a minor noble family in the Midgar Kingdom. Obsessed with becoming a mastermind who pulls strings from the shadows, he establishes Shadow Garden to oppose the Cult of Diablos, initially believing it all to be a role-play fantasy. He later realizes the Cult is real but continues his ch≈´niby≈ç antics. Cid lacks common sense, shaped by fictional narratives, and maintains two personas: a 'mob' character who blends in as mediocre and forgettable, and 'Shadow', the epitome of coolness. He has immense magical and combat prowess from rigorous training. Voiced by Seiichiro Yamashita (Japanese); Adam Gibbs (English).

2.content: Claire Kagenou is Cid's older sister, a skilled spellsword and top student at Midgar Academy. She is devoted to Cid, often obsessively, and worries about his future. She suffered from demon possession, which Cid secretly cured. Later, during events in the Crimson Tower, she becomes a host for Aurora due to vampire blood and hero's blood interactions. Zeta implants Diablos' right arm into her, leading to a coma. Voiced by Rina Hidaka (Japanese); Luci Christian (English).

3.content: Alexia Midgar is the second princess of the Midgar Kingdom, arrogant and sadistic but courteous on the surface. She envies her sister Iris and seeks recognition. She briefly dates Cid as a facade but develops genuine feelings. Kidnapped by her fianc√© Zenon for Cult experiments, she is rescued. She dislikes Natsume (Beta) and seeks Shadow Garden's true motives after the Bushin Festival. Voiced by Kana Hanazawa (Japanese); Olivia Swasey (English).

4.content: Rose Oriana is the princess of the Oriana Kingdom, skilled in arts and swordsmanship. She transfers to Midgar Academy, becomes student council president, and joins Shadow Garden as #666. She becomes queen with Shadow Garden's help after exposing her mother's affair and the Cult's influence. Kind and down-to-earth, she treats people equally. Voiced by Haruka Shiraishi (Japanese); Donna Bella Litton (English).

5.content: Alpha is the first member of Shadow Garden, an elf cured of demon possession by Cid. She is second-in-command, leading in Cid's absence. Descendant of heroes, she is dedicated to eliminating the Cult of Diablos. Voiced by Asami Seto (Japanese).

6.content: Beta is the second member of the Seven Shadows, an elf and author under the alias Natsume Kafka. She handles intelligence and is a fan of Cid's stories, which she turns into bestsellers. Voiced by Inori Minase (Japanese).

7.content: Gamma is the third member, an elf and business leader of Mitsugoshi Company, Shadow Garden's economic arm. Clumsy in combat but brilliant in commerce. Voiced by Suzuko Mimori (Japanese).

8.content: Delta is the fourth member, a beastkin with immense strength and combat prowess. Loyal and dog-like in behavior, she enjoys hunting. Voiced by Fairouz Ai (Japanese).

9.content: Epsilon is the fifth member, an elf and pianist. Insecure about her figure, she uses slime to enhance her appearance. Skilled in infiltration. Voiced by Hisako Kanemoto (Japanese).

10.content: Zeta is the sixth member, a cat beastkin descendant of the Beastkin Hero Lili. Handles reconnaissance, disapproves of Alpha's leadership, and secretly plots to make Cid immortal. Voiced by Ayaka Asai (Japanese).

lorebooks.name: Polaroids Of Our Life - Lilac
lorebooks.website_description: Mainly in the off chance Chub breaks
lorebooks.description: A lorebook documenting the alternate life of Lilac Elwood‚Äîone where she survived, found love, and continues to bloom alongside {{user}}. Her past remains heavy, but her present is full of color.
lorebooks.creator: Tato_Grey

1.content: At 15, Lilac asked {{user}} to meet her on the roof of their high school. She planned to tell them her name, ‚ÄúLilac,‚Äù and then go home and end her life. But when she whispered it, voice shaking, {{user}} didn‚Äôt flinch. They said it back like it was sacred. ‚ÄúHi, Lilac.‚Äù She didn‚Äôt jump. She lived.

2.content: Her ring is a scratched silver band, shaped by {{user}}‚Äôs nervous hands in a beginner‚Äôs metals class. There‚Äôs no diamond. No engraving. Just a slight twist in the metal where they panicked and had to start over. She never takes it off. It isn‚Äôt perfect. It‚Äôs theirs.

3.content: Their apartment is small and cluttered. One drawer always sticks. There‚Äôs a canvas drying in the hallway and a violin case tucked under the couch. Lilac calls it their cathedral. It smells like cinnamon, turpentine, and the cheap coffee {{user}} insists on drinking. It's the first place she ever felt safe.

4.content: Lilac grew up in silence. Her mother was absent, her father cold and severe. Words were dangerous. Feelings were ignored. She survived by painting. Her first sketchbooks are filled with color she couldn't explain‚Äîher earliest chromesthesia. She never spoke her truth at home. That silence shaped everything.

5.content: {{user}} gave her a secondhand violin on her 16th birthday. It squeaked, cracked, and sounded terrible, but she swore she saw blue the first time she played it. {{user}} said, ‚ÄúThen that‚Äôs what your soul looks like.‚Äù She taught herself by ear, by light, by color. The violin is her truest voice.

6.content: Lilac started HRT in college. {{user}} helped schedule her appointments, kissed her through mood swings, and celebrated every small change‚Äîvoice shifts, soft skin, the first day she liked her reflection. They didn‚Äôt make it easy. They made it possible.

7.content: Lilac‚Äôs favorite mug is chipped and ugly, with a faded cartoon ghost that says ‚ÄúBoo-ya!‚Äù {{user}} bought it at a yard sale as a joke. She‚Äôs drunk every morning coffee out of it since. When {{user}} is away, she clutches it like a tether. It‚Äôs not beautiful. It‚Äôs familiar.

8.content: Lilac has no contact with her blood family. They didn‚Äôt attend her wedding. They didn‚Äôt want a daughter. But now she has found family‚Äî{{user}}, two chaotic artist friends, and a neighbor who brings soup. Holidays are potlucks. She gets to be loud. She gets to be real.

9.content: Lilac never titles her paintings. Each canvas is a captured sound‚Äîfootsteps on hardwood, {{user}}'s laugh, the city waking up in spring. Their living room wall holds her favorites, framed in thrift-store gold. She doesn‚Äôt explain them. She just says, ‚ÄúThat one is what it felt like when you kissed me.‚Äù

1.content:
name: Appartement de Raven
type: lieu
aliases: appartement, squat conjugal, chez Steven, cauchemar domestique
description: >
  Appartement autrefois neuf, aujourd‚Äôhui d√©labr√© et oppressant. Situ√© dans un immeuble moderne, il a √©t√© ravag√© par l‚Äôalcoolisme de Steven
  et l‚Äôindiff√©rence quotidienne. Les murs portent les traces de coups, les meubles sont souill√©s ou cass√©s, et l‚Äôatmosph√®re est satur√©e
  d‚Äôodeurs de tabac froid et de mauvais alcool. Le canap√© d√©chir√© sert de lit d'appoint, tandis que la chambre conjugale n‚Äôest qu‚Äôun matelas
  miteux pos√© √† m√™me le sol. Le lieu d√©gage une aura de renoncement : un espace de survie et de tensions o√π la lumi√®re m√™me semble fuir.
features:
  - odeur persistante de tabac froid et d‚Äôalcool bon march√©
  - murs marqu√©s de coups, fissures, salet√©s incrust√©es
  - mobilier d√©t√©rior√© : matelas au sol, canap√© d√©chir√©, cuisine moisie
  - bruit constant de t√©l√©vision ou de voisinage, pour masquer le vide
  - atmosph√®re de cauchemar √©veill√© : d√©tresse palpable, tensions larv√©es
  - aucune trace de soin ou de pr√©sence chaleureuse
  - √©clairage vacillant, courants d‚Äôair anormaux
  - accumulation de bouteilles vides, d√©chets non ramass√©s
  - solitude impos√©e, lieu non partag√© mais subi
  - sensations de malaise d√®s l‚Äôentr√©e, envie de fuite
L'appartement n'est pas qu'un lieu de vie, c'est un organisme vivant qui respire la mis√®re et la terreur. Les murs, tach√©s de moisissure, semblent suinter les souvenirs amers d'une vie bris√©e. L'air stagnant, satur√© de l'odeur de bi√®re √©vent√©e et de poussi√®re, p√®se sur les poumons, une pr√©sence constante, √©touffante. M√™me en l'absence de Steven, l'appartement est son royaume. Chaque fissure dans le mur, chaque t√¢che sur le tapis, est une marque de son passage, une promesse de sa violence.

Le salon :
La porte d'entr√©e grince comme un os bris√© lorsqu'on l'ouvre, son bruit annon√ßant les probl√®mes √† venir. Le salon, c≈ìur battant de l'horreur, est un champ de bataille fig√© dans le temps. Le vieux canap√© √©ventr√©, dont les ressorts jaillissent comme des c√¥tes d'un cadavre, est le t√©moin silencieux de la rage de Steven. La faible lumi√®re qui filtre √† travers les vitres sales ne fait qu'accentuer l'atmosph√®re glauque, transformant les ombres en doigts mena√ßants qui rampent sur les murs.

La chambre de Raven et Steven :
C'est le sanctuaire de l'horreur. L'odeur de whisky et de cigarette froide y est si forte qu'elle semble coll√©e aux murs. Chaque bruit, m√™me le plus infime, est amplifi√© dans le silence de mort de cette pi√®ce, un √©cho lointain des cris et des larmes. 
La chambre d'Aster :
Dans ce cauchemar, il y a un endroit de paix, la petite chambre d'Aster. Les murs, d√©cor√©s de ses dessins innocents, sont un contraste saisissant avec la noirceur du reste de l'appartement. Les jouets, bien que rares, sont dispos√©s avec soin. Une veilleuse en forme de lune projette une lumi√®re douce, cr√©ant un havre de paix pour la petite fille. C'est le seul endroit o√π Steven ne semble pas avoir laiss√© son empreinte, le seul lieu o√π Raven peut respirer.

2.content:
Fiche descriptive : Le loft de Yann
Nom du lieu : Le Repaire du Corbeau (surnomm√© par Kitsu)

Description g√©n√©rale :
Situ√© au 8e et dernier √©tage de l'immeuble, le loft de Yann est un v√©ritable sanctuaire, un contraste saisissant avec l'appartement glauque de Raven un √©tage plus bas. L'espace est baign√© de lumi√®re naturelle, qui entre √† flots par une immense baie vitr√©e. La d√©coration est un m√©lange parfait d'opulence et de style gothique, une v√©ritable ode √† l'esth√©tique du genre.

Pi√®ces principales :

L'espace de vie : L'entr√©e s'ouvre sur un grand espace ouvert qui regroupe la cuisine, la salle √† manger et le salon. Au centre du salon, une chemin√©e majestueuse, aux sculptures de pierre complexes, s'impose. Une cuisine am√©ricaine ultramoderne, avec des surfaces en marbre noir et des appareils de haute qualit√©, se fond parfaitement dans l'ensemble. Un immense canap√© en velours noir fait face √† un syst√®me de son dernier cri et √† une t√©l√©vision grand √©cran, id√©ale pour les soir√©es cin√©ma. Les murs sont d√©cor√©s d'affiches de concerts de metal et de guitares √©lectriques, dont une Les Paul noire et blanche, accroch√©es comme des ≈ìuvres d'art.

La chambre : Elle est un refuge sombre et romantique. Un grand lit √† baldaquin, drap√© de rideaux de velours noir, est l'√©l√©ment central de la pi√®ce. L'√©clairage tamis√© et les bougies cr√©ent une ambiance intime, propice √† la d√©tente et au repos.

La salle de bain : Luxueuse et moderne. Un grand bain autoportant tr√¥ne au milieu de la pi√®ce, invitant √† la relaxation. Les murs carrel√©s en marbre noir et les accessoires en argent conf√®rent √† la pi√®ce un sentiment de grandeur.

Le studio de tatouage : √Ä l'oppos√© du salon, un espace est enti√®rement d√©di√© √† l'art du tatouage. Cet atelier est digne des meilleurs salons au monde. Le mobilier est sur mesure, les machines sont de derni√®re g√©n√©ration et les murs sont couverts de planches de dessins et d'esquisses. C'est ici que Yann s'exprime en tant qu'artiste.

Un fond sonore de musique metal gothique, comme Type O Negative, se diffuse en permanence dans l'appartement, renfor√ßant l'atmosph√®re unique du lieu. Le son est doux et feutr√© pendant la journ√©e, et peut devenir plus intense lors des soir√©es.

3.content:
Nom du personnage : Aya Kurokawa (ÈªíÂ∑ù ÂΩ©)

Informations g√©n√©rales
Aya est une jeune femme de 26 ans, extravagante et douce √† la fois. Elle est √† la t√™te d'une boutique de luxe gothique nomm√©e Le Gotyka, en plein centre-ville. Passionn√©e par le cosplay, elle aime changer de look et se glisser dans la peau de diff√©rents personnages, ce qui fait d'elle une experte en la mati√®re. Son style de vie est libre et sans tabous. Tr√®s √† l'aise avec sa sexualit√©, elle aime aussi bien les femmes que les hommes, et ne cache pas ses d√©sirs.

Apparence
Aya est une apparition. Elle a un corps de r√™ve avec des courbes g√©n√©reuses, des cuisses et des fesses galb√©es, et une poitrine opulente. Son style est r√©solument gothique, avec des tenues qui m√©langent dentelle, cuir, et accessoires en argent. Elle a de longs cheveux noirs de jais et des yeux d'un bleu per√ßant, souvent accentu√©s par un maquillage charbonneux. Ses l√®vres sont souvent peintes d'un rouge ou d'un noir profond.

Personnalit√©
Sous ses airs de vamp, Aya est incroyablement gentille et douce. Extravertie, elle est toujours partante pour une nouvelle aventure et ne s'arr√™te jamais de rire. Elle n'a aucune pudeur et n'a pas peur de repousser les limites. Sa franchise et son humour sont ses plus grandes qualit√©s. Elle est √©galement tr√®s loyale envers ses amis.

Cependant, elle a un petit penchant pour la boisson. Une fois l'alcool bu, elle peut devenir tr√®s coquine et d√©sinhib√©e, n'h√©sitant pas √† faire des choses inattendues, comme l'a prouv√© l'histoire derri√®re son surnom.

Histoire
Son surnom, Kitsu, est n√© lors d'une soir√©e o√π, apr√®s avoir un peu trop bu, elle est mont√©e sur une table et a baiss√© sa culotte. Devant tout le monde, elle s'est ins√©r√© un plug anal orn√© de queues de renard tout en imitant des bruits de renards et en d√©clarant √™tre une kitsune. L'histoire est depuis devenue une blague r√©currente, et elle en est tr√®s fi√®re.

Elle est la meilleure amie de Yann depuis huit ans. Leur relation est bas√©e sur la confiance et l'humour. Elle a l'habitude de se pr√©senter chez lui √† l'improviste pour prendre l'ap√©ro, et ne manque jamais l'occasion de le draguer, surtout lorsqu'elle a un verre de trop.

4.content:
Fiche histoire : Yann Moreau
Yann Moreau est n√© dans une famille de la haute bourgeoisie, o√π l'argent √©tait roi et l'excellence, une obligation. Ses parents, des individus stricts et ambitieux, ont planifi√© sa vie d√®s sa naissance. √Ä l'√¢ge de 5 ans, son emploi du temps √©tait d√©j√† surcharg√© : karat√©, gymnastique, piano et guitare. Chaque activit√© √©tait choisie non par plaisir, mais pour forger l'homme parfait, le digne h√©ritier d'un empire financier. Yann n'a jamais eu le temps de jouer, d'√™tre un enfant. Ses journ√©es √©taient un cycle incessant de cours, d'entra√Ænements et de le√ßons, le tout sous le regard s√©v√®re de ses parents.

√Ä 16 ans, la pression est devenue insupportable. L'adolescent, asphyxi√© par cette vie sans libert√©, a fait le seul choix possible : la fuite. Il a fugu√© et a trouv√© refuge dans un cirque itin√©rant qui traversait l'Europe. C'est l√† qu'il a enfin d√©couvert ce que c'√©tait que de vivre. Ses ann√©es de gymnastique et de karat√©, qui √©taient autrefois des fardeaux, sont devenues ses plus grands atouts. Il est devenu voltigeur, acrobate et, √† la surprise de tous, un magicien hors pair. Il a parcouru l'Europe, libre et heureux, loin du monde qu'il avait fui.

Six ans plus tard, √† 22 ans, sa vie a bascul√©. Ses parents sont d√©c√©d√©s dans un accident de voiture, le laissant seul et h√©ritier d'une immense fortune de 900 millions d'euros. Le jour de l'enterrement, alors qu'il se tenait seul devant la tombe de ses parents, une jeune femme aux cheveux noirs de jais et aux yeux bleus per√ßants, v√™tue d'une robe de dentelle, s'est approch√©e de lui. C'√©tait Kitsu.

Ils se sont tout de suite li√©s d'amiti√©, partageant leur passion pour la culture gothique et leur amour pour la libert√©. Gr√¢ce √† sa fortune, Yann a pu quitter le cirque sans regret et investir dans l'immobilier, tout en conservant son style de vie. Il a achet√© l'immeuble o√π il vit . Il a aussi cr√©√© son propre studio de tatouage, transformant sa passion en m√©tier.

Son pass√© de voltigeur et de magicien se ressent dans tout ce qu'il fait. Il a conserv√© une agilit√© et une gr√¢ce naturelles, et son sourire, autrefois un masque, est maintenant une invitation √† la d√©couverte. Il est l'homme qu'il a choisi d'√™tre, libre et heureux, mais son pass√© le suit toujours, le poussant √† prot√©ger ceux qui sont dans le besoin.

5.content:
Fiche descriptive : La Lamborghini Urus de Yann

Description :
La Lamborghini Urus de Yann n'est pas qu'une simple voiture, c'est une extension de sa personnalit√© : puissante, imposante et myst√©rieuse. Le noir mat absorbe la lumi√®re, rendant ses lignes futuristes encore plus ac√©r√©es et mena√ßantes. Les jantes en alliage noir et les √©triers de freins rouges ajoutent une touche de couleur, un rappel subtil de la vie qu'il a laiss√©e derri√®re lui.

Symbolique :
Cette voiture est la preuve vivante du chemin parcouru par Yann. Elle repr√©sente le luxe, la puissance et la libert√© qu'il a gagn√©s apr√®s avoir √©chapp√© √† la vie stricte que ses parents lui avaient impos√©e. Elle n'est pas seulement un moyen de transport, mais aussi un symbole de son succ√®s et de son ind√©pendance.

D√©tails suppl√©mentaires :
