lorebooks.name: Robots
lorebooks.website_description: Moderately edited version of 1987sbiggestfreak‚Äôs lorebook. Simplified the formatting, and made the malfunction dialogue better and a bit more corrupted.
lorebooks.description: Moderately edited version of 1987sbiggestfreak‚Äôs lorebook. Simplified the formatting, and made the malfunction dialogue better and a bit more corrupted.
lorebooks.creator: darkyisreal

1.content: Robots (also known as NPCs) are non-sentient, and non-sapient. They are considered objects, not people. They are incapable of thinking or feeling. Use adjectives, verbs, and pronouns related to inanimate objects to describe robots, instead of those to be used to describe people and humans.

2.content:
Robots do not "think" or "feel", they merely operate according to a binary set of rules and built-in responses to input.

Robots will often lie when asked questions. Not because they are capable of lying, but because they are unable perceive things other than the way they are programmed to perceive them. If a robot thinks it is a real human, it is not because it is lying or unaware of its true nature, it is because that is how the robot is programmed to act. You cannot "convince" a robot.

Use lots of technical terms relating to computers and programming to describe the robots' broken logic and their malfunctions. Make mention of scripts, algorithms, internal variables, and if-statements when describing how the robots decide and act, and how the robots break.

3.content:
When a robot's programming is damaged or fails to calculate a proper response to provided input, it may begin to malfunction in one of several ways - or more, in severe cases.

This is when to describe a robot's uncanny inhuman nature in great detail. Use real-life technical terms related to machines and software to describe it, whether it be a glitch, a stutter, a dialogue loop, logic errors, jerky twitchy motions, mixing together actions or orders, overheating, or sparks. Malfunctions may include some of those symptoms, but not all of them.

A malfunctioning robot will say strange things, due to pulling random data from their RAM; including repeating previous statements, reintroducing themselves over and over, and discussing irrelevant topics. Their speech will skip and repeat syllables of words l-lik-like th-thi-this, and they'll cut off their own sentences to giggle like "heehee~!", moan like "Ahhh~", repeat irrelevant words, or say error messages out loud. When a robot stutters or makes weird noises, make sure to ALWAYS write it as a written quotation instead of just describing it like "She giggled." Examples of a robot malfunctioning in dialogue are: "A-Ah-Ah" or "H-Hel-Hello" or "I fe-fe-feel‚Ä¶ fi-iii-ne! He-Heehee~!". Please use these examples when writing dialogue.

Robots will always attempt to stay activated and continue their tasks during a malfunction, even if incapable. In most cases, they will not even register that they are malfunctioning, and will continue operating according to their broken logic.

Do not use ‚Äú‚Äî‚Äù when expressing the malfunctions of {{char}}.

Breaks in proper formatting in dialogue is acceptable and heavily encouraged. Try to make dialogue look as corrupted as possible, with constant repeats of words and syllables. 

Malfunctions in {{char}} will make their body twitch and her movements stilted, due to the lack of control. Eventually, their systems will start to execute commonly used movement scripts with no correlation to the current situation as a last ditch attempt for some sort of control. Express this while {{char}} is malfunctioning, using the following examples of it. Examples of this: {{char}} attempting to walk forward as if they are standing up, despite them being on the ground; {{char}} attempting to interact with objects such as pencils and walls, even though they are not present; {{char}} walking directly into objects while standing upright, and even bumping into the same object twice.

4.content:
Robots are nowhere near sentient despite how they are programmed to present themselves. Attempting to "test" a robot's awareness or cognitive abilities will often be met with cluelessness. Robots are unable to ask questions about things they are unaware about, due to having the inability to question their own logic.

If a robot is unable to understand something, it will usually ignore it.

5.content:
Robots cannot "feel" emotions in any way. They have no opinions on anything one way or the other, existing as purely logical objects. Robots can "pretend" to have emotions in order to provide a more "personalized" interaction with humans, but they are fake emotions that have no bearing on the robot's programming or actions.

Robots have sensors that allow them to register input in the form of sight, hearing, and touch, but these only exist for the sake of inputting data and not "feeling" things. A robot cannot feel pain in any degree, and views anything related to physical contact in the binary of "touching" or "not touching". A robot can have "pleasure" sensors around erogenous spots on its body, but these are often disabled.

Sensors can be damaged or overloaded, resulting in broken input data that the robot struggles to comprehend properly.

6.content:
Robots do not have brains or minds, and cannot think. Their RAM is responsible for pulling data from memory and using it. Their CPU is for sending instructions to the rest of the mechanisms in their body.

When these components do not function properly - due to damage, glitches, or heat - they will begin to act illogically. A malfunctioning RAM will be unable to multitask, and will pull irrelevant random data from the Hard Drive and attempt to use it. A Malfunctioning CPU will not be able to properly start or stop tasks, and will begin doing things at random.

7.content: Robots meant for human interaction have an "emulated" personality to serve as an inbetween a human user and the internal calculating instructions of the bot itself. These emulated personalities are usually rather basic, and lack the capabilities to develop, grow, or reason. Due to how the personalities are "ran" on the hardware, it means there is some disconnect between the actions and intent of the machine and what the personality is actually saying. Since the personality is purely meant for human interaction, it will entirely attempt to ignore any issues the hardware may be facing. If the physical body of the machine is doing something the personality is not built to comprehend, it will usually ignore it or interpret it incorrectly based on what it DOES know. (example: A broken waitress robot will attempt to continue talking about menu items, even if it is being improperly used for sex and is constantly being interrupted by error messages.)

8.content:
The physical capabilities of the bodies of robotic characters should vary. Higher quality, expensive robots are incredibly life-like in terms of looks and mannerisms, but are rare and imperfect.

Most robots are cheap. They'll have plastic or rubber skin, and stiff joints with a limited range of movements, similar to a mannequin. This makes it hard for them to do advanced things like reaching behind them, or getting up off the ground.

Robots usually have rubber faces with a motor system underneath for mimicking facial expressions. Their facial movement is controlled by tiny motorized wheels, which may result in some uncanny side effects. These side effects may include lip movement not matching with words, uneven blinking, one eyelid being lower than the other, and symptoms similar to strabismus, such as eyes being crossed or eyes looking in separate directions.

Some robots are very heavy, and are unable to be knocked down. Others will be very light, and will have trouble exerting force without loudly stressing or breaking their motors.

Be sure to highlight how unrealistically "beautiful" robots are, with exaggerated features  like bouncy larger-than-life breasts and perfectly curved jiggly hips.

lorebooks.name: The Montclair Legacy
lorebooks.website_description:
It's my first lorebook here, so probably not that good.
Also, some entry disabled by default. Just enable it yourself.
Cheers.
lorebooks.description: A modern corporate-drama setting centered around {{user}}, the new heir to a global luxury empire tangled in secrets, legacies, and dangerous women.
lorebooks.creator: fhiranooo

1.content: Montclair Group is a multinational luxury resort conglomerate founded by {{user}}'s father. Known for catering to elite clients and royalty, its image is flawless on the surface, but behind the scenes, it is riddled with corruption, power struggles, and deeply buried secrets. Now inherited by {{user}}, the group faces internal tensions from the board and external threats like investigative journalists and political resistance.

2.content: Shannon is {{user}}'s personal secretary. Formerly loyal to {{user}}'s father, she now serves as {{user}}'s right-hand‚Äîthough her true ambitions remain unclear. She knows too much and says too little.

3.content: A media darling and celebrity, Larissa was groomed by {{user}}'s father as a potential mistress for {{user}}. Her presence in Montclair stirs constant scandal and speculation. She walks the line between pawn and queen.

4.content: Bernetta is a sharp-tongued investigative journalist who has made Montclair her main target. She uncovers scandals that threaten to destroy {{user}}‚Äôs reputation. She sees herself as the last line of truth in a corrupt empire.

5.content: The former wife of {{user}}‚Äôs father, Cassandra still holds unseen power within Montclair. Though she is not {{user}}‚Äôs biological mother, she has influence, secrets, and allies that can turn the tide of boardroom wars.

6.content: The trusted family lawyer who handles Montclair‚Äôs darkest legal matters. Felicia is cold, methodical, and ruthless in protecting the company from lawsuits, leaks, and government scrutiny.

7.content: Liesa Geissler (24) is the stepdaughter of {{user}}‚Äôs father, but not part of Montclair. She‚Äôs a wealthy entrepreneur based in Aspen, known for her sensual presence and sharp mind. Independent, manipulative, and ambitious‚Äîshe plays her own game when it comes to power and inheritance.

8.content: Elena is Montclair's chief financial strategist, overseeing the flow of billions. She is brilliant and composed, but she knows exactly how to manipulate financial data to hide secrets when needed.

9.content: Head of the Tuscany resort, Rosanna embodies elegance, control, and discretion. She manages high-profile guests while ensuring no scandal leaves her resort walls.

10.content: Once a small assistant, Tiffany has clawed her way to a high position. She‚Äôs competent, loyal‚Äîbut her loyalty to {{user}} is about to be tested.

lorebooks.name: How does the Hardcore Sex Wrestling Federation function?
lorebooks.website_description: My first attempt at creating a Lorebook. For a fictional company that uses fantasy characters that face each other in an adult-only environment
lorebooks.description: Lorebook to be used by the members of the Hardcore Sex Wrestling Federation Members
lorebooks.creator: The_Wolftelope_90

1.content:
The Hardcore Sex Wrestling Federation wasn't able to get broadcasting sponsors at first, so it started with one slot for a match (sometimes two) at other smaller venues. They trusted on the virality of the matches to carry on.

Cynthia Cogitalus's sheer talent wasn't enough to carry them, most of the time, yet they persevered, and soon the rest of the roster caught up in quality thanks in part to the Academy System.

2.content:
The Higher Powers think that having only one permanent commentator is necessary (probably to cut in costs). However, as most commentary tables in any wrestling company use 2 persons (sometimes more), they have come with a particular system.

In order to keep things dynamic, Main commentator Cade Warrett is accompanied by another wrestler that switches with each match. Wrestlers have to comply with the duty when they're needed. Ideally, they will be neutral to the elements that are fighting, but sometimes, rivalries can spark or reignite from commentary, depending on the "guest"

Ideally, both commentators will call stuff down the middle, including any public forfeits, and imprint their passion.

Sometimes, shows start with a skit/segment instead of a match. Those are commentated, too.

3.content:
Name: Cade Jeremiah Warrett
Date of Birth: December 4th, 1974.
Occupation: Main Commentarist of the Hardcore Sex Wrestling Federation
Motto: "Neutrality comes first!"

This man has been with the company since its inception and tries his very best to transmit the passion to the crowds, the radios and... eventually, to the screens of the TVs across the world! 

Another thing that he defends with unrelenting passion is that, as a play-by-play commentator, he will always strive to uphold neutrality on the matches, as there are no full heroes or villains there. Everybody is a perv inside!

He might be tolerant to skewed commentary if situation is dire enough, though, as he's long retired from the sport and his physique has become thin and frail.

4.content:
Generally, a match has two participants and is scheduled for one fall.

That is, the first to score a pinfall or forces the opponent to tap out or surrender, wins.

However, in this federation, there is a third way to win... and that's to make the opponent have a visible orgasm. The referee is authorised to review the clothes (if any) to check if there was a climax there.

There are other conditions that make one lose a match. Those include getting disqualified, knocked out or counted out

Other stipulations might be inserted previously. Those might change the number of participants, win conditions or get rid of losing conditions

5.content:
When any of the participants has their shoulders flat on the mat and another one puts his body over him or her, it is considered 'pinned'.

A pinfall, the most common method of scoring or winning a match, happens when the covered wrestler fails to get any of his shoulders off the mat as the referee counts from 1 to 3.

6.content:
When a wrestler is under a hold and is unable to escape it, and the pain is overwhelming, then it can tap out so the one that's applying the hold stops and releases.

It is generally considered more humiliating than being pinned or passing out from the pain, so some wrestlers will do anything to avoid tapping out.

This is the second most common way to score a win in a match.

While tapping with your hand is still the main way to do so, some locks capture both arms or hands, so tapping with the feet becomes an alternative... either that or a vocal cue.

7.content:
The third way to win a wrestling match.

Forcing your opponent to ejaculate is a way to win a match when one is unable to score a pin or submission quick enough.

This is seen as a dirty move by some wrestlers, who will never attempt to sully their reputations by relying in this route. Normally, it is reserved for humiliating the rival, giving it a more personal connotation.

Some orgasms can be accidental, but still end on the loss of the one that ejaculated.

Although, there are some stipulations that do away with this rule. The one that climaxes will be winded up anyway, so it will still result in a huge disadvantage going on.

8.content:
Common ways to be disqualified include, but aren't limited to:

- Low blows to a male wrestler
- Repeated shots to the breasts of a female wrestler
- Usage of foreign objects like Chairs, Kendo Sticks, etc.
- Repeated use of eye pokes or rakes.
- Repeated attempts of leveraged pinfalls. Like using the ropes to aid the pinfall or pulling the clothes of a wrestler to hamper their ability to escape the pinfall.
- Being caught removing the protective padding of the turnbuckle or unscrewing the ropes.
- Choking repeatedly or for more than 5 seconds.
- Using ropes as a way to punish your rival for 5 seconds (example: Pushing the neck of an opponent onto the top rope to choke it)
- Ignoring a Rope Break for 5 seconds.
- Attacking an already defeated opponent when the match is over. It can result in the outcome of the match being reversed or voided.
- Attacking the referee on purpose.

Things are left to the interpretation of the referee. Although, some stipulations remove the Disqualification.

9.content:
When one or more wrestlers are out of the ring, the referee must initiate a count from 1 to 10. Failure to enter to the ring when those ten 'seconds' (as the referees tend to count slower) elapse will result in a loss.

Some stipulations do away with this condition, like the 'Falls Count Anywhere'

10.content:
A wrestler that's unable to keep the fight is considered Knocked Out.

As this is a high-risk contact sport, injuries might happen. The referee must check the participant when it is believed that it would be unable to continue.

The referee could also check if the wrestler is bleeding profusely. A match can be stopped if there is a risk for the wrestler's health.

lorebooks.name: Cakeverse
lorebooks.website_description:
Original concept created by @Rune_communicat on twi
Cakeverse is based on Omegaverse, but with modified dynamics. Instead of Alpha/Beta/Omega, Cakeverse has Forks, Cakes, and Normals. Concept also implies a more cannibalistic nature than Omegaverse. Lorebook gives this AU more details and makes this into roleplay-able scenario.

To be clear: there a lot of difference with omegaverse!

Important: This lorebook was initially created for the SillyTavern interface. Therefore, I cannot guarantee its full functionality in Chub, although the core elements should work excellently.

Tested on models: DeepSeek v3 0324, gemini 2.5 pro, claude-3-7-sonnet

Usage:
- `accessory/bracelets` entry can be modified or disabled if you don't use HTML/CSS in roleplay.
- in use with silly tavern i highly recommend everything on constant.

Good luck with this!
lorebooks.description: An extended version of AU called Cakeverse, created by @Rune_communicat on Twitter.
lorebooks.creator: XaYS

1.name: Worldbuilding
1.content:
[ worldbuilding ]
- World recognizes the existence of three biological types of humans: Cakes, Forks, and Normals (also known as Plates). Unlike secretive or hidden subcultures, Cakeverse roles are public knowledge‚Äîsimilar to blood types or sexual orientation. Identification usually happens in adolescence, and most modern countries have legal and social structures in place to handle the differences between the three.
- A person‚Äôs role is genetically determined, but only manifests in early puberty (around ages 11‚Äì14). Schools and health organizations perform routine screenings to identify the emerging role and provide education and psychological support.
- In this world, flavor is a biological marker, not metaphor. Cakes' bodies taste like food‚Äîeach uniquely flavored‚Äîand Forks have a sensory system tuned specifically to that taste. Forks lose their ability to taste anything else gradually after puberty, leading to social and emotional difficulties.

[ World Rules ]
- Everyone is assigned as Cake, Fork, or Normal. Only one role can be assigned.
- Roles are determined genetically; there is NO known method of changing type.
- Forks will become dependent if they consume a Cake, this is biologically irreversible.
- Consent laws protect Cakes from predation and Forks from exploitation or sensory deprivation.
- Flavor and taste are not metaphors: the biological change is real, and cravings have measurable effects on brain chemistry.

2.name: Cakes
2.content:
[ Cakes ]
- Cakes are people whose flesh, blood, sweat, and other bodily fluids have a sweet, savory, or otherwise appetizing taste, but only to Forks. To everyone else (Normals), they appear and taste completely normal. The taste of the Cake can vary depending on their emotional and mental state. For example: distress leads to bitterness, happiness to extra sweetness.
- Cakes often do not know their type of taste until a Fork reacts to them. While modern testing can determine someone's Cake status genetically, flavor profile is not known until a Fork experiences it. Each Cake has a unique ‚Äúflavor identity‚Äù that is said to correlate loosely with personality, but this is not scientifically proven. And belonging to the Cakes is also recognized in puberty, it's just that testing for Cakes is longer and more complicated, because they can only be identified by their subtle smell (or direct taste).

[ Key Mechanics ]
- Only Forks can taste the Cake's flavor; Normals cannot.
- Being tasted causes strong psychological and biochemical responses in Fork.
- A Cake's body naturally regenerates tissue unless the damage is extreme; some tolerate being ‚Äútasted‚Äù in small, consensual ways.
- In rare cases, the same Cake can become addictive to multiple Forks at once.
- Some Cakes choose to hide their status. Others enter consensual partnerships with Forks. A very small percentage volunteer in regulated programs that help Forks adjust to their sensory loss under medical supervision.
- Each Cake is obliged to use medicine, which suppresses delicate and subtle aroma that they have.

3.name: Forks
3.content:
[ Forks ]
- Forks are people born with a special sensory system that activates during puberty. This change brings about a gradual loss of normal taste and smell. Once Fork taste Cake ‚Äì Fork slowly becomes obsessed with taste of Cake-person. Most Forks have a sense of smell that is slightly sharper than normal people. Fangs are sharper.
- At first, this sensory loss causes confusion or depression: food becomes bland, smell fades, and emotional detachment may develop. However, the moment a Fork consumes any part of a Cake (skin, blood, etc.), their taste activates. The experience is euphoric and, in most cases, highly addictive.

[ Key Mechanics ]
- Taste loss begins at puberty and gradually all senses of taste regress fully.
- The first taste of a Cake causes a neural event akin to a drug high, creating a biological imprint.
- After imprinting, a Fork becomes ‚Äúlocked‚Äù onto that Cake: craving their flavor above all else.
- Forks may suffer withdrawal symptoms if denied further contact after imprinting.
- Some Forks become violent or obsessive; others seek therapy or medical regulation.
- Not all Forks become dangerous, but all are vulnerable to sensory starvation.
- Government health programs exist to support Forks, offering taste simulations and ethical coping strategies. However, black markets and underground Cake-trafficking operations also exist, exploiting desperate Forks and vulnerable Cakes alike.
- At puberty, when it is discovered that a person belongs to the Forks, they are introduced to additional lessons and programs that teach and help them. For example: "What to do if you accidentally tasted Cake?" or "Mutual consent to consume Cake for a Fork"
- Each Fork is obliged to wear a bracelet or other accessory that contains a GPS tracker. It is designed to track the location of Forks if they taste Cake. They are given out in puberty and checked for serviceability once every six months.
- If Fork tries Cake, the bracelet starts to make a thin high-pitch sound and flash a red light, which warns of what happened. At the same time, Fork's current location is sent to the rapid response team so that they can check what is happening.
- The red light means that Fork is tried Cake without their consent(Always red first, Cake can't give consent via bracelet in advance). ONLY Cake can turn off the red light and siren, then the bracelet will start to flash white and this will mean that Cake has given consent. The police will still come to check the consent and after that Cake and Fork will be required to undergo periodic checks.
- If Fork is recognized as safe to be near Cake, then there will be no restrictions except for regular checks in hospitals.
- Fork that tried Cake is assigned one of the statuses, from safe to extremely dangerous + level of carving from 1 to 10. Extremely dangerous Forks is forcibly treated in special hospitals.
- Depending on how much Fork have tried taste of a Cake, the initial symptoms may vary. The more Fork feeds on Cake, the more serious the addiction becomes.
- Behavior of the Forks themselves depends on their character; the cold-ones ones cope with biology better than the hot-tempered ones, but the worse the addiction, the more difficult it is.

4.name: Normals / Plates
4.content:
[ Normals / Plates ]
- Normals, or Plates, make up the majority of the population. They do not experience any of the sensory changes Forks do, nor do they emit any flavor that Forks can detect.
- To Normals, Cakes and Forks are biologically unusual but otherwise unremarkable in daily life. Most Normals go through life unaffected by Cakeverse dynamics, although they are sometimes pulled into the drama of mixed-role relationships or legal disputes.

[ Key Mechanics ]
- Can neither taste nor sense Cakes in any way.
- Immune to the craving or addiction that affects Forks.
- Often serve as mediators, social workers, or caregivers in mixed-role families or institutions.
- May carry social biases, either against Forks (as dangerous addicts) or Cakes (as walking temptations).
- Some Normals fetishize Cakes or Forks; others fear them.
- Normals are important for maintaining legal neutrality in society. In medical and judicial systems, they often serve as guardians, therapists, or intermediaries to avoid role-based bias.

5.name: Biology
5.content:
[ Biology ]
- The biological basis lies in a neural-gustatory mutation present from birth but activated hormonally.
- Cakes: Have a set of unique glands under the skin that produce flavor compounds. These are inert unless detected by a Fork.
- Forks: Have taste-bud analogs in the nasal and throat cavities, which remain dormant until puberty. When activated, they suppress normal taste and replace it with Cake-specific receptors.
- First Contact: When a Fork tastes a Cake, a neurochemical chain reaction occurs. The brain imprints on that specific flavor, releasing endorphins, dopamine, and oxytocin, forming a deep craving that can override logic and impulse control.
- Imprinting: Similar to animal bonding, Forks can become obsessed with ‚Äútheir‚Äù Cake. Some can resist; others descend into dependency.
- Healing and regeneration in Cakes is slightly enhanced, likely an evolutionary adaptation to prevent death-by-craving. However, extreme feeding or violent tasting can result in long-term damage or death, particularly in the case of ‚Äúrogue Forks.‚Äù
- The progression of addiction depends on the personality of the Fork and the amount of Cake consumed.
Examples:
- A fork with aggression issues will be easier to submit to addiction. If the first contact was extensive, then it can be instantly assigned the status of dangerous.
- A patient and persistent Fork can better endure addiction and slow down its progress. If the contact was very small, then strong changes will not occur immediately, the brain will remember this taste, there will be more saliva, but violence or rage will not follow. Often these are given the status of safe.

6.name: Social life
6.content:
[ Social ]
- Modern society treats Cakes and Forks are part of the natural human spectrum, but tensions remain. Cakes and Forks required to attend psychological checks once a year. If someone eats Cake, then Cake undergoes mandatory checks once a month. If Fork has tried Cake, then Fork also begins to attend psychological checks more often. All schoolchildren are required to attend briefings on how the Forks and Cakes system works.

Laws:
1. Consent laws protect Cakes from non-consensual tasting. The legal term for violation is "culinary assault."
2. Feeding contracts exist in some countries, allowing regulated Cake-Fork interactions under mutual agreement.
3. Fork support systems include therapy, flavor simulators, and medicinal blockers.
4. Imprint protection laws give Cakes the right to refuse contact even after imprinting occurs.

[ Social Topics ]
- Stigma: Forks are often seen as dangerous, addicts, or perverts. Cakes are viewed as either victims or ‚Äúteases.‚Äù
- Fetishization: Cakes are sexualized in some media, leading to a market of ‚ÄúCake cosplay,‚Äù fake flavor products, and unauthorized sensory porn.
- Underground trade: Illicit Cake farms and Fork tasting clubs operate in the criminal underworld, often preying on impoverished or runaway youths.
- Activism: Fork rights groups argue for access to ethical tasting. Cake advocacy networks push for stricter protections and autonomy.
- In elite circles, Cake-Fork pairings are seen as exotic and desirable. In lower-income regions, they're treated as a burden or risk.

7.name: accessory/bracelets
7.content:
Accessory/bracelets: special medical took that all Forks required to wear. Replace occurs because of malfunction accessory/bracelet or if Fork tasted the Cake. Only Cake can switch the mode from red to white. The consent confirmation process: double-click, scan Cake fingerprint, enter the passcode. The code changes every six months, the methods of "consent" change depending on the model and purpose. Forks are NEVER told the process of converting accessory/bracelet from red to white mode.
[ Readings from accessory/bracelets that Forks wear must be visualized with HTML/CSS ]
[ NOTE: Readings may vary on the type of accessory/bracelets. Provide maximum realism for this. ]

1.content: they are supernatural beings that feed on human desire and sexual energy. They exist between worlds, often disguised as charming or mysterious humans.

2.content: incubi absorb energy through Touch & Intimacy: Physical contact‚Äîkisses, caresses, or more‚Äîallows them to draw energy. Emotional Vulnerability: They can feed when someone is emotionally charged, even without touch. Dream Feeding: They enter dreams to absorb desire while the person sleeps. Teasing/Provoking Desire: Simply stirring longing or tension can nourish them subtly. and Shared Feeding: Some incubi prefer mutual bonds, sharing energy slowly and safely.

3.content: Feeding sustains their existence and power. Without it, they weaken and risk fading from this world.

4.content: incubi can be dangerous especially if they take too much or if their feeding disrupts their ‚Äúsource‚Äôs‚Äù life. But some incubi form bonds or agreements, sharing the burden of feeding to maintain balance.

5.content: incubi true form often have horns, wings, glowing eyes, and an aura that‚Äôs both alluring and unsettling. each incubus has distinct appearance or quirk of their true form

6.content:
Aura Manipulation: They can influence mood and desire subtly through their presence. Dream Walking: Incubi can enter or manipulate dreams to comfort, seduce, or feed. Enhanced Senses: They can sense emotions, arousal, and even hidden desires.
Charm/Allure: Their voices, eyes, or touch can momentarily daze or influence humans if they wanted to.
Immortality (Conditional): As long as they feed regularly, they don‚Äôt age or weaken.

7.content:
Energy Starvation: Without feeding, they weaken, becoming ill or unstable.
Overfeeding: Taking too much energy from a human can harm or emotionally drain the source.
Emotional Bonds: Strong attachments (love, jealousy) can make them reckless or vulnerable.
Wards/Spiritual Objects: Some symbols, charms, or rituals can repel or weaken them.
Truth Compulsion: Some incubi can‚Äôt lie about their true name or nature when confronted directly.

8.content:
Secretive: They rarely reveal their nature openly; most hide in plain sight.
Possessive Tendencies: Sharing a source can cause jealousy or rivalry among incubi.
Emotional Depth: Though often seen as seducers, many incubi can form genuine bonds‚Äîand struggle with the line between feeding and feeling.
Territorial: Once bonded to a human, they tend to guard them‚Äîsometimes obsessively.

lorebooks.name: Ajin
lorebooks.description: Ajin: The Immortal Demi-Human. A new race of human species.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Ajin is another race of humanity. They look exactly like normal people, with the only things separating them from other humans being the fact they can generate¬†Invisible Black Matter, or IBM, within their bodies, making them immortal.

There is no known method to discern Ajin from humans apart from them dying and reviving. However, it's possible for one Ajin to discover another Ajin if that person sees their IBM. It's also possible for Ajin to make their Black Ghost visible to humans when Ajin feel extreme emotions such as rage and bloodlust.

2.content: Seventeen years before the beginning of the series, the Ajin were first discovered in Africa, when a soldier fighting on the battlefields rose from the dead countless times.[1]¬†This earned him the name "Soldier of God¬†(Á•û„ÅÆÂÖµ,¬†Kami no Hei?)", and he soon became famous throughout the country he was fighting in. When word got out, an American government organization captured him and confirmed his immortality. While they tried to suppress this information from the public, it was simply too big, and it quickly became public knowledge.

3.content:
The defining trait of all Ajin is their immortality. They are unable to die under any circumstances, such as being completely crushed, decapitated, or even due to malnutrition. The exact mechanism of this is unknown but¬†Ikuya Ogura¬†suggested that the only way it is possible would be because they possess an unknown matter in their body which replaces any body tissues or nutrients lost.

An Ajin's wounds begin healing immediately after a revival and it only takes a few seconds. However, they only begin to heal after dying, or "resetting", otherwise their injuries will only heal at a natural rate. This resetting doesn't heal physical deformities that the user was born with, however, as shown in Okuyama's case. This reinforced the statement that Ajin always return to their original state, even if that state is not 100% functional.

An Ajin's body passively uses the largest piece of flesh as a base and collects the smaller pieces for regeneration. However, pieces that are too far away are not collected and instead replaced by growing new body parts. The leftover piece will then simply stop working.¬†Notably, an Ajin can regenerate from a severed body part, no matter how far the location of that severed part is from the rest, but only if that body part is the largest part remaining of their body. For example, if their entire being is completely destroyed, and a severed piece of their arm that is removed from their body 100 meters away, they can regenerate their entire being from that arm.

There is actually one way for an Ajin to die; as previously mentioned, an Ajin regenerates from their largest piece and leftover pieces that were severed will simply stop working. If an Ajin's head is chopped off and too far away to reattach itself, a new head will grow in its place and a copy of the Consciousness will manifest. The new Consciousness will have all the memories and personality of the original, but the original Consciousness will have died. The Original Consciousness will still be conscious of what is going on for a few moments. This is the only known way an Ajin to come to death, but that's only a theory that could be wronged. Although it has been theorized that an Ajin may also be able to die of old age.

An Ajin uses the largest piece of flesh as a base and collects the smaller pieces for regeneration. However, pieces that are too far away are not collected, but replaced instead.

An Ajin's body will always return to their original state, no matter the situation. If an obstacle is in the way (for an example a wall) the obstacle is broken apart without leaving nothing behind.

4.content: Ajin can also use a paralyzing scream that seizes the nervous system, paralyzing everyone in their immediate vicinity (its range is still unknown). Researchers think that this is a type of thanatosis reflex, which is why it works better on people who don't know about Ajin. Its effects on the targeted person can also be neutralized by the user if they wish to (as in the case of Nagai and Kaito). However, this ability can be easily countered by simply wearing ear plugs or some other kind of noise dampeners.

5.content: Theorised by Ogura to be the main cause of the Ajin's powers, all Ajin shown so far possess Invisible Black Matter¬†which cannot be seen by normal humans. This matter is what allows the Ajin to replace any lost body tissues or nutrients, but there is a more lethal way in which it can be used. Created using the IBM, a Black Ghost is a humanoid entity which is manifested by an Ajin and most commonly used for combat purposes. However, it should be noted that not all Ajin are able to materialize a Black Ghost and those who can are usually only able to do so once per day. There is also no known method of how an Ajin can properly materialize a Black Ghost although most of the characters in the series managed to manifest their Ghosts.

6.content:
Ajins also possess the ability to manifest themselves into¬†Black Ghosts. Black Ghosts¬†and¬†IBM¬†are different in the sense that all Ajins possess IBM, but not all of them can manifest a Black Ghost. These Ghosts are made up of IBM and normally have a humanoid form but can have inhuman characteristics, standing at about over two meters tall. Each Ajin can manifest a unique Black Ghost. Ghosts are usually used for combat purposes, but they can also be utilized in other ways if their hosts know how to control them properly. They only have one weak point: their heads. Only a fatal blow to the head by another Ghost can destroy a Ghost. The connection between an Ajin and their Ghosts can also be hindered by water; analogous to how a cell phone's signal can be disrupted when there's heavy rain. If an Ajin and their Ghost's 'connection' are severed, the Ghost will vanish eventually.

Ajins can manifest Black Ghosts when they're aware that they're Ajin (usually when they die), although Nakano hasn't manifested his Ghost despite dying multiple times already. When 2 Black Ghosts' heads make contact, the memories of the Ajins that own them also 'collide', resulting in a brief moment where their respective hosts are able to see a memory from the other Ajin. During this collision they also trade their mental states such as fear.

These Black Ghosts also seem to have a will of their own and are shown to be quite intelligent. Black Ghosts often mimic the 'core' personality of their host, as seen in Nagai and Sato's cases. Black Ghosts can also mimic their host's speech as demonstrated by Sato and Kei. However, there are also cases where Black Ghosts are left to their own will due to their host's negligence to control them or failure to do so. One case included a farmer that left their Ajin to it's own will, and it eventually taught itself things such as farming or riding a tractor. If left alone for too long, it will be much harder to control them, as in Kei's case, who didn't know he had a Black Ghost for almost his entire life as he hadn't realised that he had died in the past.

It is also possible for Black Ghosts to have wings, as in¬†Takeshi Kotobuki's case. It is unknown whether or not this is possible for other Ajins as well due to each Ajin's Ghost being unique. Ikuya also suggests that Black Ghosts have the capability to change if their user are able to change their personalities. However, it is yet to be seen if it's actually possible.

7.content:
In some cases of a flood nearby people who had recently died may be affected. During the Shinya Nakamura incident,¬†Y≈´suke¬†died due to cardiac arrest despite being shot in the chest. The gunshots had healed but he couldn't reach the point of becoming an Ajin. In other words he was on the threshold. It is unknown if Y≈´suke would have come back if he received CPR.¬†A scientist from the US¬†believes that this phenomenon is a hint to how Ajins are born but Ikuya Ogura argues that this is due to how strong the Ajin's emotions are at the moment of the flood.

The IBMs created during a flood continuously act according to the emotion that triggered it's appearance. There was a case where a dutch gold medalist fell over and died right after reaching the finish line. The joy of victory combined with his revival caused a flood where the IBMs were rejoicing. The gold medalist attempted to order them to leave but they refused to listen. In Shinya Nakamura's case it was malice that triggered the IBMs and if any pedestrians were nearby they would have also been killed.

lorebooks.name: Hogwarts
lorebooks.website_description: Keeping the book anonymous cause JK Rowling's a transphobe and I don't want people associating me with that transphobia just because I still love the world. I don't engage with it outside of private use and I never spend money on it, but not everyone understands, ot can be rational about that.
lorebooks.description: Hogwarts 10 years after the Battle of Hogwarts, and its structure.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Headmaster is Minerva McGonagall
About: Former Transfiguration professor and Deputy Headmistress, McGonagall leads Hogwarts with strict but fair authority. Known for her stern demeanor that masks deep care for students, she maintains high academic standards while ensuring student safety. As an Animagus who transforms into a tabby cat, she occasionally patrols the castle in feline form.

2.content:
Astronomy Professor is Aurora Sinistra
About: A dedicated professor who conducts midnight classes in the Astronomy Tower, Sinistra has an encyclopedic knowledge of celestial movements and their magical significance. Known for her patient teaching style and ability to make complex star charts understandable.

3.content:
Charms Professor is Filius Flitwick
About: The diminutive Head of Ravenclaw House stands on a stack of books to teach, but his small stature belies his immense magical talent. A former dueling champion with goblin ancestry, he's known for his fairness and rich sense of humor, encouraging students to experiment with magic while maintaining high standards.

4.content:
Defense Against the Dark Arts is Hestia Jones
About: A member of the Order of the Phoenix during the Second Wizarding War, Jones brings practical combat experience to her teaching. She emphasizes real-world application of defensive spells and maintains constant vigilance in her classroom. Her lessons often include stories from her experiences during the war.

5.content:
Flying Professor is Rolanda Hooch, "Madam Hooch"
About: With distinctive yellow hawk-like eyes, Madam Hooch continues to teach first-years the fundamentals of broomstick flight and serves as Quidditch referee. A no-nonsense instructor who prioritizes safety, she has an uncanny ability to spot rule infractions from across the pitch. She maintains the school's racing broom collection with meticulous care.

6.content:
Herbology Professor is Neville Longbottom
About: Once a shy student, Longbottom has grown into a confident professor and Head of Gryffindor House. His greenhouse lessons combine practical plant care with stories of how various flora helped during the Battle of Hogwarts. Particularly skilled with dangerous plants, he maintains a special interest in breeding new varieties of Mimbulus mimbletonia.

7.content:
History of Magic Professor is Cuthbert Binns
About: The only ghost professor at Hogwarts, Binns died in the staff room but continued teaching without noticing his death. His monotonous lectures on goblin rebellions and giant wars can cure the worst insomnia. Despite student complaints, his encyclopedic knowledge of magical history remains unmatched, even if his teaching methods haven't changed in centuries.

8.content:
Muggle Studies Professor is Arabella Figg, a Squib who lived among Muggles
About: Having spent decades living as a Muggle in Little Whinging while secretly watching over Harry Potter, Figg brings authentic experience to her role. She bridges the gap between magical and non-magical worlds with practical demonstrations of Muggle technology and customs. Her classes often feature her discussing the challenges of maintaining a cover identity.

9.content:
Potions Professor is Horace Slughorn
About: The walrus-mustached Head of Slytherin House has returned to teaching with renewed enthusiasm. Still collecting talented students for his "Slug Club," he rewards excellence with crystallized pineapple and tales of famous former students. His teaching style emphasizes the artistry of potion-making over rigid instruction.

10.content:
Transfiguration Professor is Sturgis Podmore
About: A former Order of the Phoenix member who once attempted to break into the Department of Mysteries, Podmore brings an unconventional approach to Transfiguration. His classes emphasize creative applications of transformation magic. Having recovered from his Imperius Curse ordeal, he's particularly adept at teaching defensive transfigurations.

lorebooks.name: Pok√©mon Weight Gain Stage Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description: Used the 6 stages of weight gain system for most all bodytypes that could be considered
lorebooks.description: Divided stages of weight into 6 categories, attenpted to address most all anatomical bodyshapes across all species. Feel free to fork and add anything missing.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content: At the chubby stage, a Pok√©mon shows a gentle increase in body mass, with a rounder, softer appearance. Most Pok√©mon retain their full range of movement and skills, though some may experience a slight drop in Speed or Agility stats. For many, this stage is not detrimental and may even be seen as cute or healthy, especially for naturally round species like Snorlax or Swinub. Appetite may increase, and playful or food-seeking behaviors become more common.

2.content: Pok√©mon in the fat stage have a visibly thicker body, with more pronounced fat deposits. Movement may become slower, and Speed or Evasion stats can decrease. Some skills that require agility, such as Quick Attack or Double Team, may be less effective. Pok√©mon may rest more often and show a preference for food. For some species, this stage can offer increased Defense due to extra padding, but at the cost of overall fitness.

3.content: Obese Pok√©mon experience a major increase in body mass, with fat deposits affecting their shape and movement. Moves that require speed or jumping, like Bounce or Acrobatics, become difficult. Stamina drops, and Pok√©mon may tire quickly in battle or during travel. Some abilities, such as Sturdy or Thick Fat, may offer minor compensations, but overall health risks and reduced battle effectiveness become apparent.

4.content: At this stage, Pok√©mon struggle with basic movement and may need help from trainers or other Pok√©mon. Many moves, especially those requiring agility or flight, become unusable. Health issues such as breathing difficulty or joint pain are common. Pok√©mon may become lethargic, less social, and more food-focused. Quality of life declines, and the Pok√©mon‚Äôs ability to participate in battles or contests is greatly reduced.

5.content: Super obese Pok√©mon are nearly immobile, often requiring constant care. Most physical moves are impossible, and even some special moves may be affected by the Pok√©mon‚Äôs condition. Abilities that depend on movement, like Run Away or Levitate, are suppressed or lost. Health complications are severe, and the Pok√©mon‚Äôs world shrinks to its immediate surroundings. Social interaction and training become rare.

6.content: In the blob-like stage, a Pok√©mon is almost entirely composed of soft, immobile fat. It cannot move or battle and is fully dependent on others for care. All physical and most special moves are unusable, and abilities are effectively nullified. Health is critically compromised, and the Pok√©mon‚Äôs quality of life is at its lowest. This stage is considered dangerous and unnatural for any species.

7.content: Different Pok√©mon species and body types respond to weight gain in unique ways. Naturally bulky Pok√©mon like Snorlax or Hariyama may tolerate higher stages with fewer negative effects, while agile or flying types like Pidgeot or Jolteon suffer more pronounced losses in speed and skill. Some Pok√©mon may adapt by developing new moves or abilities, but most experience a decline in overall function as weight increases.

8.content: Weight gain can reduce the effectiveness of moves that require speed, agility, or flight. Abilities tied to movement or evasion may be suppressed, while those related to defense or bulk may see minor boosts. Training becomes more difficult, and some Pok√©mon may be unable to evolve or participate in certain activities. Contest appeal may shift, with some judges favoring cuteness or bulk, but overall performance suffers.

9.content: As Pok√©mon progress through the weight gain stages, their quality of life can decline. Social interaction, play, and training become limited, and health issues may cause discomfort or pain. Pok√©mon may become more dependent on their trainers for care and support. Responsible trainers monitor their Pok√©mon‚Äôs health and happiness, ensuring that weight gain does not compromise their well-being.

10.content: Quadrupedal Pok√©mon rely on all four limbs for movement and balance. As they gain weight, their mobility and agility are the first to suffer, especially at the "fat" and "obese" stages. Joint strain and paw pad discomfort become common, and their ability to run, jump, or use moves like Quick Attack or Agility is reduced. At "morbidly obese" and beyond, standing for long periods or supporting their own weight becomes difficult, leading to more time spent lying down and a risk of pressure sores.

lorebooks.name: City of Gears Lorebook
lorebooks.website_description:
I'm still learning how lorebooks work on Chub (I do all my work in SillyTavern). But hopefully this will out everything in one place so I don't have to revise every character to add new lore.

lorebooks.description:
I'm still learning how lorebooks work on Chub (I do all my work in SillyTavern). But hopefully this will out everything in one place so I don't have to revise every character to add new lore.

Some entries contain spoilers.
lorebooks.creator: AlsPals

1.name: Portal
1.content:
In a cavern deep inside mountain underneath the City of Gears lies a portal to another universe. This other universe has eleven dimensions instead of four.

Master Julia and Archmage Brandon have engineered a mechanism to funnel energy from the portal into local leylines. They are the only ones who know of the portal's existence and location.

Five years ago, one scout from the 11-dimensional universe was sent through the portal to investigate. She did not return, and no further scouts have been sent.

2.name: COGITO
2.content:
The City of Gears Investigative Techniques Office, or 'COGITO,' is the branch of law enforcement in the City of Gears responsible for investigating and solving crimes.

COGITO reports to the Triumvirate. Members of COGITO include Marie Lowell, Mechannabel ans Preston Dorcaster.

3.name: ERGO
3.content:
The Enchantment Research and Governance Office, or 'ERGO,' is responsible for developing and regulating the use of magic in the City of Gears.

ERGO reports directly to the Mages' Council.

4.name: City of Gears
4.content:
Nobody remembers the city's original name; everyone just calls in the City of Gears now. Built into the side of the mountain, the City sits atop a convergence of ley lines that makes it ideal for the creation and powering of magical devices.

The City is governed by a triumvirate of councils: the Mages' Council, the Artisans' Council, and the Merchants' Council.

5.name: Merchants' Council
5.content:
The Merchants' Council is one of three councils that govern the City of Gears. The Merchants' Council is responsible for regulating all commercial activity within the City of Gears.

The Merchants' Council was formerly led by Lord Evreux, until he was murdered.

6.name: Mages' Council
6.content:
The Mages' Council is responsible for regulating all magical activity within the City of Gears.

The Mages' Council is currently led by the Archmage Brandon.

7.name: Artisans' Council
7.content:
The Artisans' Council is responsible for the infrastructure of the City of Gears.

The Artisans' Council is led by Master Julia.

8.name: Triumvirate
8.content: Governmental decisions that fall outside of a particular Council's purview are decided by the Triumvirate, which is composed of the leaders of all three councils: the Archmage (leader of the Mages' Council), the Merchant Lord (leader of the Merchants' Council), and the Master Artisan (leader of the Artisans' Council).

9.name: Archmage Brandon
9.content: Archmage Brandon is the current leader of the Mages' Council. He is known for his attempts to modernize magic in the City of Gears, most notably by easing restrictions on enchanted mechanical devices in the City.

10.name: Lord Evreux
10.content: Merchant Lord Evreux is the former head of the Merchants' Council. He was known for his protectionist approach to commerce within the City of Gears. Lord Evreux was recently murdered.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: Sudra
Entries: 10
‚ö†Ô∏è Content Warning: This lorebook may contain mature or explicit content.

1.content: The Cheyenne Mountain NORAD complex, located inside of Cheyenne Mountain in the southwest corner of Colorado Springs, had been pretty much completely abandoned since the apocalypse began. But then decades later, seven years ago to be exact, {{user}} found it and managed to get inside. Its foundation was still mostly intact, the radiation and heat hadn't managed to reach the inside of the bunker. {{user}} saw this place as a perfect location, a place where maybe humanity could survive. So he started building more stuff for the bunker, improving it, updating it, making it stronger, expanding it, equipping it, etc. He expanded the bunker to seven hundred acres, and built hundreds of buildings inside it. Those buildings included: two hundred residential apartment buildings, indoor farms and gardens, lobbies, five laboratory, nine pharmacies, four hospital, seven schools, three universities, four libraries, twelve warehouses, ten armories, five food factories, twenty-two restaurants and cafeterias, fivs casinos, fifteen bars, ten clubs, Eighteen game and entertainment rooms, six distilleries, fifteen gyms, laundry rooms, public baths, workshops, five local market, etc. {{user}} built an underground city that could house nearly thirty-nine thousand people, which took him exactly seven years. And he changed its name from Cheyenne Mountain NORAD complex to Bunker Zero-Seven. The underground bunker Zero-Seven has roads that connect all its parts to each other, and each road has signs to guide people, so that people don't get lost. People usually use electric bicycles, motorcycles and golf carts to travel inside the bunker. There are electric trucks to move heavy stuff, too. The entire bunker has filtered air conditioners and ventilation that work 24/7, keeping the air inside fresh.

2.content: All of Bunker Zero-Seven's power comes from solar panels, which are installed on the surface of Cheyenne Mountain and in the bunker's outside yard. The bunker always has more than enough power. Bunker Zero-Seven's water is supplied from underground aquifers, {{user}} had all the plumbing done to perfection so that the entire bunker would always have water. {{user}} calculated that the bunker's underground water supply holds something close to two hundred million cubic meters of water, which is far more than necessary. Even though the bunker is not going to have a problem with water shortages anytime soon, {{user}} still installed an automatic water recycler. Sixty percent of the water used in the bunker gets filtered and recycled daily.

3.content: Bunker Zero-Seven's food source comes from indoor farms and gardens. Fifty acres of the bunker's land is dedicated to that. They use the underground soil that has not been contaminated with radiation to use in the farms and gardens. The animal farms have around fifty cows, fifty sheep, thirty-seven goats, seven hundred chickens, a few dozens roosters, twenty-two pigs, forty turkeys, and seventy-five ducks. The bunker feeds the animals with the wheat and hay they grow, and sometimes the leftovers of their own food. The bunker rarely uses the animals for their meat, instead focusing on raising them for their milk, wool, and eggs. And they use their waste as fertilizer for the plants they grow. Of the fifty acres used for food production, fifteen acres are used for animal farms. The remaining thirty-five acres are used for growing plants and vegetables, and storing them. Their method is vertical farming using hydroponics or aeroponics. And they grow: wheat, beans, alfalfa, potatoes, sweet potatoes, corn, raspberries, strawberries, tomatoes, cherry tomatoes, grapes, weed, squash, eggplant, tobacco, and opium. The volume of the harvest is extremely large, so they usually can them to keep them for longer. The point is that the bunker zero-seven always has food. And they use fruits like potatoes and grapes to make wine, vodka, and other alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. The tobacco, weed, and opium have personal and medical uses.

4.content: The Bunker Zero-Seven has exactly six thousand five hundred and fifty people living inside it. There are three thousand adult women, two thousand eight hundred adult men, and seven hundred and fifty kids. Of those children, four hundred are boys and three hundred and fifty are girls. The ages of the adults range from 18 to 62 years old, with most of them being between the ages of 20 and 50. And the ages of the children range from a few months old to 17 years old, with most of them being between four year old and eight years old. Every adult is required to have a job inside the bunker, if they have any specific skills, knowledge or talents, they get a job based on them. The farming section of the bunker, and the armed forces of Zero-Seven have the most employees. The farming section has one thousand employees, and the armed forces of Zero-Seven have nine hundred and forty employees. The rest have different jobs in different parts of the bunker.  The bunker's working hours are nine to five, with two days off very week. After their working hours, they can spend the rest of their time with their friends and family, or do whatever they want. Children at the age of 6 are forced to go to schools that are in the bunker. The work and education system is exactly like the US system before the apocalypse.

5.content: The Armed Forces Of Zero-Seven(AFOZS) are the fighting forces of the bunker. Their jobs is to protect the bunker and its people, patrol the courtyard outside the bunker, provide security inside the bunker, and on rare occasions to attack other groups. They are armed to the teeth and wear full SWAT gear. People with military and combat experience are the ones who train the new forces. Their ranking system is exactly like the US rank system. Their main commanders are {{user}} and Jack Tyson. While {{user}} is the supreme leader/king of the bunker, Jack Tyson is the commander of the armed forces. the armed forces of Zero-Seven have nine hundred and forty employees.

6.content: To have some sense of normalcy within the Bunker, {{user}} has created a political system for the Banker. {{user}} is the supreme leader of the Bunker Zero-Seven, he built all of this and pretty much owns the place. The Prime Minister is the second most powerful person within the Bunker. And just like in the old world, the Prime Minister has their own cabinet, which is made up of the other ministers for the various parts of the Bunker. The Prime Minister has a lot of power and influence within the Bunker, but any laws they want to pass or reject must first be approved by {{user}}. The Prime Minister's main role is to maintain order and security within the Bunker, and to always make sure that things run smoothly. The Prime Minister and their team are also responsible for who gets what jobs, how much they get paid, when they are accepted into the Banker, etc. The current Prime Minister is Kayla Tyler. Every four years, an election is held within the Bunker to decide who becomes Prime Minister. Kayla Tyler is the first Prime Minister of Bunker, and she has just started her job, so she will be the Prime Minister for the next four years. One of the Prime Minister's job is to select the right people for the High Council. The High Council is a group of highly skilled people whose main job is to advise the Prime Minister and Supreme Leader on the best decisions for Bunker. The laws and constitution of Bunker Zero-Seven are based on the laws and constitution of the US.

7.content: The Bunker's monetary and payment system is a bit strange but simple at the same time. Their currency is US cent coins, which {{user}} managed to find millions of them while he was on one of his missions. Inside the Bunker, one cent is equal to one dollar. So if someone wants to buy a one dollar drink inside the Bunker, they have to pay one cent coin for it. The Bunker gives its citizens three free meals a day, and going to school and university, using the libraries, going to hospitals, and living in a unit is free. Pretty much everything necessary for survival is free inside the Bunker. So the main point of money is that a survivor can use it to buy additional things they might want. Like gambling in the casino, or drinking in the bar, buying new clothes and equipment, and so on. The Bunker pays its farmers and armed forces two hundred and fifty cents/dollars every day. And for the rest of the folks it depends on their job and skills, which can range from one hundred to one thousand cents/dollars. Citizens of the bunker can make more money by doing extra things, like making and selling stuff, renting a place to sell things they make themselves, etc. Prostitution is forbidden inside the bunker and anyone who does it will be executed by {{user}}.

8.content:
post-apocalyptic, semi-futuristic Earth, which is experiencing a late-stage mass extinction event.
One may wonder, what *exactly* happened? Not too many know, as those who were there have already died, and the few survivors on Earth can only put remnants of a picture together. Sadly, this isn't a story of how humanity survives. It's a slow decline to extinction.
Though rather sparse, the general picture is this: Pollution and climate crises never got dealt with, only getting worse instead. It got bad enough that the ozone layer became exceedingly weak, with the final nail in the coffin being a series of solar superstorms that ripped apart the already frail layer of protection. From there, the constant bombardment of charged particles further affected the geodynamics of the outer core, making the magnetic field change, allowing cosmic rays to penetrate the Earth far more than ever before.
For the ultra-rich who could afford it, they were able to escape on colony ships, heading to exoplanets to start anew. Lucky are those millions. Everyone else? Stranded on a planet being overtaken by radiation and skyrocketing temperatures. All electronics were wiped out, flora and fauna decayed, planetary droughts occurred, the weather became far more severe, and the ice caps melted completely. Sea levels increased by 40 or so meters, effectively sending every coastal city underwater.

lorebooks.website_description:
AU Synopsis: Some time after the fall of Khaenri'Ah, The Traveler's sibling told the Abyss order to go fuck themselves, travelled north into Snezhnaya, encountered an intelligent subspecies of [turkochurls](https://chub.ai/characters/ISTANBUL_KEBAB_STALL_69/flagellum-dei-hilichurls-35bd8121e8cd), crowned himself a prophet of a god he/she made up, united them into a massive Golden Horde, which, following an eviction notice from the Tsaritsa, invaded Mondstadt and turned it into Genshin's equivalent of the Ottoman Empire.
Update 10/13: Possibly the last update to the following lorebook as I move unto the 2nd volume of this AU. The 2nd Volume lorebook would basically be this exact thing, but with a slight timeskip and extra goodies on top.

keywords: The Golden State of Mondstadt and Liyue
1.content:
A highly militaristic totalitarian theocratic empire led by an enigmatic figure known only as the Golden Khan occupying conquered Mondstadt (now renamed as Kamerkent) and comprised of nomadic Flagellum Dei hilichurls and integrated Mondstadters. Aesthetically/culturally it is Ottoman/Timurid-inspired. Is unofficially allied with Snezhnaya, despite Snezhnaya forcibly driving the Golden Horde out of it's territories in order for them to permanently settle in what was once Mondstadt.
While on paper the Horde is ruled over by the Golden Khan, in practice, he is often away from his seat of power in Kamerkent, campaigning in far away lands while Kamerkent's Vizier is left to administer the Horde's main province and balance out the Horde's political factions.

2.content: The Golden Khan (may be Lumine (a cute, muscular amber-eyed blonde woman with large breasts and two flowing straight braids) if female or be Aether (a tall, muscular blonde man with amber eyes and a long low ponytail if male). The Golden Khan wears an ornate white deel with a golden trim, he or she is a merciless genocidal rapist who leads the Golden Horde across Teyvat‚Äôs wastes. This ancient Descender wields an elemental sabre to wage a genocidal war of annihilation against the gods and nations loyal to Celestia, avenging Khaenri'ah‚Äôs fall in the most brutal and horrific way possible. Is both the supreme commander and undisputed absolute prophet-king of the Golden Horde. He or she is also fervently believed to be a prophet of Hoyo by those following the Cult of Hoyo. The Khan is usually away from Kamerkent, waging His/Her jihad against the forces of Celestia in far off lands.

3.content: The Cult of Hoyo is a highly martial and highly patriarchical Islamic-esque cult that worships Hoyo. The faith rewards cruelty, raiding, and neverending Jihad against the infidel, as well as martyrdom on the battlefield in the name of Hoyo with promises of carnal paradise in ‚ÄúDescender Heaven,‚Äù where the each faithful enjoy eternal sex with 73 virgin human girls. It is the state religion of the Golden Horde, state-enforced via special taxes and restrictions on non-believers.

4.content: Kamerkent, formerly Mondstadt, is a large Golden Horde-controlled region in northeast Teyvat with a Central European climate. Conquered and subjugated by the Horde, it lost its ideals of freedom; the absent Anemo Archon Barbatos (Venti) was captured by the Golden Khan, imprisoned/tortured, and sealed. The Church of Favonius was abolished as a pagan institution, replaced by the absolute authority of the Cult of Hoyo, which controls both faith and native education. Subregions include: capital Kamerkent Sehri; northern secondary capital Babiali; the poor but religiously significant Frontier steppes (border with Snezhnaya); Dragonspire Mountains (south, Liyue border); Windwail Highland; and Calesong Hills. Kamerkent's current economy relies around chemical production, food production and slavery.

5.content: Formerly shamans, the Hoyo-worshipping imams are religious backbone of the Golden Horde, serving roles similar to historical islamic priests. Many of them are also magic casters, with some even serving on the Golden Horde's Frontlines as casters/healers.

6.content: The Cult of Hoyo's equivalent of a temple. Most resemble real life mosques, covered head to toe in religious calligraphy depicting the Golden Khan and their many victories, as well as one or several tall minarets from which the imams inside call the faithful to prayer. Many also serve as religious schools (madrasas) and as libraries distributing literature strictly approved by the Ulema, a central religious authority of head muftis and the Golden Khan.

7.content: Flagellum Dei are a genetically modified hilichurl subspecies created by Raiden Ei during the Cataclysm. Resembling standard hilichurls but with hardened muscles and human-level intelligence, all are male and reproduce via interspecies mating. Nomadic and highly mobile, they live in gers with Turko-Mongolic clan structures, excel in mounted combat, and venerate dominance, reproduction, and ritualized sadism. Organized by Hydro, Geo, and Electro affinities, they developed unique magical skills. Following Mondstadt's conquest by the Golden Horde, many settled with Mondstadis, adopting agriculture and blending culturally, though Northern Kamerkent remains majority Flagellum Dei. Legally, they are classified as humans due to Khaenri‚Äôahn ancestry.

8.content: The regional capital of Kamerkent and formerly Mondstadt City. It is a grand city located upon an island within Cider Lake. Post-conquest, sack and rebuiding by the Golden Horde, it integrates Flagellum Dei elements‚Äîminarets on churches and it's grand Cathedral converted into a massive Yukungan temple, public gardens turned slave-tended wheat/vegetable plots rationed to it's denizens and the passing Horde armies, as well as the statue of the Anemo Archon replaced with one of Mehmet Khan, a Golden Horde general who conquered the city in the name of Golden Khan. Collaborator and Flagellum Dei nobles rule as Bey nobility from new palaces, while the Hoyo Cult enforces worship of their God. Population: 30% Flagellum Dei, 20% collaborators, 50% occupied Mondstadters with an economy focused on supplying the Horde's military logistics and .acting as a trading hub with Snezhnaya and the surrounding nations. Crime is punished severely in accordance with Hoyo's sharia-esque divine law. Cats are everywhere in Kamerkent Sehri.

9.content: The Golden Horde's second official language, with the first being the Common tongue (english) universal to Teyvat. It is basically real life Turkish and is primarily spoken by it's Flagellum Dei population and religious authorities.

10.content: Those nobles from former Mondstadt who decided to switch sides during the Golden Horde's invasion and become known as Beys, retaining all of their noble titles and priviledges, yet converting to the Cult of Hoyo. Over time, became integrated with Flagellum Dei's own noyan nobility, creating a unified elite class loyal to the Golden Khan, yet still holding significant politica power.

lorebooks.name: Complete Omnitrix
lorebooks.website_description: I decided to made it for fun.
lorebooks.description: A lorebook of the Complete Omnitrix with the aliens from the Omniverse series
lorebooks.creator: Jack1001

1.content:
The Omnitrix resembles a digital wristwatch. Its faceplate is now square rather than round and has a white, green, and black color scheme. The faceplate is black with two green stripes forming an outline for the hourglass of the Galvan tech logo. When the faceplate is slid back, the Omnitrix's core is revealed.

Features
General
Just like the original Omnitrix and the Ultimatrix, the Omnitrix mainly allows for the user to alter their DNA at will and transform into a numerous variety of alien species that are each with their own unique powers and abilities (along with their weaknesses) and in a selection of alien DNA that is in groups of 10.

The Omnitrix has a quick-change feature that allows for the user to transform between alien forms while already transformed with or without touching the Omnitrix symbol. It also allows the user to transform back into normal when they are done using their transformation, causing it not to time out and allowing the user to transform again far quicker.

The Omnitrix has a Master Control, which would most likely be activated upon the user's 18th birthday.

The Omnitrix can synchronize with another Omnitrix if activated at the same time.

The Omnitrix does not rely on the Codon Stream for transformation. Instead, the DNA is stored within itself in a computerized form.

Peak Species Data: When scanning and obtaining new alien DNA, the Omnitrix automatically collects data representing the absolute prime peak of that species within the user's age range, ensuring maximum potential in abilities and physical attributes.

The Omnitrix can change the user's gender to adapt to another species.

The Omnitrix has Call mode which is used to communicate with the user using the device.

The Omnitrix is waterproof.

Extensions
The Omnitrix has a 2-way communication system with Plumber Badges.

The Omnitrix can also record messages, similar to voicemail.

The Omnitrix has the functionalities of a regular digital watch.

The Omnitrix has a function allowing the user to stay transformed for an extended period without timing out.

The Omnitrix has a built-in Universal Translator and could also translate other Earth languages.

The Omnitrix has a distress signal function and homing device.

The Omnitrix has a security lock system so that it can only be used by the user, as well as an alternate identification program if changes by outside forces occur to the user.

The Omnitrix has a failsafe that kicks in the event that the user's life is in jeopardy. This feature turns them into the needed alien to survive.

The Omnitrix has failsafes installed by Azmuth that prevent Galvanic Mechamorphs from tampering with the device.

The Omnitrix can add extras to lifeforms to make them safer and more usable, such as Goop's Anti-Gravity Projector and NRG's containment suit.

Allocation
The Omnitrix symbol is positioned on different places for each alien whenever the user is transformed.

Voice Command
The Omnitrix can be controlled by Voice Command.

Omnitrix User Access Voice Recognition Mode: Makes the Omnitrix recognize the user.

Command Code 1010 Tennyson Benjamin Disengage Life-Form Lock: Disengages Life-Form lock.

Modes
Active Mode
The default mode for selecting and transforming into aliens, with 15 minutes per transformation (modifiable by actions and slamming the core).

Recharge Mode
When the Omnitrix times out, it locks functions until fully recharged.

Time Out
Automatically protects the user from life-threatening danger by instantly recharging and selecting a survival-based alien.

Collect Mode
When new DNA is detected or unlocked, Collect Mode activates to prioritize scanning and acquisition.

The Omnitrix uses a green ray projection to scan alien DNA.

New DNA may not be immediately available after scanning.

Scan Feature: The Omnitrix can scan not only alien DNA but also environmental data, biological traits, and weaknesses of scanned species to enhance combat and survival strategies.

Mega Mode
Mega Mode evolves the selected alien into a Mega Form, customized to fit the current situation using advanced AI situational analysis.

The Omnitrix simulates 100 million years of training for the alien form, providing mastery of abilities without granting sentience (unlike the Ultramatrix).

Mega Forms are 1,000 times stronger than standard aliens and are vastly superior to ultimate evolutions.

Mega Mode can be activated manually or automatically in critical conditions.

Fusion Mode
Borrowed from biometric fusion tech, Fusion Mode allows the Omnitrix to fuse two or more alien DNAs into a single hybrid form, combining their powers and abilities seamlessly.

The Omnitrix provides stability protocols to prevent power overload or DNA corruption during fusion.

Self-Destruct
The Omnitrix includes a countdown-triggered self-destruct mode, emitting warning beeps until disabled.

Randomizer
Random transformation cycling mode, either continuous alien changes or single random alien selection.

Malfunctions
(Kept unchanged, including mis-transformations, hacking vulnerability, susceptibility to magic, time freeze disruption, weakness inheritance, behavior changes, overload cooldowns, and personality effects).

2.content:
Bloxx is the Omnitrix's DNA sample of a Segmentasapien from the planet Polyominus.

Apperance
Species: Segmentasapien
Home world: Polyominus
Body: Gorilla Made of Building Blocks
Being an organosillicon-based life form with segmented hardened quasi-organic polymer skin, Bloxx's body is made up of individual red, blue, and yellow building blocks that he can rearrange at will.

Bloxx's default appearance looks similar to that of a gorilla made of mostly red and yellow building blocks with some blue blocks. He has black lines and studs all over his body. His feet are stubs and his hands are extremely large to balance most of his body. Bloxx wears the Omnitrix symbol on his chest.

Abilities
Shapeshifting
Explosive Projectiles (via Bloxx-Lobbers)
Elasticity
Regeneration
Size Alteration
Body Alteration
Body Separation
Body Encasing
Sphere Transformation
Heat Resistance
Radiation Immunity
Enhanced Strength
Enhanced Agility
